title: Associate UI / UX Artist
description:
Role @ Auroch Digitial:

Auroch Digital is looking to hire a Associate UI & UX Artist who will help push the art of our game projects to the next level.

The ideal candidate will have experience of game production cycles, specifically in creating detailed, usable concepts for game assets.

Responsibilities:
• Create mood-boards, wireframes, sketches and storyboards.
• Creating working prototypes to demonstrate a User Experience flow before UI design.
• Create polished UI mock-ups in Photoshop from the UX groundwork.
• Export these assets ready for implementation into games.
• Working closely with the project’s team to create a design that is accessible and excellent to use and interact with.

Requirements:
• Passion for games.
• Proficient 2D skills.
• Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator experience.
• Interest in learning UX tools such as Figma.
• Interest in accessibility and inclusivity in design.

Desirable:
• Previous experience of games jams or personal projects involving UI.
• A... desire to learn UI implementation and/ or User Experience design

title: Junior to Mid-level UX Designer
description:
Junior to Mid-level UX Designer, Office based / some hybrid working, Near Bath (Somerset)

Avanti Recruitment is currently partnering with a top digital agency based in Bradford on Avon.

This role is for an up-and-coming UX professional who champions design thinking and UX best practice or has a strong interest in UX Design with a good portfolio. You will support with UX strategy, customer journeys etc. You will have a collaborative approach to UX / UI Design.

The role offers an amazing opportunity to join a friendly and successful UX/UI team. There is so much good stuff to be done!

Requirements;
• Experience in User ExperienceThe ideal would be experience of designing complex, web-based applications / designing some cool websites from a UX perspective
• Good portfolio and track record of innovative UX Design

Key responsibilities (Support the Lead UX Designer with the following duties);
• Design the UX for company software platform
• Collaborate closely with research, design and... product teams to help identify emerging digital trends
• Gather complex business, product and technical requirements
• Conduct research associated with user goals, behaviours and needs
• Apply a Design Thinking approach in creating design solutions
• Lead initiatives and work collaboratively with product owners, developers and other UX Design Team members
• Create conceptual models based on requirements, user workflows, journey maps and Information Architecture

For more information about the role and company and the interview process, apply online and feel free to get in touch with Mike Walton at Avanti

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Role: UI/UX Designer

Location: Remote based, but the need to travel to the office 2 times a month (Oxford area)

Salary: 50,000 - 65,000pa + Benefits

Skills: UI, UX, Wireframing, Agile

Job Description

My client is looking for an excellent user interface (UI) designer to join their growing applications team working on a wide variety of technical projects. The UI designer will strive to produce easy to use, high-quality solutions for the applications (mobile and desktop) by designing application workflows, working closely with the software development team throughout the implementation process.

You would typically be working in a team of developers and product managers.

Examples of the types of work the UI Designer will be part of include:
• Collaborating with business and development stakeholders to produce designs.
• Designing application workflows and the user experience.
• Wireframing user interfaces.
• Communicating with the software development team throughout... implementation.
• Presenting designs to stakeholders.
• Conducting usability testing.

Candidates must have substantial UI design skills and love to work on projects. They will have a portfolio showcasing mobile and desktop work.

Experience in some of the following would also be advantageous:
• Qt, QML, JS
• Vector graphical asset creation
• Agile Development

This is a permanent position that is predominantly remote based, but does require you to be in the office 2 times a month

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
Overview

Our IT teams are committed to meeting the business’s evolving needs for high-quality technology solutions – we have a long tradition of designing and developing our own software and this continues with a focus on the technology needs of our clients and their customers. We are committed to offering our clients and their customers best-in-class technology solutions with a strong focus on ease of use and simplicity.

We are looking for an experienced and passionate UX expert to join a growing IT team that are developing our client-facing technology platform.

You will play a key role in building our centre of excellence for UX design, working closely with product owners, business analysts, designers and development teams across the business to create and shape key experiences, and build a consistent narrative across our solutions.

Initially you will report to the Product Owner for the BWebstream Platform – our online platform for delivering services to our clients and... professional contacts through the web – based in Bristol. We mix home and office working and have offices around the UK so are flexible on location.

Responsibilities

You will be a champion for all-things UX, promoting design excellence across the business. You will be responsible for supoirting and mentoring our designers across the business. You will need to be hands on, creating and presenting concepts, wireframes, prototypes, interaction and screen designs. You will collaborate with our software teams on the creation and roll-out of a user interface design standard and UI toolkits. You will also work with our product teams to capture feedback, carry out competitor analysis, user research and usability studies.

Qualifications

You will need to demonstrate knowledge of UI/UX principles and best practice, proficiency in UX design and prototyping tools and proven UX design expertise in responsive web applications. You will need an awareness of accessibility issues and principles within web applications. You will have experience workshopping on product design and experience working with software developers and other highly technical peers in an agile environment. You'll need excellent user experience and visual design skills with an attention to detail. You'll need to possess strong communication skills in order to run workshops, design sessions and present design concepts. You'll be pragmatic and flexible as you’ll need to work with delivery teams in a fast-moving commercial environment. You'll display a passion and enthusiasm for the value of great design, adopting a user-centric approach and you'll be a driven, self-starter.

What's in it for you?

Core & Flexible Benefits:
• Competitive discretionary annual bonus
• Core benefits paid for by BW including life assurance, group income protection, private medical cover and 25 days holiday per year with holiday trading
• A generous pension scheme where we contribute 8% of your salary from day one of your employment
• Employee Assistance Programme to support you and your family through any concerns or challenges you may experience
• A comprehensive range of voluntary benefits to suit your life stage and lifestyle including a tech scheme, cycle to work scheme, dental cover, healthcare cash plan, health assessments, critical illness cover, extension of private medical cover or life assurance to family members, gym membership, travel insurance and a broad range of discounts at hundreds of retailers including supermarkets, fitness centres, travel and leisure companies
• Fresh fruit, hot and cold drinks provided free of charge in all of our offices

Giving Something Back:
• 1 paid volunteering day per year as a commitment to our Corporate Social Investment
• Support your favourite charity with the "Give as You Earn" option
• Match-funding for individuals raising money for a recognised charity
• Our corporate social investment programme is an integral part of what we do and is focused on ensuring that our overall impact is a positive one. We recognise that we have an impact that goes beyond our core activities.

Values: our values are PRINCIPLED, RESPECT, QUALITY AND PARTNERSHIP - they are important to us and we want them to be important to you as well.

Wellbeing: employee wellbeing has always been important to us and our approach is to create an environment where individuals will be engaged at work, successful in what they do and able to achieve their full potential, benefiting both their self and the business. BW offer a great range of employee benefits as we believe it's important individuals are supported in making choices which are flexible enough to meet their needs and help support their wellness.

Diversity: we are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce where people from all backgrounds, beliefs and perspectives can thrive, feel welcome and develop to their full potential. Our recruitment processes are designed to be fair and consistent and enable candidates to compete on a level playing field.

Your progression: we offer career progression opportunities and a focus on training and professional development to provide you with the tools and skills to thrive. We also offer study support for relevant professional or skills qualifications.

Other activities: we have clubs, sporting events, social, cultural and belief groups across our offices if you’d like to join in and meet like-minded people.

Not quite the right opportunity for you this time?

Follow Barnett Waddingham on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/barnett-waddingham-llp in order to receive updates and posts about future opportunities, webinars and industry event invites, industry news and insights, exposure to new connections, BW services and new content

title: Senior UI/UX Digital Product Designer
description:
Senior Digital Product Designer
• Fully remote US based candidates will also be considered
• This is a hybrid role (remote and Bristol office, for UK candidates) - You will also need to come into the London office at least once a month (subsidised)

Spotlight Sports Group is a global media and technology company specialising in sports betting content and data. We have over 500 staff, and operate multiple award-winning B2C brands including Racing Post, MyRacing, Soccerbase & Free Super Tips in the UK. In the US we operate Pickswise & Fantasy Alarm. Our other businesses in the group are ICS-digital and ICS-translate. Our global B2B division provides sports betting and fantasy sports content, media partnerships (including a joint venture with Spanish publisher, AS) & much more.

The Product Design and Research team are a key element of the business transformation to digital and the future success of Spotlight Sports Group. We are driven to provide timely, authoritative content and... experiences so sports enthusiasts can be deeply informed and inspired and bettors can bet with confidence and ease. This role would be working with our Sports Affiliate team, mainly working on our US brand - Pickswise, helping to bring premium sports data and content for NFL, basketball, baseball, hockey and more, to sport enthusiasts and sports bettors alike. We have first generation products out in the US and UK/Europe; we’re looking for someone to help us take these products to the next level of audience engagement as we provide more content, tools and data to our users.

We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to work on our Pickswise brand - our flagship sports product for the US market. You would also work on some emerging brands for other markets including Latin America and Asia, as they come online. If you like working in (or want to work in) sport, working with data visualisation, solving complex business problems involving a hefty amount of data, insight, and sports analysis (because you like geeking out) with a highly collaborative team designing products that are pushing into new markets across the world, this could be the role you’re looking for.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is a mid level or recently became senior who wants to build up their experience - learning, progressing and contributing to a larger design approach. You’ll have the opportunity to influence stakeholders across the business and mentor more junior designers, while being given the room to develop and push your craft.

The role:
• This role is a senior level hybrid role of UX and UI disciplines, more heavily weighted towards User Interface Design - we need someone who has deep UI knowledge and interaction design experience.
• A good candidate for this role is someone who enjoys collaboration and bringing both designers and stakeholders on a journey to creating the best user centred product.
• This role will include mentoring other mid level designers - thus it would suit someone looking to move to the next phase of their career.
• Having enthusiasm for sport will be a huge benefit for this role. Any knowledge of US sports like NFL, basketball, baseball, hockey, etc. is a very big plus.

Aspects of this role include:
• Working with product owners, researchers and other designers on the team to identify and define usability issues and opportunities within our digital product suite of sport affiliate websites and apps
• Collaborating with User Research to understand current users and users in growth markets both in Europe and internationally (e.g. the US).
• Running / owning larger pieces of work, including working with other designers to distribute work and ensure high quality levels are maintained throughout the projects.
• Working closely with the Product Design Manager to help improve ways or working, identify areas for optimisation and encourage exploration into areas ripe for innovation.
• Designing, prototyping and building digital product designs for larger flows and smaller features for responsive websites and mobile apps.
• Prepping screens and prototypes for user testing (both lab and/or remote testing)
• Working closely with development in a modified Agile environment to ensure solutions are technically feasible, as well as being involved in design handover and UAT processes.
• Presenting, explaining and defending design work to internal and external stakeholders.
• Mentoring other designers in UI design best practice, as well as handling stakeholders.
• Managing and integrating stakeholder feedback, building relationships to enable a more collaborative way of working.
• Working with the larger design culture at Spotlight Sports Group to share design ideas and approaches for the purpose of creating a tighter overall product suite.
• Evangelising the benefits of good user centred design.

Requirements

Experience
• Working companies with complex digital products (e.g. in complex e-commerce or data rich digital products especially) in a predominantly client-side UX/UI design hybrid role or high-volume B2C/B2B role
• Designing for sport and/or betting a plus but not required
• Working with research, user personas and other methodologies to determine user needs to formulate hypotheses and wireframe / designs for digital products
• Collaborating with senior stakeholders from Product and Technology departments
• Working with other Designers and UX Researchers on a regular basis
• Evangelising the benefits of user experience for creating more customer focused, effective products and business outcomes
• Experience of influencing and advocating for the user/customer to non-design/digital design audiences, such as Product, Marketing or Technology Managers
• Designing for responsive web and one app platform (iOS or Android).
• Managing stakeholders across numerous departments.
• Working with UX Research and UX Design to help integrate findings, UX best practice and other user centric recommendations into compelling UI designs.
• Designing for accessibility within UI
• Designing a UI design system (or knowing how to work with them), creating visual style guides and knowledge around aligning designs with code component libraries is a massive plus

Skills and Knowledge:
• Must be able to execute at an accomplished level of design craft and organisation with minimal guidance by the Product Design Lead.
• Must be an exceptional communicator and collaborator who can balance business goals, user needs with excellent design solutions.
• Must be able to work collaboratively within a design team and with key stakeholders.
• Can support cross-functional team workflows.
• Can present and defend design work to non-design stakeholders in the business.
• Software skills:
• Excellent Figma or Sketch design skills
• Experience in Protopie, Invision, Figma or other prototyping software.
• Knowledge of how to package up and hand-off finished designs for development.
• A solid foundational knowledge of UX methodologies and how to integrate user research into user experience design solutions.
• Possess a working knowledge of responsive web and app platforms - the opportunities and limitations of those platforms, especially around interaction design patterns and features that can affect performance.
• Possess an eye for typography, a good spatial sense for laying out screens and components, and knowledge of optimised colour usage for digital platforms.
• Be familiar and understand larger, familiar UI patterns for digital and how they define and affect interaction design.
• Be cognizant of what other departments (Marketing, Analytics, Product Research) do, what their goals are and how that can affect UI design output.

We are looking for people who share an affinity for our values:

Trust is Everything

We are One Team

We are Focused but Flexible

Our goal is Excellence

If you feel aligned to these values, we would love to hear from you.

Spotlight Sports Group recognises the value of employing people from a range of different backgrounds who come with a variety of experience, views and opinions. Please let us know if you require any flexibility or adjustments to enable your application.

Any role that has access to employee, client or financial data will be required to go through background checks.

Benefits

The position will come with a competitive salary, bonus, 25 days holiday, Private Healthcare and a great pension. We also give you your birthday off. We think we have an amazing working environment and culture and hope you will do too

title: Ui/ux Designer
description: UI/UX Designer Salary: Up to £50,000 We are a new and exciting technology led ecommerce fulfilment company, focused on helping online sellers grow their business by providing global fulfilment, we are VC funded and continue to grow at a rapid pace. You will be joining an energetic and dynamic team in our offices in central Bristol. We are looking for someone with lots of enthusiasm with a desire to learn and succeed, a focused mind and a “Can Do” attitude. Key responsibilities for our UI/UX Designer: - Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers - Run user research and discovery session - Develop high fidelity mock-ups - Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders - Identify and troubleshoot UX problems - Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours, and images Requirements: What we look for in our UI/UX Designers: We would love to hear from you if you have: - Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or... similar role - Portfolio of design projects - Knowledge of Sketch or similar design software - Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders - Good time-management skills Benefits What do we offer for our UI/UX Designer? - Competitive salary - Up to £50,000 (DoE) - 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays) - An excellent work place with great facilities and a creative working environment in Corn Street, central Bristol - Partnership with Bristol sports where you get the opportunity for match tickets and VIP experiences - Perkbox - Share options - Opportunities for personal development and progression - Casual dress Our skills and our Values applicable for our UI/UX Designer: Integrity: Fairness is really important to us. We speak with clarity, honesty, frankness and transparency to our customers, to our partners and to our colleagues. We do what we say we will. Ambition: We make bold decisions with a focus on growing the business and striving to be leaders in our field. We show up to be our best for our customers and each other. Focus: We are wholeheartedly committed to our mission and our customers. We aren’t robots but human beings with a single-minded determination to deliver to exceptional standards. Solidarity: Our business only works because of the strong relationships we build with those around us. We are friendly, approachable, and human in everything we do. We are one team; we work together to build the business and support our customers. About us: Founded in 2017, Huboo was created by e-commerce sellers for e-commerce sellers. Martin Bysh (CEO) and Paul Dodd (CTO) found that the demands and struggles that came with picking, packing, and shipping their products was becoming impossible. They considered outsourcing their fulfilment but could not find a company that allowed them to remain in the driving seat of their growing business. Paul and Martin soon created Huboo’s unique Hub Model. Huboo was then founded. Huboo is not like any normal fulfilment warehouse, we have a specific Hub Model, which allows our Hub Managers to take ownership of their Hubs and be the point of contact for our clients. They are not only pickers and packers but are also account managers too. Huboo work with client selling through eBay, Amazon, and other channels. We are the fastest growing e-commerce fulfilment company in the UK and are looking for an UI/UX Designerto join our exciting journey! * Salary:Up to £50,000

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Position: Senior UI Designer

Salary: £49k to £61k + up to 40% bonus

Location: Hybrid, Bristol (On site once a month - flexble on location)

Contract: Permanent, full-time

Excited to grow your career?

Our mission is to 'help people save and invest with confidence'. We are looking for great people to join us, so please come and invest in YOUR future.

About the role

We are looking for a talented Visual/UI Designer, who takes pride in creating great products and experiences, to join our growing User Centred Design department. This is a fantastic opportunity to own and grow the visual language of our digital experience. Alongside a multi-disciplinary squad you will be responsible for the growth, development and establishment of our recently created design system.

What you'll do

You will be an internal advocate for the user and will work closely with product, development, and creative design teams to ensure our design system consistently empowers our internal and external... users.

The ideal candidate should have an eye for detail and great design, possess superior visual design skills, be able to translate high-level requirements into best-in-class interaction flows, and transform those into, intuitive user interfaces.

Creating and documenting visual designs that effectively communicate product function and brand identity should be second nature.

You will have previous experience of design systems, with detailed understanding of their operation and be comfortable championing your work throughout the business.

As part of the visual design team, you will be a proactive Owner/guardian of the visual identity, championing the brand and its consistent delivery across the business.

Responsibilities
• Work collaboratively and build successful relationships within our Design System squad, UCD department and wider business to better inform design solutions
• Iterate and improve designs based on evidence and sound rational
• Own the structure and promote UI process and documentation within the Design System
• Support development teams with clear hand over and documentation
• Conform and contribute to organisational design standards
• Working to brand, design guidelines and pattern libraries. Comfortable to challenge and evolve when required
• Work end to end on solutions from concept creation through to working with developers to ensure the design work is effectively implemented and looks great
• With the squad, adopt a user-centred approach, being passionate about ideas and design but not precious about your solution.
• Help shape the UI design within HL
• Collaborate and support the UI team to ensure consistency across platforms and develop the teams design approach.
• Present complex information and concepts in a clear and articulate manner
• Share work with colleagues for critique, provide constructive, actionable critique on the work of others and facilitate critique sessions
• Proactively share knowledge effecting positive change across the UI team and wider UCD department

Skills and experience
• Have excellent knowledge of established design and interaction patterns
• Passion for interface design and interaction, keeping up-to-date with digital trends, techniques and emerging UI patterns
• Excellent attention to detail, with excellent visual design knowledge and experience
• Set up and run collaborative design workshops
• Clearly articulate design decisions and rational to stakeholders and wider business
• Produce testable prototypes using appropriate tools and methods
• Create and document on brand reusable components, building and monitoring UI library's for our digital space

Why HL?

Here at HL, we're the UK's number 1 investment platform for private investors, based in Bristol. For more than 40 years we've helped investors save time, tax and money on their investments.

To achieve our mission, we believe we have a workplace like no other, with constant learning, dynamic teams, and a great ethos. We're steered by core values that promote service, quality, innovation, and opportunity in everything we do.

What's on offer?
• Discretionary annual bonus & annual pay review
• 25* days holiday plus bank holidays and 1-day additional Christmas closure time
• Option to purchase an additional 5 days holiday per year
• Flexible working options available, including hybrid working
• Pension scheme up to 11% employer contribution
• Sharesave scheme - have a real stake in HL's future
• Income Protection & Life insurance (4 x salary core level of cover)
• Health care cash plans - including optical, dental, and out patientcare
• Help@hand and an Employee Assistance Programme
• Gympass - gym memberships and wellbeing apps available
• Variety of travel to work schemes with free bike storage and shower facilities
• An inhouse barista serving subsidised coffee and snacks
• Join HL's sports, I&D networks and volunteering groups (two paid volunteering days per year)
• LifeWorks Discounts on services, restaurants and retailers
• Up to 30 days depending on role level & increasing with length of service

title: Senior UX Designer - Mobile
description:
Role: Senior UX Designer - Mobile
Salary: Up to £65'000
Location: Hybrid 1 day p/w in Bristol

Our client are the UK's leading app and digital platform for Electric Vehicle drivers, enabling them to search for charge points, plan journeys, pay for charging, and share insights with other EV drivers. Their mission is to make charging simple and, by doing so, help accelerate the transition to electric vehicles and zero-carbon mobility.

The Role:

You will the first permanent UX Designer on the ground. You will need to be comfortable defining and leading the approach to design. You will work across the full design process and will be building a connection with their users' needs, map key journeys on our platform and lead the team in designing, prototyping, and testing new features and functionality.

Required Experience & Skills
• Experience of a range of user experience, research and product design roles. And/or appropriate qualifications in user experience and user centred design from... a reputable industry body.
• Experience of using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile design, including native design (material / human interface guidelines).
• Experience working with mobile applications and designing products that work for 100k+ users. Experience with multi-language apps that are available in several international markets is desirable, but not essential.
• Experience of working closely with engineering teams to enable rapid delivery in an agile environment.
• Expertise in common UX & UI tooling (such as Sketch, Figma, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq) and the like.
• A solid grasp of user-centred design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

Responsibilities:
• Ensure a consistently high quality, brand aligned, user experience is delivered across our mobile applications, website, and in car product set.
• Lead research and discovery activities, building and communicating a clear view of our users and their needs.
• Facilitate the conception of new experiences, sketching, prototyping, and testing new propositions across new and existing digital channels.
• Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
• Develop and deliver user stories, user journeys, and mock-ups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces, to enable our engineering team in delivery.
• Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
• Lead the establishment of a consistent design language across our digital experiences.

Long term
• Build a scalable design process that will support expansion of the team, and product, into international markets
• Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the app evolves in line with other channels, including our website experiences.

Benefits
• Performance bonus scheme.
• Pension & Benefits
• Flexible working options available.
• Professional training and mentoring to extend your skills

title: Lead UX Designer
description: Lead UX Designer | Remote | Permanent | £60,000 + Career Progression + Flexible Hours + Extended Company Benefits Peaple Talent have partnered with the UK's largest hosted IT and Telecoms service provider to the Public Sector in search of an IT Field Engineer. Established in the 1980's, this long-term staple of the public sector is now looking to grow their UX/UI team, in order to breathe new life into their internet presence. Our partner is looking for someone with extensive industry experience providing UI/UX solutions within a leadership role, with experience in application development. If this sounds like you, why not give us a call or apply now? The Role: In this role, you will be responsible for the improvement and delivery of User Experience design across the Software Development function, and web presence teams. This is a varied and autonomous remote position, giving you the freedom to work from home, with the option of flexible hours included. Responsibilities: * Work... alongside development teams, product managers and business analysts to deliver a high standard of UX solutions * Lead in the execution of projects, and structure the suite of artefacts that need to be produced for each project. This can include information architecture, creating wireframes and prototyping, depending on the needs of the project. * Develop re-usable designs to aid in the creation of a fresh and uniformed appearance and experience to the company's product portfolio The Candidate: * Industry experience in a similar role is essential * Extensive knowledge and experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop * Figma experience is crucial * Must be SC Eligible (have lived in the UK for 5+ years) The Package: Basic salary: £60,000 + Career Progression + Flexible Hours + Extended Company Benefits Interested? If you think you're right for this role, then click the 'Apply Now' button, send us your CV and we'll consider you for the first round of interviews. * Contact: George Covelo * Reference: Totaljobs/15620BB * Job ID: 99345018

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Can you create ground breaking UI? Ready to flex your professional and creative muscles? Want to be part of a world leading company safeguarding the planets most precious digital assets?

We are Preservica and we are changing the way organizations safeguard their digital information. Our SaaS Solutions are at the razor’s edge of commercial software addressing the need for smart digital preservation technologies. As a world-leader in digital preservation, our award-winning software is used by leading businesses, archives, libraries, museums and government organizations across the globe.

About You

A dynamic and adaptable professional with extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions. You will have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You may already be a UX/UI Designer or have the credibility and capability to step up into the role. Either way we... want to hear from you!

The Role

Working across a growing development team, you will be a key contributor to our new roadmap, building on from the existing UX framework for our PLG SaaS solutions. We use Figma as our main tool so you will need to be an advanced user. Preservica is growing at pace and this is a great opportunity to join a team which is being built from the ground up and to contribute to the new landscape of digital preservation.

Our offices are in Abingdon, UK but this role can equally be based remotely within the UK.

Responsibilities

• Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.

• Facilitate the client’s/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.

• Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.

• Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.

• Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

• Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.

• Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

• Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Skills And Qualifications

• Three or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for B2B / B2C applications.

• The ability to be dynamic and adaptable is paramount. This role requires design support to multiple engineering teams.

• The successful candidate will be proficient in Figma and have a design portfolio to demonstrate their case studies.

• Proficient understanding of web mark-up, including HTML5, CSS3 (comfortable with CSS animations and flexbox) is a plus.

• Ability to work with clients/stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.

• A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

• Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.

• Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

• Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.

• Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.

• Good understanding of accessibility.

• Excellent analytical and multitasking skills.

• Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.

• BSc degree in Computer Science, BA in Multimedia or equivalent experience.

What We Offer

As well as a competitive salary, performance bonus and benefits package, we also offer great prospects in a fast-growing market sector. We are committed to maintaining high standards and ensuring our people have the access to the best learning and development.

Location & Reporting

This role can either be based in Abingdon or remotely within the UK base. You may be required to travel to customers premises. Some International travel may also be required. Preservica is an equal opportunities employer. Sorry - we are not in a position to sponsor candidates who do not have the right to work in the UK

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Senior UX/UI Designer required by our market leading client in Bristol who offer a hybrid working model. The Senior UX/UI Designer will ensure that user experience is an integral part of our clients approach. You will play a critical role in designing exceptional user experiences as part of a dedicated UX team reporting to the UX/UI Design Manager.

This role will suit someone who strives to learn and understand our client users` needs, behaviours, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design.

Main Responsibilities:
• Be the lead on UX projects
• Ensure a user-centred design approach working collaboratively with UX designers, BAs, POs, and Developers
• Ensure exceptional standards UX and UI design, ensuring brand standards and guidelines are maintained and enhanced across all designs
• Research, ideate and concept UX solutions working closely with Stakeholders, BAs, and POs
• Collaborate and instigate research and user-testing
• Generate user stories, user... journeys and flow diagrams, proactively Identifying UX and UI design problems and offer solutions
• Rapidly test and iterate your designs, through sketching, paper prototyping and mind maps quickly iterate through ideas
• Presenting solutions and insight to the wider team/stakeholders
• Translate concepts into; wireframes, mock-ups, hi-fidelity designs, and prototypes
• Design and evolve designs across websites and mobile apps, using a mobile first approach
• Mentoring and peer reviewing the teams work, and defining UX/UI standards with the team
• Fulfil any other duties as required by the UX/UI Design Manager

Ideal Background:
• 4+ years of UX/UI design experience, UX principles, UI design best practices and processes, stakeholder engagement
• A portfolio demonstrating high calibre digital design skills, working with material designs
• Ability to communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions clearly and effectively
• Experience of leading on discovery projects and in planning, facilitating workshops
• Proficient in mobile-first and responsive design
• Proficient of creating low and high-fidelity prototypes
• Strong knowledge of UX/UI software; Adobe XD, Proto.pie, Optimal sort, Maze or similar
• HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills/knowledge
• Experienced in accessibility requirements and solutions
• Adept at working within an Agile project development environment
• Collaborative, good communication, strong problem-solving skills

This fantastic role comes with a salary of £55,000-60,000 p/a depending on experience and is accompanied with a 10% annual bonus, 25 days paid holiday, a flexible pension scheme, flexible working opportunities, shared Parental Leave - 18 weeks full pay, continued investment in your career, Bike to Work, discounts and many more

title: UX/UI DESIGNER
description:
UI/UX Consultant

Location: Remote Working with occasional travel to Bournemouth office

Salary: From £38,000 - £42,000 per annum DOE

Our highly successful and reputable client has an exciting opportunity to join them as a UI/UX Consultant. You will be responsible for delivering user experience and interface design and development of our client's online presence.

The UI/UX Consultant will be accountable for the design of the digital customer experience journey, encompassing brochureware and full online application and transactional capability.

To be successful in the UI/UX Consultant role, you will need a strong understanding of user experience and human-centred design methodologies to shape the online customer journey, as well as functions and features of web design.

Main Responsibilities:
• Ensuring that visitors to our client's website has a positive experience when visiting the customer facing portions of the site.
• Working collaboratively with the digital analytics team to... find and optimise issues within the customer journey and manage a programme of multivariate testing.
• Ensuring that functionality, site structure, information and architecture are aligned to a good customer experience.
• To run user testing sessions and conduct research to feed into the UX strategy.
• Creating concepts, design and tests to ensure the customer journey and UI is best in class.
• Ensuring the website is compliant, accurate, on brand and meets TCF guidelines.
• Contributing to web projects e.g. implementation of promotional initiatives; addition of, or changes to, product offerings; changes to panel composition; price changes;
• Working with agile teams to implement, influence and manage change.

In order to be successful in the UI/UX Consultant role, you need to have:
• Customer User experience is essential, particularly within UI / UX design
• Experience working with Agile and scrum teams (desired)
• Proven experience in the build, test and implementation of websites
• Ability to analyse and interpret user journey stats and digital analytics
• Knowledge of 'best practise' usability functions
• An excellent verbal and written communicator, being able to present and explain designs and key milestones deliverables to peers and senior stakeholders
• Comfortable identifying and escalating risk where necessary.

In return for your hard work and commitment, our client offers fantastic benefits, including:
• A competitive pension for which our client will pay twice the amount.
• Generous amount of holidays with the option to buy up to 5 additional days.
• Annual Salary review.
• Discretionary annual bonus based on personal and company performance.
• Life assurance of 4 x salary with the option to flex up.
• Return to work programme scheme.
• Flexible benefits package (private medical insurance, health and dental plans, free life assurance policy, discounted gym membership, cycle to work scheme as well as discounts with a wide range of retailers through our partner Perkz).
• Support groups- well-being activities, yoga, mindfulness sessions, Sports and Social Club events and more.

So, if you would like to work for a Company where you feel valued and rewarded for your hard work, APPLY TODAY

title: Lead UI/UX Designer - UK based Remote/Flexible
description:
Are you an experienced UI/UX Designer looking for a fresh challenge and opportunity where you can make a real impact?

We want you to #JOINTHEREBELLION!

For 30 years we’ve been creating incredible video games at our multiple studios, but Rebellion is more than just games. We have our own film and mo-cap studio, we create board games, publish books, and through 2000AD, publish comics and graphic novels such as the amazing Judge Dredd.

We operate across multiple UK locations, with studios based in Oxford, Warwick, Liverpool, and Wakefield. Work-life balance is important to us, and we want everyone at Rebellion to work in the way that works best for them. So, if you are based in the UK, we are always open to discussing how we can support remote and/or flexible working options.

We’re looking for a new Lead UI/UX Designer to lead a team of UI artists and technical designers to design and deliver the live service UX strategy for an unannounced co-op strategy shooter game.

Your job will... be to lead a team of UI Artists, Technical UI Designers and UX Designers to shape the vision, aesthetic and implementation of the UI for an unannounced action title.

You will be involved in building the UX pillars for the game alongside the Lead Game Designer, delivering scope and planning throughout the project, working as part of a multidisciplinary leadership team.

What we need is someone who knows how useful data is in analysing and reacting to user behaviour and feedback but also someone who loves working with other people. We believe that UI is never solved by a single person or a single point of view and that is why we want the best collaborators so that we can work together to make memorable experiences for us and for our players!

Responsibilities
• Lead the UI team, design and iterate UX and drive the UI/UX deliverables for the project
• Build a UX strategy for a brand-new game, helping to shape the UX vision in collaboration with experts from the Design team
• Design integral player experiences and get the joy of implementing and iterating some of those experiences yourself using a visual scripting toolset
• Drive the delivery and quality of the UI for the project, mentoring and supporting UI designers, artists, and technical designers
• Experience designing UX on at least one title
• Experience managing a small team through all phases of the project lifecycle
• Portfolio showing experience designing high fidelity UI using industry standard tools, e.g., Adobe XD, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc
• Able to effectively communicate whilst building long-term, trusting relationships with a wide range of people
• Games as a service experience required for this project

We offer an extensive benefits package to our team including:
• 26 days holiday + Bank holidays (increasing with service at 5 years – one day each year until you reach 31 days)
• Private Medical Insurance, healthcare cash plan, including dental and Vision
• Life Assurance, Income Protection & Critical Illness Cover
• Enhanced Family Leave
• Interest Free, Tax-Free loans
• Enhanced Pension Scheme
• EAP a range of Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
• Plus loads more… including a wide range of discounts, freebies, and social events!

About Us

Whichever team you join at Rebellion we are proud of our open, friendly, and creative atmosphere. We love what we do, and we have fun doing it! As a big indie developer, we have complete creative freedom over our titles which allows us to work on a massive variety of projects across all the major platforms.

Find out more about ushere

Our size, stability, and the variety of in-house expertise across multiple industries, makes Rebellion completely unique! We work in our own way, and we celebrate that as the key to our success. We foster an inclusive culture where you are encouraged to be yourself, to express your creativity and your talent. We are people focused and will support you in every way to can be the best at what you do. We recognise the importance of enjoying what you do and having a healthy work-life balance. We offer a friendly, creative, and relaxed working atmosphere, with sensibly managed projects and a wide variety of benefits and development opportunities for all our teams to ensure you are fully supported with your physical and Mental Well-being.

We are actively recruiting for a diverse team and continue to add to our culture of growth and inclusion. Rebellion encourages innovation in all areas, and we look forward to hearing how you can help us to be better. We encourage all demographics of culture, gender, ethnicity, neurodiversity and beyond, because a representative team makes better products.

If you are interested in working at Rebellion, but this role doesn’t sound quite like you, we’re recruiting for a range of positions across the studio and we’re always happy to receive speculative applications via our website. Visit our Careers website to view all our live vacancies: Rebellion: Careers

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Job Title: UX/UI Designer

Location: Cardiff/Dynamic

Employment Type: Full Time/Permanent

Salary: £45,000

Suitable candidates must have:
• 3 + years of product design or UX and UI design experience
• Have a fluency with visual and interaction design tools, including prototyping (such as Figma or Sketch, Invision, Framer etc.)
• Be experienced in usability testing, A/B testing, and other testing methodologies
This is the job

Solution bringers. Day makers. Extra milers. We are the AA. And we keep everyone pointing in the right direction. There for our customers wherever and whenever they need us, we're always ready for anything. That's why, for over 100 years, we've continued to evolve and adapt. Today, as the nation's number one motoring organisation, we offer a range of excellent products and services to millions of customers. As a UX/UI Designer, you will work in collaboration with product managers and engineers to iteratively design a user experience in our web products and apps... that deepen customer engagement and reduce friction.

Sound like this is the job for you? Keep reading!
What will I be doing?
• Design solutions (from wireframe, prototypes, interaction flows to user interface)
• Set a vision for the user experience and collaborate with others to research and prototype concepts
• Work independently, take charge and responsibility for your work and the attention to detail needed
• Produce and iterate over concepts and prototypes at pace. Be able to pragmatically distinguish when to apply high levels of attention to detail and when low fidelity concepts will suffice
• Take an active role in quality assurance of designs developed
• Make strategic design and user experience decisions related to features
• Take a user-centred design approach and rapidly test and iterate over your designs
• Collaborate effectively with other team members and stakeholders
• Collaborate on the development of new products and our brands.
What do I need?

Capability, Knowledge and Experience:

Essential:
• 3 + years of product design or UX and UI design experience
• Love working collaboratively, as part of a multi-discipline team
• Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design
• Have experience working with a lean, agile approach
• Have a growth mindset - we work with a strict MVP approach
• Be creative in your input of ideas for features and improvements
• Have a fluency with visual and interaction design tools, including prototyping (such as Figma or Sketch, Invision, Framer etc.)
• Be experienced in usability testing, A/B testing, and other testing methodologies

Desirable:
• Exposure to React and / or React Native.
• Exposure to Material UI / Material Design
• An understanding of HTML/CSS.
Additional Information

We're always looking to recognise and reward our employees for the work they do. As a valued member of The AA team, you'll have access to a range of benefits including:
• Diverse learning and development opportunities to support you to progress in your career
• 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
• Yearly bonus up to 10%
• 50% discount in your first year on AA breakdown membership
• Discounts on AA products including car and home insurance
• Employee discount scheme that gives you access to a car salary sacrifice scheme plus great discounts on healthcare, shopping, holidays and more
• Worksave pension scheme with up to 7% employer contribution
• Dedicated Employee Assistance Programme

Plus, so much more!

Good conduct matters to us. Our teams are motivated by doing the right thing for both customers and colleagues, and in line with our values, we ask all our employees to act with honesty & integrity and respect for others at all times.

We're an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from anyone regardless of race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

We hope to hear from you soon

description: Job Title: Senior UI/UX DesignerContract Type: 18-month FTC, full timeLocation: Remote with adhoc travel to our Bournemouth officeSalary: depending on experienceAgeas UK have an exciting opportunity for someone to join our Marketing & Digital team as a Senior UX/UI Designer on an 18-month Fixed term contract. title: UX/UI Designer
description:
UX/UI Designer

(Grad – Senior) all levels will be considered

Salary: Up to £50,000 (Depending on relevant skills and experience) plus 25 days holiday, flexible hours and more!

Client Details

Who's the client?

• My client are a global leader of analytical instrumentation used in clinical, pharmaceutical, biotechnology and food & beverage laboratories.

• Their mission is to accelerate the development of sustainable customer-centric solutions that enable the delivery of life-saving drugs and treatments.

As a result of recent expansion, my client are looking to expand the scope and quality of the solutions which they offer, they have now opportunities opening to bring a UI/UX Designer into their Software Engineering team. In this role, you will help them in the vision and design of the user interface in their systems, as well as being given the opportunity to work within a multi-disciplined R&D team to help their customers achieve real-world improvements to medicine and end-patient... care.

As a member of the development team your responsibilities will include:

· Creation of prototypes and concepts across multiple user domains

· Creation of final concepts for different solution environments including desktop, embedded and web

· Creating, improving, and using wireframes, prototypes, style guides, user flows and effectively communicate your interaction ideas using any of these methods

· Collaboration with Product Management, Engineering and End Users representatives on the creation of designs

· Ensure design standards, guidelines and best practices are adhered to

· Communicate designs to technical and non-technical colleagues ensuring that all have an understanding of UI/UX design practices

· Coordinate with a multi-disciplined R&D team across the world to ensure positive product outcome

Essential Experience

· Experience of creating wireframes, prototypes, storyboards, user flows etc.

· Experience in designing responsive UIs for at least two of: desktop, websites, embedded, and apps

· A strong portfolio to be presented and defended during interview

Beneficial Experience

· Familiarity with technical constraints and limitations of platforms such as desktop WPF UI Frameworks, web applications and embedded touch screens

· Understanding of basic web front-end languages: HTML5, CSS3 JavaScript

· Understanding and practice of working in, and designing solutions for, regulatory compliant environments

· A solid grasp of user-centred design (UCD), rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability, and accessibility concerns

· Understanding of the complexities of designing multi-lingual interfaces

· Solutions spanning automation systems, robotic systems control, or other mechanical control systems

· Display of high-resolution images created via processing and manipulation for object detection and classification

· Experience of creative ideation, rapid prototyping

· Familiarity with Agile development processes

title: UX Designer
description:
As a UX Designer, you will help shape the future of the company's digital products by working collaboratively to come up with innovative ways to solve business problems centred around customer's needs.
Client Details
Our client are a large society that has been around for nearly 170 years helping people find a place to call home. They aim to deliver real help and value to its customers by providing the financial tools and support to enable them to achieve the things in life that matter to them most.
Caring about their people and working in an environment that promotes flexibility, development and inclusivity.
Description
In your first few weeks in this UX Designer role, you can expect to:
• Utilise your tried and tested UX and UI design skills at all stages of the design process, including research, ideation, prototyping, and UI design
• Carry out usability testing and other forms of validation to improve and iterate your designs
• Contribute towards the company's creative culture by... helping to drive awareness and understanding of design throughout.
Profile
To apply for this UX role, you will need a proven track record of experience, researching and designing engaging experiences that meet the needs of the people that use them. You will also require the following:
• Experience conducting competitor analysis, using analytics tools, and customer insight to find opportunities and tease out pain points that drive your design decisions
• Solid experience bringing your ideas to life using design tools such as Sketch, Invision, Figma or Adobe Xd
• Experience planning, conducting, and analysing usability studies
• A willingness to learn and try new things - be it tools, techniques, or ways of working.
Job Offer
As a vital member of the team and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach and commitment, you will receive a salary of 40,000 to 45,000 and the chance to join a supportive and welcoming team.
To apply for this inclusive and collaborative full-time UX Designer job in Leeds, please contact PageGroup today.
Established in London in 1976, we've been bringing the world's best employers and brightest professionals together for over 40 years. We are passionate about career progression and offer our people unrivalled talent development programs as an organically grown business. Page Executive, Michael Page and Page Personnel make up the recruitment powerhouse PageGroup. Join our culture of success and expand your career horizons around the PageGroup world

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Job Description

We are delighted to be working at an established company who are looking for UX professional

Person specification
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Human Factors / Ergonomics or a related field such as Psychology.
• 2+ years’ professional agency experience in digital user experience (UX) design for desktop and mobile, and, as a bonus, may additionally have some first-hand experience in user research.

? a bright, innovative, ambitious and collaborative individual who approaches work with curiosity and integrity

? a high degree of creativity, attention to detail, interaction design and problem solving ability

? an understanding of testing methodologies, including usability and accessibility standards

? a strong verbal communicator with excellent written, organisational and interpersonal skills

? a team player who takes personal ownership of assigned tasks, yet is able to collaborate and work effectively with... colleagues and clients

? able to work to project requirements and delivery deadlines ? intelligent, eager and passionate about producing high end solutions

? flexible and adaptable with a persistent drive to learn new skills and constantly improve

? eager to keep abreast of industry trends, web development technology and advancements

Experience needed:

? a mastery of all aspects of Axure

? experience with Photoshop, Illustrator and other software from Adobe Creative Suite, and balsamiq, Adobe XD, invision, sketch or other relevant mapping, diagrams or graphic creation software would be beneficial. Coding is not required.

? a high competency of information design and be able to clearly express and organise complex information

? the ability to present research findings and illustrate innovative solutions with confidence and enthusiasm through developing and crafting: user personas, goal and task analysis - user scenarios, user stories, storyboards user journeys and experience maps, site maps, process flows, content strategy and taxonomy, conceptual sketches, wireframes and prototypes

? confidence in undertaking user research including the planning, management and delivery of workshops, focus groups, interviews, questionnaires and surveys

? an understanding of common software, management practices, development practices, & agile working

? hold experience developing UX for iOS, Android, and/or responsive web, with knowledge of common design patterns

Package

title: UX Designer
description:
Oxford Nanopore Technologies is headquartered at the Oxford Science Park outside Oxford, UK, with satellite offices and commercial presence in many global locations across the US, APAC and Europe.

Oxford Nanopore employs from multiple subject areas including nanopore science, molecular biology and applications, informatics, engineering, electronics, manufacturing and commercialisation. The management team, led by CEO Dr Gordon Sanghera, has a track record of delivering disruptive technologies to the market.

Oxford Nanopore's sequencing platform is the only technology that offers real-time analysis (for rapid insights), in fully scalable formats from pocket to population scale, that can analyse native DNA or RNA and sequence any length of fragment to achieve short to ultra-long read lengths.

Our goal is to enable the analysis of any living thing, by anyone, anywhere. We offer real-time nanopore-based DNA/RNA sequencing technology: accessible, easy to use and fully scalable for any... requirement.

We are looking for a talented and curious individual to join our growing UX Team.

The Details The successful candidate will be part of a growing team responsible for designing and building MinKNOW - our software for running our suite of genetic sequencing devices.

We're looking for a mid-level designer who can contribute to all parts of the design process from user research to visual and interaction design. You don't need to have a background in science, but do need a curious attitude, with a willingness to ask questions.

You'll work closely with product managers and software developers, to identify user needs and translate those into intuitive workflows and interfaces in our software.

Responsibilities: - Collaborate with the Product Management, Development and UX Design teams to define and clarify user requirements and use cases. - Create, iterate on, and deliver UX design concepts, prototypes, as well as UI specifications and assets for use in all stages of the product development process. - Work within, and contribute to the Oxford Nanopore Design System.

What we're looking for You'll to be educated to degree level or equivalent in a relevant subject (UX Design, Human-computer interaction, Human Factors Engineering). You'll have 3-5 years experience in UX design at a software company, ideally including the use of a Design system. Familiarity designing for expert or data intensive software tools is a bonus.

The ideal candidate will: - Have a good understanding of software development lifecycles. - Be experienced in the use of design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Marvel etc. - Good understanding of visual design fundamentals - Have excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with a variety of teams and users, both internal and external. - A curious attitude with a willingness to learn. - An interest in designing for complex scientific products - Possess accurate attention to the small details.

As well as a competitive salary, company benefits also include pension, private healthcare and share options! Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- A min 3 yrs solid UX/UI experience within an enterprise environment.
A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
A deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
Knowledge of Figma.
Willing to attend the Abingdon office once a month.

Responsibilities:

-
• Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
• Facilitate the client’s/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
• Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.
• Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
• Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
• Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and... iterate your designs.
• Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
• Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Technologies:

- CSS
- Figma
- HTML5
- Mobile
- Web
- UX UI Design

More:
Can you create ground breaking UI? Ready to flex your professional and creative muscles? Want to be part of a world leading company safeguarding the planets most precious digital assets?
We are Preservica and we are changing the way organizations safeguard their digital information. Our SaaS Solutions are at the razor’s edge of commercial software addressing the need for smart digital preservation technologies. As a world-leader in digital preservation, our award-winning software is used by leading businesses, archives, libraries, museums and government organizations across the globe.
About You
A dynamic and adaptable professional with extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions. You will have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You may already be a UX/UI Designer or have the credibility and capability to step up into the role. Either way we want to hear from you!
The Role
Working across a growing development team, you will be a key contributor to our new roadmap, building on from the existing UX framework for our PLG SaaS solutions. We use Figma as our main tool so you will need to be an advanced user. Preservica is growing at pace and this is a great opportunity to join a team which is being built from the ground up and to contribute to the new landscape of digital preservation.
Our offices are in Abingdon, UK but this role can equally be based remotely within the UK.
Responsibilities
• Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
• Facilitate the client’s/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
• Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.
• Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
• Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
• Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
• Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
• Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.
Skills And Qualifications
• Three or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for B2B / B2C applications.
• The ability to be dynamic and adaptable is paramount. This role requires design support to multiple engineering teams.
• The successful candidate will be proficient in Figma and have a design portfolio to demonstrate their case studies.
• Proficient understanding of web mark-up, including HTML5, CSS3 (comfortable with CSS animations and flexbox) is a plus.
• Ability to work with clients/stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
• A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
• Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
• Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
• Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
• Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.
• Good understanding of accessibility.
• Excellent analytical and multitasking skills.
• Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
• BSc degree in Computer Science, BA in Multimedia or equivalent experience.
What We Offer
As well as a competitive salary, performance bonus and benefits package, we also offer great prospects in a fast-growing market sector. We are committed to maintaining high standards and ensuring our people have the access to the best learning and development.
Location & Reporting
This role can either be based in Abingdon or remotely within the UK base. You may be required to travel to customers premises. Some International travel may also be required. Preservica is an equal opportunities employer. Sorry - we are not in a position to sponsor candidates who do not have the right to work in the UK

Previous commercial experience (internship or a full-time)
Prototyping and user research for digital products
Industry tools (Adobe CC, Figma or anything similar)
Degree in Interactive Design or related field
Please note this is a full time position and all applicants are required to be located in the UK.
If you are looking for any other information, please contact Paula Kastrouni at IC Resources.
We have a number of other Frontend, Backend, and Fullstack positions across different industries and locations available too

title: UI UX Designer - Tech Scale Up - Hybrid/Remote
description:
UI UX Designer - Tech Scale Up - Hybrid/Remote

Commutable to Cardiff - £30,000 - £40,000

Remote, flexible working, shares, pension, private healthcare, income protection, 33 days hols...

About Them

Over the last 3 years, this tech scale-up have been revolutionising an outdated industry and now at a size of ~60 people, they show no signs of stopping with the success of their cloud & mobile applications. Backed by Silicon Valley investors & a strong partnership with one of the world's largest software companies, they're continuing to grow due to demand for their technologies. They're now hiring for their fourth UI UX Designer!

About The Role - UI UX Designer

You'll be joining a design team of 3 led by a hands on manager, working with the wider agile tech team of developers and more. You'll have daily scrum meetings and sprint planning every 2 weeks.

You'll be helping to design a suite of next-generation mobile & web applications. You'll be building new functionality, getting... involved/running workshops, enhancing existing functionality and helping to improve processes, and you'll also be contributing to the design of a new MVP shortly.

As a UI UX designer, you'll be user/data led with UX at the core of your role. You'll be involved in user research, prototyping, wireframing, usability testing, contributing to design systems, creating beautiful user interfaces, leading workshops...

Key Requirements
• At least 1 year's commercial experience as a UI UX Designer for web/mobile applications
• You'll be well versed in UX practices including user flows, research, testing/validation of your design work
• You'll be a confident communicator & problem solver

What's in it for you

You'll be joining at an exciting time that's early enough to have an impact, but that's also at a level of maturity with a team and the support of a company who will invest in you. You'll have the opportunity to work both autonomously taking ownership of your own tasks without micromanagement, as well as having the support of your team with regular collaboration to share ideas, problem solve, as well as do research together.

You'll have the freedom to be yourself in an open environment built on trust and transparency. They actively encourage you to run with your passion both directly in work, but also outside; e.g. one of the current designers does a lot with design students from local universities. You'll be working in a flexible environment free from clock watching that will support your needs if you need to make adjustments to your hours etc.

Their office is in central cardiff & the design team tend to work in a flexible hybrid way; everyone comes to an agreement when to get together for in person workshops etc - this could be once or twice a week, or not at all for a number of weeks. If you're someone who wants to work from the office more often, this would be more than welcomed. Meetups, game nights, paid lunches, drinks, company days out and more, there's something for everyone if you'd like to get involved socially!

> Sound right for you? Send your latest cv right on through! <

Remote, flexible working, shares, pension, private healthcare, income protection, 33 days hols...

description:
Lead UX Designer urgently required by Bournemouth based private health client. This is part of a large-scale transformation the client is currently undertaking and will be a pivotal role which will lead to becoming head of product design. As Lead UX and Product Designer you will work on Beta stage projects with some high-profile features which will require prototyping from scratch. This will use modern technology and Agile development methodology to provide the creative input for building new digital services and support the transformation driven by user insight and clear media content, to change how our clients connect with our services. UI experience is key! As Lead UX Designer you will be looking at all customer research working very closely with the customer on the execution of solutions, mapping out the entire UX journey with your own vision.

The successful UX Designer must be able to demonstrate:
• Expertise designing interactions professionally for the web and mobile.
• Solid... experience of working with Sketch and Invision. Low-FI prototyping, research and design.
• Experience working within an agile, multi-disciplinary team environment, and ability to deliver iterative design components to the development team.

Client interviewing immediately. Fully remote and offering salary in the region of £90k plus 6% matched pension, healthcare cash plan, bonus and much more Please apply now
