title: Senior UX Designer - Elsevier Website
description:
Senior UX Designer - Elsevier Website

Location: Open to applicants based in London or Oxford, United Kingdom, or Amsterdam, Netherlands

About the Team

Our UX team works closely with tech and product squads in Elsevier, providing design thinking, a human-centric approach, and the expertise to imagine and deliver great digital experiences. We look after a wide portfolio of products including the corporate website, the stores, and the enterprise tools for performance and data monitoring.

Our mission is to understand our customers in science and health, create for them the best path to information and design environments to serve their purpose.

About the Role

As Senior UX Designer, you will work closely with other Designers in the UX team and with the NextGen cross-functional teams to help shape the future of the flagship Elsevier website. You will support the design strategy for the evolution of the Elsevier websites and play a key role defining the best experience for researchers... organizations, and health professionals worldwide.

You are an expert user of multiple design tools, a mentor for others in the business, and lead the presentation of design to stakeholders. You can informally lead cross-functional team members and represent UX in product strategy meetings. Usability and inclusive design principles are part of your process.

Key Responsibilities
• Mature a solid understanding of customer use cases.
• Advocate for customers’ needs with the cross-functional team.
• Demonstrate energy and vision to see through innovative ideas.
• Propose design solutions that are guided by users’ data and recognize contribution from others.
• Iterate on designs at different levels of fidelity and test solutions to check they solve the right problem
• Create and manage deliverables for the project including design assets, design patterns and style guides which reflect user needs and company brand.
• Facilitate the adoption and use of cross-product style guides to support design strategy.
• Partner closely with Business, Product and Engineering while staying connected with UX community and team.
• Produce designs across all relevant platforms and take the lead in helping the team establish key metrics for projects.

Key requirements
• Solid design process reflected in UX/UI design portfolio. Experience creating UI design patterns, and product processes that adapt to customer needs,
• Excellent interaction design skills, demonstrable understanding of information architecture, usability and inclusive design principles
• Ability to produce and communicate user journeys and flows that teams can use to advance the conversation and the creative process.
• Enjoys collaborating with technology, product, and other key stakeholders such as content managers to come up with new ideas and solve product challenges.
• Comfortable creating wireframes, prototypes, design concepts, style guides, design patterns, and high-resolution artefacts to be used in final implementation, liaising with other UX designers to produce a consistent experience
• Proficient using design and prototyping software (e.g., Miro, Figma, Adobe)
• Desire to be part of a collaborative team with a creative, positive human-centred approach.

Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.
• Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

Working with us

We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.

Working for you

At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:

· Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days

· Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits

· Wellbeing programs

· Life assurance

· Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme

· Long service awards

· Save As You Earn share option scheme

· Travel Season ticket loan

· Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave

· Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children

· RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you

· Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer

· Access to extensive learning and development resources

· Access to employee discounts via Perks at Work

About us

A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s

grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.

Join us

Are you ready to help us progress science and health? Our technology leads to innovation, so join a forward-thinking digital business that is tackling world-scale challenges and align your ambitions with our passion for driving global knowledge-sharing.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact accommodations@relx.com or if you are based in the US you may also contact us on 1.855.833.5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Where does this role fit in?

We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer who will be responsible for producing exceptional user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design, and defining which UX opportunities the latest technology presents our clients. You will ensure that all elements of the user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.

The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

What can you bring to the table?

Just have a look below, if this sounds like you it’s definitely worth putting yourself forward:
• Proficiency in Adobe CC (Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign etc)
• Proficiency in Adobe XD and Figma
• High level of initiative, appetite to produce great design and self motivation
• Previous agency experience or similar creative... environment
• Solid understanding of the UX process and ability to communicate their thinking in a concise and clear manner

Work’s a treat!

On top of a competitive salary, you can expect a whole load of perks:
• 25 days’ holiday + bank holidays – we understand the importance of you getting some down time.
• Annual Wellbeing Day – enjoy an additional day on us to look after your physical and mental wellbeing.
• Pension Scheme – helping you save towards your retirement home in the sun!
• Corporate Medical Cash Plan – claim back the cost of your medical treatments.
• Smart Working Options – spend up to 40% of your working week from home.
• So many savings – through our online community platform, you can access dozens of daily deals, from money off top brands to discounts on days out.
• Employee Assistance Programme – our people are at the heart of everything we do, so if you’re happy, we’re happy.
• Cycle to Work Scheme – save on the cost of biking to work.
• Monthly Employee Awards - Employee of the Month programme with £250 bonus
• Raising money for charity including a paid Volunteer Day – we’re all about giving back… and having lots of fun in the process!
• Referral scheme – know the perfect person to join the team? You could bag £1,000 for a putting a good word in.
• Wellbeing Programme – giving you the opportunity to join regular, interactive Wellbeing Workshops or join our 30 plus Wellbeing Champions.
• Enhanced Family Friendly Leave – support for you and your family to help you navigate through the craziness of family life.

What next?

If you found yourself interested in knowing more, drop us your application and someone from our team will be in touch.

#LI-AM1

title: Mid-Weight UI UX Designer
description:
About the Role:

FFC is seeking a Mid-Weight UI UX Designer to join our growing creative team and work under our Lead Designer and alongside our Junior Designer, Client Services team and Developers. We are a small agency but massively growing and are already extremely excited about 2023’s future for the business. We are looking for somebody who thrives in a smaller company environment. This role will be for three months with high potential to convert into a permanent role within those three months.

The ideal candidate will thrive from a fast paced environment who has one to two years experience within an agency environment or similar. You must be enthusiastic and always up for a challenge and be excited to communicate with clients on calls. This role is ideal for someone who’s either a junior designer already and is excelling at their role and wants to progress or someone who’s already a mid-weight designer and wants to eventually seek further promotion within a company in the... future.

You will need to have a portfolio that shows off your design skills for both desktop and mobile devices, please where possible showcase live work. While this is a mid-weight level we will still provide training and support throughout to help you advance your knowledge of Shopify and UI/UX where possible, FFC offers a clear progression for those who thrive from challenges and engage within the company.

Due to the volume of applications, we unfortunately can only respond to successful candidates. We will not accept unsolicited CVs or approaches via recruitment agencies.

What you’ll be doing:
• Working with the lead designer to produce a range of D2C Shopify websites for a variety of clients in fashion, lifestyle, food & beverages
• Creating low fi wireframes and converting these into high quality polished design outcomes in both Desktop & Mobile formats with potential prototyping elements applied
• Being introduced to clients in workshops and kick off calls
• Using Hotjar and Google Analytics to review data to help inform design decisions
• Identify and troubleshoot UI / UX issues on retainer clients
• Working with the Junior Designer to provide support where needed on tasks/projects
• Making an impact within the design team with possible room to introduce new policies and processes where suitable to enhance the team further
• Creating concept designs for the commercial team to support prospective clients

Requirements:
• You have a strong portfolio with detailed case studies that show off your design skills, we’re looking for quality over quantity
• You love being within a small group and are able to communicate well
• You know how to problem solve and overcome issues in creative ways
• You respond well to guidance but understand when to challenge feedback.
• Meeting clients is something you enjoy and are comfortable doing
• Deadlines are not an issue for you, we know you’ve got the time management skills sorted!
• A clear understanding of ecommerce, best practice, trends and design choices which you can apply to your designs.

Desirable Skills:
• Knowledge of Figma (Sketch or Adobe XD are acceptable too)
• Collaborative, but also able to be creative and self-driven

Please apply with your CV in PDF format, and links to your portfolio.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00-£35,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Additional leave
• Casual dress
• Company events
• Company pension
• Flexitime
• Wellness programme
• Work from home

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Birmingham, B1 2JB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:
• Agency or similar: 1 year (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Birmingham, B1 2JB

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Voxpopmeis a venture-backed SaaS company that provides a Video Survey Platform in the exploding category of experience management (XM). Founded in Birmingham, England in 2013 the Company has grown rapidly establishing a global team across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. The Company’s software helps leading brands create continuous conversations with the people who matter most, helping them build great brands, products, teams and experiences. Over 150 companies including Microsoft, Kimberly Clark, Mondelez, eBay and Verizon use Voxpopme to capture real-time, qualitative feedback from their customers and employees.

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer who is looking to make a positive impact with a rapidly growing SaaS company with an agile team mindset.

This Agile Team Mindset includes:
Respect
Focus on Value Creation
Being Adaptable to Change
What you’ll do:
Translate ideation into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that result in intuitive user... experiences.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders working closely in particular with the Product Managers. Currently a single UI/UX role across the product experience and core role in the wider Product & Engineering team.
Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs. Delivery of features early to customers and flexible approach to working process based on discovery and customer feedback.
Work closely on a core product to design new features as well as maintain consistent platform design
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
Required Skills:
Experience as a UI/UX designer
Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently
A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking
A solid grasp of planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, analysis, usability and accessibility concerns
Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesising abstract ideas into concrete design implications
Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design
Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism
What will you receive in return?

Benefits: In addition to a competitive salary and benefits package including equity and private health insurance, you will also enjoy:
Workplace Settings– our offices are vibrant and spacious. Along with breakout areas with free drinks and snacks, there are weekly events hosted such as breakfast, end-of-week lunches, and more!
Support and Encouragement– We are passionate about growing and developing our team and want to ensure they have all the tools and resources they need. This includes having an open and transparent culture where employees are encouraged to use their initiative alongside the expertise of the rest of the business. Bespoke L&D programs allow you to carve out your own career path to reach your full potential.
Work-life Balance– We take the health and well-being of our staff seriously. With this comes the ability to request flexible working, policies such as enhanced maternity and parental leave, annual leave, and a dedicated HR department for guidance on matters that are important to you. We also hold regular team outings throughout the year.
Ready to be part of the future of insights? Join our team

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Our metaverse group helps our partners realise their metaverse ambitions. The team’s expertise encompasses creative (concept and design), production (art and content), engineering (game development and Web3) and operations (dev and live).

At Improbable, you’ll collaborate with some of the best in the industry. Together, you’ll create unique, tailored experiences that stretch the boundaries of what’s possible in digital spaces and virtual worlds – and help define what the metaverse can be.

Your Opportunity:
• Create high quality UI Art within industry standard timelines.
• Deliver the required concept related tasks to the quality set by the UI Art leadership in a dependable and professional fashion.
• Design user interface and HUD display systems that are visually appealing, intuitive and effective.
• Read and understand all game design documentation in order to understand the intended user experience.
• Develop concepts for in-game menus with focus on functionality and user flow.
•... Apply and maintain a consistent artistic standard for the entire interface of a project and respect brand guidelines in conjunction with the Art Director.
• Understand and respect technical constraints of the platform.
• Make sure that all game information is clearly, consistently and relevantly conveyed through the various user interfaces.

Why You're Made For This:
• A strong understanding of UI/UX design experience in AAA, indie, or mod games.
• Ability to clearly and effectively communicate and collaborate with other designers, artists and engineers to ensure delivery of the best possible User Experience.
• Ability to design UI flow and layout in conjunction with discipline leads.
• Expertise in graphic design and motion graphics software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects (preferred) etc...
• Unreal Engine or other commercial game engines experience (preferred).
• University or college diploma in graphic and multimedia design or equivalent work experience (preferred).

#LI-CO1

Improbable focuses on Information Technology, Video Games, Defense, Software, and Gamification. Their company has offices in London. They have a large team that's between 501-1000 employees. To date, Improbable has raised $520M of funding; their latest round was closed on January 2018.

You can view their website at http://www.improbable.io or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

description: Do you love solving complex problems and thinking outside the box?Do you enjoy assessing and working how to best optimise customer touchpoints?Are you motivated by taking a concept and making it visual?This Global business is spearheading its next stage of growth and this forward-thinking team drives innovation, at scale and at pace and we need to bolster the team with someone like you!Your role will support the customer interaction team as an experienced UX Designer - Experience Designer. You will be a key part of a hugely ambitious technology programme with the aims of improving digital presence on a global scale, transforming the business, and preparing for the future. You will have the ability and desire to work as part of a collaborative team possessing a background in the development of customer journeys and service blueprints.You will need enthusiasm and drive, with proven experience of working to deadlines in a fast-paced environment. You will need to think on your feet, be... self-reliant, with a positive attitude; constantly striving to bring the customer thought process to life.UX Designer - Experience Designer responsibilities- Take an 'outside in' design approach i.e., think what this needs to look like from an end / user customer perspective.- Use design tools to create concept sketches, user flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes, and interaction specifications.- Link the development of conceptual ideas into concrete designs in line with a brands identity and business strategy.- Provide a clear vision for improving design processes and explaining and presenting design decisions to service designers business owners and stakeholders.- Consider existing applications and evaluating their UX effectiveness.- Consider the human-computer interaction element of a design.- Develop and maintain design wireframes and specifications.Salary: Up to £55,885 incremental salary, enhanced pension scheme, 25 days holiday, death in service, free parking, flexible working, online benefits, and additional benefits to be discussed.If this interests you please feel free to email or call and we can discuss this role further

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Role: UI/UX Designer

Location: Remote based, but the need to travel to the office 2 times a month (Oxford area)

Salary: 50,000 - 65,000pa + Benefits

Skills: UI, UX, Wireframing, Agile

Job Description

My client is looking for an excellent user interface (UI) designer to join their growing applications team working on a wide variety of technical projects. The UI designer will strive to produce easy to use, high-quality solutions for the applications (mobile and desktop) by designing application workflows, working closely with the software development team throughout the implementation process.

You would typically be working in a team of developers and product managers.

Experience in some of the following would also be advantageous:

This is a permanent position that is predominantly remote based, but does require you to be in the office 2 times a month

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
SUMMARY

WeArisma is an influencer marketing solution helping brands and agencies understand, measure and optimise influencer marketing RoI. We help clients increase the effectiveness of their influencer marketing strategy and grow brand equity.

As the importance of influencer marketing grows and as the industry matures, so does the need for independent effectiveness specialists. Join us in our mission of bringing independent measurement, accountability and effectiveness to the industry.

You will be joining us at a very exciting time of growth, we have received investment from Morgan Stanley and have been named one of the most promising AdTech companies by Business Insider.

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer looking to accelerate their career in design leadership as a part of a creative and dynamic team.

We have a fantastic culture with a collaborative environment where everyone pitches in and has the chance to excel.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a UI/UX Designer at Wearisma, you will be... an advocate for crafting a visually rich, intuitive, and user-centric design across the whole customer experience, providing information for management to make decisions and delivering platform tools in an effective and efficient manner through design, user research, prototyping, and storytelling.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Drive end-to-end design initiatives to create an intuitive and delightful experience for our users.
• Create high quality responsive UI designs and optimize existing designs for user-facing web applications ensuring intuitive and best user experience.
• Create user stories, journeys, intuitive and user-centric wireframes, page layouts, prototypes, mockups, and UI designs with an application of usability principles.
• Research and synthesize user data to create 'simple' practical design solutions to complex design challenges.
• Maintain design standards throughout the products' interface, as well as continue to improve our existing design system.
• Collaborate with various stakeholders, and the wider product and development teams to ensure delivery of the user interface designs and design standards.
• Assess the competitive landscape, understand patterns and trends, analyze customer behavior and collaborate with others to improve the overall design, holistic experience, and quality.
• Follow up on the final implementation of all features to ensure proper execution.
• Work with developers to ensure pixel-perfect UI implementation.
• Performing tests for intuitive and best user experience.

REQUIREMENTS
• At least 5 years of professional experience as UI/UX designer in an agency or client side.
• Demonstrating solid understanding of web technologies and application of user-centered design methods with knowledge of high-fidelity interaction design, UI/UX principles, best practices, and techniques.
• Portfolio of UX/UI work demonstrating quality examples of clean and clear designs, easy-to-use flow and principles that meet user stories.
• Prior experience designing for Analytics and SaaS products preferred
• Strong background in visual design with an understanding of graphic design communication skills, like color, iconography, typography, and layout a plus.
• Proficiency in industry-standard tools for design, presentation, and prototyping such as Adobe Suite, Figma, Sketch, etc.
• Understanding front-end concepts such as HTML and CSS is a plus.
• Knowledge of social media, websites, applications and digital marketing is a plus.
• Experience with creating simple and clear design documentation for multiple audiences (developers, product owners, and other stakeholders).
• Experience working within an Agile environment using Agile methodologies and comfort with fast-paced Agile/Scrum environments.
• Ability to communicate effectively using tools such as JIRA, Confluence and Slack.
• Self-starter with strong analytical and critical thinking skills to learn and apply with problem-solving skills.
• A positive, can-do attitude and strong task follow-up skills.
• Great team player who communicates openly, honestly and completely; seeks input from other team members, and shares knowledge openly and regularly.
• Excellent communication, fluent in English, good time management and organization skills.

To Apply:

Please share your CV and portfolio with high quality samples of your work so that we can get a better understanding of your style and design skills. In addition, for a project of your choice within your portfolio, a paragraph with the user stories and your thinking behind the design and how the design achieves the goals.

LANGUAGES
• English Mandatory.

BENEFITS
• Team Offsite trip to a European location
• 20 days annual leave in addition to public holidays
• Incentivized bonus plan
• The hybrid co-working space environment
• Monthly coaching and team lunch/dinner

Annual Package:
• Competitive

About WeArisma:

With the boom of social media, the growing need for authenticity in brand communications and the recent changes in advertising personal data policies, brands are shifting budgets from traditional media and social platforms to influencer marketing. The channel is now a key part of the digital media mix, expected to grow by 32% p.a. over the next 4 years.

3 in 5 consumers trust influencer recommendations. Done well, influencer marketing can grow brand equity and increase RoI for brands. Yet, 4 in 5 brands say measuring influencer marketing RoI is a challenge. This is where we come in to solve one of the industry's biggest challenges.

Our solutions enable professionals from brands and agencies to develop impactful influencer strategies, evaluate the effectiveness of influencer partnerships and optimise return on investment.

We empower our clients across multiple sectors with the tools they need to revolutionise their influencer marketing approach, and our technology is designed to be easy-to-use for everyone – from practitioners to C-level executives.

WeArisma was one of the first influencer marketing solutions, founded in 2015 by Jenny Tsai, a prominent and inspiring leader in digital marketing whose work enabling influencers and brands to connect and establish hugely successful partnerships has transformed the world of influencer marketing.

Since our inception in 2015, we have been powering some of the world’s most valuable luxury brands and fortune 500 brands like Unilever, Hermes and more, with user-friendly software, intelligent and independent data and actionable insights.

WeArisma focuses on Digital Media, Sales and Marketing, Analytics, and Big Data. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.wearisma.com or find them on LinkedIn

title: UX Designer
description:
UX Designer
Northampton

As a Barclays UX Designer, you will work collaboratively within a cross-functional team (UX designers, UX researchers, UI designers, UX copywriters, product owners, solution architects, BAs and developers). You’ll help craft first-class online interfaces for our customers across our digital products and channels. Working with multiple stakeholders from various backgrounds, you’ll guide them through an approach to create design concepts at various stages in the design process.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home... and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally are able to request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances
Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.

What will you be doing?
• Leading and creating user interface and visual designs and interactions, for a variety of devices and products including screen designs, prototypes, customer journey maps
• Creating all visual elements, including interactive states, and work with and evolve existing design systems
• Working as part of a team to understand customer needs, business objectives and outcomes, and contributing to the proposition and wider user experience
• Consistently push for a customer-centric approach whilst delivering on business objectives
• Identify and implement process improvements within the team
• Ensuring all outputs adhere to all relevant policies and standards e.g., channel, accessibility, brand, design systems
• Keeping up-to-date and sharing knowledge on industry best practices, the latest thinking and trends in order to deliver fresh, relevant and industry leading designs

What we’re looking for:
• Knowledge, understanding and hands-on experience of responsive and/or app UI design and interactions, through to creating detailed specifications
• Collaboratively working with developers
• Experience of using, and creating or contributing to, design systems
• Presentation skills and a good communicator who can articulate their thinking and the rationale behind design decisions to different audiences

Skills that will help you in the role:
• Professional qualification, or equivalent experience in a related field and demonstrable experience designing for web and mobile
• Knowledge of visual-based design principles and have a strong understanding and skill with color, typography, layout, illustration and data visualisation, combined with an eye for detail
• Understanding the customer experience, translating this understanding into impactful and appropriate visual designs
• Proficient with tools such as Figma or Sketch, Adobe CC, Adobe XD, to effectively deliver high quality design solutions

Where will you be working?
Northampton was the birthplace of Barclaycard in 1966 and we've been based in Pavilion Drive since the building opened in 1997. We purchased the building from the landlord in early 2018 as a sign of our commitment to investment in Northampton. Plans to further develop this Campus-style location are under way to allow for a real collaborative work environment. Based just off the A45 it is easily accessible by both car and bus routes.

Working Flexibly
We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs.

#LI-Hybrid

#LI-AG1

title: Lead UX/UI Designer
description:
We're currently looking for a Lead UX/UI Designer who is responsible for leading the digital design experience for major brand(s), taking ownership for the design and user experience for a range of key client’s digital engagement platforms. You will help advance the client’s digital design and customer experiences through the creation of visionary inspirational design ideas, employment of intuitive UX expertise and best practice – whilst also bringing to the table, new themes in digital design and customer experience engagement trends.

About McCann and you

Based out of our stunning waterside Milton Keynes office, you’ll be joining a team of over 100 people committed to delivering stand-out work for blue-chip clients across a wide range of disciplines.

Naturally, your work needs to be awesome. But beyond that, we’re looking for someone who inspires teams and clients through their ideas and approach; someone who’s always curious, who is always looking at the next thing, before it’s a... thing.

Who we are

McCann Milton Keynes is part of McCann Worldgroup, a global agency network that delivers culture-shaping work for some of the world’s biggest brands.

And to add to the (literal) wheelbarrow full of awards we’ve got including Euro Effies most effective global agency, Cannes Network of the Year, Campaign’s European Integrated Agency of the Year, not to mention McCann Central’s haul of awards in recent years at Cannes Lions, Clios, One Show, D&AD, LIAs, Golden Drum & Creative Circle Awards. Creativity really is at the forefront of everything we do.

As Lead UX/UI Designer, you will have responsibility for the interpreting and establishing the digital experience principles for our clients across all their entire expanse of digital platforms and customer interfaces. Working with the strategy, wider creative teams and research experts, you will be required to:
• Create inspirational digital concept ideas and designs that help bring brands and user journeys to life in engaging and effective methods.
• Be the lead digital storyteller – using your skills to help create designs that can communicate key brand messages, value propositions and guide users on emotional and functional journeys as required.
• Lead our development of intuitive UX approaches that form the basis for final design interaction, such as journey mapping, information architecture and wireframes.
• Create digital design prototypes (ideally with experience in platforms such as Figma, Adobe XD or similar) to help bring your vision to life.
• Have experience designing for component-based design systems.
• Help create the final interaction designs and associated digital content assets.

In addition to a competitive salary, we are committed to creating a brilliant environment for all our people. This includes benefits such as 28 days holiday, plus the opportunity to take additional fully paid leave, enhanced pension contributions, private healthcare, life assurance, and much more.

A culture of learning and development is also central to our ethos, so you’ll have access to industry leading training and development programmes, plus you’ll get to work closely with the world’s biggest media partners to access exclusive features and products.

Most importantly, you’ll be part of a fun and collaborative team and you’ll work in an environment where you are supported and developed.

Our commitment to equal opportunities

For us, diversity is a business imperative – one that must be embedded into every aspect of how we operate in order to drive success. Simply put, we believe an encouraging and inclusive environment makes sound business sense.

As a globally integrated community that influences and shapes culture, it’s vital that the talent mix in our agencies encompasses all dimensions of diversity, and that we demand the same of the people we work with.

Conscious inclusion encompasses social, cultural and cognitive differences and cultivates an ethos of belonging, connection and shared purpose. It is the integration of this philosophy that allows us to create meaningful experiences for our employees, drive better business practices with our vendors and clients, and ultimately lead with purpose.

McCann is a disability confident committed employer and will guarantee an interview to any disabled candidate who meets the minimum criteria for this role, so please do let us know when you apply if you are eligible, along with any adjustments you may need to the recruitment process to enable you to perform at your best

title: Creative Design (UX/UI)
description:
Creative Designer
40k DOE
Permanent

I'm currently partnered with a web and software development agency based in Crewe who are looking for a Creative Designer to join their team.

The Role
You will design the UI/UX on a variety of digital solutions for our clients including brochure websites, e-commerce platforms, online portals, and software applications. You will take ownership of the entire design process, from helping to collect insights from the client, to designing the UI/UX, reviewing concepts with the client, and handing over to the front-end development team. There may also be opportunity to work on several branding and print design projects (subject to experience).

More specifically, you will:
• Gather insights from the client and develop a thorough understanding of their business (market position, products/services), and users (demographics, psychographics, behavioural) to inform design decisions.
• Design UI/UX concepts for entire systems - driven by insights.
• Present... concepts to clients via screenshare calls, discuss the concepts, and provide rationale behind key design decisions.
• Design responsive views for concepts.
• Iterate design concepts until we reach final concept, working in a collaborative way with project stakeholders throughout the Design phase.
• Liaise with the Technical Lead to ensure that design concepts meet client briefs and functional requirements.
• Hand over designs to the front-end development team for front-end implementation and provide guidance to front-end developers when required.
• Provide updates to Project Support on the progress of Design concepts, identify and communicate any potential blockers.
• Proactively engage with the latest trends in Design and share ideas with the Head of Design.

You
• You will have experience in creating brilliant conceptual web design.
• On a personal level, a creative mind is key, and you must possess a perfectionist approach to detail. A calm and collected character is important as this is a fast-paced environment with several ongoing projects, all of which are time-sensitive.
• Finally, communication skills are critical as you will be working closely with several stakeholders (internal and external). A key component of this role is to effectively gather design requirements from clients, and present your concepts accordingly (via screenshare or face-to-face).
• Ideally, you will have experience as a UX/UI Designer in a similar role, preferably within an agency.

Essential Technical Skills
• Adobe XD or Figma
• Adobe Illustrator
• Adobe Photoshop

Desirable Technical Skills
• Adobe InDesign
• An understanding of HTML & CSS and how it can impact design decisions
• An understanding of React

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
Company Description

This is a hybrid role based out of our Nottingham or London office.

Who are Experian?

We are the world’s leading global information services company. During life’s big moments – from buying a home or a car, to sending a child to college, to growing a business by connecting with new customers – we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence. We help individuals to take financial control and access financial services, businesses to make smarter decisions and thrive, lenders to lend more responsibly, and organisations to prevent identity fraud and crime.

We have 20,000 people operating across 44 countries and every day we’re investing in new technologies, talented people, and innovation to help all our clients maximise every opportunity. We are listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN) and are a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index.

Our approach to flexible working

We care about work that works, whether that’s about where you work or... adjusting your hours to fit better with your life. Our flexible working practices, including our hybrid working model where you can split your working time between the office and your home, support our belief that this balance brings long-lasting benefits for our business as well as ensuring that our people can balance successful careers with their commitments and interests outside of work. So that you can love where you work, please discuss what works for you with your recruiter during the hiring process.

Accepting you, for you.

We want you to feel accepted for who you are and to feel safe, valued and to help us build a culture of true belonging. Experian is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we take affirmative action to create a more inclusive and equitable world of work. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital status, race, ethnicity, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, Veteran status or whether you’re pregnant or on family leave.

Job Description

As a member of the Global Digitization team and working closely with our global and regional Product Management teams, you will be steering the evolution of our application user interface designs.

You will oversee the creation of functionality which will be intuitive and important to our users. This will involve creating wireframe documents and prototypes, collaborating with the development teams and gathering feedback from other stakeholders during the product development lifecycle.

This position requires an individual with strong leadership and relationship skills, coupled with a demonstrated track record of designing high quality user interfaces for major software applications.

Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate with Product Management, Business Analysts and Development teams to create high quality user experience and intuitive interfaces for complex software applications.
• Create standard information architecture documentation including conceptual models, wireframes, user flows, user scenarios, navigation schemas, documentation and working prototypes.
• Develop and maintain the internal standards, templates and processes necessary to ensure a consistent, unified, high quality user experience across all products in the suite.
• Oversee creation of mock-ups and functional prototypes.
• Work with development teams and stakeholders to ensure designs are successfully implemented.
• Support operational needs in terms of Experian/DA style guides and visual branding.

Qualifications

Profile
• You are a passionate advocate of user-centered design with proven experience in the design of all user interactions especially for web, mobile and applications.
• You are confident, bright and intelligent
• You enjoy creating experiences that solve complex interactions with elegance and simple designs. Your designs tell a compelling story about users and products
• You can take direction but are also a versatile self-starter
• You develop relationships both externally and internally

Experience & Qualifications
• User interface design and usability evaluation experience (preferably around web-based UIs).
• Detailed understanding of product development lifecycle; some knowledge of product and project management (including iterative development methodology concepts).
• Familiarity with usability testing processes and prototyping.
• High degree of creativity, interaction design and problem solving ability.
• Strong UX design standards and workflow processes using Figma, Axure or similar
• Well developed communication skills and the ability to present visual designs to stakeholders.
• Excellent organisation skills – ability to handle a dynamic environment.
• Positive and professional approach at all times.
• Strong diplomacy and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to liaise with staff at all levels, and across regions and business units.
• Initiative and ability to demonstrate a pro-active approach to tasks.
• Ability to work under pressure and to deadlines.
• Keen attention to detail.

Additional Information

Why choose us?

Our colleagues’ health and wellbeing are a top priority for us, that’s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programmes are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money, and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether it’s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or preparing for the next big milestone in your life, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!

To learn more about our culture and what it’s really like to work here, check out our interactive guide here: https://view.pagetiger.com/experianguideforcandidates/1

Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with Experian!

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
As a UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for the visual concept and design language, creating unique visual designs and game features that result in a fun experience for our players. You will be working on one of our exciting new projects - a AAA IP in the strategy genre.

Third Kind Games is an independent game studio based in Royal Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, the heart of the UK games industry. Third Kind was founded in 2016, by a group of industry veterans from many high profile companies such as Activision, Codemasters, Sony, Crytek and we have been growing ever since.

We're now one of the largest independently owned game dev studios, we have also launched our new studio in Poland, built on the same shared TKG spirit and values.

We work with some of the biggest AAA names in the industry such as Blizzard, Amazon, Microsoft and Mythical Games. Alongside our client projects, we're also working on our own IP, so it's a super exciting time at Third Kind Games!

At TKG we want... to offer a place where our team can be their most creative, imaginative and curious selves. We dare to dream and turn that ambition into a reality with our combined skills and experience, pushing us lightyears ahead.

We are always expanding and we are looking for others to join us as Third Kinders.

WHAT IS IT LIKE TO BE A THIRD KINDER?

Our team is a diverse group of people. They are collaborative, high performers who embrace ideas and knowledge from everyone in the Third Kind family, with the aim of developing and inspiring ourselves and our games.

Work life balance and flexibility are very important to us and our team. We also actively encourage our teams to explore their creativity outside of work on their own projects.

Role Overview
• You will apply and maintain a consistent user experience throughout the gaming interface across multiple platforms.
• You will work collaboratively with the UI team and develop game features to give players the best possible experience.
• A team player, you will work closely with our artists and engineers to take the design from concept to game launch.
• With an ability to see the detail, you will produce wireframe, concept sketches to support UI interaction models that exceed expectations.
• Your passion for gaming will allow you to carry out comparative analysis of other relevant games, determining what makes them great and what can be learned from them.
• You will make useful contributions to our creative planning sessions, scrums, and retrospectives and help us drive the development of our projects and the team.

IDEAL CANDIDATE
• You have an understanding of the UI/UX principles behind games, with exceptional visual design skills.
• You will strive to create fun gameplay, championing the player experience.
• You will be motivated by creative freedom, ground-breaking challenges, and unknown territory.
• You will be able to collaborate and communicate well with team members to realise a shared vision.
• You will be able to work alone and also as part of a team, whilst knowing when to ask for advice from your colleagues.

Skills & Requirements
• 3+ years industry experience as a UI/UX Designer in a gaming environment.
• Good written and verbal communication skills.
• Proven ability to design fun gameplay features that keeps players wanting more.
• Strong understanding of usability design principles

DESIRED
• Experience in Unity

If you think this is the role for you please send us your CV and an introductory email, which helps us to get to know you better. We aim to respond to your application within 2 working days.

Usually we will conduct a telephone interview, prior to any face to face or virtual interviews

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
My client is an innovative healthtech company, working with multiple healthcare providers worldwide. They are seeking a Digital UI/ UX Designer to join their rapidly growing team.

Located in Didcot, my client offers hybrid working, flexible working hours and a salary of up to £35,000, along with other benefits.

As a UI/ UX Designer, you will be responsible for designing projects through the entire design cycle. You will design mobile apps and web portals, fulfilling a pivotal role and impacting future design and development on the product.

In this role, you will have a clear career progression path, as well as lots of training opportunities and autonomy. This is a great opportunity to work on products and technologies that make a real difference in people's lives!

As a UI/ UX Designer you will have experience with:
• Previous commercial experience (internship or a full-time)
• Prototyping and user research for digital products
• Industry tools (Adobe CC, Figma or anything... similar)
• Degree in Interactive Design or related field

Please note this is a full time position and all applicants are required to be located in the UK.

If you are looking for any other information, please contact Paula Kastrouni at IC Resources.

We have a number of other Frontend, Backend, and Fullstack positions across different industries and locations available too

title: UX Designer (Remote)
description:
The team at Lava Labs are looking for a UI/UX Designer to join their rapidly growing company.

Reporting to the Art Director, you will be responsible for the UX and UI concepts and design for their upcoming AFAR series of games.

This role is a great opportunity to build something from the ground up without being hindered by an existing design system, and so is ideally suited to either somebody with a history of leading a UI/UX project or somebody looking to take that next step.

Lava labs are a high ambitious studio who are seeking to be the market leaders in web3 and revolutionise and redefine the gaming field of Crypto and Blockchain.

Working on their first game, a third person arcade platform called AFAR (A far away realm) that social and competitive gaming elements that pit players against each other.

Your responsibilities…
• Conceptualize and design the game UI, including 2D and 3D HUD + GUI elements, boot-up sequences, loading screens and menus
• Assure that game information... is well conveyed through the various user interfaces
• Work closely with the code team to implement assets into the game and verify the quality of the graphics once implemented
• Keep control of assets production, respecting technical constraints and optimization guidelines

The skills and experience you’ll bring to the role…
• 3-5 years of experience in the gaming industry, specializing in the creation of interfaces and in menu design
• Knowledge of UI/UX industry standards and trends
• Ability to work with a high degree of self-direction and motivation
• Expert in Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects and other creative tools
• Excellent graphic design skills (design, layout, typography)
• Familiar with industry game engines Unity and Unreal

With more than $10 million in total funding from leading investors like Dialectic, Merit Circle, Dragonfly, DeFiance Capital, Animoca Brands, Razer Computer, Weak Simp Cap, Dapper Labs, and Maven 11, as well as angel investors Santiago R Santos, Gabby Dizon and Nick Chong, Lava Labs now have a valuation upwards of $100 million

title: UX UI Design Lead Remote working
description:
UX/UI Design Lead urgently required by Milton Keynes based private health client. This is part of a large-scale transformation the client is currently undertaking and will be a pivotal role which could quite possibly lead to becoming head of product design.

As UX/UI Design Lead (Product Designer) you will work on Beta stage projects with some high-profile features which will require prototyping from scratch. This will use modern technology and Agile development methodology to provide the creative input for building new digital services and support the transformation driven by user insight and clear media content, to change how our clients connect with our services. UI experience is key! As Lead UX Designer you will be looking at all customer research working very closely with the customer on the execution of solutions, mapping out the entire UX journey with your own vision.

The successful UX Designer must be able to demonstrate:
• Expertise designing interactions professionally for... the web and mobile.
• Solid experience of working with Sketch and Invision. Low-FI prototyping, research and design.
• Experience working within an agile, multi-disciplinary team environment, and ability to deliver iterative design components to the development team.

Client interviewing immediately. Fully remote and offering salary in the region of £90k plus 6% matched pension, healthcare cash plan, bonus and much more Please apply now

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Faculty is one of Europe’s leading applied artificial intelligence companies. We build, deploy and operate AI solutions to increase our customers’ performance and help them realise their full potential. We believe that AI should be trustworthy, impactful and beneficial across society. Those principles have shaped our work with more than 230 organisations across the public and private sectors as we help them use AI to understand more deeply, make better decisions and act faster.

What you'll be doing:

We are looking for an experienced Product Designer, with a balanced mix of UX and UI skills, to create bespoke AI applications for our customers, enabling them to make use of this powerful technology, safely.

The design & product team at Faculty is responsible for delivering delightful solutions and experiences to customers. We bridge the gap between technology and people to ensure our AI applications tackle the right problems and are applicable, safe and accessible.

As a Product... Designer, you’ll help us achieve that goal by designing products that bring AI to life and help our customers make more intelligent decisions for their organisation.
• Designing bespoke AI applications that tackle specific customer problems across a wide range of sectors, from healthcare to the public sector and consumer businesses. These solutions will include dashboards, feature-rich B2B products, and data visualisations.
• Leading the design process in collaboration with delivery teams of data scientists, engineers and commercial managers.
• Contributing ideas and wireframes to customer pitches and demos, and rapidly prototyping the vision for a proposed solution.
• Conducting user research with customers to understand their workflows, goals, and pain points; synthesising findings and communicating insights to the delivery team in order to inform and refine the scope of the solution.
• Communicating your design thinking through user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and visual designs (with varying levels of design fidelity), presenting alternatives and justifying design decisions where necessary, both to customers and to delivery teams.
• Creating high quality visuals and interactions, based on a strong understanding of good design principles as well as the Faculty brand.
• Being a team player within the design & product team, actively participating in our activities and design critiques as well as contributing to scaling the design and product capability across the company. You will be expected to contribute to the design vision for Faculty; encourage and ensure world-class design execution by helping set standards and best practices.
• Contributing to and helping grow our design system.

What we are looking for:
• Mid level experience, ideally working with data or on business intelligence / AI-based applications.
• Experience in carrying out the end-to-end design process independently, with examples of activities that span across user research, UX, and UI.
• A portfolio showcasing a range of projects, with examples of your design process and artefacts you produced along the way.
• Examples of work where you have done discovery and research to understand a complex problem and then synthesized your findings to come up with design solutions.
• Knowledge of prototyping and design tools. We use Miro, Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud, but are quick to adopt better tools and processes, so you’ll be more than welcome to contribute all the good practices you’ve used before.
• Excellent verbal, written, and visual / presentation communication skills.
• Background in a quantitative discipline, like mathematics or computer science.
• Demonstrable interest in working on data science / AI applications.
• Demonstrable interest or experience in data visualisation.

What we can offer you:

The Faculty team is diverse and distinctive, and we all come from different personal, professional and organisational backgrounds. We all have one thing in common: we are driven by a deep intellectual curiosity that powers us forward each day. This curiosity pushes us to seek truth and understanding in everything we do, to execute work in a nimble and pragmatic manner, to foster talent in one another and always to challenge assumptions.

Faculty is the professional challenge of a lifetime. You’ll be surrounded by an impressive group of brilliant minds working to advance our goal of making artificial intelligence real. Our consultants, product developers, business development specialists, operations professionals and more all bring something unique to Faculty, and you’ll learn something new from everyone you meet. You’ll also have the opportunity to make your mark on a high-growth start-up now poised to expand internationally.

Fostering talent is one of our core values, it’s built into our culture and what we offer. An incredible, unique learning and development system: Faculty was founded by people who are passionate about continuous learning, and adding value to our people. Genuinely flexible working: We believe people have needs, responsibilities and interests that require something different to a strict working day. We trust people to organise and take accountability for their own work and do our best to support their lives outside Faculty. Equity, we want you to benefit from Faculty’s growth and success. Unlimited holidays: We encourage each other to use this time to take a break, work on personal projects, or to spend time with their friends and family. Fantastic private health, optical and dental cover, including 24/7 unlimited virtual private GP appointments. Breakfast and more fruit, drinks and snacks than you could ever eat (for office-based employees). Did we mention Yoga? You’ll make friends and professional connections that will last a lifetime. We work hard and make sure we enjoy what we do. So we have frequent socials and informal get-togethers to help make sure you enjoy your time with us.

Faculty focuses on SaaS, Big Data, Consulting, and Training. Their company has offices in London. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://faculty.ai/ or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- A min 3 yrs solid UX/UI experience within an enterprise environment.

A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.

A deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.

Knowledge of Figma.

Willing to attend the Abingdon office once a month.

Responsibilities:

-
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.

Facilitate the client's/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.

Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.

Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.

Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate... your designs.

Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Technologies:

- CSS
- Figma
- HTML5
- Mobile
- Web
- UX UI Design

More: Can you create ground breaking UI? Ready to flex your professional and creative muscles? Want to be part of a world leading company safeguarding the planets most precious digital assets?

We are Preservica and we are changing the way organizations safeguard their digital information. Our SaaS Solutions are at the razor's edge of commercial software addressing the need for smart digital preservation technologies. As a world-leader in digital preservation, our award-winning software is used by leading businesses, archives, libraries, museums and government organizations across the globe.

About You

A dynamic and adaptable professional with extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions. You will have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You may already be a UX/UI Designer or have the credibility and capability to step up into the role. Either way we want to hear from you!

The Role

Working across a growing development team, you will be a key contributor to our new roadmap, building on from the existing UX framework for our PLG SaaS solutions. We use Figma as our main tool so you will need to be an advanced user. Preservica is growing at pace and this is a great opportunity to join a team which is being built from the ground up and to contribute to the new landscape of digital preservation.

Our offices are in Abingdon, UK but this role can equally be based remotely within the UK.

Responsibilities

Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.

Facilitate the client's/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.

Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.

Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.

Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.

Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Skills And Qualifications

Three or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for B2B / B2C applications.

The ability to be dynamic and adaptable is paramount. This role requires design support to multiple engineering teams.

The successful candidate will be proficient in Figma and have a design portfolio to demonstrate their case studies.

Proficient understanding of web mark-up, including HTML5, CSS3 (comfortable with CSS animations and flexbox) is a plus.

Ability to work with clients/stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.

A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.

Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.

Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.

Good understanding of accessibility.

Excellent analytical and multitasking skills.

Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.

BSc degree in Computer Science, BA in Multimedia or equivalent experience.

What We Offer
As well as a competitive salary, performance bonus and benefits package, we also offer great prospects in a fast-growing market sector. We are committed to maintaining high standards and ensuring our people have the access to the best learning and development.

Location & Reporting
This role can either be based in Abingdon or remotely within the UK base. You may be required to travel to customers premises. Some International travel may also be required. Preservica is an equal opportunities employer. Sorry - we are not in a position to sponsor candidates who do not have the right to work in the UK

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You'll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren't always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

A proficient use of Figma

A background of digital product experience

A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: Lead UI/UX Designer - UK based Remote/Flexible
description:
Are you an experienced UI/UX Designer looking for a fresh challenge and opportunity where you can make a real impact?

We want you to #JOINTHEREBELLION!

For 30 years we’ve been creating incredible video games at our multiple studios, but Rebellion is more than just games. We have our own film and mo-cap studio, we create board games, publish books, and through 2000AD, publish comics and graphic novels such as the amazing Judge Dredd.

We operate across multiple UK locations, with studios based in Oxford, Warwick, Liverpool, and Wakefield. Work-life balance is important to us, and we want everyone at Rebellion to work in the way that works best for them. So, if you are based in the UK, we are always open to discussing how we can support remote and/or flexible working options.

We’re looking for a new Lead UI/UX Designer to lead a team of UI artists and technical designers to design and deliver the live service UX strategy for an unannounced co-op strategy shooter game.

Your job will... be to lead a team of UI Artists, Technical UI Designers and UX Designers to shape the vision, aesthetic and implementation of the UI for an unannounced action title.

You will be involved in building the UX pillars for the game alongside the Lead Game Designer, delivering scope and planning throughout the project, working as part of a multidisciplinary leadership team.

What we need is someone who knows how useful data is in analysing and reacting to user behaviour and feedback but also someone who loves working with other people. We believe that UI is never solved by a single person or a single point of view and that is why we want the best collaborators so that we can work together to make memorable experiences for us and for our players!

Responsibilities
• Lead the UI team, design and iterate UX and drive the UI/UX deliverables for the project
• Build a UX strategy for a brand-new game, helping to shape the UX vision in collaboration with experts from the Design team
• Design integral player experiences and get the joy of implementing and iterating some of those experiences yourself using a visual scripting toolset
• Drive the delivery and quality of the UI for the project, mentoring and supporting UI designers, artists, and technical designers
• Experience designing UX on at least one title
• Experience managing a small team through all phases of the project lifecycle
• Portfolio showing experience designing high fidelity UI using industry standard tools, e.g., Adobe XD, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc
• Able to effectively communicate whilst building long-term, trusting relationships with a wide range of people
• Games as a service experience required for this project

We offer an extensive benefits package to our team including:
• 26 days holiday + Bank holidays (increasing with service at 5 years – one day each year until you reach 31 days)
• Private Medical Insurance, healthcare cash plan, including dental and Vision
• Life Assurance, Income Protection & Critical Illness Cover
• Enhanced Family Leave
• Interest Free, Tax-Free loans
• Enhanced Pension Scheme
• EAP a range of Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
• Plus loads more… including a wide range of discounts, freebies, and social events!

About Us

Whichever team you join at Rebellion we are proud of our open, friendly, and creative atmosphere. We love what we do, and we have fun doing it! As a big indie developer, we have complete creative freedom over our titles which allows us to work on a massive variety of projects across all the major platforms.

Find out more about ushere

Our size, stability, and the variety of in-house expertise across multiple industries, makes Rebellion completely unique! We work in our own way, and we celebrate that as the key to our success. We foster an inclusive culture where you are encouraged to be yourself, to express your creativity and your talent. We are people focused and will support you in every way to can be the best at what you do. We recognise the importance of enjoying what you do and having a healthy work-life balance. We offer a friendly, creative, and relaxed working atmosphere, with sensibly managed projects and a wide variety of benefits and development opportunities for all our teams to ensure you are fully supported with your physical and Mental Well-being.

We are actively recruiting for a diverse team and continue to add to our culture of growth and inclusion. Rebellion encourages innovation in all areas, and we look forward to hearing how you can help us to be better. We encourage all demographics of culture, gender, ethnicity, neurodiversity and beyond, because a representative team makes better products.

If you are interested in working at Rebellion, but this role doesn’t sound quite like you, we’re recruiting for a range of positions across the studio and we’re always happy to receive speculative applications via our website. Visit our Careers website to view all our live vacancies: Rebellion: Careers

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Would you like to work on projects that help advance science?
Would you like to work in a complex problem space to design effective tools to publish scientific research?
About the team
SSRN is an online preprint service delivered by a very collaborative distributed team - the business is based in upstate New York while the product and development squad is located in Oxford and London. The squad supports the day-to-day operations of SSRN for the 800K+ academic authors who have posted over a million research papers on the site since we launched. We also work on more strategic improvements to make it easier for researchers to share their research early and openly. We work hard to create an inclusive, relaxed, and friendly environment because we think that happy and engaged people do the best work.
About the role
We need a designer to help champion our users' needs, transform initial concepts into ready-to-ship services, and refresh the look and feel of the website. As a Senior UX/UI... Designer, you will liaise with senior stakeholders and partner closely with cross-functional product and engineering teams to deliver services by conducting research, identifying problems, developing workflows, and creating and user-testing new solutions. You will own the design, managing complex UX challenges and visual design work. You will be part of a supportive design team with an innovative design culture.
Responsibilities
Partner with product managers and engineers to define the roadmap and backlog, and to ensure strategic alignment and effective working processes

Conduct research to develop a deep understanding of user needs, support your design decisions, and build empathy for users across the organisation
Run workshops, ideate and prototype quickly, and produce detailed design deliverables to ship your designs into production
Refresh the SSRN website and explore co-branding opportunities
Ensure that product designs meet user needs, support business goals, and are technically feasible
Key Requirements needed as a Senior UX/UI Designer:
Have a portfolio that demonstrates design experience covering User Research, User Experience (UX), and User Interface Design (UI)
Hands-on experience in research and user testing
Attention to detail and proficiency in producing UX flows, design concepts, high-fidelity designs and prototypes using tools such as Figma or similar

Ability to use existing pattern libraries and deliver design specifications
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders, think strategically about product and design, and communicate persuasively to influence decisions
Experience of delivering products in an Agile environment
Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact accommodations@relx.com or if you are based in the US you may also contact us on 1.855.833.5120.
Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy
