title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Who We Are

Our vision is to embody a common-sense principle: Learning should adapt to the user – not the other way around. Everyone has the right to find their own path, one in which they can fulfill their talent in a meaningful way.

To achieve our vision, we are creating a new way to learn; one that is motivating, personalised, and efficient. Motivating through gamification, personalised through our proprietary cognitive test, and efficient in leveraging cognitive sciences. These key elements are what constitute our recently-launched app, Thunder Reward.

Your Mission

We are looking for a talented UX/UI Designer to showcase their skills and create unique user experiences to help us build the Zeta Learning user experience.

At Zeta, you will play a crucial role amongst a team of passionate individuals who are working to revolutionize educational technology and help our users unlock their full potential.

As a UI/UX Designer you will:
• Ensure that your interfaces are creating the... most optimized experience for our users.
• Be empowered to create unparalleled user experiences
• Include our highly motivated users in the process.
• Work to achieve the vision through your visuals.
• Ensure that your interfaces are creating the most optimized experience for our users.
• Communicate with the engineering team to ensure your designs are executed exactly as you intended them.
• Create high-fidelity prototypes of the app’s user interface.
• Ensure that all designs are aligned with our Zeta’s brand and current objectives.

Who You Are

Required:
• A keen eye for details
• UI prototyping softwares (Figma or Sketch)
• Strong communication skills
• Able to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders
• Able to merge different kind of inputs
• Deep knowledge of creative process from concept to production
• Stays up-to-date with design trends
• Ability and drive to create unconventional and unique user experiences
• Strong knowledge of branding design guidelines
• A portfolio of previous work and results is essential to demonstrate in your application
• Ability to communicate reasons for designs created and seek feedback during reviewing sessions to continually improve

Appreciated:
• Adobe Creative Suite: After Effects (UI animations), Premiere Pro
• Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
• Degree in Design or related field

Perks/Compensation
• Ability to very quickly see your designs live and in the hands of users
• Competitive salary
• Strong ownership
• Fast career-advancement opportunities
• International mobility
• Potential to manage your own team
• Company Stock Options
• Bonus scheme

Contact Info

Come conquer technology and products with us.

Liberate potential.

Email resume, portoflio and cover letter to us at careers@zetalearning.com.

zeta learning focuses on Games. Their company has offices in San Diego and London. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.zetalearning.com

title: UI/UX Designer & Researcher ( German speaking)
description:
Salary 35,000 - 45,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- 3+ years professional experience in the field of UX, usability & information architecture
-Experience with design and concept software tools (e.g. Sketch, Invision, Figma) to create user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes and customer journeys
-Ability to design and conduct user research like usability tests
-Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy
-Self-driven, organised and diligent personality
-Proficiency in German and English. Please note that we can only consider candidates that speak German on a native speaker level.

Responsibilities:

- - Ability to lead and ideate products from scratch and improve features for web and apps within a user-centered design process
- Create consistent user flows across all touchpoints, wireframes and UI designs to support agile development teams
- Conduct user research through interviews, field visits and usability studies
- Support the product team in strategic... product development decisions based on your user research
- Work in an agile environment with cross functional teams
- Ensure design consistency across all platforms (web & mobile apps)
- Regular UX analysis and improvements of our customer experience

Technologies:

-

More: Playbrush is the innovation leader in smart Oral Care in Europe and beyond.

Since 2015 we have been pioneering Smart Toothbrushes and Oral-Care-As-A-Service Subscriptions to revolutionize dental health for children, families and adults alike. Our interactive smart toothbrushes connect via Bluetooth to a smartphone or tablet. Children control mobile games with their toothbrush, and consequently get better at toothbrushing. Adults also interact and receive smart feedback via the toothbrush, so they can improve their brushing performance.

Playbrush is a startup that has received multiple millions of investment, won several awards and was recognised by the media globally. Only recently it has been acquired by the Swiss-Japanese consumer health champion Sunstar Global!

Now we are looking for an experienced and ambitious UI/UX Designer to own user research and UI/X design end-to-end for web and mobile apps to join our team in London.

Benefits

-Flexible working hours
-Variety of perks (e.g., bonuses, travel support, trainings, lunches and free books)
-The opportunity to become a part of one of the most exciting software startups in the consumer space (multiple award winner), which recently exited to a Global Consumer Health Champion
-Location for this position: London( we also offer help with relocation - VISA & relocations costs) or Vienna

title: UX Designer (Remote)
description:
Job Description

The team at Lava Labs are looking for a UI/UX Designer to join their rapidly growing company.

Reporting to the Art Director, you will be responsible for the UX and UI concepts and design for their upcoming AFAR series of games.

This role is a great opportunity to build something from the ground up without being hindered by an existing design system, and so is ideally suited to either somebody with a history of leading a UI/UX project or somebody looking to take that next step.

Lava labs are a high ambitious studio who are seeking to be the market leaders in web3 and revolutionise and redefine the gaming field of Crypto and Blockchain.

Working on their first game, a third person arcade platform called AFAR (A far away realm) that social and competitive gaming elements that pit players against each other.

Your Responsibilities...
• Conceptualize and design the game UI, including 2D and 3D HUD + GUI elements, boot-up sequences, loading screens and menus
• Assure... that game information is well conveyed through the various user interfaces
• Work closely with the code team to implement assets into the game and verify the quality of the graphics once implemented
• Keep control of assets production, respecting technical constraints and optimization guidelines

The Skills And Experience You'll Bring To The Role...
• 3-5 years of experience in the gaming industry, specializing in the creation of interfaces and in menu design
• Knowledge of UI/UX industry standards and trends
• Ability to work with a high degree of self-direction and motivation
• Expert in Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects and other creative tools
• Excellent graphic design skills (design, layout, typography)
• Familiar with industry game engines Unity and Unreal

With more than $10 million in total funding from leading investors like Dialectic, Merit Circle, Dragonfly, DeFiance Capital, Animoca Brands, Razer Computer, Weak Simp Cap, Dapper Labs, and Maven 11, as well as angel investors Santiago R Santos, Gabby Dizon and Nick Chong, Lava Labs now have a valuation upwards of $100 million

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
About MyBuilder

MyBuilder.com helps homeowners find reliable tradespeople through the power of online reviews. We’re a market leader in the UK and part of the Instapro Group, the technology company powering Europe’s leading home services marketplaces.

What does the role involve?

We are looking for a Senior UX Designer who’s a passionate advocate for the voice of the customer and can foster and evangelise user centred design principles in the organisation.

This role has an end-to-end responsibility - from discovery and ideation to delivery - you’ll create and optimise features that make a material impact in our customers’ lives, as well as helping us to achieve our business goals.

You’ll play a key role in the product team - through planning design thinking activities and conducting user research, to designing user flows, testing prototypes and studying data, you will continuously help guide and enhance our offering for our UK customers.

Key responsibilities:
• Plan and conduct... research with users to understand their needs
• Own the design process, from start to finish
• Design interfaces, user-flows and information hierarchies that create a rewarding and motivating user experience
• Create interactive prototypes for testing and development
• Write intuitive UX copy that helps guide users through the experience
• Review and critique design from your peer designers
• Use UX metrics and user research insights to inform your design decisions
• Plan UX/UI priorities with Product Managers
• Constantly improve the usability and user experience of all our digital touch points
• Own, contribute and expand our Design System

What we are looking for:
• 5+ years of hands-on UX design experience - we’re keen to see top-notch solutions across content, platforms and devices in your portfolio
• 2+ years of experience in a customer facing digital marketplace
• Experience planning and conducting user research; from ethnography to validation and usability.
• Strong Interaction Design, Information Architecture, and User Interface Design skills
• You have in-depth customer behaviour knowledge and understand how to translate insights into customer journeys and product/service requirements
• Know all about the good, the bad and the ugly of UX and UI design. You understand that good design is about moving people instead of moving pixels
• Master your tools. Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, etc.
• A team player, while also being able to work autonomously
• Proactive bringing knowledge, best practices, etc, to help build the skills of the team
• Creative, open to learning new things and embracing diverse ideas
• Fluency in English so you can communicate easily with all of your colleagues and conduct user interviews across the UK

Why you’ll enjoy working at MyBuilder

We’ll set you up with a shiny new laptop and all the kit to get you up and running. As part of a close-knit team, you’ll benefit from regular peer support and feedback to help you succeed and progress in your role at MyBuilder. Most importantly, you’ll be in great company, surrounded by a world-class team on a mission to make the world a better place, one project at a time.

We’ll also add:
• 33 days holiday (including bank holidays) + 1 extra day every year
• 5% employer pension contribution
• Comprehensive private medical insurance with AXA
• Routine treatments health cash plan
• Enhanced parental leave
• Flexible hybrid working options
• Office travel allowance
• Free lunch on office days
• Annual personal development grant + days off
• Generous new hire referral bonus

Read more about life at MyBuilder on the Product/Tech team.

For more information on how we store your data please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status

title: UI/UX Designer (London)
description:
UI/UX Designer

AND Introduction

At AND, we accelerate the development of digital capabilities. In practice, that means helping ambitious leaders and organisations build the teams, products, processes and even operational structures they need to close the digital skills gap within their organisation today, so that they thrive tomorrow.

Clients rely on our experience, agility and craft skills across tech and business strategy, software development and product management to address some of the toughest challenges facing their businesses.

We bring aboard thinkers, tinkerers, passionate software craftspeople and inspiring technologists to help us solve these challenges. Together, we’re united by a sense of pragmatism, purpose and a deeply-held belief that digital products and technology alone won’t transform a business or save the world: it’s the people that count.

About You

As a UI/UX Designer, you will help to deliver world class customer experiences for our clients, guiding them... on best practice in visual design, user experience and design development, as well as delivering design outputs of your own.
• This is a client facing delivery role with a mix of advising, implementing and delivering, sometimes across multiple clients
• You will be an ambassador on user experience and visual design, supporting the creative direction and vision within our fast growing design function.
• You’ll engage closely with the client and Scrum teams to review current design processes and methods, before making your recommendation and making it happen!
• You’ll also have the chance to shape and deliver internal communication and training
• Support the development of design skills in the Club

To do that, it’s essential you bring the following:
• 4+ years of UI design experience
• Experience in Mobile, web and responsive environments
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
• Strong visual and brainstorming skills with the ability to confidently sketch interfaces in cross functional collaborative teams
• Experience with design systems, from creation to management over time

It’s helpful if you also have:
• Interest or experience in UX research
• Knowledge of Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Marvel, Invision, Figma
• Demonstrable experience delivering B2B and B2C UX and/or UI for dashboard, control panels and management applications
• Demonstrable experience delivering innovative solutions for consumer facing iOS and Android applications, utilising native functionality where appropriate
• Ability to flex between UX and UI if required is a plus

Joining AND

From the work we deliver, to the way we serve and support our people, we work hard to ensure that there’s nowhere quite like AND. But joining a company is a two-way street: the fit has to work on both sides. So before you apply, here’s three key things to understand about us:
• We’re built for people - like, real humans. Not ‘resources’ or ‘staff’. That means happiness and wellbeing really do matter to us, and we hate unnecessary hierarchy and bureaucracy.
• There’s no well-trodden path ahead: AND is growing fast and forging a new trail. That’s exciting, and gives us all the autonomy and opportunity we love - but bear in mind it also demands focus, patience and resilience.
• Diversity is a priority. After all, to build great products that a wide variety of different people love to use, we need a wide variety of people to help us build them. So diversity is more than a policy or a word: it’s business critical for us.

Still sound good? Great! Fill out the short application form below and we’ll be in touch.

AND Digital focuses on Professional Services and Consulting Services. Their company has offices in London, Amsterdam, Manchester, Edinburgh, and Glasgow. They have a large team that's between 501-1000 employees.

You can view their website at https://and.digital or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: UI/UX
description:
About Us

Tuli's mission is to transform the current diagnostic testing process into a convenient, local, and digital experience. Our business aims to ease the consumer journey and for the medical professionals involved. Our key focus is to equip traditional brick-and-mortar pharmacies with diagnostic capability. Also to digitise the process by providing them with their easy-to use-software.

Why work with Tuli?

Not only does joining Tuli mean being part of an exciting scaling business, but we also encourage team members to have a say in the direction and focus of the business.

At Tuli, we are a community of hardworking people who are committed to success and growth, not only to the business but to ourselves as individuals.

As we are a small team, we value our people. Career growth and progression within Tuli is something we highly encourage.

We support your growth with internal/external training and industry exposure - we want to give you what you need to succeed.

You will have... great exposure to start-up culture and will see how your hard work can make a positive impact each and every day.

The Role:

The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and debugging responsive web applications for the company. Using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, this candidate will be able to translate user and business needs into functional frontend design.

You will help define how Tuli Health runs for our clients and users.

Design web and mobile experiences that are simple and intuitive for the end user

Take new features from ideation to prototyping, user testing and production

Daily collaborate with our tech and customer support teams

You will be owning product features that support all of our platforms (iOS and Android)

You will be interacting directly with end-users and Tuli developers to collect feedback that will help you define the further path of the product development

You will be in a small agile team and aim to improve user experience

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Description

We're looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer with an eye for clean and artful design, superior UI/UX skills and the ability to translate high-level requirements into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

Responsibilities

In this role, you will:
• Collaborate with our product and engineering teams to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, focusing on user experience.
• Create industry-leading eCommerce experiences with a focus on high conversion rates.
• Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering.
• Research, brainstorm, create wireframes, and design product UI to bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.
• Work in constraints of a specific brand and within design system guidelines.

Requirements
• Legally eligible to work in the UK
• 5+ years of proven UX UI experience.
• Strong portfolio of product design.
• Experience within the fintech and ecommerce industry - a... strong advantage.
• Excellent communication skills.
• An eye for a clean and simple design.
• Experience in user research, user flows, and creating wireframes.
• A self-starter and an autodidact that is able to explore and progress by yourself.
• You have excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
• Proficiency in Figma - a strong advantage.
• Ability to illustrate vector icons and figures - a strong advantage.

About Us:

Overwolf is the world's leading platform for in-game creators and gamers who build or consume user-generated content around their favorite games. We're talking about some of the biggest AAA titles out there - games like Minecraft, League of Legends, World of Warcraft, PUBG, and Fortnite - to name just a few.

The way people create and play games around the world is changing, and Overwolf is leading the revolution. We empower just about 100K creators to make the best games even better - giving them everything they need to create unique gaming experiences that serve more than 33M gamers every month.

Our mission is to turn in-game creation into a new profession and build the next generation of games. And we're just getting started.

Are you ready to join the pack and shape the future of gaming

title: Experienced/Senior UI/UX Artist - Sonic Mobile
description:
Experienced or Senior UI Artist – Sonic Mobile

We are looking for an Experienced or Senior UI artist to join our Sonic Mobile projects. Why work at HARDlight?

• We pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of the office

• Based in the ‘Heart of England' in stunning historic Royal Leamington Spa, with great connections to London & Birmingham

We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!

This is a hybrid role where the team works 3 days in the office (Tues, Wed, Thurs) and 2 from home (Mon, Fri

title: UX Designer
description:
UX/YI Designer
Radbroke

As a Barclays UX/UI Designer, you will be innovating, creating and shaping the user experience for both new and existing bank applications. You’ll be part of a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team of UX designers, UI designers and UX researchers. Working as a UX/UI Designer here at Barclays, you get the chance to use your creative skills to create accessible and usable designs that can be experienced via any channel or device. Additionally, you will deliver consistent, excellent, customer-focused design solutions.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

Working Flexibly
We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in... This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to
business needs.

Hybrid Working
We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally are able to request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances
Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.

What will you be doing?
• Creating accessible and usable designs that can be experienced via any channel or device

• Understanding complex digital concepts, and presenting them as simple design solutions

• Owning the end-to-end design process from concepts to developer handoff

• Being proactive in solving problems effectively, using multiple sources of factual information

• Working through complex problems and resolving to an appropriate solution

• Contributing to strategic concepts that can drive engagement

• Constantly pushing for a customer-centric approach whilst delivering on required business objectives

• Identifying and implementing process improvements within the team
What we’re looking for:

• Ability to create design documents from flows and low-fidelity wireframes to pixel perfect designs and prototypes
• Ability to translate a combination of business requirements, user needs and technical requirements into engaging and simple designs
• Proven experience of working with UX design principles and brand guidelines
• Excellent communication skills
Skills that will help you in the role :

• BSc degree in relevant discipline
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS
• Experience in the Fintech industry

Where will you be working?
The Barclays Technology Campus, just outside Manchester, is our transatlantic tech command centre for information security in the UK. It’s the vital strategic powerhouse behind our global operations. Radbroke is a place where big ideas become realities. Where the talent in the world can build careers full of scope, variety and reward, by creating the technical solutions that meet today’s demands, answer tomorrow’s questions and redefine the future of finance.

#Software #Hybrid

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
We are on a mission to improve the world of work, technology and people, building products and services to help solve our customers' people-related challenges now and in the future.

We design software to make processes easier, create apps to foster engagement, support organisations to get better insights from their data and much more for over 1200 organisations across the UK and Ireland.

Our?4-core?values Sustainability, Trust,?Collaboration?and Innovation have been the?drive to MHR's success. This starts internally within our business by putting our colleagues and customers at the?forefront?of everything we do.

Be part of our mission, join MHR and help shape the world of work.

About the role

The Product Planning team are recruiting for an individual with a passion for UI/UX and a strong drive for innovation, to join as a Senior UX Designer. You will help facilitate internal and external business contacts; pulling the resulting information together to create simple and effective... UI/UX designs.

Key Responsibilities
• Understand target audiences needs and conduct user research of competitor products
• Be an excellent communicator with great mediation, facilitation and translation skills
• Craft simple and elegant solutions to difficult technical and functional problems
• Undertake research as required and attend conferences and events, documenting afterwards to extend the team knowledge
• Communicate, specify, and describe UX designs to researchers, developers, testers, PMs, senior leadership and other designers without ambiguity and within deadlines
• Be fluent in technology (especially in digital media - its concepts and direction) and able to understand it well enough to communicate comfortably with developers
• Push creativity and challenger conventional thinking to solve design problems
• Proactively identify areas of improvement in current products and designs
• Mentor junior and mid-level UX Designers
• Contribute to the leadership of the UX of current projects

Key Skills
• Passion for UI/UX and strong drive for innovation

With a great working environment and amazing colleagues, we'll support you professionally and personally through our learning and wellbeing programmes. In addition, we offer:

title: Lead UI / UX Designer (Flexible Remote Location)
description:
Dorian is a social creator platform that enables fiction writers to easily turn fiction 📚 into games 🎮, stream them to their fans and make money 💰 from their hobby!

As Dorian UI / UX Designer you will focus on empowering creators by inventing and designing amazing creative tools. Have you ever felt passionate about working on a creator platform, like Twitch or TikTok? If so, this position would be a great opportunity for you to flex your design muscles 💪

What you'll be doing:

What we offer:

Dorian focuses on Games and Content Creators. Their company has offices in San Francisco. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Dorian has raised $19.25M of funding; their latest round was closed on March 2022.

title: Senior UX Designer - Elsevier Website
description:
Senior UX Designer - Elsevier Website

Location: Open to applicants based in London or Oxford, United Kingdom, or Amsterdam, Netherlands

About the Team

Our UX team works closely with tech and product squads in Elsevier, providing design thinking, a human-centric approach, and the expertise to imagine and deliver great digital experiences. We look after a wide portfolio of products including the corporate website, the stores, and the enterprise tools for performance and data monitoring.

Our mission is to understand our customers in science and health, create for them the best path to information and design environments to serve their purpose.

About the Role

As Senior UX Designer, you will work closely with other Designers in the UX team and with the NextGen cross-functional teams to help shape the future of the flagship Elsevier website. You will support the design strategy for the evolution of the Elsevier websites and play a key role defining the best experience for researchers... organizations, and health professionals worldwide.

You are an expert user of multiple design tools, a mentor for others in the business, and lead the presentation of design to stakeholders. You can informally lead cross-functional team members and represent UX in product strategy meetings. Usability and inclusive design principles are part of your process.

Key Responsibilities
• Mature a solid understanding of customer use cases.
• Advocate for customers’ needs with the cross-functional team.
• Demonstrate energy and vision to see through innovative ideas.
• Propose design solutions that are guided by users’ data and recognize contribution from others.
• Iterate on designs at different levels of fidelity and test solutions to check they solve the right problem
• Create and manage deliverables for the project including design assets, design patterns and style guides which reflect user needs and company brand.
• Facilitate the adoption and use of cross-product style guides to support design strategy.
• Partner closely with Business, Product and Engineering while staying connected with UX community and team.
• Produce designs across all relevant platforms and take the lead in helping the team establish key metrics for projects.

Key requirements
• Solid design process reflected in UX/UI design portfolio. Experience creating UI design patterns, and product processes that adapt to customer needs,
• Excellent interaction design skills, demonstrable understanding of information architecture, usability and inclusive design principles
• Ability to produce and communicate user journeys and flows that teams can use to advance the conversation and the creative process.
• Enjoys collaborating with technology, product, and other key stakeholders such as content managers to come up with new ideas and solve product challenges.
• Comfortable creating wireframes, prototypes, design concepts, style guides, design patterns, and high-resolution artefacts to be used in final implementation, liaising with other UX designers to produce a consistent experience
• Proficient using design and prototyping software (e.g., Miro, Figma, Adobe)
• Desire to be part of a collaborative team with a creative, positive human-centred approach.

Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.
• Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

Working with us

We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.

Working for you

At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:

· Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days

· Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits

· Wellbeing programs

· Life assurance

· Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme

· Long service awards

· Save As You Earn share option scheme

· Travel Season ticket loan

· Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave

· Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children

· RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you

· Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer

· Access to extensive learning and development resources

· Access to employee discounts via Perks at Work

About us

A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s

grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.

Join us

Are you ready to help us progress science and health? Our technology leads to innovation, so join a forward-thinking digital business that is tackling world-scale challenges and align your ambitions with our passion for driving global knowledge-sharing.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact accommodations@relx.com or if you are based in the US you may also contact us on 1.855.833.5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy

title: Product Designer (UI/UX) (Remote)
description:
Description

The UI / UX Designer role holds responsibility for the construction of application designs for both internal and external user audiences.

The role is responsible for creating both functional and appealing features that address the client needs, and helping the company grow its customer base - as well as engaging with users to make their experience more user-friendly, intuitive and more efficient.

What that means day to day
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product analysts, product managers and developers.
• Understand product specifications and user psychology.
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps.
• Design graphical user interface elements; e.g. menus, tabs and widgets.
• Develop UI mock-ups, prototypes and wireframes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look, focusing on ease of use and minimize the need for training.
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. usability, findability and... responsiveness).
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with Product Managers and Developers.
• Modify and revise existing designs to meet changing customer preferences.
• Work closely with Product Managers and Developers to suggest improvements for products and processes.
• Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate over your designs.
• Take an active role in quality assurance of designs developed.
• Collaborate effectively with other team members and stakeholders.
• Present UI / UX design ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
• Stay up to date on current industry trends and market conditions.

What you’ll need to be successful

You'll have demonstrable work experience as a UI / UX Designer or similar role with HTML / CSS designer experience. You'll have experience with tools such as Adobe products;

PhotoShop / Illustrator, Balsamiq / InVision Mockups (or similar) and will have knowledge of JavaScript and Assistive technology.

You'll also have :
• Portfolio of design projects including digital experiences
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Knowledge of accessibility usability standards and guidelines
• Good skills in user interface creation, user experience, website and app design
• Good communication skills both verbal and written to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Good time-management skills
• Problem-solving aptitude
• Background in product research
• Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture

LI-remote

What you’ll get in return

FOR THE HERE AND NOW We provide a mature and flexible work your way’ culture, generous holiday allowance, a giving day’ to give back to others, enhanced family friendly leave (regardless of gender), an employee assistance programme, 24-hour online GP, gym discounts, cover for a variety of healthcare, dental, optical and wellbeing treatments / services, a cycle to work scheme and paid time off when you’re physically and mentally unwell.

FOR FUN You spend a significant percentage of your time with your colleagues (and what a great bunch of people they are!) and it’s important to us that everyone contributes to an environment that is positive and full of laughs.

We’ve always got something going on, from charity events and competitions to recognition events and awards and we encourage our teams to get involved and have fun along the way.

FOR THE FUTURE To set you up for later on in life, we provide an enhanced pension scheme with generous employer contributions and a life assurance policy for peace of mind.

We offer a plethora of development resources and support, including access to LinkedIn learning to support you as you develop your career with us.

Last year alone we filled nearly 30% of our roles with internal candidates (which equates to almost 50 people being promoted!)

Sound interesting so far?

What you can expect if you apply :
• A response to your application within 10 working days
• An interview process consisting of :

o An initial discovery call with the recruiter

o A first stage interview via Microsoft Teams

o Additional interview (likely face to face) with the stakeholders you’ll be working with closely in the role

We’re keen to ensure our hiring process allows you to be at your best, so if you need us to make any adjustments, please just let us know.

Who we are :

By this point, you’ll likely have decided if the role sounds up your street, but what about Alcumus as an employer?

Time to introduce ourselves

We believe that everyone should be able to go home safely from work every night, so we’ve made it our mission to build risk management solutions that are far beyond simple box ticking exercises, instead embracing new and evolving technology that will support our clients to keep their workforce safe.

We’re a PE backed, high growth business that sets ambitious goals, moves at pace, and fails fast. We believe that if you look after your people, they look after everything else, so we place significant emphasis on providing stretch for personal development.

Our growth will be your growth.

We value diversity and work hard to foster a culture where everyone can bring their whole self to work, each and every day.

Every one of our people is unique, and that’s what makes Alcumus stronger as a whole.

What we stand for :
• Our values are the core of our business and fundamental to the way we work. In your role, you will;
• Be a team player working collaboratively and being consciously inclusive with your colleagues
• Be brave sharing your ideas, challenging the status quo, and taking responsibility for the part you play
• Know your stuff continuously developing your skills and expertise, with the support from our many learning offerings
• Enjoy the journey contributing to a positive working environment that enables you and everyone around you to be at their best

Equal Employment Opportunity

Alcumus is an equal opportunity workplace. All candidates will be afforded equal opportunity through the recruiting process.

We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity and / or expression.

We are dedicated to growing a diverse team of highly talented individuals and creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation / adjustments during the interviewing process, please let us know.

Follow #careerswithalcumus to keep up to date with new vacancies and experience the everyday life at Alcumus

title: Head of Design - UX, UI, Service, Design Thinking
description:

Head of Design / Head of UX Design / Head of Digital Design / Head of CX Design

title: UX designer at a data start-up
description:
About Anmut

In 2018, Anmut was started to solve a big problem. We saw the world-changing potential of data being lost because most organisations don’t understand the real value of it. So we set up Anmut to value data. We translate the intangible idea of data into an asset that businesses can better manage, earning higher returns on their data investments and ultimately driving more change. We democratise the value of data, for all those businesses that aren’t Amazon, Alphabet, Apple, Netflix or Microsoft.

Data valuation is a new and challenging field, and we’re at the forefront. Our approach isn’t limited to shareholder value. We also take a broader, more considered view, applying strategic thinking, data science and machine learning to understand the role data plays in the value an organisation creates for its wider stakeholders.

We are building an exceptional team to deliver a suite of innovative software products to support our mission and our clients. As data is intangible... developing products that help bring to life its value and importance in a visually interactive way is an exciting opportunity we need your help with. If you want to be part of a creative and growing business, tackling a complex challenge that matters, read on.

Role

We are looking for a UX designer to join our small, high-energy product team. You will be critical to defining the user experience of our new products by:
• Taking the lead on the UX development aspect of our new products. We have lots of ambitious and exciting ideas and this is an opportunity to really own the UX design aspect of something completely new.
• Gathering requirements from a range of different stakeholders and translating them into user journeys, storyboards and initial design ideas.
• Designing the appropriate flow and layout of solutions which optimise the experience for the user.
• Building visually appealing wireframes and prototypes to bring complex ideas around understanding data to life.
• Think critically about design from the user’s perspective, to design and iterate the most elegant solution possible and help identify likely user issues early.
• Gathering feedback on designs from a wider range of stakeholders
• Working alongside our developers to help convert final designs into software.
• What we look for
• Ability to translate complex customer requirements into user journeys, wireframes and prototypes to demonstrate best practice user experience.
• A strong visual design aesthetic including high quality UI, along with a keen eye for detail.
• Experience in prototyping including proficiency in industry standard design software (e.g. Adobe XD, Sketch, InVision, Figma etc).
• Ability to draw out critical requirements, and identify and predict potential design problems early.
• Strong communication skills and ability to interact clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across the wider business.
• A commitment to the highest quality standards, with designs being clear enough for easy hand off to developers.
• A willingness to seek out feedback and constructive criticism on work produced.
• A pragmatic and flexible attitude – recognition that lack of clarity can be inherent in designing something so new, as well as consideration for technical constraints placed on designs.
• A creative and innovative mind that is not afraid to offer different ideas that are ‘outside the box’
• A real passion to create something that is completely new.

Additional desirable experience
• A degree (preferably in a discipline relevant to Art, Design or Usability), professional certification to a similar level or related work experience
• Experience working within Agile / Sprint based environments
• Experience in designing products from initial design through to hand-off to the development team for build.
• Experience in delivering designs which reflect complex user requirements and deliver measurable business benefits.
• Experience in working in a related field to data management or experience of data management tools e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Collibra
• Knowledge or experience of the technology behind web development e.g. CSS, HTML, JavaScript.

We are looking to shape this role based on finding the right person with a passion to grow with us as a company, and therefore the exact role requirements are flexible based on your previous level of experience. If you do not exactly meet our requirements but feel that you would be a good fit for the role, please apply anyway! Every application is reviewed by our team and we're always looking to evolve our understanding of what a great candidate looks like.

Benefits
• Salary: £TBC based on experience, plus annual bonus. Bi-annual salary reviews.
• Opportunity for equity with career development.
• 25 days annual leave.
• Monthly development reviews.
• Training and development budget for professional development.
• Social events.
• Cycle and run friendly central London office.
• Remote working friendly.
• We are able to offer visa sponsorship (SOC 2137)

Applying

To apply use this link:https://anmut.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=30

On passing initial screening the process is as follows:
• 30 minute phone screening with a member of our Product team

Half day assessment day covering:
• Candidate introductions and fit interview
• Portfolio review
• Whiteboarding design exercise
• CEO interview

Anmut focuses on Big Data, Consulting, Big Data Analytics, Data, and Management Consulting. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.anmut.co.uk or find them on LinkedIn

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
We’re looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer with an eye for clean and artful design, superior UI/UX skills and the ability to translate high-level requirements into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:
• Collaborate with our product and engineering teams to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, focusing on user experience.
• Create industry-leading eCommerce experiences with a focus on high conversion rates.

Requirements:

• Strong portfolio of product design.
• Experience within the fintech and ecommerce industry - a strong... advantage.

About Us:

Overwolf is the world’s leading platform for in-game creators and gamers who build or consume user-generated content around their favorite games. We’re talking about some of the biggest AAA titles out there – games like Minecraft, League of Legends, World of Warcraft, PUBG, and Fortnite – to name just a few.

The way people create and play games around the world is changing, and Overwolf is leading the revolution. We empower just about 100K creators to make the best games even better - giving them everything they need to create unique gaming experiences that serve more than 33M gamers every month.

Our mission is to turn in-game creation into a new profession and build the next generation of games. And we’re just getting started.

Are you ready to join the pack and shape the future of gaming

title: UI Senior Designer
description:
A leading premium automotive business and leading to move towards electric autonomous vehicles.

WHAT TO EXPECT

We are looking for outstanding creatively minded individuals to join our UI Team
Creative UI Designer: Become part of Jaguar and Land Rover Design at a pivotal point in our digital transformation. Our 'Refocus' strategy brings renewed energy and focus on UI and has created opportunities to join our team working with two of the most awarded and aspirational brands in the world.
This is a huge opportunity for passionate, driven and creative UI Designers to make their mark in a fresh and forward looking era where experience will define our next generation of products.

Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities

This role is embedded at the core of the UI and Interior Design teams you will be tasked with creating in-car screen based content plus our virtual head-up displays, and goes further to influence our apps and cloud connected customer touchpoints.
Working as part of a... team working on future UI for both of our luxury brands, at all stages in the creation and delivery process.

What You'll Need

A hugely impressive, natural flare for creativity and on-trend "look and feel" in everything you do. The ability to create stand-out presentations and inspiration to communicate ideas. First impressions count; simplicity, refinement and confidence will really make applications stand out.

A broad understanding of all things digital and interaction design, in a both automotive and consumer UX. The applicant must show deep routed passion and personal creations that demonstrate luxurious graphic designs, inspiring motion graphics, animated texts and UI layers, luxury web based platforms and apps. Digital motion design is as important to us as the layout and graphic design itself.

An open-minded approach. You must be able to digest and integrate senior feedback as well as demonstrate a considered and confident approach to challenge and influence.

Highly capable ability to create a fresh and modern look and feel to your work using a range of digital tools and software. Open to trying new tools, processes and ways of working.
A passion and understanding for our great brands, and their iconic products. What makes Jaguar and Land Rover Digital experience premium and different to other OEM's - what principles could be shared and what could be different to amplify each brand experience?

Essential criteria:

Primary skills include: Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop.

Additional skills in After Effects, Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch, 3D software, Powerpoint, Jira, Javascript, InDesign and also useful but not essential.

Additional useful skills: 3D CAD modelling, rendering and 3D animation skills (Maya or 3ds)

Experience of Digital Design

title: Lead UX/UI Designer
description:
No agencies please

We are an early stage fintech looking for a London or Norwich-based Lead UX/ UI Designer.

As a key member of product team you’ll be responsible for supporting end-to-end feature development; from understanding what customers like and dislike about the current experience, building prototypes to enable feature testing, creating designs to support feature development and working with our development team to make sure implementation and design remain aligned throughout the delivery process. You’ll thrive in a fast-paced environment and being a key person in a cross-functional team.

You’ll have demonstrable experience identifying and building user personas, developing and documenting user journeys and flows, wireframe development and prototyping.

You’ll be an expert craftsperson in designing digital product interfaces and keep up-to-date with the latest guidelines from the likes of Google and Apple. Your portfolio should show demonstrable experience of defining and... delivering both UX and UI solutions for products.

You’ll be responsible for:

• Devising simple, elegant UX mobile solutions to complex problems

• Producing beautiful, clean and intuitive mobile UI designs

• Designing new screens and experiences for both Snoop apps

• Defining and maintain good design process

• Rapidly prototyping new ideas

• Designing with data

• Providing design direction to the development team and coming up with solutions where technical limitations cause divergence from initial approaches

Job Requirements

As a successful applicant for this role, you’ll be:

• Sociable, driven, a self-starter that is enthusiastic about design and innovation

• Comfortable presenting and articulating work (internally and externally)

• Able to demonstrate a good understanding of the technical implications of design choices

• Naturally solution-oriented and able to quickly adapt and offer ideas

• Willing to go above and beyond to achieve excellence and capable of working in a collaborative environment

• Able to think at all levels of the design process, from product (system) design, to interaction, to beautiful pixels

• Working closely with agile development teams

• Empathetic and inclusive

• Able to quickly change focus as customer and business needs evolve

We want you to have the right credentials and experience for the job, but crucially we want to see a thirst for learning and an entrepreneurial spirit. Working in a start-up is a lot of fun and incredibly fulfilling; but it is hard work and without the support and infrastructure that exists in big business. You must be able to thrive in this environment. And whilst you are here to get a job done, we would love you not to feel constrained by your role and get involved where you can, to make Snoop a success.

Full job description here: https://jobs.snoop.app/o/lead-uxui-designer

Snoop focuses on Mobile, Financial Services, Banking, Mobile Application, and Fin Tech. Their company has offices in London and Greater London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://snoop.app or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
An opportunity to directly contribute to Burp Suite, by bringing your niche expertise in desktop application design to enhance our user's experience.

Background

Based in Cheshire in the United Kingdom, PortSwigger Web Security is a global leader in the cybersecurity sector. Our cutting-edge software is used by over 50,000 customers in 150 countries to help them secure their web applications. We go beyond just selling software. Our educational and research output is used by millions of people globally to learn about web security.

We first made our name with Burp Suite, the leading software for web penetration testing. We have since broadened our focus with the release of Burp Suite Enterprise Edition, which is aimed at software development teams and large organizations with extensive web assets to defend, and the Web Security Academy. Our software products include our customer-facing website, the Customer Success Platform.

We are a fun group of people from a diverse range of... backgrounds, who pull together to produce amazing outcomes for our customers. We achieve this by continually investing in and supporting our people, giving them opportunities to flourish in our supportive and collaborative working environment. Want to find out more about our new fantastic office and what life is like at PortSwigger, check out; Life at PortSwigger

We now have a hugely exciting opportunity for a world-class UX/UI Designer to join our Burp Suite Professional team. Bringing your niche expertise in desktop application design, you will work with a high-performing team to solve complex design problems.

About you

You come from a technical background as someone who may have started their career as a developer or programmer but have taken a keen interest into all things UX. You are a UX Designer whose career demonstrates technical experience, as well as a strong portfolio of visual design and problem solving using UX methodologies and principles. You thrive in a hands-on design role in a highly collaborative flat team environment.

This means that:
• You have a good understanding of technical concepts.
• You are a strong visual communicator.
• You are naturally organized with great time management skills.
• You have the ability to adapt within fast paced agile environments.
• You are humble and open to constructive feedback.
• You are always looking for ways to improve your knowledge and skills .

Key responsibilities

Our designers are pivotal to the success of our product teams, working alongside highly experienced software developers and product experts. This means that you will be involved in a wide variety of activities, including:
• Modernization, research and design of future generations of our product.
• Working alongside the product team to define customer needs through bringing a design influence.
• Designing simple, elegant, data-driven, user-centric experiences that will delight our customers.
• Helping to shape the product strategy and vision, bringing your insight and expertise from a design perspective.
• Extensive and thorough user research with the primary responsibility of bringing forward new findings and learning to influence design decisions.
• Conducting user testing to validate all design solutions.
• Producing high quality sketches, wireframes and mock-ups at various degrees of fidelity.
• Collaborating closely with development teams during the prototyping and building of UI components.
• Contributing to the wider design systems and practices at PortSwigger.

Essential skills
• Strong technical background and knowledge - comfortable having highly technical conversations with developers and customers.
• Full-stack, cross-platform design experience, from discovery to design, through to building and delivering an exceptional product.
• Previous experience modernizing the design for a desktop application and understanding the challenges and opportunities that go with it.
• Ability to keep the customer at the heart of everything you do. Validating your ideas with data and customer research to build products that will delight the user.
• Exposure or experience with working in a cross-functional agile team solving complex user problems and evolving your design in rapid iterations to meet changing requirements.
• Experience using design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Axure, XD.
• Experience with moderating user testing and conducting interviews.
• Experience using user story techniques.
• A depth of hands-on experience with various UX methods such as empathy mapping or customer journey mapping.
• Good understanding of interaction design, including common UI patterns.
• Experience in creating user personas.
• A healthy understanding of accessibility standards.
• Proven ability to multi-task and deliver continuous, incremental value to the team.
• Self-motivate with the ability to adapt quickly, forming outstanding and innovative ideas.

Desirable skills

Although not essential to the role, it would be beneficial to have some knowledge or interest in the following area:
• Cybersecurity - although direct experience with Application Security is not required - you'll learn quickly!

Be well rewarded

We firmly believe in paying people what they're worth to us, not just what we can get away with or what they could earn elsewhere. We pay excellent salaries above the normal market level, and this is always determined based on your individual skills and contribution. In addition to a generous base salary, we offer share options and a comprehensive benefits package.

Salary: We pay excellent salaries above the normal market level, and this is always determined based on your individual skills and contribution.

Benefits: Share options, 8% employer pension contribution.

Life assurance: 4x salary.

Income protection: full pay for first 6 months of incapacity followed by 75% of salary plus pension contribution.

Private medical insurance: Bupa

Holidays: 25 days plus public holidays.

Working hours: Core hours are 9am to 5pm, with flexibility to start any time between 8am and 9.30am.

Why join PortSwigger web security?
• We like to have fun (why else would we make a product called Burp?).
• We are professional without being corporate.
• We encourage a positive work-life balance. We work hard but keep to a normal working day. We don't do stress.
• We offer a healthy, high-tech working environment. All our people work on the latest Macs, with dual monitors, sitting-standing desks, and (if they are so inclined) walking treadmills.
• We are a close-knit team. We have regular team lunches, evening social events, and amazing parties twice a year

title: Lead UI/UX Designer
description:
Resi is looking to hire an experienced and enthusiastic Lead User Interface/User Experience Designer who is comfortable owning the end-to-end user experience, reporting directly to our female CTO. From requirements gathering and ideation through to build, launch and performance review, you will have a huge impact on the Resi applications. It is important that you are able to clearly offer guidance on improving the user experience of our applications through design and performance optimisations. You will need to be comfortable with experimenting to discover the perfect user experience and work with others (both inside and outside of the business) to define and achieve this.

You will develop and manage a talented team of UI/UX designers; inspiring them to do their best work through your vision, communication, coaching, and problem solving techniques. Your team will define early concepts, articulate end-to-end experiences, and craft effective design solutions across a range of teams and... environments, working side-by-side with our engineers.

We are a female-led business, currently at ~140 people based in International House right at the heart of Brixton, South London. International House is the UK’s first Living Wage Building. Our office is both accessible and we will make reasonable adjustments to accommodate successful candidates. We have an ideas-led innovation culture and we really care about creating a diverse and inclusive team - so we welcome people from all backgrounds with different perspectives, ideas and experiences to work with us.

Key Responsibilities
• Translate complex business processes into intuitive and elegant user and product experience
• Assist in the development and evaluation of personas, user stories, and usability studies. Understand customer needs by driving customer/UX research and usability studies
• Create process flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity mockups to effectively communicate design strategies and detailed interaction behaviours
• Provide guidance on improving the user experience of our applications through design and performance optimisations
• Lead cross-team conceptual development and design documentation partnering with PMs, engineers, business teams, and senior management
• Handle multiple projects in an agile, fast-paced environment
• Be the go-to member of the team for questions or queries on UI/UX

Your Experience:
• 5+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, or similar
• Experience working in B2C, enterprise products, internal tools, or SAAS environments
• Strong portfolio of work showing digital product design experience
• Strong understanding of UX and user-centric design processes with data-driven analytics capabilities
• Ability to influence others to set and achieve goals and deadlines
• Ability to prioritise and manage projects
• Expertise with Figma
• Strong professional written and verbal communication skills

What We Can Offer You:
• A competitive salary
• Flexible and remote working opportunities
• Personal development budget
• Opportunity to level up your skills in a fast-growing tech business
• Office perks - snacks, fresh fruit and refreshments
• A strong culture of openness & transparency
• Well-being platform with quarterly credit added
• Salary sacrifice childcare scheme (Enjoy Benefits)
• Paid maternity and paternity (66% of pay for up to 4 months after 9 months service)
• Employee assistance program
• Cycle to work scheme
• Health cash plan
• Annual company trip away (abroad when we can!)
• Zero fee mortgage advice for you & your friends/family
• The chance to make a real impact on an ever changing industry
• The opportunity to work in a team of passionate individuals! You can check out our team here - https://resi.co.uk/about

Resi focuses on Startups, Application Platforms, Technology, and Architecture. Their company has offices in London. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.resi.co.uk

title: Senior UI/UX Artist
description:
Description

Atomhawk are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Senior UI Artist with an interest in developing in-game and front-end UI for AAA games projects and a solid UMG experience. As part of our UI team, you will work closely with UI engineers to develop and implement great UI for some incredible clients.

In This Role You Will
• Design, create and implement UI using proprietary and middleware UI tools
• Create visual and interaction design, adhering to a cohesive style guide and maintaining consistency
• Maintain high visual fidelity, competitive aesthetics, presenting game information in a clear and understandable manner.
• Organise and maintain game-ready assets for use in user interfaces, such as textures, icons, and fonts
• Create and revise UI concepts and prototype flows, to establish the UI direction
• Work with UI engineers to implement assets and ensure correct functionality and visual fidelity

This position is open to remote, hybrid and in-studio working. For... those wanting to work in a physical office, we can currently offer in-studio work in one of our UK studios. This can be from our principal studio in Newcastle, on the banks of the River Tyne, or from one of our many Group studios in Leamington Spa.

If this sounds like something that interests you then read on!

UI Artists at Atomhawk work on a variety of projects alongside their team members. We work at all stages of UI/UX development, from early concepting through to implementation. We work with leading brands including WB Games, XBOX Game Studios, 2K and EA, helping shape the user interfaces of the games of tomorrow.

We look for the following in people who want to join our team
• Quality at all stages of the process – Creation of UI/UX designs, organised workflow & files, well presented and defined from initial design through to implementation.
• Design thinking – Solving creative problems when adapting 2D concept, balancing form and function, always being aware of the whole pipeline and the requirements
• Technical skill – Adobe Photoshop, After Effects, Animate and Photoshop and an understanding of the usual development software & tools. An understanding and interest in real world mechanics would also be a benefit.
• Art fundamentals – A strong grasp of UI/UX principles and design.
• Variety and iteration – The ability to provide multiple creative options, then iterate upon them as projects progress.
• Adaptability – Switching quickly and fluidly to new requirements and processes when required.
• Working to a brief – Understanding creative briefs, then considering elements such as context, timescales and creative constraints when solving tasks.
• Time management – Creation of high-quality work within allocated timescales.
• Collaboration – Receptive to taking feedback and working together with team-mates and clients.

Requirements
• Great graphic design skills and the ability to flex your range and embed yourself in new and existing IP.
• Able to design and create UI from wireframe to concept to prototype to final.
• Excellent use of typography, composition, colour theory and motion graphics.
• Proven experience using core tools including Adobe Photoshop, After Effects and Animate.
• Experience of interface creation in game engines is desirable.
• Comfortable communicating and collaborating with engineering and production.
• Eager to get it right, redo/iterate work until the desired outcome is achieved.
• Task driven, self-motivated and proactive.
• Quick learner, able to rapidly pick up new software and workflow pipelines.
• Must be patient and polite but also able to judge moments where push-back is needed.
• A good understanding of 3d modelling is not required but is a bonus.
• Proficiency or ability to learn relevant software; XD, Axure, Perforce, Jira, Basecamp and Confluence.
• Understanding of animation timing.
• Experience on a multiplayer game titles and live-service titles (console).

About Atomhawk

Atomhawk produces the very best in cutting-edge creative conceptualisation, visualisation, and realisation. Our client list includes major names - Warner Bros, Sony, Microsoft, SEGA, Activision, 2K, EPIC, The Pokémon Company and Blizzard all feature. And we like variety. Every project is different from the last. The spectrum covers gritty, hard-hitting Mortal Kombat, irreverent and stylised Surgeon Simulator 2, comic book superheroes, nostalgic childhood favourites and all things in between. Whichever franchise is on today’s agenda - DC, Halo, Marvel, Mortal Kombat and Warhammer - we move through their worlds with ease and creative curiosity.

The work our team produces is world-class. We’ve celebrated that fact in three artbooks. Each one features concept art, tutorials and professional tips. Volume 3 was created to mark the studio’s 10th anniversary, and was displayed and sold at the Great North Museum: Hancock in Newcastle, where we held the exhibition Other Worlds: The Art of Atomhawk in 2020. You can take a virtual tour of the exhibition here.

Our output hasn’t gone unnoticed. We received Best Companies’ 3 Star Accreditation 2021 and Top Companies North East 2021. We hold the Queen’s Award for Enterprise for International Trade, as well as the TIGA Star Award 2021. We were also named Best Art/Animation/Trailer Supplier at the 2021 Develop Star Awards.

Creativity thrives through diversity, not conformity. Every Atomhawk applicant and employee is afforded space and freedom to be their true self, with no fear of prejudice or persecution. During the application process, you won’t be judged on your name, your gender, your sexuality, your ethnicity, your age, your religion, or any other factor unrelated to your ability to do the job.

Benefits

As well as having the chance to work on some incredible projects, Atomhawk offers a unique environment for those wanting to be surrounded by like-minded creative people. We have one of the largest in-house teams of specialist digital artists in the world, providing a collaborative community that works, develops and socialises together.

Atomhawk provides structured career development and training pathways for staff at all levels. We offer flexible working hours and a strict ‘No-Crunch’ culture, meaning overtime is not required within the art team.

Atomhawk is part of Sumo Group Ltd, one of the UK’s leading videogame developers

title: Lead UI/UX Designer - UK based Remote/Flexible
description:
Are you an experienced UI/UX Designer looking for a fresh challenge and opportunity where you can make a real impact?

We want you to #JOINTHEREBELLION!

For 30 years we’ve been creating incredible video games at our multiple studios, but Rebellion is more than just games. We have our own film and mo-cap studio, we create board games, publish books, and through 2000AD, publish comics and graphic novels such as the amazing Judge Dredd.

We operate across multiple UK locations, with studios based in Oxford, Warwick, Liverpool, and Wakefield. Work-life balance is important to us, and we want everyone at Rebellion to work in the way that works best for them. So, if you are based in the UK, we are always open to discussing how we can support remote and/or flexible working options.

We’re looking for a new Lead UI/UX Designer to lead a team of UI artists and technical designers to design and deliver the live service UX strategy for an unannounced co-op strategy shooter game.

Your job will... be to lead a team of UI Artists, Technical UI Designers and UX Designers to shape the vision, aesthetic and implementation of the UI for an unannounced action title.

You will be involved in building the UX pillars for the game alongside the Lead Game Designer, delivering scope and planning throughout the project, working as part of a multidisciplinary leadership team.

What we need is someone who knows how useful data is in analysing and reacting to user behaviour and feedback but also someone who loves working with other people. We believe that UI is never solved by a single person or a single point of view and that is why we want the best collaborators so that we can work together to make memorable experiences for us and for our players!

Responsibilities
• Lead the UI team, design and iterate UX and drive the UI/UX deliverables for the project
• Build a UX strategy for a brand-new game, helping to shape the UX vision in collaboration with experts from the Design team
• Design integral player experiences and get the joy of implementing and iterating some of those experiences yourself using a visual scripting toolset
• Drive the delivery and quality of the UI for the project, mentoring and supporting UI designers, artists, and technical designers

Requirements
• Experience designing UX on at least one title
• Experience managing a small team through all phases of the project lifecycle
• Portfolio showing experience designing high fidelity UI using industry standard tools, e.g., Adobe XD, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc
• Able to effectively communicate whilst building long-term, trusting relationships with a wide range of people
• Games as a service experience required for this project

Benefits

We offer an extensive benefits package to our team including:
• 26 days holiday + Bank holidays (increasing with service at 5 years – one day each year until you reach 31 days)
• Private Medical Insurance, healthcare cash plan, including dental and Vision
• Life Assurance, Income Protection & Critical Illness Cover
• Enhanced Family Leave
• Interest Free, Tax-Free loans
• Enhanced Pension Scheme
• EAP a range of Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
• Plus loads more… including a wide range of discounts, freebies, and social events!

About Us

Whichever team you join at Rebellion we are proud of our open, friendly, and creative atmosphere. We love what we do, and we have fun doing it! As a big indie developer, we have complete creative freedom over our titles which allows us to work on a massive variety of projects across all the major platforms.

Find out more about ushere

Our size, stability, and the variety of in-house expertise across multiple industries, makes Rebellion completely unique! We work in our own way, and we celebrate that as the key to our success. We foster an inclusive culture where you are encouraged to be yourself, to express your creativity and your talent. We are people focused and will support you in every way to can be the best at what you do. We recognise the importance of enjoying what you do and having a healthy work-life balance. We offer a friendly, creative, and relaxed working atmosphere, with sensibly managed projects and a wide variety of benefits and development opportunities for all our teams to ensure you are fully supported with your physical and Mental Well-being.

We are actively recruiting for a diverse team and continue to add to our culture of growth and inclusion. Rebellion encourages innovation in all areas, and we look forward to hearing how you can help us to be better. We encourage all demographics of culture, gender, ethnicity, neurodiversity and beyond, because a representative team makes better products.

If you are interested in working at Rebellion, but this role doesn’t sound quite like you, we’re recruiting for a range of positions across the studio and we’re always happy to receive speculative applications via our website. Visit our Careers website to view all our live vacancies: Rebellion: Careers

title: Product UI UX Designer - FinTech
description:
