title: UX Team Lead
description:
Salary 65,000 - 75,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- Strong background of User centered design.

Strong Figma expertise.

Line Managment experience of UX/UI resource.

Enterprise level experience.

Responsibilities:

- Lead a team of experienced UX designers and ensure consistency with our strategic aims
Drive to vision for our UX strategy aligned to business goals and understanding our key user groups
Ensure consistency of approach within the UX team to ensure the designs are inline with broader strategy and direction
Be comfortable being a player/coach getting involved with projects as necessary to support the wider product and business goals
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences and articulate these to the UX team for incorporation into their designs
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
Take a user-centered design approach with the team and... rapidly test and iterate designs.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Technologies:

- Figma
- Mobile
- UX UI Design

More: Can you lead a ground breaking UX/UI team? Ready to flex your professional and creative muscles? Want to be part of a world leading company safeguarding the planets most precious digital assets?

We are Preservica and we are changing the way organizations safeguard their digital information. Our SaaS Solutions are at the razor's edge of commercial software addressing the need for smart digital preservation technologies. As a world-leader in digital preservation, our award-winning software is used by leading businesses, archives, libraries, museums and government organizations across the globe.

About You:

A dynamic and adaptable professional with extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions. You will have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You may already be a UX Team Lead or have the credibility and capability to step up into the role. Either way we want to hear from you!

The Role:

To lead our UX team and work across a growing development team. As such you will coach, mentor, guide and grow a UX team, ensuring that we build a value-based and consistent experience for our users. You will be a key contributor to our new roadmap, building on from the existing UX framework for our PLG SaaS solutions. We use Figma as our main tool so you will need to be an advanced user. Preservica is growing at pace and this is a great opportunity to join a team which is being built from the ground up and to contribute to the new landscape of digital preservation.

Our offices are in Abingdon, UK but this role can equally be based remotely within the UK.

Responsibilities:

Lead a team of experienced UX designers and ensure consistency with our strategic aims
Drive to vision for our UX strategy aligned to business goals and understanding our key user groups
Ensure consistency of approach within the UX team to ensure the designs are inline with broader strategy and direction
Be comfortable being a player/coach getting involved with projects as necessary to support the wider product and business goals
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences and articulate these to the UX team for incorporation into their designs
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
Take a user-centered design approach with the team and rapidly test and iterate designs.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Experience:

Significant experience of UX design with preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for B2B / B2C applications.
Demonstrated experience of running a team, or wiliness to lead one.
Excellent communication skills that span various stakeholder groups both internally and externally
Good understanding of accessibility.
Excellent analytical and multitasking skills.
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.
BSc degree in Computer Science, BA in Multimedia or equivalent experience.

What we Offer:

As well as a competitive salary, performance bonus and benefits package, we also offer great prospects in a fast-growing market sector. We are committed to maintaining high standards and ensuring our people have the access to the best learning and development.

This role can either be based in Abingdon or remotely within the UK base. You may be required to travel to customers premises. Some International travel may also be required. Preservica is an equal opportunities employer. Sorry - we are not in a position to sponsor candidates who do not have the right to work in the UK

title: UI / UX Design Contractor
description:
Who We Are:

Omaze is a venture-backed startup with a mission of transforming lives through the power of storytelling and technology. Our for-profit platform offers people everywhere the chance to win a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Since our founding in 2012 in Los Angeles, California; Omaze has raised more than $100 million for over 350 charity partners. We’re growing our team of smart, dedicated, passionate people, and that’s where you come in!

Who we are seeking:

Omaze is planning an exciting UK launch with a regional focus, offering a significant dream-come-true prize to support a worthy local cause. We are seeking an experienced designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of our various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design so we can deliver a successful first UK campaign. You will be the fourth person in... our London office and as such, will need to be a well-rounded self-starter who is entrepreneurial and resourceful. The ideal candidate will be creative, analytical and energetic. Join our team and help make a global impact!

What you’ll do:

Develop a deep understanding of our target customer and their needs

Design and develop the creative assets (marketing & web)

Partner with the International Growth Manager to create a comprehensive product & user experience plan

Build and manage a fully responsive Omaze Shopify store

Work with Omaze HQ in Los Angeles, CA, USA to leverage best-practice learnings and existing technologies

Develop on-boarding flows including multiple landing pages for different audience segments & split tests

Integrate best-practice tracking and analytics

Continually optimize product quality in campaign based on performance and user feedback

What you’ll bring:

4+ years of experience in UI/UX design

Working knowledge of technologies and software including CSS, HTML, Adobe Creative Suite

Experienced in relevant design software and tools

Experienced in designing successful e-commerce websites

Experience with Shopify preferred

General understanding of SEO as it relates to development

Experience working in a high growth startup where you were forced to chart new territory

Strong analytical skills required; both quantitative and qualitative

Stellar communication skills; (both written and verbal)

Highly organized with the ability to prioritize, manage a heavy workload, and meet deadlines

Demonstrated examples of self improvement; you practice a growth mindset

You take your work seriously but not yourself

Omaze focuses on E-Commerce, Education, News, Ventures for Good, and Finance. Their company has offices in Los Angeles, London, and Culver City. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, Omaze has raised $13.01M of funding; their latest round was closed on January 2018.

You can view their website at https://www.omaze.com/ or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: UX UI Designer
description:
We are looking for a talented UX UI Designer to join my client, a digital marketing and design agency based in Macclesfield, Cheshire East.

As part of the Web Design Team, you will be their go-to creative for new websites and existing projects.

Graphic design and web asset creation

Commercial - always looking to optimise value

title: Senior UX Designer - Design System Team
description:
Senior UX Designer - Design System Squad

ADLIB are excited to be partnering exclusively with Hargreaves Lansdown’s UX design team as they look to scale in several key squads. It’s an exciting time to join as the team continue their mission to put people at the heart of product with huge investment in digital transformation.

This particular ad is to apply for the Design System Squad.

About Hargreaves Lansdown

Here at HL, we’re the UK’s number 1 investment platform for private investors, based in Bristol. For more than 40 years we’ve helped investors save time, tax and money on their investments.
To achieve our mission, we believe we have a workplace like no other, with constant learning, dynamic teams, and a great ethos. We're steered by core values that promote service, quality, innovation, and opportunity in everything we do.

Our mission is to 'help people save and invest with confidence'. We are looking for great people to join us, so please come and invest in YOUR future at... Hargreaves Lansdown.

Our user-centred design team is growing and we’re looking for an experienced UX designer to join our growing design system team.

About the UCD team

As part of the user centred design team, you’ll be joining over 25 practitioners in UX Design, User Research, Content Design and Visual Design. You’ll also work closely with Product Managers, Business Analysts and Developers as well as the wider HL team.

As a Senior UX designer within the design system team, you will:

The design system is a relatively new endeavour for us and we're growing the team tasked with helping improve the quality, consistency, and development speed of our digital products.
• Help define and promote organisational design standards
• Identify, capture and communicate the needs and capabilities of the design system's users
• Lead the co-creation of the governance, processes and principles needed to manage the design system
• Collaborate with your team and external squads to assure and document design standards
• Conduct regular reviews with external squads to simplify, consolidate, and challenge design patterns
• Collaborate with engineering to define and deliver design system platform architecture and tooling
• Evaluate the quality, consistency, and usefulness of design system guidance with users
• Iterate the design system based on evidence and sound rationale
• Proactively communicate changes and updates to colleagues across the business
• Assist colleagues across the business with design and accessibility questions
• Create a shared understanding of users and their experience through the collaborative creation of UX artefacts
• Present complex information and concepts to colleagues in a clear and articulate manner
• Work with the UX Design Lead and user centred design practice to promote and shape UX design at HL

About you
• Are a passionate advocate for both high design and engineering standards with a meticulous attention to detail
• Are an open, confident, and considered communicator and collaborator
• Have excellent knowledge of established design and interaction patterns
• Have excellent knowledge of web accessibility guidelines
• Have experience using and contributing to design systems
• Have experience developing and evaluating information architecture
• Have experience facilitating effective collaborative workshops
• Can follow a rigorous, yet flexible, user-centred design process within an Agile environment
• Can produce testable prototypes (using varied tools and methods) for design research and evaluation
• Can clearly articulate design rationale to both designers and stakeholders
• Can employ excellent analytical, and critical thinking skills in your work

Desirable experience
Not essential, but we would also like to see:
• A degree in UX Design, HCI, or a related field
• Working knowledge of front-end development
• Experience working in distributed teams
• Experience with Figma
• Experience with ZeroHeight
• Experience with GitLab (or similar)
• Experience with Adobe Analytics (or similar)

What you’ll get in return
• Discretionary annual bonus & annual pay review
• 25* days holiday plus bank holidays and 1-day additional Christmas closure time
• Option to purchase an additional 5 days holiday per year
• Flexible working options available, including hybrid working
• Pension scheme up to 11% employer contribution
• Sharesave scheme - have a real stake in HL’s future
• Income Protection & Life insurance (4 x salary core level of cover)
• Health care cash plans - including optical, dental, and out patientcare
• Help@hand and an Employee Assistance Programme
• Gympass - gym memberships and wellbeing apps available
• Variety of travel to work schemes with free bike storage and shower facilities
• An inhouse barista serving subsidised coffee and snacks
• Join HL’s sports, I&D networks and volunteering groups (two paid volunteering days per year)
• LifeWorks Discounts on services, restaurants and retailers
• * up to 30 days depending on role level & increasing with length of service

What next?

We have chosen to work with our partner ADLIB recruitment who are managing the recruitment process for these roles. Please apply with a CV and they’ll be able to brief you fully on the roles and manage your application

title: UX Designer
UX/UI Designer
description:
JOB INTRO 🔎

At sync. money we are looking for a ‘super-hero’ UX/UI Designer and incredible new team player to join our family and help us to make a real difference. Someone to bring positive energy and a smile to the workplace. Whilst we may be building a company and a brand, we’re also building bonds that can last a lifetime.

Other skills required as an UX/UI Designer include:

• English speaking, with multiple languages beneficial.

• Hardworking, willing to take responsibility but also a co-worker.

• Proactive, willing to get involved with the wider team and helping where possible.

• Being passionate about your job and taking the initiative on coming up with new ideas how we can improve our product, culture and company. • You are part of the community but a user too!

• Willing to learn but also to coach others where possible.

• Understanding about the importance of our product, the customer experience to peoples everyday lives and the need to support them where... appropriate.

HOW YOU WILL HELP US SUCCEED

• Take meaningful ideas and design them into something valuable for our users.

• Design flows and experiences from the initial concept phase to high-fidelity mock-ups.

• Partner with product owners, other designers and engineers to oversee the user experience of new features and products from conception until launch.

• Ability to think at a high level about creative strategy and vision.

WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED 💻

• A minimum of 4yrs of experience as an UX / UI Designer.

• Solid experience in designing digital products in iOS, Android and web..

• Experience in interaction and visual design (Sketch, Figma and Photoshop).

• Experience in prototyping (Invision, Framer and AfterEffects).

• Strong communication skills.

• A portfolio showcasing your work.

SALARY 💵

Will market competitive and will depend on the location, position and experience of the candidate.

WHO WE ARE 😎

sync. is a young and exciting FinTech company headquartered at Level39 in Canary Wharf in the Centre of London with a second hub in the Historical Centre of Malaga, Spain, right next to the Picasso Museum. Our driving ambition is to save people time and money. It’s what motivates us to come in to work every morning knowing that we could be making a real difference to people’s lives.

We combine the very best of features and services across the market, whilst also creating our own, to make a unique product that can be everything to everyone. We always say that great products and built by great teams. We’re very much on our way to building both but need more great people to achieve all of our lofty goals and ambitions. Are you that person? Apply now

Why the ✖️, crossover, where old banking meets the new world of innovation, disruption and inclusion. We are sync. and you could be too.

Read more about us on our blog or follow our latest news on Twitter.

WHY US 🤔

There are 2 things we love doing. Disrupting the relevant landscape and saving people money. We know what you’re thinking. It’s either “what’s the connection between the two?” or “So do I, so how can I be involved?”. Well we have the answer to both questions, read on…

As a result, we’re now looking for motivated applicants to join our team as we develop our new product. This exciting new project is going to change the way people interact with their finances and will take us to the forefront of alternative banking.

If you have the ambition of working in a truly exciting, forward thinking and passionate company, where your work will have immeasurable impact, here we are!

WHAT WE DO ✖️

We are aiming to lead the way in Smart Open Banking. We allow users to instantly open a current GBP &/or EUR account in minutes and we provide them with the ability to open up to 30+ other currency accounts. Users are able to exchange currencies between their accounts at the best rates and transfer money worldwide and unbeatable rates. Learn more about our features here.

sync.’s USP is to allow users to synchronise all of their financial accounts (bank, credit, loan and mortgage accounts) in one app, as one experience by utilising our AISP snd PISP licenses. By being able to budget, manage and track all of their accounts and expenses in one place, offering our users unrivalled user experience as a money management platform and be their financial advisor.

This then translates into tailored recommendations on how to save time and money through our marketplace of products from numerous financial and retail service providers that we have deals with.

"Our ultimate goal is for our users to better understand their saving, spending and investing habits and to make easy, simple, beautiful and accessible to everyone".

WHAT WE OFFER 🏆

> Salary package that rewards you.

Hard-working, dedicated and talented people deserve to be rewarded and that’s why we offer you a salary and bonus package that will reward you for your contribution.

> Flexible hours for a flexible lifestyle.

We know flexibility is important in this day and age. We also know we can trust you to know when you’re at your best, which is why we encourage working smarter not harder.

> Satisfying and fulfilling.

Both of our offices are stocked with plenty of snacks and drinks for you to enjoy.

> A workplace for you.

Choose between our City Centre office in London or by the beach in Malaga. Regardless of which one you choose we’ll make sure you’re using the best equipment available.

SOME OTHER BENEFITS 🏆

> An office you can call home.

Use our beautiful office space to organise and run events planned by our team, for our team, for a fun filled evening. Feel free to get involved and organise some yourself!

> Opportunities to Grow.

We love when people join us and stay with us and that’s why we offer you amazing growth opportunities. You have the opportunities for promotions, internal transfers and even international transfers as we look to open up more offices worldwide.

If you want to build sync. in your country or in your city then tell us, push us and help us expand our technology and values to your home.

> Our products are for everyone, and so are our offices.

We value diversity on an individual level. We’re dedicated to creating an environment where people can share their own diverse backgrounds, experiences, perspectives & ideas.

sync. money is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

READY TO TAKE THE LEAP? 🚀

Feel like you’re ready to accept the challenge and embark on a new and exciting chapter of your life? Click below to apply for the UX/UI Designer job role at sync. money and let’s make a difference together.

Apply here! https://sync-money.jobs.personio.com/job/456525?_pc=467344#apply

RECRUITERS NOTICE ⚠️

This Role is for direct applications only for a full time position and our HR Department will not be responding to any Recruitment Agencies, software firms or freelancers that contact us.

Sync.Money focuses on Financial Services, Banking, Fin Tech, and Digital Currency. Their company has offices in London and Málaga. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Sync.Money has raised $2.2M of funding; their latest round was closed on July 2019.

You can view their website at http://www.sync.money or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Would you like to work on projects that help advance science?

Would you like to work in a complex problem space to design effective tools to publish scientific research?

About the team

SSRN is an online preprint service delivered by a very collaborative distributed team – the business is based in upstate New York while the product and development squad is located in Oxford and London. The squad supports the day-to-day operations of SSRN for the 800K+ academic authors who have posted over a million research papers on the site since we launched. We also work on more strategic improvements to make it easier for researchers to share their research early and openly. We work hard to create an inclusive, relaxed, and friendly environment because we think that happy and engaged people do the best work.

About the role

We need a designer to help champion our users’ needs, transform initial concepts into ready-to-ship services, and refresh the look and feel of the website. As a Senior UX/UI... Designer, you will liaise with senior stakeholders and partner closely with cross-functional product and engineering teams to deliver services by conducting research, identifying problems, developing workflows, and creating and user-testing new solutions. You will own the design, managing complex UX challenges and visual design work. You will be part of a supportive design team with an innovative design culture.

Responsibilities
• Partner with product managers and engineers to define the roadmap and backlog, and to ensure strategic alignment and effective working processes
• Conduct research to develop a deep understanding of user needs, support your design decisions, and build empathy for users across the organisation
• Run workshops, ideate and prototype quickly, and produce detailed design deliverables to ship your designs into production
• Refresh the SSRN website and explore co-branding opportunities
• Ensure that product designs meet user needs, support business goals, and are technically feasible

Key Requirements needed as a Senior UX/UI Designer:
• Have a portfolio that demonstrates design experience covering User Research, User Experience (UX), and User Interface Design (UI)
• Hands-on experience in research and user testing
• Attention to detail and proficiency in producing UX flows, design concepts, high-fidelity designs and prototypes using tools such as Figma or similar
• Ability to use existing pattern libraries and deliver design specifications
• Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders, think strategically about product and design, and communicate persuasively to influence decisions
• Experience of delivering products in an Agile environment

-

title: Senior Product Designer UX/UI - Remote
description:
Role : Product Designer

Location : Remote (with monthly team gatherings in London)

Salary : £65,000-£75,000 + Amazing benefits

Benefits :

Unlimited holidays with a minimum of 35 days + bank holidays + 2 weeks off for Christmas

£1,200 annual budget for working from home . This can be for anything you need to make your environment work for you

Flexible working - Remote - but with socials if you wish to attend

£500 per year personal growth and development allowance

£500 per year wellbeing allowance

1-1 coaching and financial coaching

The Opportunity :

Working as a Product Designer at a company that normalises mental wellbeing in the workplace. They are on a mission to shift the negative conceptions around mental health in the workplace and to empower people to work on their wellbeing with an assigned coach.

Over the last 5 years they have partnered with 100's of progressive organisations

You'll be working alongside the Product Manager and the Chief Technology Officer

Key... Skills & Responsibilities :
• Own the end-to-end product lifestyle
• An intuitive and empathetic person who asks questions
• Deliver accessible and functional designs that solve problems.
• Conduct user research - the ability to use Qualitative and Quantitative metrics to inform and test your designs
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams

Someone who...
• Is comfortable working in an early-stage start-up environment
• Has creative direction and can explain their design decisions

Looking to take that next step in your career?

Apply now or send your CV to Romy.Duggal AmberResourcing.co.uk

title: UX/UI Designer - Mid/ Senior
description:
UX/UI Designer - £60,000 - £75,000 - Remote Option
• UK APPLICANTS ONLY**

Are you an experienced UX/UI Designer with a background in both b2c and b2b design and research? Are you looking for a new role with a flexible/ wfh setup?

Are you looking to work for one of the UK’s leading Social Media Marketing Platforms?

title: UX/UI Design Lead (BioHotel Virtual Labs)
description:
YOUR ROLE AS UX/UI DESIGN LEAD

As a UI/UX Designer you will collaborate with the product design team, engineering team and marketers to create, design, code and implement amazingly intuitive interfaces for our virtual laboratories. Our philosophy is to make life science easier by creating better user-centric interfaces and experiences. With a strong understanding of best practices and knowledge of cutting-edge trends in digital interfaces, the UI Designer is the ultimate end-user advocate who produces online and mobile experiences that seamlessly engage every user. This role requires a mix of both creative and coding skillsets.

Responsibilities:

Your key responsibility will be the lead and creation of the web/mobile app for our virtual laboratories and to:
• Create compelling online and mobile consumer experience that drive business results;
• Strategise and drive interactive product development from site map to launch
• Design and develop front-end user experience/interface... solutions
• Update web/mobile app themes & templates to match brand guidelines
• Research and stay current with UI/UX/IxD best and recommended practices
• Responsible for front-end performance optimization across all user interfaces
• Facilitate development of UI designs for user research; provide recommendations both in written and visual form
• Work collaboratively with digital marketing team and brand/communications teams
• Demonstrate solid project management skills to assist project managers in work estimates, planning and level of effort
• Test concepts, perform task and user analysis, and assist with user acceptance testing
• Learn proprietary content development software
• Data visualisation of different IoT sensors

Required Experience, Skills and Education:
• Associate Degree or commensurate work experience in UI Design, Interaction Design, Visual Communication, Mobile App Development or similar.
• Experience with interface design and best practices (navigation elements, data & dynamic content presentation, forms, responsive/adaptive design, patterns, components, etc.)
• Experienced in creating mobile apps and web apps
• Strong skills and demonstrated experience with design programs (Sketch, XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)
• Extensive experience creating interactive prototypes with tools such as Adobe XD, MarvelApp, Invision, AfterEffects, UXPin, Axure or similar.
• Demonstrated proficiency in HTML5/CSS3
• Experience with App Development
• Basic experience with Git, Node/Gulp, Javascript is a plus
• Able to contribute in a team environment yet work autonomously
• Solid professional communications skills
• Detail oriented, strong organizational skills
• Flexible, good at multi-tasking and able to prioritize
• Willing to learn and ready for the challenge
• A passion for IoT

Apply here and let us know more about your passion and about yourself.

https://cutt.ly/dE5JUK6

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

ABOUT OPENCELL.BIO

Our mission is to bring down the barriers to entry of biotechnology. We want to make it easier, faster, and cheaper to build with biology.

We are based in White City London, at the heart of the biotech revolution. Over the last 3 years, the team has bootstrapped a we-work for biotech that gives startups access to hundreds of thousands of pounds worth of equipment for hundreds of pounds a month. We have built and deployed rapid-response diagnostic labs and processed half a million COVID qPCR tests. We are looking for outstanding product-obsessed people to join our team to help us build the best labs in the world.

WHERE YOU WILL WORK

You will work in the first “BioHotel” which will bring over 12000 sqft of lab space to West London.

The BioHotel is a new model for flexible and fully serviced lab-space for life science companies.

BioHotel laboratories are connected to a virtual twin to plan experiments, book and collect data from equipment, and monitors the ideal conditions such as airflow, temperature and humidity from home or the office. The labs have reproducibility and regulations at its heart to move enable companies to move fast and seamless from R&D to trials to production.

Besides private labs, the BioHotel facilities provide access to equipment worth 100,000 GBP for a few pounds per day. Its support services such as (cold) deliveries, clinical waste, H&S and integrated consumables store allow companies to focus on development of their technology instead of investing time and money into their infrastructure.

It is the perfect place for companies if they need to access equipment for a day to run a PCR, for a month to run a trial, or longer to bring an idea into reality.

We all LOVE biotechnology and are excited about sharing what we do. You must LOVE it too. You need to be driven and have a passion to create products, not just ideas. You need to be brave and prepared to test your assumptions rapidly, take criticism, and start over from scratch. You need an open mind but also an intense focus on product delivery. You need to be excited to work within a collaborative diverse team. We love research but we are not looking for researchers without a product mindset.

OpenCell.bio focuses on Biotechnology. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at http://opencell.bio

title: UX Designer
UX/UI Designer
description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION :

Reynolds and Reynolds is currently looking for a highly talented individual, with a keen eye for user-experience to fill a UX / UI Designer role.

Working alongside our software development team, you will develop user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) designs for multi-platform products.

Your role will involve enhancing the functionality of our CRM applications, which allow automotive retailers to run their business.

You will be responsible for delivering projects to the agreed specification and meeting quality and timescale objectives.

In addition, you will provide assistance to our dedicated support team and interact with third parties as needed.

EXPERIENCE :

Candidates must be highly motivated to work in the designing and supporting of business applications. A clear understanding of UI / UX methodologies and the ability to create / leverage design guidelines / pattern libraries is preferred, but not essential.

Experience in one or more of the... following would be advantageous :

Academic background or professional qualification in a related field

Proficiency in Axure and / or Adobe Creative Suite Products, including Photoshop

Designing Iconography

Strong Typography Skills

JavaScript

Candidates will also be expected to demonstrate the following attributes :

Good drawing or illustration skills

Detail orientated, achieving thoroughness and accuracy when completing a task

Good verbal and written communication skills

Project-oriented, focused on quality and delivery

Ability to research problems and recommend solutions

Good team worker, reliable and organized

BENEFITS :

We strive to provide our employees with an environment that includes the right balance between work and family.Our employees receive life assurance cover, optical care, the option to purchase additional annual leave and 4% employer pension contributions.

You will also have access to our Health Assured Employee Assistance Programme and Cycle to Work scheme, as well as free parking.

We promote employee camaraderie outside of work through company sponsored charity events and a variety of activities and social outings.

ABOUT OUR COMPANY :

Are you looking for a rewarding career in a fast-paced environment with an established company? Do you want to work at a company with growth opportunities that will provide you with the training to be successful?

If so, Reynolds and Reynolds is the company for you! Reynolds and Reynolds is a leader in high quality software solutions and IT services around the world and we are looking for a person with the potential to grow and continue our legacy of over 100 years of outstanding products and services at our Birmingham office.

Any data you submit to Reynolds and Reynolds Ltd. will be handled in accordance with our privacy policy which you can read at https : / / reyrey.co.uk / privacy

title: Web & UI/UX Designer
description:
Who are we?

Y-combinator backed and recently voted ‘Fintech Start up of the Year 2022’ at Fintech Awards London, Verto helps businesses in emerging markets reach the world by making cross-border payments easy.

We enable businesses to accept payments and send payouts globally in one single platform. Each year we process billions of dollars of payments and provide companies with solutions which help them to save money, automate processes and grow. We have worked with thousands of businesses globally since our launch in 2018 and have high growth aspirations for the future. By 2028 it’s forecasted payments revenue from emerging markets will exceed that of mature markets by $400bn, join Verto to make us the number one B2B payment provider in this space.

The role

As a Web Designer at Verto you’ll report directly to our VP of Growth but also work collaboratively with the product, marketing and content team to iterate the product and make the brand consistent across channels. We’re about... to embark on an overhaul of our marketing website and we’re looking for an ambitious and experienced web designer to lead the change.

Success in this role requires outside-the-box thinkers, we believe that the best designs are made with bold yet thoughtful decisions. With a keen eye for detail and a customer driven approach, you will be focused on producing seamless friction free journeys that drive impactful customer experience and commercial results. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast paced environment, can take ownership of design deliverables, confidently bringing their ideas to the table while having a seat at it too.

What you’ll be doing

Leading the redesign of our marketing website from initial research and mapping end-to-end journeys all the way through to final designs and dev implementation, all while keeping our customer experience at the forefront.

Leading the creation and maintenance of a reusable component library as part of our emerging design system to create a cohesive customer experience and improve efficiency.

Presenting design concepts and negotiating with stakeholders to arrive at a design that supports both the business and a strong user experience.

Working with our other designers to develop brand guidelines and assets that support our creative vision and ensure design consistency

Working collaboratively to deliver the best possible experiences for our users, taking into account commercial goals and realities, and technical constraints.

Working to strict deadlines with a proactive approach. Schedule management is key for this role to ensure projects are delivered on time to the specified requirements.

Keeping up to date on current trends, competitors, and the overall market to ensure that Verto is an industry leader.

Requirements

3+ years of experience in a web designer role, preferably within a B2B, Fintech or SaaS environment

Good knowledge of Figma, Sketch, XD, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, or any other tool is also welcomed as long as you can transition to Figma.

Fluent knowledge of user centred design methodologies and approaches

More than just a keen eye for visual design and great taste: you design with purpose and with user experience in mind.

You speak the language of designers, developers, stakeholders, and most importantly - users

Basic awareness of web development principles and coding languages (HTML, CSS, REACT and Javascript)

A passion for learning, the world of design is constantly evolving, and we want our Designers to match this. You’ll bring a proactive approach to problem solving, always striving to improve.

Ownership and growth mentality with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively, with excellent communication and influencing skills

A strong design portfolio. We’d love to see your portfolio as part of your application.

What We Offer

• 31 days holiday each year (Including Bank Holidays)

• 5% Employer contribution towards Pension

• Hybrid working policy

• Regular company social events

• Perkbox Subscription and private health and dental for employees and their family

VertoFX focuses on Payments, Online Marketplaces, Fin Tech, and Digital Currency. Their company has offices in San Francisco, London, and Lagos. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, VertoFX has raised $12.1M of funding; their latest round was closed on September 2021.

You can view their website at http://www.vertofx.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: Mid UX/UI Product Designer
description:
Origin’s software has transformed the debt capital markets, completely streamlining the way companies and investment banks work together to raise capital. Having launched just over 7 years ago, Origin is now used by over 20 investment banks and over 90 borrowers in over 50 cities worldwide. Our clients include some of the largest investment banks and borrowers globally, including Barclays, Citi, and Telefonica. We are backed by Clearstream, the Luxembourg Stock Exchange and a number of prominent angel investors.

Our culture has helped us succeed where others have failed, in an industry that is famously resistant to change. We are a group of self-starters who are brave enough to take risks, and humble enough to learn from our mistakes. We know that our whole is greater than the sum of our parts, and we’re looking for like-minded individuals to join our team.

Here are a few links that you might enjoy:
• https://www.originmarkets.com/blog-feed/an-intervi...
•... https://www.originmarkets.com/blog-feed/an-interview-with-anusha-sonthalia
• https://www.businessinsider.com/fintech-startup-origin-markets-raises-7-million-in-the-middle-of-a-pandemic-2020-11

The Team

The company is small, collaborative, and diverse. We have seen tremendous growth over the past couple of years, and now support clients across all 6 major continents. You will work hand in hand with the product, engineering and business development teams.

The Role

Your primary responsibility will be to understand the nuanced customer requirements and translate those into an outstanding user experience via well thought out user journeys and designs. You will lead the whole design process for one of Origin’s Products. You will be equally comfortable meeting clients as well working autonomously looking at platform usage stats to improve user flows or researching best design practices.

Requirements

Must Have
• 1/2 years Product Design/UX Design experience
• A keen interest in technology and fintech
• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
• Experience designing highly complex/technical interfaces containing numbers & charts
• An understanding of research methodologies, including interviews, surveys and workshops
• Skilled with Figma library and prototyping
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• A growth mindset and openness to new ideas with an interest in providing and receiving feedback
• Strong communication skills and the ability to communicate ideas clearly
• Attention to detail and technical intuition
• Enthusiasm, passion, ambition, and humility
• Please include a link to your portfolio (applicants without a portfolio link will not be considered)

Nice To Have
• Experience in B2B SaaS/Enterprise software
• An understanding of web and mobile technologies - some coding experience a plus!
• Colour and typography skills, interaction and visual design experience

Benefits
• Competitive salary plus equity package
• Mentorship and coaching programmes to help you grow in your career
• Annual training budget up to £500 to attend conferences and workshops
• Established client base (Bank of America ML, BNP Paribas, The World Bank etc…)
• Work with latest technologies (we aim to track the latest Python/Django/Angular versions)
• Flexible working hours / part WFH (Mondays & Fridays) and up to two months of the year working remotely
• 24 days paid holiday in addition to bank holidays, your birthday off and 1 additional day of holiday for every year worked
• Optional monthly company Company socials (last year’s events included cookery classes, bouldering and escape rooms), team outings and annual company summer retreat somewhere hot!
• £500 home office budget
• Enhanced parental leave
• Cycle to Work Scheme

Origin focuses on Fin Tech. Their company has offices in Hong Kong and London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Origin has raised $2.5M of funding; their latest round was closed on November 2015 at a valuation of $5.5M.

You can view their website at https://originmarkets.com or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: UX Designer
description:
Oxford Nanopore Technologies is headquartered at the Oxford Science Park outside Oxford, UK, with satellite offices and commercial presence in many global locations across the US, APAC and Europe.

Oxford Nanopore employs from multiple subject areas including nanopore science, molecular biology and applications, informatics, engineering, electronics, manufacturing and commercialisation. The management team, led by CEO Dr Gordon Sanghera, has a track record of delivering disruptive technologies to the market.

Oxford Nanopore's sequencing platform is the only technology that offers real-time analysis (for rapid insights), in fully scalable formats from pocket to population scale, that can analyse native DNA or RNA and sequence any length of fragment to achieve short to ultra-long read lengths.

Our goal is to enable the analysis of any living thing, by anyone, anywhere. We offer real-time nanopore-based DNA/RNA sequencing technology: accessible, easy to use and fully scalable for any... requirement.

We are looking for a talented and curious individual to join our growing UX Team.

The Details The successful candidate will be part of a growing team responsible for designing and building MinKNOW - our software for running our suite of genetic sequencing devices.

We're looking for a mid-level designer who can contribute to all parts of the design process from user research to visual and interaction design. You don't need to have a background in science, but do need a curious attitude, with a willingness to ask questions.

You'll work closely with product managers and software developers, to identify user needs and translate those into intuitive workflows and interfaces in our software.

Responsibilities: - Collaborate with the Product Management, Development and UX Design teams to define and clarify user requirements and use cases. - Create, iterate on, and deliver UX design concepts, prototypes, as well as UI specifications and assets for use in all stages of the product development process. - Work within, and contribute to the Oxford Nanopore Design System.

What we're looking for You'll to be educated to degree level or equivalent in a relevant subject (UX Design, Human-computer interaction, Human Factors Engineering). You'll have 3-5 years experience in UX design at a software company, ideally including the use of a Design system. Familiarity designing for expert or data intensive software tools is a bonus.

The ideal candidate will: - Have a good understanding of software development lifecycles. - Be experienced in the use of design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Marvel etc. - Good understanding of visual design fundamentals - Have excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with a variety of teams and users, both internal and external. - A curious attitude with a willingness to learn. - An interest in designing for complex scientific products - Possess accurate attention to the small details.

As well as a competitive salary, company benefits also include pension, private healthcare and share options! Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job

title: UI/UX Manager
description:
UX/UI Design Manager

This is a 12-month rolling contract paying up to £650 per day INSIDE IR 35 fully remote.
Company/project overview:

A global corporation with over 150,000 employees and a billion-pound turnover is currently a UX/UI Design Manager with technical leadership capabilities within an agile environment. Ideally, the chosen manager will have proven experience providing global UX and UI leadership, interaction design and information architecture.

The UX/UI Design Manager will be responsible for the successful delivery, innovation and development of Design. They will work effectively within the Agile methodology employed in the Digital team and ensure the UX and Visual Design team are a positive and constructive part of the Scrum working approach.

Role responsibilities:
They will work together with the UX&VD leadership team will prioritise a broad spectrum of projects and requests against organisational goals and Digital objectives, in line with the vision of the Digital... Director. They will set clear deliverables and measures of progress for their team, and maintain a positive, supportive and inclusive work culture.

The UX/UI Design Manager needs to:

·Provide leadership and mentoring to the team of UX AND UI designers
·Successfully drive innovation in UX design across a complex range of digital platforms, products and services, spanning both our commercial English and Exams portfolio
·Work with stakeholders to the highest level, providing insight into the principles and benefits of an enterprise-level focus on the organisations audiences and user centred design methodology
·Successfully lead efforts to develop, document and systematise our design / interaction patterns into a global library
·Help contribute to the development and delivery of a new domain strategy; leading the creation and UX and visual design solutions as part of its implementation
·Ensure inclusive design is embedded in all our design solutions; creating and implementing an inclusive design strategy that enables the organisation to make its digital estate accessible to all
·Improve the quality of our employee digital experience by improving the quality of design within internal platforms used by teams around the world

Experience required:
·Must have strong leadership capabilities within a digital global corporation - preferably Education or Public Sector
·Must have UX and UI leadership and technical experience
·In-depth knowledge of Agile design and development processes
·Significant knowledge and experience of delivering high quality UX/UI design, interaction design and information architecture.
·Ability to influence and work collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels.
·Experience in supporting and working in effective cross-functional project team

This is a 12-month rolling contract paying up to £650 per day INSIDE IR 35 - fully remote.

UX/UI Design Manager

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
We’re hiring a Senior UX Designer, tasked to make Sweep an outstanding experience for our users, and a real driver of change for our planet.

Ideally you’re based in London, but if we fall in love with you, Europe and beyond might work just fine as well.

Sweep builds software that lets businesses take control of their climate journey - from managing and reducing emissions, to championing cutting edge climate projects.

I’m intrigued. What would I be doing?

You will have a key role in developing the Sweep user experience. Together with the team, you will turn complex sustainability standards, data sets and interactions into interfaces that are easy to understand and a joy to navigate.

This will require you to develop a deep understanding of corporate sustainability practices and combine research, design thinking and user testing to create smart interactions.

You will be seeing projects through from start to finish, working in close collaboration with our product, engineering and... carbon staff.

This position will allow you to shape our design approach from the ground up, planting the seeds for many good things to come.

Nice. Can you be a bit more specific please?

In your day to day, you will...

1. Design software for a better future 🎨
• Help steer our product design from crucial big architectural strokes down to the smallest interaction that makes all the difference.
• Kick off the design process through exploration, ideation and user validation.
• Design interaction models, wireframes and prototypes that focus on ease of use and optimise how customers interact with our software.
• Present design solutions, defend design decisions and incorporate feedback into the design cycle.

2. Build the Sweep design system ⚙️
• Ensure a consistent brand and UI experience across the whole customer journey.
• Maintain a unified, scalable and progressive design system through libraries and documentation.
• Make sure that we build accessibility into our product right from the start.

3. Establish our user research practice 🔬
• Organise and host design critiques and user research labs.
• Gather and document insights that will influence our UX, feature development and roadmaps.
• Help establish best practices for user research at Sweep.

4. Be an advocate for good design 🎙
• Actively develop a positive, productive and passionate design culture within Sweep.
• Represent our mission externally, through active exchange with the design industry, to help build Sweep’s network and thought leadership credentials.

That sounds just right for me. What do I need to bring?

Good you asked. This is who we’re looking for:

Qualifications 🏆
• You bring a minimum of 5 years of experience in software product design
• Experience in software-as-a-service environments, ideally in the B2B space
• Proven expertise turning complex business problems into simple and engaging products
• Strong command of interaction design, visual design and information architecture
• Experience working closely with multi-disciplinary teams
• Adept at communicating and prototyping interactions rapidly at all levels of resolution
• A deep knowledge of modern web UI patterns

Qualities 🧠
• You’re an empathetic team player that is great at building lasting relationships
• A strategic thinker, who sees both the big picture and the smaller underlying mechanics
• An expert English language communicator that has a knack for breaking down complex topics both verbally and written. Also, French is an added bonus
• A hands-on problem solver, self-motivated with a glass half-full attitude
• An entrepreneurial mind, ready to launch and fail and iterate
• Attuned to remote collaboration, using digital tools and meticulously documenting work
• A desire and ambition to grow, mentor and support other designers on the team

Ok, sounds fun. What’s in it for me?

You will be joining an exciting young business that has the humble ambition to change the world. With a proven track record in starting companies, we’re planning to hit the ground running and have an impact fast. Joining this journey right at the beginning allows you to really help shape our path.

You will join a dynamic (mostly remote) team of engineers, business minds, creatives and carbon experts spread across France and the UK. We’re a fun bunch of people that want to work hard, and enjoy ourselves while doing so. And we believe in creating a calm environment, that knows that life is not just work, and we’ll be doing better work because of that.

We’re big believers in creating successful businesses that are good for everyone, including society and the planet. That’s why we have a BCorp Startup status.

We think this might be the ride of our lives. And maybe yours, too.

To apply, please submit both a CV and a portfolio. Make sure to showcase your design process, UX flows, interaction patterns and visual design skills. Please also provide details of your role on the projects.

Sweep focuses on SaaS, Clean Technology, and Marketplaces. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.sweep.net/ or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

You care.

description:

title: Head of UI/UX Design
description:
At Truligent, we build and operate a portfolio of profitable software businesses. We own eight companies in various stages of the development cycle, and are adding new businesses to our portfolio every quarter.

We are looking for a passionate UX/UI designer to join our team in a leadership position. You will be responsible for creating digital identities for our new companies - from overall style, to design of web and mobile interfaces, to design of promotional pages. An ideal candidate would have a mixture of hand-on practical skills and managerial experience.

Our companies are mainly B2B SaaS, with heavy focus on European and American markets. It’s important for our Head of Design to stay in touch with recent trends, and help us make sure that our products are perceived as innovative, forward-thinking, and pixel-perfect.

We are striving to offer the best working conditions possible. If a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment excites you, Truligent is the right place for you... every day you will experience our culture of innovation, rapid speed of execution, and desire to reach global scale.

As a new team member, you are expected to go above and beyond in understanding our customer to design the best experience for them. You will find yourself surrounded by passionate individuals who deeply care about the future of software, and to truly excel at the job you will need to always stay up to date with recent development in B2B software and Artificial Intelligence.

We are striving to create a feeling of being on a rocket ship every day for the entire team - so that everyone can move fast, explore the unknowns, innovate, and enjoy the journey.

Day to Day Responsibilities
• Design Systems: Defining and implementing design systems for each of the early-stage portfolio companies. You will be creating a distinct style for every brand.
• Practical: Hands-on execution and design of core interfaces & promotional pages for our early stage portfolio companies. Owning the entire design process from ideation through to UX, UI to defining design systems and continuous improvement through user testing. Examples of deliverables include development of dashboard interfaces, App Store screenshots, graphics for landing pages, and stylesheet for social media posts .
• Managerial: As each portfolio company matures, you will need to on-board and manage a dedicated design team who will build up on your initial designs. Continue to build a diverse and inclusive world-class product design team, with strong vision on how to scale the team effectively.
• Entrepreneurial: You will need to take full ownership of your work, and ensure that the outcome is world-class, pixel-perfect, and represents our brands well on the international arena.
• Tools: You will have flexibility in selection of your own tools for your work; but as standard we use Figma and Adobe Suite for our design needs.

Design Experience
• 3+ years of experience in digital product design, preferably in software products
• Deep understanding of UX and UI principles
• Confident usage of design software, such as Figma / Sketch or Adobe Creative Suite.
• Optional, but a bonus: Experience of owning the design process for the product from Day 0 to MVP, including everything from overall style to actual interface designs

General qualifications and skills
• A strong entrepreneurial mindset
• Must have a 'can do' attitude with a strategic and rigorous mindset
• Must be comfortable working in a fast paced environment
• Passionate about providing exceptional product and service experiences to customers
• Ability to communicate and defend design decisions in front of senior stakeholders
• Can map out and understand the user journey along with creation of wireframes
• Proficient with prototype tools and can get into the details of a design
• Able to research and validate designs using a variety of user testing techniques
• Can produce high quality design specifications

Your Opportunity
• Highly entrepreneurial role - you will have a lot of creative freedom;
• The excitement of playing a key role in the success of a hypergrowth new ventures;
• Career opportunity and responsibility: take on senior position quickly and lead your own team of designers;
• Competitive salary and other benefits - including gym membership, events, and travel;
• Working remotely or working from our Central London office in Mayfair

More about Truligent:

Truligent builds and acquires market-leading, profitable software businesses globally. Our mission is to build, manage and acquire market-leading software companies that develop highly innovative products.

We are focusing on building non-trivial software products and defining the next generation of technology solutions. We are not interested in simple, 'done-before' businesses - instead, we focus on technologies with transformational power - such as Artificial Intelligence, blockchain and new communication channels.

At Truligent we love innovation, scale and fast-growing software businesses. We are passionate about Intelligent Enterprise and we believe in AI, automation and bringing digital transformation to different industries. We always look for new opportunities and are hungry to build and acquire profitable mission-driven businesses. As a team we stay highly-motivated, results-driven, focused and confident to take our companies from zero to one quickly. We value an ability to work independently and efficiently, meet deadlines and deliver excellent results. We give everything to our projects and we look forward to working with like-minded individuals who strive to make a difference.

Truligent focuses on SaaS, Enterprise Software, Incubators, and Studio. Their company has offices in New York City and London. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://truligent.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: Group UX/UI Designer
description:
As Group UX/UI Designer, you’ll build products that both empower and delight. Reporting to the Head of Technology You’ll focus on user-centric design principles to help craft a variety of HomesByDesign Group experiences that span across the web, mobile and beyond. We place a high value on individuals who are self-motivated and can work across the design disciplines of UI, UX, and Visual Design.

You will be someone with high attention to detail and who is technically proficient in Illustrator, Photoshop, XD or similar as well as familiarity with rapid prototyping tools is a plus. The purpose of this role is to take some of the weight of asset building off of the conceptual teams by utilizing efficient production workflows that also ensure pixel-perfect asset delivery under tight deadlines. You must be able to take design direction with ease while staying extremely organized and comfortable managing multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

We have developed innovative Design ... Buy Tools for our bathroomsbydesign.com website that you will be responsible for improving. These tools are a little rough around the edges so you will be focused on sanitising where appropriate and maximising the commercial effectiveness of them.

A key part of our evolution will see the launch of our new HomesByDesign website, building on the software we have developed for the bathroom industry and taking it into the home improvement industry as a whole. You will be responsible for the UX Design, taking the principals of the unique design led approach we have for BathroomsbyDesign.

Duties:

Drive innovative thinking to create unique products

Own the user experience of all products, interaction design and visual design, turning high-level product requirements into workflows and designs

Design clean, intuitive, and responsive interfaces with reusable design patterns

Create detailed specifications to guide development teams

Confidently communicate the rationale of design decisions

Rapidly iterate design solutions based on feedback and technical needs

Partner with teams to brainstorm new ideas and work through the details of new and existing products and features

Generate comprehensive information architecture, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, data visualizations and interactive prototypes

Solicit field and customer input, feedback and validation for new features and major enhancements and rapidly iterate

Collaborate with Engineering to ensure designs are feasible and are well implemented​

Our Initial Products (more exciting stuff to come):

New: Magento 2 eCommerce Website

Existing: Partner Portal (customers manage designs, quotes, orders, deliveries and payments)

Existing: Plan2Design VR App (IOS & Android)

Existing: BathKAD design software (used by internal designers)

New: Odoo v15 ERP system (upgrade from existing v8)

New: KADware design software for the whole home

New: Community Marketplace (in stealth mode)

Company Benefits

Pension

Quarterly and annual bonuses

EMI Share Scheme

Perkbox

Flexi-working

Coffee Tea Fruit & Nuts

Bar & Beer Fridge

Hired

KADware focuses on Marketplaces, Social Commerce, Project Management, Home Renovation, and CAD. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

title: UX Designer
description:
Job Title: UX Designer x2

Location: Handforth, Manchester / Hybrid (1 to 2 Days P/M)

Duration: 12 Months FTC

Role:

An exciting opportunity has arisen to join our rapidly expanding UX team in the role of UX Designer. As the UX Designer, you will form part of a decentralised UX team, working closely within an agile Product Squad to represent UX/UI Design best practice and application. With a keen eye for detail and a customer-driven focus in your approach, you will represent the UX team by putting our customers at the forefront of your design solutions, producing seamless friction-free journeys that drive impactful commercial and customer experience results.

Working closely alongside the Product Owner, you will champion and take accountability for ensuring that all proposed design/journey changes within your Product Squad are designed and prioritised with best practice UX/UI techniques in mind, and ensure that our customers are always at the forefront of any proposed... solution.

Your role will form part of a wider network of like-minded UX Designers, using a set of common processes and joined-up agile ways of working, following a test-and-learn evidence driven ethos to create easy to use intuitive user experiences that drive growth for our group digital teams.

Requirements:
• Commercial experience working within a UX/UI environment
• Ability to wireframe and prototype across desktop, mobile and tablet.
• A clear understanding and appreciation of design standards across the various screen formats.
• Prior experience of having worked within an Agile delivery framework.
• Skilled with Adobe Xd & Creative Cloud, Sketch or Figma
• Knowledge of InVision, Axure or Balsamiq
• Exposure Miro & Zeplin would be advantageous, but not essential.

Intelligent Resource is committed to barrier-free and inclusive recruitment. We are a Disability Confident recruiter, and a RIDI 100 and Business Disability Forum partner organisation.

Should you choose to contact Intelligent Resource regarding this role or apply for it, all personal data you submit to us will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Notice which you can find on our website

title: Senior UI/UX Designer - Creative Product Thinker
description:
Product Designer job description

We are looking for a talented Product Designer to create amazing user experiences. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

You will be designing ideas using various methods and latest technology.

Duties and responsibilities

· Plan and implement new designs

· Optimize existing user interface designs

· Test for intuitivity and experience

· Communicate with team & product stakeholders to understand their business goals and objectives

· Combine creativity with an awareness of the design elements

· Create prototypes for new product ideas

· Test new ideas before implementing

· Conduct an ongoing user research

Requirements and qualifications

· Previous working experience as a UI/UX Designer for minimum 6+ years

· Excellent design... portfolio

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

· Critical thinker and problem-solving skills

· Knowledge of the range of products including Figma, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator etc.

· BA in design or similar relevant field

· Experience with HTML5 & CSS3

· Familiarity with Human-Computer Interaction

Responsibilities:
• Create best in class work with brand and performance in mind
• Create designs for both mobile and web products
• Ensure designs are unique and stand out amongst the market in regards to competitors
• Contribute and offer ideas in brainstorm sessions. Constantly challenge yourself and others on the team to think outside of the box and push creative further.
• Communicate with the design team and cross-functional stakeholders on projects to offer as much transparency and collaboration as possible.
• Ability to manage projects from concept to execution.
• Understand design & current trends: Track trends and changes in the design landscape and evolve our applications in a strategic way.
• Resize and manipulate imagery as-needed.
• Design and prep artwork for production.
• Strong visual design skills with high attention to detail.
• A solid understanding of how web and mobile applications work.
• Experience using various design and prototyping tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, Invision, Principle).
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• A self starter who needs minimal direction to get started.
• Excellent collaborator who likes to work independently as well as in team settings.
• Design experience in the ecommerce industry is a big plus.

Qualifications:
• 3+ years of experience specializing in graphic design for mobile as well as desktop
• Strong understanding of User Experience concepts and practice.
• An exceptional portfolio showing smart, thoughtful design work
• Comfortable with the tenets of good visual design, with a solid sense of typography, color theory, and grid systems
• Expertise with standard design tools such as Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop)
• Ability to analyze situations and solve problems
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Self motivated with the ability to work autonomously.
• Experience using SEO/SMM Tools like Youtube Analytics, Google Analytics, VidIQ, Tubebuddy, etc.
• Good communication and writing skills in English.

Provide a link to a portfolio that showcases your work and your role on projects.

Location: At Office Bangalore Based

Start Date: Immediate/or as early possible

Compensation: (Not a problem depending on level of experience & work quality)

About us:

The world is changing. Technologies are changing. This is an opportune time to invest in Smart Cricket Technologies. SmartCricket Global Limited (SCG) is at the brink of bringing tomorrow’s technology, today.

Mr. Atul Srivastava, Founder of SmartCricket Global Limited, in collaboration with Intel has indigenously worked for over 5 years to build a portfolio of IoT powered products, of which BatSense is the first product. Bringing cutting-edge technology into Cricket.

BatSense fits onto the bat and records all the movements of the bat. The same data is displayed on an iPhone/Android mobile App and monitors the batsman’s progress. The data collected is the property of the SCG and is continuously fed into the data analytics engine.

Players and Teams witnessed BatSense at the Champions Trophy 2017 with players such as David Warner, Travis Head, Aaron Finch and Tamim Iqbal allowing the 25-gram chip to be mounted on top of their cricket bat. The result was a data set which indicated the bat speed, follow-through angle and back-lift angle among others. The same data was broadcasted on television live.

The company is building a data-driven ecosystem that will create a connected community of smart players, bringing fans closer to the game and redefining the way sport is played, watched, followed and analyzed. The Company will soon get into Golf, Baseball, Badminton, Tennis, Football, Hockey & Volleyball.

Powered with Intel, Partnered with International Cricket Council (ICC)

Beta-launch in ICC Champions Trophy 2017 London with Broadcast in Live Television

Official Product launch in ICC World Cup 2019 - London

Considering the Importance of Data in day to Sports, A batsman’s lifetime data is stored in the Cloud from where Individual players, coaches and cricket analysts can introspect, analyze and review many aspects pertaining to a batsman’s technique, tendencies and temperament.

title: Trainee UI/ UX Designer
description:
Junior Designer - Training to become a Fully Qualified UI/ UX Designer
Location:
UK based - Expected to travel to customer sites UK wide; working from client/office/home locations as appropriate. Flexible working arrangements will be available
Candidates must be eligible to obtain BPSS clearance.

Experis Consulting has an exciting and unique opportunity for Developer's who are looking to train and upskill to become UI/ UX Designers whilst working onsite for one of the leading Technology and Outsourcing clients within the IT industry. This is a great opportunity to join Experis' ever growing consulting division where you will be trained and developed whilst representing Experis on one of our key accounts.
We're looking for dynamic Developers who possess the desire to enhance their current skills and are looking to accelerate their career within UI/ UX Design. An interaction designer works out the best way to let users interact with services and products in terms of both overall flow... and at the level of individual design elements. You will be a part of a multiple disciplinary team ensuring the accelerated application development across our clients. You will demonstrate knowledge and experience of working with Agile/Scrum.

As a minimum, ideally, we require candidates to demonstrate the following experience and attributes:

Coding knowledge & experience of HTML/CSS
GDS experience
Any experience of UX, wireframing, visual design or an Agile environment is desirable.
Successful candidates will then undertake a UX/UI boot-camp aligned to the outputs of the attached role.Once training has been completed, your day-to-day responsibilities may include:

Create prototype, wireframes, mock-ups, workflows, user flows, site maps, and storyboards, interactive design, graphic design, information architecture.
Proficient with tools such as Sketch, Invision Studio, Balsamiq, Axure, and (url removed) Prototype Kit - Interpret evidence-based research, identify user issues/difficulties and important needs, engagement with websites, platforms, and services and incorporate into your work.

Collaborate with user researchers and content designers to test, iterate, and launch products and services that satisfy stakeholders.

Work with Business Analysts on refining and updating designs aligned with business requirements.

description:

We are building a category-defining product that allows people to meet anonymously across the world over the shared interests and ideologies, as well as helps content creators & influencers to monetize their name, image, and likeness in the... Web 3.0 ecosystem.

The Role:

Are you eager to build a multi-sensory future of the VR event & entertainment industry and future of relationships on the web? Then this challenge is for you! We are looking for an energetic, passionate, creative and very hands-on team player to join our groundbreaking start-up. We are building a large-scale virtual worlds application and need an experienced UX & UI designer to build new branches of user interactions and supercharge the look of our UI. Our products works on desktop, VR and mobile, so we need someone who has exerience and is interested in designing for all of these. This is a minimum 2 month role but could be a full-time position long-term for the right person. The ideal candidate will have experience in VR, AR, WebXR and / or metaverse projects. Note: This is not a good fit for beginners.
• Applications without portfolio will not be considered.
• Requirements:
• 3 years of experience as an UI / UX Designer (outside of university)
• BA degree in design communications or similair
• Expert in Figma & Adobe CC (XD, Illustrator and Photoshop), InVision, and other common digital design tools
• Ability to design for cross platfroms
• Experience in VR, AR, WebXR and / or metaverse projects
• Highly creative mind with prolific idea generation capabilities and innovative thinking
• Ability to discuss and explain design options
• Detail oriented
• Critical thinker
• Problem solver and customer-centered
• Knowledge of Usability Factors in Human Computer Interaction.
• Excellent interpersonal written and oral communication skills
• Ability to work productively with a geographically distributed team
• Responsibilities:
• * Design user flows and wireframes
• Plan and implement new designs
• Optimize existing user interface designs
• Combine creativity with an awareness of the design elements
• Create prototypes for new product ideas
• Test new ideas before implementing
