title: UI/UX Designer - OutThink
description:
Remote (CET +/- 2 hours)

We are excited to be partnering with OutThink to support them in hiring for a UK based UX / UI Designer.

OutThink is seeking a UI/UX Designer to join their exciting start-up, working within a high-performing agile engineering squad, and playing a key role in building and delivering OutThink’s ground-breaking SaaS (Software as a Service) Cybersecurity Human Risk Management Platform.

The platform provides innovative and just-in-time learning experiences, nudges, and simulations to hundreds of thousands of users worldwide via desktop and mobile devices. At the same time, the system monitors training responses, collects security system data and continually gathers feedback. All this data is collated and processed by our cloud engines in Azure, culminating in the provision of sophisticated predictive human risk management models. Our models can drive automated countermeasures, and present analysis results via the delivery of highly visual and interactive online... dashboards.

The Role

You will have a design background with valuable UX knowledge gained from commercial experience. You will need to be a master at eliciting requirements from stakeholders, internal and external, and be able to design beautiful, elegant, and perfectly realisable user interfaces.

You should possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level business requirements into effective design artefacts such as task flows and wireframes, and further ensure that they can be transformed into intuitive and functional user interfaces.

You will need to communicate scenarios, end-to-end experiences, interaction models, and screen designs to stakeholders and be able to realise complex data visualizations.

This is a predominantly remote role in a remote team where open feedback, new ways of working and thinking out of the box are encouraged and expected.

Requirements

Responsibilities
• Investigating user experience design requirements for OutThink’s digital SaaS platform, in collaboration with Product Owners and other stakeholders.
• Translating complex business processes into intuitive and elegant use and product experiences.
• Working with teams internally to ensure the creation and delivery of beautiful and elegant experiences for users.
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, process maps, flow diagrams, storyboards, and prototypes.
• Assisting in developing and evaluating user stories and usability studies.

What You’ll Need
• A solid appreciation of art, beauty, and a keen sense of aesthetics to drive design innovation.
• A positive and proactive attitude with strong initiative and team-working skills.
• Good communication skills, with the ability to communicate in English in all forms.
• An understanding of the basics behind great software design.
• An eye for clean and artful design.
• Experience building data-centric web visualizations with an understanding of the limitations of web architecture design choices.
• 3+ years of solid commercial experience with UI design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Zeplin, Axure, Figma or Invision.
• Experience with Agile Development Methodology, working in short sprint cycles.
• Experience with Purpose-Driven Design processes.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and self-assured to present your work and represent the team at all levels.
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Ability to learn new processes and concepts fast with a demonstrated sense of curiosity.
• Intrinsic drive and motivation to build a ‘world first’ and share our start-up vision.

Benefits

In Return, You’ll Receive
• This a rare opportunity to help build a global SaaS business and have full visibility of the entire operation
• You’ll learn and grow at a breakneck speed
• Great start-up culture in a fun, friendly, and hardworking team.
• Flexible remote working
• Share options package - a rare opportunity to get in early and have a stake in what could potentially be a unicorn start-up, with a huge financial payback
• 34 days paid holiday (including public holidays)
• Plus, an extra day off on your birthday!

Join us!

We are a remote-first company headquartered in London with teams across EMEA. You will be based in the UK, Spain or South Africa and are willing to travel, as the role requires.

We believe in: Trust and Integrity, Innovation, Customer Centricity, Purpose and Collaboration and are looking for someone who lives and breathes our values. We strive to be ‘exceptional’ in everything we do and have a lot of fun along the way!

All OutThinkers are part of our journey, so we offer equity options with every role and benchmark against other VC-backed companies to provide above-market-rate salaries for companies of our size.

Beyond this, plenty more makes OutThink an incredible place to work

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
This is a hybrid role that requires occasional travel to the Edinburgh office. Suitable travelling distance to Edinburgh is advised.

This is a great opportunity for any Junior UI/UX Designer to join one of the biggest sports betting publishers in the UK and Brazil. They have an audience of over 5,000,000 passionate sports betting fans across a range of social platforms and websites.

This is an organisation that has seen continuous growth every year since 2014, with no plan on slowing down. It’s a great opportunity to join an established team of designers, social media experts, marketing professionals and product developers to produce incredible user-centric design across a number of high traffic websites.

If you’re looking to join a team that are passionate about what they do, provide UI & UX solutions, build on your wireframing & prototyping knowledge and be part of a growing, exciting, contemporary business, this is the role for you!

The Role

You’ll be helping with the UI/UX... design process end-to-end, providing user-centric solutions to problems. You’ll be helping maintain the current websites with a mobile-first approach, optimising the existing interfaces and improving on the overall user experience. This will be achieved through the creation of interactive prototypes, wireframes, and user flows to create the best user journey possible.

You’ll be working towards the company’s mission; to create the safest, most powerful and engaging sports betting communities and websites in the world.

Responsibilities
• Delivery of innovative, user-centred website designs with great attention to detail.
• Optimisation of existing user interface to improve the user experience and maximise the number of conversions.
• Creation of interactive prototypes, wireframes, and user flows to deliver compelling digital experiences.
• Implementation of Figma design systems and component libraries to create fast and efficient processes.
• Collaboration with the product manager, designers, and developers to help bring your designs to the user.
• Providing developers with proper assets like style guides, icons, graphics, etc.
• Effectively working across multiple brands, implementing and adding to each brand’s creative assets and design systems.
• Reviewing front-end designs implemented by developers and provide feedback to ensure pixel-perfect experiences.

Requirements
• A strong portfolio that shows your strengths in both UX and visual design, particularly with mobile-focused website design.
• Experience using Adobe Creative Suite and Figma.
• Ability to use problem-solving skills to determine solutions to user interface challenges.
• Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team.
• A proactive, self-starter who takes pride in their work.
• An ambitious, team player who wants to contribute to long-term organisational goals.

Beneficial
• Experience creating design systems and component libraries from scratch in Figma.
• Experience working hands-on with developers and product managers.
• Experience working with Google Analytics, Hotjar or other digital analytics platforms.
• A passion for football as you’ll love what they do!
• Knowledge and/or an understanding of sports betting.

Package
• Pension contribution.
• Remote-first working. Office based in Edinburgh
• Work from home setup budget.
• Training budget to aid professional development.
• Phone bill contribution.
• Laptop and essential items provided.
• Regular social events, including tickets to sports events.
• Bupa private healthcare after 2 years of service

To be considered for this opportunity, please apply below, or get in touch with Fraser Gillespie.

E:

All submissions must include a portfolio

title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer

Team: Design

Location: Sports Interactive, Here East, Olympic Park, London

Reporting to: Producer

Studio Overview

Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global audience of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly-owned subsidiary of SEGA, having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. No matter how big we dream, though, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.

Further information on the company and its games is available at www.sigames.com.

Position Overview

We are seeking a talented UI/UX... Designer for our fast-growing Design team. Collaborating with the UI and Games Design teams you will be assisting in improvements being made to the overall UI of the product, with a specific focus on usability. This role offers the chance to work on and develop for the world’s leading football management simulation titles. We are also aiming to improve our accessibility support to ensure our games are enjoyed by a wider range of audiences and would hope the successful applicant shares that passion.

The successful candidate will be organised, self-motivated and able to communicate with all disciplines, both within the design team and across the wider studio. You'll be keen to share your expertise and experience as well as committed to the constant improvement of your own skills and knowledge.

Please note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive any applications without a portfolio link showcasing your best work will be discounted.

Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate with Games Design in developing new and exciting features for upcoming versions of Football Manager.
• Produce UI designs & assets of a consistently high quality.
• Communicate your work through Site Maps, User flows and early stage wireframing through to hi-res mock-ups.
• Work with the UI/UX Design Lead and Production to develop and grow your skillset.
• Within cross-disciplinary Feature Pods, collaborate with QA, Production, and other development disciplines to ensure all new features are placing the user and usability as a top priority.

Knowledge, Skill and Experience
• Strong understanding of key UI design principles
• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets
• Ability to communicate clearly and tell stories throughout the design process
• Experience with visual design software such as Figma and Miro
• A passion for UIUX design
• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user
• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team
• Clear written and verbal communication.  

Desirable
• Experience creating prototypes, wireframes and developing user flows
• 2+ years UI/UX professional experience within software production (ideally within the games industry but not exclusively)
• Experience in Unity
• Animation or motion design skills (e.g. After Effects, Principle etc.)
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS or similar
• Basic Understanding of Accessibility settings in games
• Experience of Adobe Suite (Illustrator/Photoshop)
• Interest in Football Manager and Football, whilst very helpful, is not essential

Working Here

We approach everything with passion, whether that’s leaving our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who works here.

We like our talent to be tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to consistent improvement and encourage our people to truly realise their own personal potential.

We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do and that’s one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).

If you want a positive work/life balance, we’re right behind you. While we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on, so you can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.

Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid, and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.

When you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.
• We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.

Inclusivity Matters

We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.

SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process.

This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
THE ROLE:

We are looking for an intermediate or senior UI/UX Designer experienced in designing for PC and console games. You will find yourself within our creative team collaborating closely with our tech team. You would be responsible for the player's experience within the game systems and gameplay inside and out of the game's menus. Passion for unorthodox co-op mechanics is a plus.

While we prefer applicants with a right to work in the UK, candidates without it will still be considered due to the remote nature of the work. However, we do not foresee ourselves sponsoring visas in the short term.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Owning the full game user experience from onboarding, UX flow and controls to menu layouts and navigation.
• Defining UI/UX objectives & exploring the best possible solutions in collaboration with colleagues from other disciplines.
• Designing the logic, layout, and flow of the game's user interfaces based on information architecture and accessibility principles.
•... Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, animated mockups, process flows, and sitemaps and presenting them to others.
• Design of graphic user interface elements.
• Animation of GUI elements.
• Creation of functional prototypes for rapid iterations on key elements.
• Ensuring that signs and feedback clearly communicate the game information based on best practices in accessibility.
• Ensuring optimal interaction feedback.
• Ensuring that the interface arrangement accounts for localization, accessibility, platform and other constraints.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Prior experience in visual user interface design as a UI/UX artist or designer, or a game designer.
• Experience in designing for multiple gaming platforms.
• A comprehensive portfolio included with your application that documents your thinking and process in addition to any finished work.

SKILLS:
• Familiarity with the Unity game engine.
• Raster & vector based workflows.
• Basic 3D knowledge for working with assets and textures.
• Excellent communication skills and desire to work in a team.

APPLYING:

We prefer all applicants to apply at https://zaumstudio.factorialhr.co.uk/

If you do not meet some of the criteria above but produce killer work please send us your portfolio anyway! We're always looking for fresh takes on all fronts.

ZA/UM is a video game studio that in 2019 released the award-winning role-playing game Disco Elysium. The studio has offices in London and Brighton in the UK and Porto in Portugal. Currently, we are around 90 writers, artists, developers and producers from around the world.

ZA/UM is committed to encouraging equality, diversity and inclusion among our workforce, and eliminating unlawful discrimination. The aim is for our workforce to be truly representative of all sections of society and our customers, and for each employee to feel respected and able to give their best. The organisation - in providing goods and/or services and/or facilities - is also committed against unlawful discrimination of customers or the public

title: UX Designer
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar North is on the lookout for a UX Designer with great attention to detail and a passion for Human Centered Design principles and delivering user centered experiences. We are considering both mid and senior candidates.

WHAT WE DO

We work as a global UX design, UX writing and UI design team to create intuitive, effective, and engaging user interfaces across all Rockstar games.

We build bridges and foster close collaboration with teams across the business to turn the creative vision for the game into a seamless, high quality player experience.

We design for players and advocate for their... needs and expectations by applying user-centered design methodologies to our workflows.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Brief interpretation – able to dissect a design brief, identify knowledge gaps, additional information required, and objectives needed for the roadmap.
• Planning – choosing the correct deliverables for a project in collaboration with the necessary teams and wider business objectives.
• Process – understand, apply, and advocate for the users by employing user-centered design techniques and processes, from project initiation to on-going product evolution.
• Understanding – know how to interpret insights from existing and new research and how these apply to a project.
• Producing flows to demonstrate how an experience should function. These may be supported by the creation of complex interactive prototypes at various fidelity.
• Communicating complex architectures and content structures with clear diagramming and artefact creation.
• Collaborate and communicate with other teams continuously throughout the lifecycle of the project. Presenting work to stakeholders throughout project lifecycle.
• Always be aware of and learning evidence-based design methodology and ways to improve the work and design process.

QUALIFICATIONS
• 2+ years' professional experience in a design environment, or in a similar capacity within the games industry.
• Degree or equivalent work experience in a related field, such as Interaction Design, HCI, Human Factors and UX, Psychology, Anthropology, etc.
• Portfolio demonstrating applied UCD processes and full case studies.

SKILLS
• Experience in understanding complex content structures and designing and improving architecture for large scale systems.
• Problem solving for longevity and systems ready solutions rather than bespoke or one-off concepts.
• Strong creative problem-solving capabilities.
• Great communication skills to collaborate closely with our teams worldwide.
• Solid foundation and understanding of UX methodology and user centered design.
• Analytical and methodical in your approach to working.
• Build lasting relationships with internal stakeholders.
• Be proactive in your ongoing learning, skills development, and self-improvement.
• Proficiency in industry standard design tools (Figma, Framer, Adobe CC etc)
• Passion for playing and making games.
• A desire to share knowledge, expertise and help others improve their skills.
• Showing initiative when presented with a problem; even in moments when that problem is presented as a solution.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
• Experience working on large scale enterprise projects and content management systems is advantageous but not essential.
• Experience with complex information architecture and content strategy is advantageous but not essential.
• Experience with compliance, accessibility for TV/GUIs/Console is advantageous but not essential.
• Multi-platform and omni-channel experience is advantageous but not essential.
• Understanding of the possibilities and limitations of front-end development and mark-up languages such as Javascript, CSS, XAML.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race

title: UI/UX Design Manager
description:
Puffy is one of America’s fastest-growing e-commerce retailers. Our award-winning mattresses are developed with unrivaled attention to detail and are loved by millions of sleepers in America and Canada.

Since entering the bed-in-a-box market in 2016, we have experienced consistent and considerable year-on-year growth. Driven by a mission to make optimal sleep health a priority for all, we’ve made headlines on Entrepreneur.com and TechCompanyNews, to name a few. Puffy’s product range now extends to the entire bedroom, including pillows, bedding, and bedroom accessories.

The Role

Puffy are looking for a talented UI/UX Design Manager to help take our user centric design to the next level. The is a strategic, people management and operational role within our business.

What you'll be doing
• Enhance the user experience by creating seamless navigation within the e-commerce website and Landing pages
• Develop UI/UX strategy to support AB testing and Landing pages
• Develop wireframes and... prototypes around the business needs for AB tests
• Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)
• Drive UI/UX strategy; manage and mentor junior designers about UX/UI design processes
• Communicate high-level design ideas and prototypes to stakeholders in meetings
• Understand user behavior and psychology, and review User testing results to support hypotheses made on UX.
• Understand and create compatible UI designs with UX wireframes in accordance with brand guidelines
• Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
• Build storyboards process flows, and sitemaps to conceptualize designs to accurately convey project plans to stakeholders.
• Collaborate with project manager and team for reporting, team assignments, status, and updates
• Take lead in creative development
• Keep UI/UX tasks up to speed and work closely with the digital project manager to ensure deadlines are met.
• Work closely with the Digital Marketing team to optimize the main funnel as well as dedicated landing pages for PPC.

Ideally you will have
• At least 3 years experience leading and managing a team of UX/UI Designers
• A minimum of 7 years of demonstrated experience in creating and implementing UX/UI design for e-commerce websites
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Design Manager
• Background in research is a plus
• Proficient in design software (e.g. Sketch, Figma, InVision, Zeplin)
• Proficient with visual design programs such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and others
• Up to date with UX/UI trends and current design strategy and technologies
• Ability to prioritize and manage several milestones and projects efficiently
• Experience creating storyboards and website mapping
• Account for challenges using problem-solving skills and seek to optimize data for the best possible outcome
• Strong portfolio of design projects, willing to share in the interview
• Professional written and interpersonal skills when communicating with stakeholders

Puffy Perks & Benefits
• “We challenge the status quo.” Work with young and supportive colleagues. The leadership team are highly entrepreneurial, it reflects. Ideas, challenges, think tanks, it is all in your day to day.
• Not in Dubai yet? We will cover your visa requirements and help you settle with flights and temporary accommodation (2-week hotel stay).
• Flights home once per year.
• A modern and stylish open plan office in the heart of Dubai Marina. Dozens of restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and shopping within a 5 min walk! Ps. Don’t worry we have free company parking.
• We promote a healthy lifestyle! On top of world class health insurance (dental & vision included), our kitchen is stocked with organic snacks, juices, fruits, tea & coffee.
• Top tier tech stack. We are young and modern. G suite, Atlassian, Re-tool, Asana, Slack. Need something more? Ask away.
• The best equipment, whatever helps you get your work done. Choose your own laptop, monitor (we prefer curved Samsung screens;)), Super ergo office chairs, and whatever else you need.
• Closing the week with a delicious catered lunch on Friday

title: UX Designer
description: Job Description and ResponsibilitiesVisa Consulting and Analytics (VC&A) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful and financial results for Visas network clients, including both financial services and merchants. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, data analytics, brand management, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, Visa Consulting and Analytics solves the most strategic problems for our clients.Visa Managed Services (VMS) is an augmentation of Visas consultancy offering, supporting the execution and implementation of recommendations to help scale competitive advantage and operate to succeed in the digital age. We are looking for an experienced UX Designer to supplement the Visa Managed Services (VMS) team in an important Visa client (the Client) in London.Visa is heavily investing in its Global Design Team to help support its growing digital product line. Visa Global Design is comprised of five specializations: Design, Design Engineering... Design Operations, Design Strategy, and Research & Accessibility. We are looking for a Staff Designer to join our team.We believe that great design could engage and inspire users, and we strive to rethink and redefine how users interact with Visa's products and services. Our team members are innovative thinkers and strategic problem solvers who are as analytical as they are creative. We value hard work, accountability, and collaboration, and we prize proven skills and team success over personal gain.In this role, you will model excellent design principles and mentor junior staff. The UX Designer is an experienced individual contributor responsible for designing usable, accessible, and engaging user experiences.What you will be doing?Collaborating with our cross-functional design, product, and business teams to build upon their vision using sound design principles to ensure project success.Facilitating workshops, presentations, and walkthrough sessions to explore business requirements and promote shared knowledge.Creating, delivering, and supporting high-quality design deliverables like concepts, user journeys, wireframes, UI flows and detailed UI design.Ensuring all designs adhere to all relevant policies and standards e.g., channel, accessibility, brand, design language.Proactively exercising independent judgement with minimal direction from supervisors.Creating, using, or contributing to design systems.Managing client expectations whilst designing responsive and/or app UI design and interactions through collaboratively working with the build teamsQualificationsSkills were looking for Proven UX design experience in designing digital products for complex systems across web and mobile applications. Financial services, consulting, and management experience. Experience working in Agile/ Waterfall environment. (Jira/ Confluence) Experience in client engagements, demonstrating excellence in presentation polish, and strong client orientation.Experience in creating wireframes, prototypes and user flows using specialist tools such as Figma, InVision, Marvel, OmniGraffle, and Sketch.Ability to drive change in a matrix environment

title: UI / UX Designer - REMOTE
description:
UX-UI Developer - Fully Remote

Our client is a prestigious international Financial Services / online trading Company. The Company is looking for a candidate with great design skills and an excellent online portfolio.

Our client will focus on candidates with work examples within similar industries (banking, financial services, cryptocurrency etc).

Main requirements: Bachelor or Master's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), UI/UX design or equivalent degree At least 3 years' experience in a similar position Portfolio that demonstrates experience with problem-solving, and technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms (e.g. desktop and mobile, Android and iOS) Experience in best practices for information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques Knowledge of industry tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Zeplin and Principle. Experience with planning and... conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing and rapid prototyping Agile Experience Strong communication skills with ability to articulate and optimize design based on the value to the user and the business

The Role: As our UI/UX Designer, you will help shape the end-to-end journey of how clients interact with our products. The UI/UX team works on delivering an intuitive and user-friendly trading experience by focusing on design, usability and function. As part of the UI/UX Team, you will be responsible for measuring, optimising and improving ease-of-use; as well as exploring different approaches to solving end-user problems.

Some of your responsibilities will include: conducting user research and testing, creating personas, and developing wireframes, prototypes and task flows. You will be working closely with Graphic and Product Designers to come up with inspirational UI designs, as well as working with the Web Development Team to implement and test your work.

The main responsibilities of the position include: Translate concepts into user flows, journeys, wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences Create user stories, personas, and storyboards Apply user-centric methodologies and common practices to design websites, UIs, mobile UIs and online content Optimise designs by devising elegant solutions Facilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products Plan and conduct competitor analysis & user research Collaborate with project managers, designers, developers and other departments to create engaging content and interfaces

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer

Location:

London/ Hybrid Salary: £65,000 - £77,000 (Depending on Experience) About the Company:
Currency Solutions started in 2003 with the belief that every customer deserved access to excellent exchange rates, a premium service and the latest market insight and technology. Fast forward to today and weve successfully transitioned from start-up to a leading independent FX and international payments company. Headquartered in London with offices in four countries, weve sent billions securely around the world and been ranked Excellent on Trustpilot by our customers.

Today the world is different. Our core beliefs havent changed, but we recognise our delivery must if we are to successfully solve the complex challenges our customers are facing. In practice, this means finding both savings and stability in challenging trading environments, moving to an anticipatory model of servicing business and personal customers, and collaborating with industry partners to develop... new and compelling product and service offerings.

As part of our continuing growth, we are now looking for a skilled Senior UX Designer to join our technology team and play a key role in defining and designing amazing user interfaces. Role description:
As a Senior UX Designer at Currency Solutions, you will play a key role in working with both internal stakeholders and external users to research, define, validate, and design great user experiences. Using a variety of techniques and software, you will convert user needs into digital experiences, and in turn will go on to create the development artifacts needed to successfully take an idea through into delivery.

This will be the companys first UX hire, and you will need to be highly skilled in your field, operating with minimum oversight and prioritising your own workload. The role will report into the Head of Product. Your responsibilities:
Own the User Experience Take the UX lead in rebuilding our online products from scratch Run and facilitate in-person and remote workshops for both internal stakeholders, and external prospects and existing clients Working alongside Product and Engineering, take the lead role in defining design standards, guidelines, and templates, and ensure that they are adhered to Meet with clients to gather information about their requirements and validate your UX hypotheses Be comfortable with initial ambiguity, and be able to transform it into clearly defined requirements Run A/B / MVT experiments to test designs and validate assumptions Work closely with Product and Business Analysis to produce user stories and supporting collateral Create user personas, user journeys and site maps Produce great UX collateral across the whole product lifecycle, including rough sketches, interactive flat designs, high-def branded collateral, wireframes, prototypes and style guides using tools such as Axure, Miro, Figma, InVision, Balsamiq, etc.

Work on cross-platform applications to develop user experiences that transition multiple devices Work closely with both frontend and backend developers to ensure that user experiences are technically feasible and realistic The experience and competencies you will bring:
An ability to quickly build strong working relationships with stakeholders. Experience in leading change, driving decisions, and ensuring that all deliverables are fit for purpose and providing the intended value. Confidence in engaging stakeholders operating ls.

Experience working with cross-functional IT development teams within an Agile software delivery environment. A pragmatic approach to task prioritisation with outside the box problem solving skills. 5 years experience in a UX role within an organisation(s) using agile software development methodologies. Flexibility for occasional travel if required. Flexibility to of hours conference calls if required. Ideally experienced in using Design Sprints, but able to learn fast if not.

Experience in Fin Tech or Technology organisations would be beneficial, but not essential. A good working knowledge of and interest in currency exchange would be beneficial, but not essential.

Experience of working with both inhouse and offshore development teams would be beneficial, but not essential. If you think you are the right person for this role, please apply now

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Business Summary

The Long Term is a personal finance platform that aims to utilise open banking technology to show users their current financial situation. By using analytics, forecasting and financial planning tools, the platform helps users create their own financial plans for financial independence. In addition, the platform equips users with the knowledge and skills to improve all facets of their finances with a financial literacy course, coaching and live sessions from seasoned professionals. Users will also benefit from accessing the platform's community for support and professionals to render additional services such as mortgage advice, financial planning, insurance and tax. Our platform aims to show users what's required to achieve financial independence and give them the tools and knowledge to make it a reality.

Role Description

We are looking for an experienced and creative UI/UX Designer to join our team!

As a UI-UX Designer, you will be responsible for delivering the... best online user experience, which makes your role extremely important for our success and ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty.

You will be designing ideas using various methods and the latest technology. You will be designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, forms, and widgets.

Your responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you.

Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base. Working alongside the CEO and COO of the business you’ll have the chance to hone your skills and learn more about working in app design in a growing business whilst adding real value

In this role, you will have a clear career progression path, as well as lots of training opportunities and autonomy. This is a great opportunity to work on products and technologies that make a real difference in people's lives!

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
via: via HR Software For Growing Businesses | Freshteam
description:
Please make sure to submit your professional portfolio in English while applying!

💸 45-60k EUR per year (or local currency equivalent) full time contractor contract

🌎 Fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!

🏖 33 Days Paid Leave

✨ Exciting products, millions of users, sold to global brands

💻 Working with the latest hardware, tech stack and tools

🏋️‍♀️ Access to benefits (country dependent 🌎 )

ABOUT US

Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and... values as we do.

RESPONSIBILITIES

What can you expect?
• Designing websites and apps for internal projects and external clients and contributing to our internal design systems and processes
• Working closely with developers to bring your designs to life, by creating design specs, prototypes, and providing UI/UX feedback
• Creating effective and dynamic style guides and templates in Figma for other teams to produce social and digital marketing assets
• Producing fun, polished, well-designed assets using the Figma as primary tool and Adobe CC from time to time.
• Using a user focused design process to balance client, business and user needs to create the most effective design solutions
• Helping create polished client presentations
• Keeping up with design trends and tools
• Mentoring junior team members and helping set the standard of design for the company

QUALIFICATIONS

What's important to us:
• Excellent eye for detail particularly with regards to typography and layout
• Minimum of 3 years professional experience as a designer in a similar role: UI/UX design, product design, interaction design, etc
• Proven ability to design user flows, considering user needs, business needs, functionality, accessibility and aesthetics
• Mastery of Figma or willingness to learn quickly.
• Quick to learn and adapt to the dynamic nature of working with new tools, technologies and techniques
• High work-ethic, self-motivation and ability to work independently
• Strong time management skills with a proactive attitude towards communication with regards to your work
• Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities

YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT

Modern Tech Stack

We use the latest tools, hardware and methodologies across our teams. We’re always on the look-out for new ways of working and ensure everyone is setup with enough hardware firepower to excel, Windows or Mac.

Agility & Openness for Ideas

We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!

Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People

We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality and skills, we’re an international team with more than 125 people onboard and we’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

Flexibility

We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working. In your role you will be working from 10am till 6pm.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.

PAYMENT

45,000 - 60,000 EUR per year, depending on experience and skills.

CONTRACT TYPE

Full time contractor contract - fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

First, you will be invited for a 30-minute pre-interview via Zoom. We usually ask about your previous experience, future career path and motivation for changing your job.

If the pre-interview goes well, we will invite you to a second step - You will meet Jakub, our Design Manager, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom.
It’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team.

If the technical interview with Jakub goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task.

And that’s it

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
As part of WANdisco’s Customer Experience organisation, the UX / UI Designer’s role is to work with Product Managers, Architects and Software Developers to design user interfaces which simplify complex problems and provide an attractive and user-friendly experience for our customers, allowing them to self-serve and optimise their use of our software.

The successful candidate will have an eye for clean, simple design and be able to translate high-level user flows and wireframes into functional and intuitive user interface designs. The initiative to make decisions based on solid understanding of user behaviour and a deep understanding of usability best practises is key to success within this role.

About WANdisco
WANdisco is the first and only data activation platform for accelerating digital transformation at scale. WANdisco makes infinite data actionable across clouds and enterprises in real time. WANdisco customers unleash the business value of the cloud with zero downtime, data... loss or disruption. WANdisco activates data to power AI and machine learning, create new services, and transform businesses. To learn more, visit www.wandisco.com

title: Product Designer (UI/UX Designer)
description:
The role

We are looking for a inquisitive, well-rounded Product Designer to join our core team. Working closely with the product manager and engineers, you'll play a key role in enabling our cutting edge technologies to build excellent developers' experiences on web3. You will collaborate with the engineering team to bring great user experiences to life for the entire product.

Things we'd love to see:
• You are a skilled UI/UX designer, with at least 1+ years of experience with innovative design solutions
• You have a knack for delivering successfully on complex UI/UX challenges without compromising quality and speed
• Good experience with Figma
• User research skills: contextual inquiry, knowledge elicitation, any other creative methods for gathering high-quality data from remote or infrequent user interaction
• You are delivery oriented and understand the tradeoffs between complete and perfect.
• Outstanding written, visual, and spoken communication skills with technical and... non-technical stakeholders
• Tendency to think outside of the box for more effective solutions
• Produce high-fidelity working mockups
• Keep up on design trends, best practices, existing solutions, standards
• Familiarity with Agile development
• Ideally you have experience working knowledge of frontend languages such as HTML, CSS, JS, frameworks such as React.js, Next.js, and UI Libraries such as Tailwind (not required but good to have).

Puzolve focuses on Sales and Marketing, Product Design, Design, Web Development, and Digital Marketing. Their company has offices in Remote. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://puzolve.com

Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry.

title: UX / UI Designer - Brighton
description:
UI UX Designer Job Description

My client is looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of various projects. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.
UI UX Designer Responsibilities
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions
• Designing UI elements and tools
• Testing UI elements
UI UX Designer Requirements:
• A bachelor's degree and a minimum of 1 year UI/UX design experience.
• A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.
• A team player but can work independently too.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.

title: UX Designer
description:
About Atos

Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of € 12 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos|Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index.

The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure... information space.

At Atos, our ambition is to be a diverse and inclusive company where people are truly free to be themselves. They can thrive, achieve their personal goals and innovate without limitations. We welcome everyone to apply.

Family friendly, flexible working arrangements will be considered across all roles.

The opportunity

Atos Digital Transformation Consulting (DTC) helps clients deliver innovation to their customers and improve cost and effectiveness by leveraging Information Technologies. With over 1,500 experts we provide advisory services and expertise so that our clients keep control of their processes and projects, can customise as much as required by directly managing the resources provided, and keep ownership of their assets and systems.

Our five clusters: Strategy, Insights & Experience, Efficiency, Technology Strategy & Transformation, Organisational Change and Digital Compliance offer a range of cost-effective transformation and innovative solutions tailored to each industry-sector.

We are looking for motivated forward-thinking UX Designers, who love working in a fast-paced environment to join our team!

Responsibilities:
• Leading the design workstream within Customer Experience or wider Digital Transformation projects.
• Managing relationships with client stakeholders.
• Refinement of our core offerings by providing expertise and keeping up to date with the latest trends.
• Working with senior practice members to support business development activities.
• Building thought-leadership to help position Atos's brand in the marketplace.
• Line management and mentorship of junior team members.
• Coordinating the transfer of knowledge and skills across the team, sharing best practice.

Skills & experience we can't do without:
• Understanding and experience working with quan and qual data to create evidence based design (and on occasions conducting your own research activities).
• UI/UX specialist for web/mobile/enterprise/emerging digital touchpoints.
• Strong design background, with experience defining design systems/patterns and an understanding of UX best practice.
• Affinity with creative design tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Figma, Sketch, etc.
• Ability to work across the end-to-end design lifecycle from strategy, conceptualisation, information architecture, wireframes/prototypes, UI content creation, art working, quality checking (ensuring the final product matches the initial designs).
• Workshop facilitation skills using Design Thinking/ Human Centred Design or similar techniques to elicit innovation solutions that solve customer needs.
• Appreciation of technology constraints and opportunities.
• Handling client relationships, particularly the ability to understand clients' needs and challenges.
• Circa 5 years of experience in Customer Experience and Digital Transformation.
• UK and Ireland mobility to deliver client projects.

Skills & experience we'd like:
• Government Digital Service (GDS) design system knowledge.
• Experience completing user research.
• Service design experience.

What we offer?
• Attractive salary.
• 25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
• Flex benefits system - exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
• Retail discounts.
• Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
• Private Medical Scheme.
• Life Assurance.
• Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
• Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.

We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the application process for people with disabilities. Individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation!

Here at Atos, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity, and work hard to ensure that all of our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you an experienced and talented UI/UX Designer looking for your next career opportunity with a leading global SaaS organisation?

As a pioneering global technology firm and market leader in our field, VoucherCart is a voucher and gift card technology disruptor.

We are growing fast and are looking for an experienced and talented UI\/UX designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design across our platform. We pride ourselves on trust, respect, and teamwork and value our most important asset above everything else; our people.

The Role

This is a fantastic opportunity for a Senior UX/UI Designer with an appetite for learning and the ability to grow their own role within the organisation and push new boundaries in design.

You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimised for usability, and exceptional visual design. The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to... UI\/UX design by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

Requirements:

Working knowledge of some of the following technologies and software: Figma, Sketch, InVision, Visio, HTML, CSS (SCSS), iOS, Android, Design Systems, Adobe Creative Suite and Adobe XD.
• Display a strong portfolio of professional UI\/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.
• Be Articulate & Confident with excellent English written and verbal communication skills.

A keen collaborator with the ability to work independently as well as in a team, you will:
• Investigate user experience design requirements for our full suite of new and existing digital assets.
• Develop and conceptualize a comprehensive UI\/UX design strategy for the brand
• Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes
• Have strong graphic design skills in the production of all recognised file-formats including vector imagery for both digital and print production.
• Collaborate with the marketing team, product owner, developers, and designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user.
• Be highly driven and focused on taking ownership of the delivery of targets
• Prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time
• Adhere to branding and style standards on typography and graphic design.

What we offer

Salary range: £25K - £35K (Depending on Experience) + Annual Salary Review

You’ll be part of a friendly and focused team in an environment that promotes an open, empowered culture where everyone pulls together and is passionate about the solutions they’re delivering and the impact on UK healthcare. You’ll be encouraged to leverage your UX experience, along with your natural creative flair and great communication skills, to innovate design concepts across the full suite of web, desktop, and mobile user environments.

You’ll receive a competitive salary and pension package and opportunities to develop your career further, along with the chance to directly influence and impact the evolution and direction of the world’s leading voucher and gift card technology platform.

Working Hours

Full-Time

Location

Edinburgh, UK or Katowice, Poland + Remote/Work from Home

How to Apply

Please send all applications including CV and Portfolio of works to jobs@vouchercart,com

Additionally, you may choose to provide a Video CV - (Up to 120 seconds of intro about you, your experience, and why we should hire you

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer
Fully remote, Edinburgh HQ
£40,000-65,000

Overview:
We are working with a household name in Financial Services that build and deliver intuitive, customer-led products used by hundreds of thousands of customers across the UK to add to their highly respected Customer Experience and Design team.
The organisation have a deep understanding of the benefits of great design and is keen to maximise this, supporting a well-established and high-performing design team with a Senior UX Designer to deliver customer-centred design solutions.
If you are passionate about delivering engaging end-to-end, cross-channel experiences, this one’s for you!

About You:
Your background can be within any industry – from in-house with clients or agency side, but you will hopefully have strong experience delivering high traffic, data-driven applications and be passionate about delivering research-driven design decisions.
The design team work with multiple departments within the organisation, so... projects are highly varied and can include web updates, mobile app design, internal platform design, service design and looking to the future - how to design for customers in a cost of living crisis.

This position will join an established and experienced Design Function of almost 30, where you will have full support and backing from the team.

You will be part of a team responsible for:
• Researching and working on high-performing applications used by millions of customers across the UK.
• Looking for innovative ways to help customers manage their money as easily as possible
• Working to support the retail part of the business and using the data of thousands of shoppers to make informed, design decisions.
• Assessing design solutions after launch to evidence impact and driving future optimisation.
• Designing impactful products and journeys in a cost of living crisis.

This position can be undertaken on a remote-first basis, with current team members spread across the UK. The organisation will cover the expenses of any visits to their Edinburgh HQ when required. The team currently try to meet once per month for meaningful collaboration, something purposeful (e.g. design speakers) as well as social.

Company Details:
The organisations' senior leadership team are committed to user-centric development and invests heavily across the Customer Experience division of the bank.
This organisation is embracing the future. You will be supported by highly experienced Product and Customer Experience Teams who are passionate about creating exceptional products for their customers.
The company offer an excellent benefits package including matched pension up to 7.5%, 28 days + bank holidays, bonus scheme and discounts across the company's retail outlets and services.

title: UX Designer
description:
UX Designer
Glasgow
As a Barclays UX Designer, you will be an integral part of Enterprise Data Tools & Insights Team, working with leadership and fellow team members (both offshore and onshore) and delivering to meet specifications and timelines. You will work alongside UX/UI Designer and DevOps/Cloud engineers and Business Analysts to deliver innovative, high quality, solutions.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality, and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees... globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs.

We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally are able to request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances
Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.
What you’ll be doing?
• You will be quality checking across various programmes of work and delivering this in a timely manner
• Presenting ideas and designs to colleagues and adapting work based on reviews and direct feedback
• Participating and providing feedback in code reviews
• Developing innovative solutions that will enhance the client experience and providing cost-effective solutions
• Developing fellow team members through mentoring and code review
• Working within a large & multidisciplinary team and coordinating and communicating with colleagues effectively
• Dealing with complex technical problems and making sound decisions and using independent judgment
What we’re looking for:
• University degree in an Engineering, mathematical or computer science discipline with experience of application client and server development in the web and/or mobile domain
• Language and UI Experience to include JavaScript, ReactJS and CSS3 with Middleware DB and familiarity with GraphQL/ Apollo, NodeJS & with RDMS of MariaDB
• Test experience with some form of unit testing and proven ability to take ownership of tasks - ability to monitor/ report progress and deliver to completion
• Ability to demonstrate previous evidence of drive, energy, commitment, and enthusiasm while operating in an Agile delivery environment with good logical reasoning
Skills that will help you in the role:
• Development experience for hosting on cloud platforms such as AWS
• Experience with REST and RDBMS (SQL Sever, Oracle SQL) and compatible ORMs e.g. hibernate/GROM
• Experience with Jest and Cypress, along familiarity in Selenium Webdriver, JUnit, Spock, Mockito, TypeScript, Java, .Net, Groovy and Scala
• Knowledge of tools like GIT, VSCode/ IntelliJ, SQLWorkbench, SonarQube, Jenkins/TeamCity, Docker/Kubernetes, OpenShift, NodeJS, Web driver/Cypress & Angular
Where will you be working?
Our new state-of-the-art Campus, right in the heart of Glasgow is a hub of creative collaboration. A place where everyone can bring their true selves to work and reach their full potential. Home to 5,000 of our colleagues, our Tradeston campus will support the community in more ways than one - by creating thousands of new career opportunities and celebrating local artists. A short walk from Central Station on the south of the Clyde, it will be a key location for the Barclays business that will deepen our ties with the city and its communities.

title: Product Designer, UX/UI - Dashboard and Listening Experiences
description:
About BeyondWords

BeyondWords was founded from a desire for instant access to information through audio.

Our all-in-one voice cloning and audio publishing CMS helps businesses easily make their articles, research, and insights listenable in AI voices that resonate with their audiences.

We’re looking for a capable UX/UI Designer to join our team to help us solve complex problems, enabling us to develop groundbreaking audio experiences that bring the convenience of audio to millions of listeners across the web.
• What you’ll do: *
• Collaborate with product and engineering to reimagine audio interfaces exposed to millions of listeners each day.
• Build and maintain a new design system.
• Collaborate with product and engineering to produce concepts, prototypes and mockups.
• Challenge status quo on creativity and quality of design work across the team.
• Collaborate with sales and marketing to align assets with the design system.

Who you are:
• You have 3+ years of experience... designing at consumer or enterprise tech or media companies.
• You are able to apply first-principles thinking and other mental models to your design thinking.
• You are passionate about new technologies (e.g. Figma) and are happy to work alongside technical teams.
• You have excellent visual design skills as well as a solid UX design foundation.
• You are able to provide a brief explanation and link to a portfolio/presentation in your application and explain why you think you’re excellent for this role.

More about BeyondWords:

We’re a remote-first team of 12, spread across the UK and Europe. Our technology is used by some of the largest news brands in the world, bringing audio to their articles that generates millions of streams every month. Our goal is to continue our expansion into new geographies and verticals, such as finance, consulting, and healthcare.

We’re backed by top angels and VC’s, including Audible’s Newark Venture Partners, and have been awarded an Innovate UK grant. We’re now developing voices for some of the world’s most well-respected news brands and businesses.

BeyondWords focuses on SaaS, B2B, Audio, and Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, BeyondWords has raised $1.65M of funding; their latest round was closed on April 2021.

You can view their website at https://beyondwords.io/ or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Everyday we tackle new and exciting challenges to empower developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile, and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Couchbase delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments. The database market is one of the largest undisturbed markets for enterprise software. The main catalyst for this is the need for digital transformation. Join Couchbase to be a part of a greater change. Here you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most innovative, passionate and humble individuals in the database industry.

You are a UI/UX Designer/Engineer who crafts delightful web interfaces, designs, prototypes new and innovative experiences, and implements features while advocating for UX.

Here's a brief look at what success looks like in this role:

In three months, you’ll have collaborated with the team to deliver a... material contribution, contributed to code reviews and fed into technical discussion.

In six months, you’ll have earned the trust of the team and are actively collaborating on the design of new features.

In twelve months, you are regularly delivering tasks through the entire SDLC and have established a cadence of timely delivery without cutting corners

Responsibilities
• Design, develop, test and deploy software.
• Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
• Support the definition and progress of team goals.
• Have fun building great software.

In this role you can expect to
• Ship code regularly.
• Be experimental.Learn new skills and work with modern technologies.
• Collaborate with a similarly forward-thinking group of frontend engineers on technical decisions.
• Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.
• Maintain code quality with unit tests and support delivery of automated integration and E2E tests.
• Work closely with UX designers, quality teams, product managers and systems engineers to build, iterate, and ship new features to enhance the user experience for our industry leading cloud solutions.

Key Technologiies
• HTML

• CSS
• UI frameworks (eg. Svelte, React, Angular, Tailwind)

•Understanding of Usability and Accessibility is preferable
•Knowledge of working with design systems is preferable
•Wire-framing and prototyping web, mobile and tablet experiences using tools (for example Sketch, Balsamiq, Axure, UXPin, Proto.io etc.)
•Knowledge of working with UX design tools (for example Figma / Adobe XD etc.) and ability to design for web and mobile user interfaces (as per iOS and Android design guidelines)
•Strong Presentation, Written and Oral Communication skills

Educational Qualifications:
•Any Graduate or Diploma holder, Undergraduates with relevant UX experience / certifications / work portfolio
•Any relevant certification in Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors and Accessibility will be highly preferred

Additional Requirements:
•The candidate is required to show a portfolio of his/her work before or during the interview

title: Senior User Experience Designer (UX)
description:
Senior UX Designer- Remote

Who We Are

At 8th Light, we take a human-centered design (HCD) approach to crafting digital solutions, collaborating with the people writing code as well as those using it. We embrace the need for adaptability in a constantly changing world. Our design team is composed of thinkers and doers, with a breadth and depth of experience across UX research, UX design, UI design, and implementation with specific expertise in software product design and delivery, ready to take on most any challenge that we encounter.

As an employee-owned software consultancy, we consider software design and development a craft. We’re driven by our deep commitment to excellence, and powered by our collective depth of knowledge and experience.. We value colleagues who enjoy learning and teaching, which creates our collaborative organization.

We enjoy working with empathetic, passionate collaborators who value the work they do. At this time, we are seeking a Senior UX Designer, with... a keen interest in user research, to join our human-centered software design team.

Who You Are

A UX Designer with a depth of experience focusing on understanding and advocating for users. You’ve contributed to all aspects of design, iterating through potential solutions, mental models, and feature priorities through personas, user journeys, wireframes, prototypes, information architecture, and detailed design. You’ve successfully:
• Performed user research through a variety of methods throughout the design process (including usability testing in preparation for delivery)
• Synthesized user insights into opportunity areas for design
• Established information architecture and content strategy informed by research synthesis
• Led UX workshops (project planning, design thinking, research and synthesis activities, generative co-creation and prioritization of design opportunities)
• Performed iterative design prototyping from low fidelity sketches to high-fidelity interactive experiences
• Regularly sought and participated in design reviews with project teams and the broader design discipline through a lens of usability, accessibility, feasibility, and aesthetic quality
• Collaborated closely with developers to ensure faithful interpretation of design through delivery

What You’ll Do At 8th Light

You’ll create user research procedures and assets (personas, journey maps, etc.) as well as user interface wireframes and prototypes, working with fellow design team members. You will also support client projects, performing user research and creating software user experiences . In unison with the design and engagement teams, you will be responsible for:
• Designing human-centered software solutions across a range of industries and client organizations, with 5+ years of experience.
• Applying the design process to solve complex problems across a variety of software contexts (e.g. mobile, desktop, web, and hardware) with a portfolio that demonstrates your skills
• Collaborating with designers and developers on integrated teams to bring designs to life
• Facilitating effective communication with internal teams, clients and partners in team and workshop contexts
• High-quality presentation and writing skills
• Intermediate experience with Figma, along with other industry design and prototyping tools and frameworks
• Knowledge of emerging technologies e.g., web3

Nice to Have

We work across many areas, and encourage anyone with the experience mentioned above to apply. Given recent client requests, we would particularly like to encourage applicants with experience in the following areas:
• Design consulting across a range of industries and client organizations
• Integrated human-centered design and Agile delivery practices

How You’ll be Supported

We recognize that creating a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization is an ongoing journey. We want our people to feel supported and encouraged to embrace their most authentic selves. Our wellness package at 8th Light is centered around the Whole YOU. Offerings that include:
• £1,500 annual budget for learning & development
• L&D time allotment of 120+ hours per year
• Flexible PTO
• Wellness days
• 12 weeks of new parent leave available immediately
• Fertility benefits
• Semi annual promotion panel

See our full list of Benefits

Join Us

We recognize that creating a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization is an ongoing journey, and we’re excited to share our journey with you. We have a proud tradition of hiring talented colleagues with unusual career experiences. We're more interested in your experiences, results, and impact than brand names, degrees, or keywords that may appear on your resume. We appreciate your time in completing a few application questions to help us get to know you better.

8th Light is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

#LI-Remote

8th Light focuses on Consulting, Web Design, Software, Web Development, and Testing. Their company has offices in Los Angeles, New York City, Austin, and Chicago. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.8thlight.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Gaming Industry - Remote - 55K Base

We are an interactive learning company, with the mission of making education fun! Having started our journey through a series of print products, many of which became best sellers. We have since transitioned to the Educational Tech space (Ed-Tech), where we are currently edifying the gaming industry through a series of exciting games.

We recently partnered with Roblox to help build an educational game that'll be setup within schools on a global scale! We are now looking for a UI/UX designer to help make this dream a reality and to help build out the UI for a truly fantastic user experience.

You will help design, wireframe and implement the UI based on our current concept, while working with the wider creative team to integrate our trademark style into your work. Working with multiple points within the team to help deliver the project, but also with our QA team to test the UI/UX and help identify and mitigate critical bugs as they... arise.

Experience We Are Looking For
• 2 years UI/UX Designer experience
• Experience with design tools such as Figma or Adobe Suite

Nice To Haves
• Gaming industry experience (This is not essential though!)

Benefits
• £55,000 Base salary
• Fully remote working
• Holidays
• Pension

To Apply
