title: UI Designer
description:
The role

As a UI Designer you will spend most of your time creating exceptional ecommerce experiences and be responsible for the full lifecycle of an ecommerce design project; making design decisions based on good judgement, experience, research and data, whilst collaborating with the Strawberry team and clients along the way.

You will also take part in establishing the design scope and requirements for new projects, and may then create and present compelling presentations by communicating the rationale behind it to all involved.

We Work With

Software

· Adobe Cloud suite (Adobe XD, Photoshop, After Affects etc)

· UI prototyping software

General

· Project management tools (such as Teamwork or Jira)

· Internal comms tools (such as Slack)

Experience using the technology associated with your specialism is expected, though a good knowledge of similar and also wider commerce technologies would be desirable.

Responsibilities
• Design high performing, responsive websites from... concept through to the handover of ‘development ready’ files
• Understand and be up-to-date with the principles of UX/UI design and how to apply them
• Maintain a keen interest in user needs as defined by data, analytics and human motivations to inform design decisions
• Work with developers to ensure everything envisioned is possible, suggest alternatives where designs won’t work as expected.
• Work both autonomously and collaboratively with the team, able to self-manage and prioritise tasks to ensure work is delivered on time
• Work with project managers and the wider team to help deliver successful outcomes for our clients.
• Support other designers in their work; if one of us struggles we all end up struggling.
• Working to deadlines, being honest when they aren’t reachable, and keeping the relevant people up to date with any delays or problems.
• Share ideas and opinions, for example: things you’re inspired about, new tech that excites you, things we could do to improve workflows…
• Attending and contributing to client and internal meetings where your expertise may prove beneficial
• Maintaining a high standard of work and ensuring only the best work gets in front of the client

What we’re looking for is someone who:
• Can demonstrate versatility as a designer
• Has a strong knowledge and foundation of ecommerce and web experience design, working with brand, the creative process and conceptual thinking.
• Is able to work within the software associated with designing for web independently, with minimal support.
• Cares about quality of work and the overall finished ‘product’.
• Can work out problems independently while knowing when to ask for help.
• Demonstrates a desire to continually broaden and improve your knowledge in ecommerce and web design.
• Happy to be encouraged to try new tools, new technologies and to explore innovative ways to grow our clients’ business

With a salary of up to £40k and a 4 day working week as well as being completely remote, this is a great opportuntiy to offer complete owneership of the role and flexibility in your day.

• Work from home

Schedule:

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Senior UX/UI Designer

Reporting to the Experience Design Director

Hello! We're Hi Mum! Said Dad.

We're one of the UK's most awarded and innovative digital product studios with a ten-year pedigree in innovation and digital product design. We design for real needs and build digital products that people truly value. In the Strategy and Design team, we're at the product front-line - crafting digital products for mobile, web, voice, and exciting emerging technologies.

We believe creating innovative digital experiences is both a science and an art, so we champion rigorous research and testing as well as giving the Strategy and Design team the space to follow a flexible creative process.

We’re a close-knit team that believe learning from each other is essential to our personal growth. We have dedicated time every week devoted to developing each other’s skills and critiquing each other’s work - even if we’re not on the same project.

As a Senior UX/UI Designer in the Strategy and Design... team, you’ll be involved in every step of the way of creating new digital products from scratch; from research, product strategy, UX design, UI design, and user testing, to collaborating with developers through build and launch.

In return, you’ll get the opportunity to grow your craft and leadership skills, taking on responsibility that stretches you in a way that matches your career aspirations.

Who we’re looking for

We’re looking for someone who has played a role in creating a range of new digital products and is passionate to grow their skillset.

You’ll have a strategic, solution-focused mindset with the ability to translate concepts and ideas into practical and tactical outcomes. You’ll play an integral part of a team that will deliver world-class digital products and experiences for our globally recognised clients.

Your main strength lies in UX design. However, you are also competent at UI design when needed. You’ll have a basic understanding of research, strategy, visual design, and service design. While you’re not necessarily an expert in all of these, you’ll know what good looks like and can have a decent conversation about them. You’re a keen learner and are excited to develop your skills in these areas.

Above all, you’ll be an excellent communicator having presented work and explained your design rationale to a variety of stakeholders.

What Will You Be Doing?

You’ll usually be working on one project at a time, bringing highly effective digital products and experiences to life. You’ll be working in multidisciplinary teams - collaborating with other designers, strategists, developers, product managers, and project managers. As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you’ll be coaching and supporting more junior designers, while in turn being supported by a Principal Experience Designer. You’ll be reporting into our Experience Design Director and Managing Partner.

In a little more detail, you will:
• Usually work on one project at a time. Occasionally two.
• Work directly with the client executing all the necessary design work - creating deliverables such as user flows, mockups and prototypes
• Work across a broad range of projects spanning websites, mobile apps, services and voice skills
• Coach and inspire more junior members of the team; demonstrating best practises, and promoting a culture of collaboration
• Work with strategists and designers to ensure that products are research-driven, validated with user testing and deliver against business objectives
• Support the costing and planning activity of design deliverables, report on the status of deliverables and quickly notify the project management team of risks
• Design and run both internal and client-facing workshops
• Contribute to company culture, blog posts, social media, white papers, as well as attending or speaking at industry conferences
• And most importantly; be part of a team that creates exceptional design work

Essential experience
• Been hands on at every step of creating a new digital product
• Worked as part of a multidisciplinary team following an agile approach
• Designed native experiences for both iOS and Android, and understand how experiences differ between the two
• Designed responsive web-based applications across different devices
• Collaborated with developers to understand technical constraints and create appropriate deliverables
• Communicated the underlying principles and rationale of designs, constructing compelling narratives that sell ideas to stakeholders and team members
• Created or maintained design systems and component libraries
• Proficient in both Sketch and Figma

Bonus experience
• Worked in both agency and in-house design roles
• Worked in a startup environment
• Worked in Fintech, Auto, Energy sectors
• Created new voice skills
• Service design - both documenting existing services and creating new services

And what will you get in return?
• A competitive salary
• 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
• ½ day off on your birthday
• A great pension scheme
• Health and dental insurance (it can even be used towards a spa day)
• Craft-focused skills development
• Sector-specific training courses help take your career to the next level

title: UI/UX designer
description:
A market leader and globally respected brand in the design and development of mobile app connected audio devices is seeking a UI/ UX designer. Your focus will be on the visual and interaction design for my client's world-class mobile application.

A competitive salary with benefits is on offer, as well as remote working (a visit to the Salisbury head office once a month will be required).

With this UI/ UX designer position, you will add new features and design UI/ UX requirements for cutting-edge projects. An excellent opportunity for you to grow with an established company and enhance your career!

Required Skills:
• Experience working in UI/ UX Designer role (building IOS/ Andriod mobile apps).
• Knowledge of design tools (Figma, Illustrator, or anything similar).
• Familiarity with Jira to track your projects.
• Experience with visual design and creating interactive prototypes.If you are looking for any other information or would like to have an exploratory chat, please apply now... or contact Paula Kastrouni at IC Resources.
We have a number of other positions across different industries and locations available too

title: Senior Product Designer (UX/UI, Remote in the UK only)
description:
Who we are

We’re a digital CX agency, collaborating with healthcare and pharmaceutical organisations around the world to create digital experiences that are truly aligned to audience needs. Our services fall under three core pillars; strategy, research and design. In joining Graphite, you’ll become part of a creative, diverse and rapidly growing team that is making a measurable difference to people’s health and wellbeing through creating exceptional digital experiences.

We’re headquartered in Brighton, with our teams working remotely across the UK.

The Role

You will be responsible for helping to lead the way of design on one of our key pharmaceutical accounts. You will be in constant interaction with other departments and clients. Your work will be outcome-focused, user-centred and data-informed. You will share your work early and often, seeking feedback from across the board and taking part in design reviews. You will be part of a talented team of Designers, Researchers, Account... Managers and Project Managers.

As a storyteller, you will be responsible for presenting your work to high-level client stakeholders and make them see the positive impact of your design strategy and vision. You will comfortably facilitate and lead various design and concept workshops. You will also be planning your work, creating compelling visions for our clients, estimating tasks and communicating those to the rest of the team.

You will feel comfortable zooming in and out of BAU project work, as well as flexing to contribute to the strategy and processes of the squad. With an eye for detail, you will help manage our Design System, and work closely with developers to maintain it. Your expert problem-solving skills will be effective in creating solutions that are in line with the regulatory requirements of the sector.

Your Manager will help you achieve your goals and enable you to create your best work. You will have regular 1-2-1 sessions and training budget to make sure you get the best out of your time at Graphite.

Your responsibilities
• Think strategically about the future of our client's key products and services.
• Create, iterate, communicate and own design that is anchored in user and business needs.
• Supporting the Project and Account Managers in maintaining and growing our relationship within this key account.
• Communicating your approach and ROI of your work to clients, involving key stakeholders along the way to make them feel engaged.
• Communicating and improving your design process (Design direction and strategy, research, UX, Ops, workshops, etc...).
• Brainstorm concepts, facilitate & plan workshops (UX/Roadmap/etc..).
• Working with researchers and UI Designers to refine the final product.
• Maintain a Design System and contribute to its growth and documentation.
• Line manage one or two designers (1-2-1, goal settings and personal development).

Skills Required

Please apply even if you only have experience 6 out of 8 criteria
• Extensive experience in user experience (UX), user interface (UI), information architecture and interaction design.
• Strong understanding of product strategy and research.
• Ability to ideate fast and explore multiple routes to solve a problem.
• You are able to recognise and act on pain points and opportunities within customer journeys to fulfil user and business needs.
• You have facilitated multiple workshops and are comfortable adapting the framework to the business needs.
• You have a good understanding of key design methodologies (Design Thinking, Design sprints, Atomic Design, UX, etc…)
• You have worked in an Agile environment.
• You have experience presenting your work to clients and leading client meetings.
• Figma experience, including working with Design Systems.
• Desirable but not essential: Experience managing multidisciplinary teams (UX designers, UI designers, Researchers)
• Desirable but not essential: You have worked within regulated sectors such as Healthcare, Banking or Insurance.

Benefits

Read our employee experience introduction to see all our benefits; including:
• Private health insurance with high standards of cover
• Comprehensive private dental plan
• Enhanced maternity and paternity leave
• Personal development time and annual training budget
• Monthly social meet-ups and events
• 25 days holiday, increasing after 2 years
• Opportunities to give back with dedicated time for community engagement and charitable initiatives to suit your interests — young talent; diversity and inclusion; environment and sustainability; wellness
• Free employee assistance support for personal challenges, whether legal, financial or medical
• Cycle to work and electric vehicle car lease schemes
• Pension scheme with employer contributions

Salary

£42,000 to £51,000 a year (Depending on experience)

Applying

Please apply via our online application system and include a cover letter and your CV. Be sure also to include a link to your digital portfolio.

We can only accept applicants with the right to work in the UK.

We value diversity of experience, knowledge and perspectives and all they bring to our teams. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know

title: UX | UI Designer
description:
Do you love solving complex problems and thinking outside the box?

Do you enjoy assessing and working how to best optimise customer touchpoints?

Are you motivated by taking a concept and making it visual?

This Global business is spearheading its next stage of growth and this forward-thinking team drives innovation, at scale and at pace and we need to bolster the team with someone like you!

Your role will support the customer interaction team as an experienced UX Designer - Experience Designer. You will be a key part of a hugely ambitious technology programme with the aims of improving digital presence on a global scale, transforming the business, and preparing for the future. You will have the ability and desire to work as part of a collaborative team possessing a background in the development of customer journeys and service blueprints.

You will need enthusiasm and drive, with proven experience of working to deadlines in a fast-paced environment. You will need to think on your... feet, be self-reliant, with a positive attitude; constantly striving to bring the customer thought process to life.

UX Designer - Experience Designer responsibilities

- Take an 'outside in' design approach i.e., think what this needs to look like from an end / user customer perspective.
- Use design tools to create concept sketches, user flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes, and interaction specifications.
- Link the development of conceptual ideas into concrete designs in line with a brands identity and business strategy.
- Provide a clear vision for improving design processes and explaining and presenting design decisions to service designers business owners and stakeholders.
- Consider existing applications and evaluating their UX effectiveness.
- Consider the human-computer interaction element of a design.
- Develop and maintain design wireframes and specifications.

Salary: Up to £55,885 incremental salary, enhanced pension scheme, 25 days holiday, death in service, free parking, flexible working, online benefits, and additional benefits to be discussed.

If this interests you please feel free to email (url removed) or call (phone number removed)
and we can discuss this role further

title: Lead UI / UX Designer
description:
Important:

We have a need for a part-time contractor who can work remotely anywhere in Canada, the US, the UK or Europe. This is an ongoing need and could develop into a permanent part-time contract or staff position.

Who we are: Chelo is the latest AI Tech startup to come out of Post Urban Ventures, a highly successful deep tech AI venture builder. We are a team of serial entrepreneurs with PhDs from Cambridge, MIT, and UCL that is, fully funded, and on a mission to transform the way companies operate, grow, implement their vision, create cultures and products. You can learn more about us here: https://posturban.vc/

What we are working on: We operate in the deep tech AI space, where we focus on applying fundamental science to business problems as we create solutions. As such, we are often developing prototypes to prove our fundamental science hypotheses and we need help creating product on top of these scientific prove outs. For Chelo, we are focusing on the application of graph... structures and AI to knowledge base creation.

The Role:

We are looking for an experienced Senior UX Designer to lead the research activities that will help define and drive the future of our products. You’ll be working on a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team in order to discover, explore, and validate Chelo's business propositions as we grow the product. Any experience with: database visualization, graph databases or large qualitative data knowledge bases would be helpful in this role

What we are looking for: In this role here are the key competencies we are looking for.
• Creative: You will help define the problem—not just help influence the solution. You will come up with practical ways to formulate research and design questions, explore problem spaces, and surface insights before having all the information.
• Quick. You can scale—up and down—your research activities to reflect the need: not everything needs to be completely understood or take weeks to deliver value. You look for opportunities to leverage other learning's and insights, even if they aren’t a perfect fit.
• Unconventional. We work on complex challenges that invite bold and unorthodox approaches. You’re not afraid to suggest something that sounds odd or risky, and you build on the ideas of others.
• Comfortable with iterative change. We often need to quickly change direction based on what we’ve learned—or still need to learn. We can be working on more than one idea at a time, ideas can move forward, or ideas can be shelved.
• Embracing ambiguity. We deal with challenges that no one else has tackled yet. We make decisions based on the data we have, knowing there are areas of the problem space we just don’t know much about yet.
• Experimental: Open to trying new ways of doing things. We embrace experimentation, look for inspiration in non-traditional spaces, and measure things to see what works.
• Imperfect. You don't let perfection be the enemy of the good or good enough, to start.

If this is you and you are comfortable working in undefined creative space, we would love to here from you

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Netcall is a high growth business providing industry specific software solutions that accelerate and simplify the path to digital. Spanning the entire customer journey across the public, healthcare and corporate markets, our solutions combine the skills of business experts to craft incredible customer experiences.
Purpose of Role:
To develop UX and UI solutions using Adobe Creative Suite and implement custom SASS to modify the Liberty platform UI to a high standard.
Key Responsibilities:
Take responsibility for the development of tasks within any given project
Work proficiently with a range of stakeholders within the business and its customers.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement in all areas of technology and the software development process. Help instil the principle of this culture across the entire development organisation.
Help ensure that the Development Team adheres to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001, PCI-DSS and any future quality or security accreditations that... Netcall holds.
Essential Skills:
Demonstrate a deep understanding of SASS and Grid CSS and their role in building flexible front-end interfaces.
Demonstrate an excellent working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, in terms of UX and design.
You'll have the ability to design user interfaces from a UX, design and development perspective on a range of products and systems
You have experience working within a multidisciplinary team including project managers, product owners, developers/builders and QA/test resources.
You have the ability to manage conflicting messages, influence stakeholders whilst retaining a focus on core business requirements
You are able to prioritise your work and deliver to tight timescales, demonstrating good organisational, communication and administrative skills.
You take responsibility for your own professional development and learning and encourage others in the team to do the same.
Desirable Skills:
Experience of the latest Vue.JS v3.
Experience of the Bulma CSS framework.
Experience of some of the tools and libraries used by the wider team, including PHP, MySql, Git and the Linux command line.
Behavioural competencies:
At Netcall we measure how results are achieved using a competency framework. Definitions of the competencies applicable for the role are listed below:
Teamwork - co-operates with others to accomplish common goals; works with others within and across his/her department to achieve shared goals; treats others with dignity and respect and maintains a friendly demeanour; values the contribution of others.
Communication - listens to others to gain a full understanding of issues; comprehends written material; presents information in a clear and concise manner orally and in writing to ensure others understand his/her ideas; appropriately adapts his/her message, style and tone to accommodate a variety of audiences.
Drive - having the sustained energy and determination to achieve results by overcoming obstacles.Drive is about demonstrating the urgency and motivation in setting and meeting challenging targets with required quality and service, and to time.
Accountability - accepts full responsibility for self and contribution as a team member; displays honesty and truthfulness; confronts problems quickly; displays a strong commitment to the success of the Company acting as a credible representative of the business.
Agility - adapts to change and different ways of doing things quickly and positively; does not shy away from addressing setbacks or ambiguity; deals effectively with a variety of people and situations; appropriately adapts thinking or approach as the situation changes.
Creativity & Innovation - applies creative problem solving skills in order to develop solutions; recognises and demonstrates the value of taking "smart" risks and learning from mistakes; develops multiple alternatives and understands the feasibility of each; effectively shares and implements ideas.
Customer Focus - understands that all employees have external and/or internal customers that they provide services and information to; provides helpful, courteous, accessible, responsive and knowledgeable customer service
Personal Development and Developing Others - enhances the capabilities of the organisation by openly and effectively sharing his/her expertise with others; supports a continuous learning environment by preserving and compiling intellectual capital which can be used by others within his/her team and the organisation as a whole.
Special conditions:
Satisfactory completion of pre-employment screening, including a DBS/NPPV3 check dependent on role and responsibilities.
There may be some requirement to travel to other locations within the UK
Implement and act in accordance with the Company's Information Security and Acceptable Use policies.
The above list of duties is not exhaustive and you may be required to undertake other tasks within the scope of your role. Any job description provided to you by the organisation will not form part of your contract of employment unless specified otherwise

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Plentific is one of the fastest growing property technology companies in the world, backed by renowned investors including Brookfield, Highland Europe, A/O Proptech, Target Global and Mubadala. We are headquartered in London, UK, with offices in Germany, USA and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making property work better for everyone. We do so by streamlining how repairs, maintenance and compliance services are delivered. Our platform gives clients rich insight into management, operational and performance data, helping them deliver their customer service promise, while optimising supplier costs and adhering to their environmental, social and governance goals.

Come and be a part of:
• A leading Proptech with a global footprint and an HQ in heart of London’s bustling centre
• A diverse, multicultural workplace with over 30 nationalities amongst our employees
• A stimulating atmosphere and fast-paced growth led by our recent $100m funding round
• A flexible work culture and a... number of programmes built around your physical and mental wellbeing

Developing acclaimed technology is only possible when we’ve got a great team on our side. Our culture is open and empowering. If you are passionate and driven, you will fit right in.

plentific.com/careers

The Role

The role designs a wide variety of graphics, layouts and user interactivity for web pages, prototypes and product illustrations across digital and offline media both on the marketing side, and UI side with a primary focus on Plentific’s core product. It is a hands-on role, helping to set the vision and driving concepts to create innovative and interactive design experiences.

To be successful in this position, the role holder will be a self-starter, high energy, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail.

Responsibilities:
• Support the design team objectives by accomplishing tasks as needed on time.
• Creating user-centred designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback
• Work with product managers to create prototypes for new product ideas.
• Create and help maintain the design system and style guides.
• Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders as necessary throughout the lifecycle of projects
• Collaborate with other designers and help disseminate design best-practice across the team.

Requirements
• Proficient with Sketch and inVision, basic experience in Abstract workflow, general proficiency with Adobe CC, Office, Google apps, Dropbox.
• A deep understanding of mobile app design patterns.
• Strong attention to detail with a keen eye for aesthetics
• A good understanding of accessibility patterns in design.
• High energy, happy to learn, positive attitude, passionate about design.
• Ability to collaborate across teams.
• Expert understanding of how visual layouts affect user experiences.
• Proficiency in prototyping tools such as Sketch, InVision, Abstract and Figma.
• Extensive experience in the industry as a digital designer, preferably in a start-up or a digital design agency.
• Excellent communication skills and can clearly articulate your ideas, designs, and suggestions
• Experience designing web and mobile apps with complex user flows.
• Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus

Benefits

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:
• A competitive compensation package
• A flexible working environment + 25 days annual holiday
• Private health care including discounted gym membership
• Life insurance
• Employee assistance program
• Company volunteering day and charity salary sacrifice scheme
• Learning and development fund
• Referral bonus and charity donation if someone you introduce joins the company
• Season ticket loan, Cycle to work, Electric vehicle and Techscheme programs
• Pension - 3% employer contribution, 5% employee contribution
• Regular company-sponsored lunches, dinners and social gatherings
• Fully stocked kitchen with drinks, snacks, fruit, breakfast cereal etc.
• An inherently diverse culture with over 18 nationalities and 25 languages spoken

title: UI/UX Design Graduate
description:
Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment? What are you waiting for? Apply today! Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow. Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert - so you're getting a firsthand account of what it's like to work with us! What we do at Jacobs Our People & Places Solutions (P&PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management.

While we shape some of the very largest and most challenging landmark projects in the UK, we also deliver local projects that protect communities. We... lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients' challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.

What's in it for you? As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.

Be working towards a relevant Degree or Masters level qualification such as Computer Science To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems The adaptability to learn, unlearn and reprioritise as things around you change You must have the permanent right to work in the UK. We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? Worked in a bar? Been captain of a sports team or volunteered for a charity? Tell us - we're looking for people with interesting stories and experiences! Selection Process Step 1: Apply Online Step 2: Gamification Assessment Step 3: Interview What else we provide In addition to work-life balance and flexibility, UK employees also receive; Free single medical cover and digital GP service Reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships An inclusive and diverse environment, embracing the variety of cultures, backgrounds and lifestyles of our employees through Jacobs Employee Networks A focus on safety, health, and wellbeing, prioritising our people through a culture of caring and a network of positive mental health champions Opportunities to give back to our communities through our Collectively program, incorporating matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations. We are truly passionate about inclusion and diversity and recognise that this application and selection process may not suit all candidates.

If this is the case for you, please get in touch with us to discuss how we can make this process more accessible. #EarlyCareersUK #GraduateUK #GraduateJob2023 #GraduateCareersUK #GraduaterecruitmentUK #GraduateJobsUK #GraduateopportunitiesUK #GradsP&PS

title: Senior UI Developer
description:
We have a great opportunities across the UI and UX space within Pega. In case you have never heard of us, we are a leader in Cloud Software for customer engagement and operational excellence. The world’s most recognized brands rely on Pega’s AI powered software to optimize every customer interaction on any channel

Every day, Pega powers...MILLIONS of automated processes BILLIONS of customer interactions TRILLIONS of dollars of business. If you’ve used your credit card, called a company for service, opened an account, applied for a loan, accepted an offer, flown on an airplane, paid a bill, submitted a claim, or countless other things you do in your day......you’ve interacted with Pega.

Meet Our Team:

Our team lives and breathes the Pega delivery vision: quickly building high-quality, outcome driven applications that evolve with the changing needs of business. As a key member of the Pega Consulting team, you will work with passionate and driven colleagues, delivering innovative... user-centric business and technical solutions using Pega technology.

Picture Yourself at Pega:

In an enterprise world filled with poor design and implementation, we’re looking to you to help save our Fortune 500 clients! You will provide UI configuration leadership and Pega-specific user interface design guidance on multiple clients facing implementation projects.

Activities include owning the UI implementation and making design decisions that are grounded in User Experience best practices.

What You'll Do at Pega:

• Partner with our clients to deliver cutting edge UI solutions across all phases of the software development lifecycle

• Utilize your outstanding technical consulting skills to demonstrate new and innovative ways to implement software solutions

• Mentor and train our clients in Pega’s UI technology and design system

• Leverage your Thought Leadership skills, you’ll engage, educate and enable your clients’ resources on UX/UI and Pega Best Practices

Who You Are:

• You are a highly technical hands-on individual who is passionate about exploring and applying Pega technology to help solve business problems.

• Intimately familiar with leading–edge web technologies with an emphasis on HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, ReactJS, and UI architecture

• Understands enterprise software design principles, best practices, and dependencies

• Aptitude to pick up new concepts and technology rapidly; ability to explain it to both business & IT stakeholders

• Capacity to work in teams as well as alone

• Ability to match technology solutions to customer needs

What You've Accomplished:

• You’ve engaged with the various technical landscapes of multi-channel business architectures, including CRM, web, mobile, legacy and 3rd party software systems and the key linkages between them

• You have experience in all phases of software development including design, configuration, testing, debugging, implementation, and support of large-scale, business centric and process-based applications

• You’ve built and implemented model-driven, enterprise-level business solutions and applications

• You’ve worked alongside UX Designers to bring user-centered concepts to life

• You’ve delivered solutions in Agile and Scrum methodologies

Pega Offers You:

• Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products

• Experience building mission-critical, high volume applications which truly make a difference in user’s lives

• Continuous learning and development opportunities

• An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment

• Competitive global benefits program including pay + bonus incentives, employee equity in the company

Inclusion and Diversity - Inclusive is one of our values at Pega. Pegasystems is committed to inclusion and diversity and strives to foster a fair and inclusive environment for all. We believe Pega can achieve more when we create a culture that inspires each of us to fully contribute each and every day. We encourage diverse thinking and collaboration for better outcomes for all. Learn more about our inclusive culture.

As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.

Accessibility – If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact PegaApplication@pega.com.

Pegasystems focuses on Technology. Their company has offices in Bengaluru and Hyderabad. They have a very large team that's 5000+ employees.

You can view their website at https://www.pega.com/about/careers/job-listings?f%5b0%5d=location%3a25951&f%5b1%5d=location%3a25961

title: Senior Product UX/UI Designer
description:
Senior Product UX/UI Designer

Salary: Up to £85k + Perks

Location | Workplace Policy: Hybrid remote with occasional travel to Manchester or London office

A pioneering force within today’s digital economy, the business we are representing is a performance marketing agency that is made up of a team of experts in data and technology that have all banded together under a like-minded vision for the future.

With increased customers and a firm plan in place to transform the company into a fully digital organisation, the brand is expanding its recruitment efforts and needs a hybrid Product UX/UI Designer to engage with both UX and UI work (about a 70/30 split UX side).

Working within an autonomous in-house product team and leading the development of a brand-new platform of internal software applications, this position would be perfect for someone who possesses a strong understanding of USD, product lifecycles, landing page designs, and prototyping.

What do you need to succeed in the... role?
• 6+ years relevant industry experience working within a digital process/product function
• Create and iterate upon a wide array of core deliverables (user journeys, task flows, system/site mapping etc.)
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills that can drive products forward and iterate across teams
• Experienced in agile, lean UX methodologies
• Comfortable working with C-suite and senior stakeholders in product teams
• Proven UX/UI Design abilities
• Interested in how customer behaviour can shift design
• 1 year’s experience working on SaaS or enterprise-level tools/platforms
• Capable leader that can mentor junior members
• Basic awareness of web development principles and coding languages (HTML, CSS, REACT and Javascript)
• Background prototyping using Figma

Regardless of circumstance, you can rest assured that career development will remain an integral part of the position on offer, with the business making note of their continued dedication to offering employees a stable and secure work environment that not only promotes workplace productivity but also professional wellbeing.

UX Designers hold a crucial role in the maintenance of client satisfaction and have ample opportunities given to improve their user research techniques through fast-moving UX projects and upskill sessions.

Next steps:

So, if you’re looking for a role that will further expand your skillset and cement you as an industry expert, don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity

title: Sr. UX Designer, VP (CAO)
description:
Description

We are the Employee Experience Corporate Technology (EECT) design team in JPMC's User Experience (UX) Center of Excellence. We are looking for a highly creative, passionate, and driven user experience designer to join our team focused on the CAO and Audit pillar of applications to create a better experience for our global network of employees.

We are looking for someone with extensive digital and usability design experience that can be a great partner to both business and technology teams. The ideal candidate will operate as the UX lead for high profile and priority applications - responsible for delivering best in class solutions in collaboration with UX researchers, UX Designers and supporting UI Designers.

What are the ingredients of a successful designer at JPMC?

You combine exceptional craft in working through the details of a visual design with good problem-solving and communication skills. You are a master with Sketch + InVision or Figma and you can draw quick... wireframes to communicate ideas. You are at your best when collaborating with other designers, researchers, product managers, and developers to create designs that marry the best of user, business + technology thinking. You are detail oriented. You advocate for the user.

What is your typical day?
• You will be collaborating with project teams comprised of business and technology stakeholders at all levels
• You will be creating wireframes, UI design, and prototypes using modern design tools
• You will be sharing your work with designers, developers, and stakeholders across multiple teams
• You will be participating in user research and partnering with internal researchers
• You will be providing solutions for applications that aggregate data from multiple sources
• You will be collaborating with other UX designers and researchers offering advice and constructive feedback on design/usability reviews

Responsibilities
• Creating wireframes, and interactive POCs leveraging our design system
• Working with project teams and researchers to understand our users
• Working with business analysts + developers to define user stories and product backlogs
• Participating in usability research to iterate and refine your designs
• Presenting your ideas to stakeholders and advocating on behalf of the user
• Working with developers to realize and polish user experiences
• Actively contributing and using our common design language + design systems
• Mentoring and offering guidance to junior designers
• Collaborate with team and stakeholders to create UX artifacts such as journey maps, empathy maps, and personas
• Lead the UX design process for multiple projects
• Evangelize UX to business, stakeholders and technology

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interaction/Interface Design, Graphic Design, Technology Communications or related discipline from a major accredited college or university
• 5+ years or equivalent compelling experiences as a designer for enterprise software, responsive web applications, mobile apps, and defining in-house style guides & documenting standards.
• 5+ years of experience with modern design tools - Figma, Sketch, Invision, or equivalent.
• A balance of creativity, productivity + a passion for elegant, simple, emotionally rich design
• Excellent communication, listening, and negotiation skills with clients and senior executives- write, speak and present information effectively, persuasively and confidently in a variety of communication/corporate settings
• Strong understanding and commitment to usability and user-centered design principles/methods; including experience in a variety of usability evaluation techniques such as usability testing, contextual interviews, and heuristic evaluations
• Strong understanding of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0) and assistive technologies (JAWS, NVDA, Zoomtext), and proven track record of incorporating into your day-to-day work.
• General understanding of the capabilities of modern web application technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, LESS/Sass, React.
• Experience across multiple teams and release cycles working closely with design, product management + development to realize experiences using agile project management.
• A11y knowledge/experience.

Qualifications (+)
• Master's or other terminal degree in Human Computer Interaction, Design, Technology Communications or related discipline from a major accredited college or university
• Working Knowledge of modern web application technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, LESS/Sass, React. Working knowledge is a plus.
• You are a CUA (Certified Usability Analyst)
• You have experience in conducting UX Research

To Apply

In Particular, We Want To Hear About

Submit your resume and portfolio. Your portfolio should include at least 3 examples of work-related projects.
• The opportunity you were trying to solve
• The process involved in developing the design or project

About Employee Experience Corporate Technology (EECT)

We deliver streamlined and consistent solutions supporting JPMorgan Chase's Controls, Compliance, Legal, HR and IT Risk agendas, with a focus on stability, delivery, efficiencies and people. The goal of CTR's drive to standardization, consistency and simplicity is a JPMorgan Chase architecture that fosters long-term productivity, quality and innovation across the entire enterprise. The disciplines within this organization are Compliance Technology, Oversight & Controls Technology, Legal & e-Discovery, Identity & Access Management, IT Risk & Controls, HR Real Estate & Global Services Technology, and Third-Party Risk Management.

About JPMorgan Chase

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and

asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com .

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and private equity.

Employee Experience Corporate Technology (EECT) organization develops applications and provides technology support for corporate functions across JPMorgan Chase, including Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and all functions within the Corporate Administrative Office (CAO).

EECT teams are aligned with corporate partners' evolving technology needs and the firm's ever expanding technology controls agenda.

A top EECT priority is building scalable corporate systems. Teams focus on:
• Responding to the evolving regulatory environment and helping to meet the firm's regulatory commitments by addressing internal and external commitments
• Advancing the firm's Roadmap programs -- Single Sourcing of data, Architecture Convergence, and Rationalization of Platforms
• Adopting industry leading technologies to support best-in-class business capabilities for high performance computing and data storage solutions
• Driving innovation across the firm's corporate technology portfolio, increasing efficiencies through process automation, and Agile application development, with an emphasis on user experience and shorter development cycles
• Investing in security & controls for cyber, access/entitlements uplift, data protection and application resiliency

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs

You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:

Our designers are pivotal to the success of our product teams, working alongside highly experienced software developers and product experts. This means that you will be involved in a wide variety of activities, including:

What you'll need to succeed
You come from a technical background as someone who may have started their career as a developer or programmer but have taken a keen interest into all things UX. You are a UX Designer whose career demonstrates technical experience, as well as a strong portfolio of visual design and problem solving using UX methodologies and principles. You thrive in a hands-on design role in a highly collaborative flat team environment. This means that:
• You have a good understanding of technical concepts.

• Experience using design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Axure, XD.

• Cybersecurity - although direct experience with Application Security is not required - you'll learn quickly!

Our client firmly believes in paying people what they're worth. title: UI/UX Engineer
description:
Financial Conduct Authority – Permanent, Full-Time

Background

It Is Responsible For

There are few jobs where you can make a real difference to the 40 million consumers of financial products, the 2 million people who work in the UK Financial Services industry, and the stability of our economy. The FCA has three objectives.

ensuring that markets operate with integrity. promoting effective competition; and protecting consumers of financial services.

Advanced Analytics is driving digital innovation at the FCA. Our purpose is to change how we regulate financial services. Our team of change experts and data scientists combine cutting-edge techniques and the latest technology to generate breakthrough insights. We believe the best approach is sometimes an innovative approach. We place emphasis on curiosity and experimentation. We collaborate widely with academics, innovative companies, and the rest of the FCA. We believe that people need space to continue learning and the support to... develop new ideas, so we commit to giving them both.

Come and join our diverse team of creative and passionate innovators.

What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities?

As a front-end engineer (Senior Associate) in the Advanced Analytics Engineering team, you will design, implement, and deploy Advanced Analytics Applications. You will take a proactive approach to planning and delivery based on Agile principles and values. You will take pride in your product and the quality of its implementation.

You will collaborate with end users, product managers, data scientists and other SMEs to make design decisions and formulate implementation strategies. You will form lasting partnerships with data scientists to develop new data science ideas into enterprise grade applications with real business value. You are an advocate for innovation and get excited about new technologies and new ways of doing things. You will invest time in both learning and advancing your knowledge and sharing your knowledge through peer reviews, demos, debates, and other knowledge sharing platforms.

What will the candidate get from the role?
• Experience in with graphic design and image manipulation software
• Understanding of UI/UX design including user research, prototyping, testing and accessibility design
• Knowledge in Python programming and Linux OS

Which minimum, essential & desirable skills are required?

We’re a signatory to the Government’s Disability Confident scheme. This means that we will offer an interview to disabled candidates entering under the scheme, should they meet the minimum criteria for a role. A minimum criterion needs to be measurable from reviewing a candidate’s CV. Exceptions may apply if due to the volume of applications we are not able to interview all eligible candidates who qualify under the scheme.

Minimum
• Experience developing JavaScript applications
• Experience using UI frameworks (Angular/React/Vue) and CSS frameworks

Essential
• Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs.
• Experience working with Node.JS and web development tools (e.g. Webpack)

Desirable
• Experience in with graphic design and image manipulation software
• Understanding of UI/UX design including user research, prototyping, testing and accessibility design
• Knowledge in Python programming and Linux OS

About The FCA

At the FCA, we’re creating a fair and more resilient financial system. We’re establishing more transparent relationships between financial services and their customers, building trust in financial markets and protecting vulnerable consumers.

The FCA's Values & Diversity

Our ambition is to create a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the society we serve, helping us to be a better regulator.

The FCA supports hybrid working and you will be expected to work 40% of your time over a month, in our office. We will consider other flexible arrangements, for example part time working, and you can discuss this with the recruiter.

Useful Information

We are looking for A UI/UX Engineer/ Front-End Engineer, graded Senior Associates within our Regulatory Career Family.

London salary range is approximately £50,000 to £65,000 plus a competitive benefits package and non-contributory pension.

National salary range (including Edinburgh and Leeds) is approximately £47,000 to £58,500 plus a competitive benefits package and non-contributory pension

Job post will close on Tuesday 20th December 2022

For more information, please contact Melanie.Dubock@fca.org.uk if you are an internal candidate and Ifrah.Azam@fca.org.uk if you are an external candidate

Understands how UI design impacts the overalll user experience.
Is familiar with and can use customer frameworks (e.g. Jobs To Be Done, personas, journey maps).
Keeps up to date on... news/incidents and understands what is happening in the market and with competitors.

Creative Problem Solving
Asks the right questions to explore the problem.
Iterates and tests solution to check it solves the problem.
Considers the problem from a number of angles.
Independently identifies different creative solutions.
Collects feedback from users, other designers and stakeholders.

Product Design
Follows a User-Centred visual design process.
Creates original visual design assets.
Works with UX Researcher to understand the user needs.
Works with UX Designer to define structure and layout of the product.
Works with existing design patterns and style guides, occasionally introducing new patterns.

Data Driven Analysis & Testing
Iterates work based on testing and data analysis.
Regularly tests design work with users in partnership with UX Research team.
Explores data from analytics packages, customer insight or other sources to understand context of design work.
Proactively uses data to establish key metrics for projects.

Technical Skills
Has a good knowledge of the tech stack of the organisation.
Uses relevant tools for communicating designs to developers (InVision, Zeplin).
Uses design software (Adobe, Sketch) to intermediate level.
Proatively identifies needs for training in technical skills.
Understands the nuances of designing for different platforms.

Competencies:

Personal Capability
Practices Self-Development
Is curious and keen to learn and develop new ideas, skills and knowledge
Acts on feedback to improve him/herself
Looks for developmental opportunities in day-to-day work
Invests time and energy in self-development (professional qualifications , relevant reading, networking meetings, etc.)

Solves Problems and Analyzes Issues
Is able to ask effective questions and collect facts from multiple sources in order to solve problems
Is able to effectively identify and analyze problems and propose solutions
Effectively manages day-to-day issues and problems without intervention

Innovates
"Brainstorms" with others to look for different approaches to current process and tasks
Looks for opportunities to develop new ideas or thinking within own role
Experiments with new ideas as part of role

Interpersonal Skills
Communicates Powerfully and Prolifically
Demonstrates effective conversational skills, including active listening and questioning
Shares information relevant to own role
Participates in team presentations

Collaboration and Teamwork
Develops co-operative working relationships within the team
Considers how own style affects others and tailors interactions accordingly
Looks for ways to develop mutually beneficial relationships across teams

Builds Relationships
Is approachable and friendly
Asks for opinions of others
Participates in formal and informal gatherings to meet new people and develop new relationshipsOur Benefits

In addition to all of this, we offer the following 'core' benefits:

25 days annual leave (with option to buy up to 5 days)

3 discretionary days over Christmas

2 paid charity days, where you get paid to help the community (as a business we do a lot of charity work)

Pension

Life assurance scheme (4*Salary)

Share options scheme

Private Medical Insurance

Women in technology:

We are very supportive of women in Technology and has been a founding signature for the Tech Talent Charter. Currently 27% of our Technology workforce are women which is much higher than the UK average of 17%. We have the following initiatives in place to support women in technology:

Mentoring scheme for women in technology

Women's network forum

Regularly run events for schools girl about careers in technology to inspire the next generation of girls in tech.

At Lexis Nexis Risk Solutions Group having diverse employees with different perspectives is key to creating innovative new products for our global customers. We have 35 diversity employee networks globally and prioritise ensuring inclusive leadership is part of our culture. Our aim is for every employee to be the best version of themselves. We would actively welcome applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups.

We encourage applicants and employees to tell us about any health issues they may have to allow us to put in place reasonable adjustments that may support applicants in the application process and support employees to succeed in their role.

title: UX Designer
description:
• Manage and support ExD team from User Research, through Interaction Design to Visual Design.

Our employees' safety is priority, so currently you will be working from the comfort of your own home most of the time. In the future we can spend more time in some of our offices, in Glasgow, Bank or Epworth House.As a result, you will be able to enjoy London's vibrant dynamics!

.... And another thing, you will be joining a close-knit team that is supportive and approachable.Which means that as a new joiner, you will always have someone available to offer help and guidance.

title: Senior User Experience Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer

Working at Ito World

We’re a mission-driven and diverse team of 80+ people from over 18 countries with a passion for technology and transportation.

We’re interested in talented, curious people that share our mission and love data as much as we do.

What we do

At Ito World, we solve transportation challenges across the globe for millions of travellers every day, by delivering real-time transit data feeds to journey planners and a platform for transit authorities and operators. Our clients include Google, Apple, Microsoft and public sector organisations such as the Department of Transport and Transport for West Midlands.

The Senior UX Designer role

As a member of Ito’s growing product team and reporting into the Head of Products, the Senior UX Designer will take responsibility for leading our product UX/UI strategy. You will primarily be working on our Ito Transit Hub product, our solution for cities, transit agencies and operators.

Working as part of a cross... functional team of Product Managers, Product Owners, Software Developers and QA Engineers, you will be responsible for designing software that’s elegant, intuitive and easy-to-use.

This is a hands-on role with responsibility for gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. The Senior UX Designer will create functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base in the UK and internationally.

We’re looking for someone who has demonstrable experience in UX/UI design for an enterprise SaaS company, ideally operating in B2B and B2G markets. This is an important role that requires exceptional UX/UI design skills, product vision and leadership. The ideal Senior UX Designer is someone who can both lead the UX/UI strategy and delivery as well as roll up their sleeves and get things done.

Ito World has a flexible and remote working culture and will consider applicants that want to work fully remote from anywhere in the UK. We also have an office in Cambridge to accommodate those who prefer to work onsite / hybrid.

What the Senior UX Designer will do
• Design and execute research activities to inform product discovery, including surveys, customer interviews, user testing, and data analysis
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Work closely with the product and development teams to gather requirements, define problems, and create solutions that incorporate the applicable accessibility standards
• Own the build and maintenance of a design system in Figma (or similar) for our rapidly scaling product suite
• Work with development to ensure the design system meets all requirements and integrates seamlessly with workflows
• Implement and maintain existing UI patterns and behaviours to create polished UIs that are consistent with the rest of the product suite and the design system
• Produce detailed personas, user journeys, user flows, sketches, wireframes, and prototypes for new products and features
• Communicate your design decisions, process and solutions to the wider team to keep everyone up to speed and to ensure buy-in
• Lead and direct the activities of an external team of designers
• Keep up to date with competitor analysis within the transit tech/geospatial industry and general software industry trends
• Maintain a good understanding of our customers and what they want out of their interactions
• Lead a data-driven approach to problem solving and increase analytics capability within the team
• Contribute and adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images

What the Senior UX Designer will need to have
• Proven experience as a Senior Designer or similar role
• A portfolio of work that demonstrates your experience in leading the design of complex systems interfaces
• Proven experience of leading and managing a design team
• Skilled in Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite
• Ability to ideate fast and explore multiple routes to solve a problem
• Experience in preparing and conducting user research and usability tests
• Knowledge and curiosity about technology and its impact on design solutions
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Some knowledge and experience of Government Digital Service Standards would be beneficial but not essential

What you need to be
• Comfortable being involved in direct conversations with external users and stakeholders in order to understand the detail of complex problems and communicate this to your team
• A strong leader, with sound technical judgement, and the ability to influence decision-making
• A team player who leads by example, and supports, mentors and motivates others around you
• Committed to self-development and a subject matter expert

What we offer for the Senior Product Designer
• Flexible & remote working to suit all lifestyles and life stages
• Enhanced pension and health insurance after 2 years' service
• Life insurance
• 25 days + bank holidays as standard
• Flexible public holidays - option to swap up to 5 UK public holidays to celebrate the festival of your choice. Choose an alternative day that fits your personal values, beliefs or celebration calendar better
• Enhanced parental leave policy
• New parents take a day off to celebrate your child’s first birthday
• Wellbeing and employee assistance programme
• Cycle to work scheme
• Free bike repair service for those that commute by bike
• Regular team lunches and team socials

Equity, diversity and inclusion at Ito World

At Ito World we believe diverse perspectives make for a better company and better products too. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups and are committed to equality and inclusivity in our hiring processes and company culture.

By submitting this application you agree to Ito World retaining your personal data on a "legitimate interest" basis. For further details see our privacy statement
