title: UX Designer
description:
About us

We’re The Very Group and we’re here to help families get more out of life. We know that our customers work hard for their families and have a lot to balance in their busy lives. That’s why we combine amazing brands and products with flexible payment options on Very.co.uk to help them say yes to the things they love. We’re just as passionate about helping our people get more out of life too, building careers with real growth, a sense of purpose, belonging and wellbeing.

About the team
The Digital Customer Experience (DCX) tribe is striving to create a world class customer experience across our Mobile and Web platforms. We are in control of building this exciting future and are looking for like-minded individuals to help make this a reality. We need people with strong backgrounds in digital retail to help us on this journey as we strive to define, design, build and run frictionless experiences that sets The Very Group apart from other online retailers

About the Role

With a... big ambition and millions of our loyal customers using the experiences we create every day; design plays a huge part in what we do at The Very Group (and rightly so!).

We are looking for an experienced UX Designer who can push boundaries, create great accessible experiences based on deep customer insight and disrupt the way we do things today.
• You will help bring our digital strategy to life, contribute to our Design System and be the voice of all things Design in one of our product squads.
• You will work in a collaborative hybrid environment, working closely with your cross-functional team of UX researchers, Product Managers, Engineers, Data Analysts, BAs, Testers and Delivery leads
• You will be involved in the end-to-end designs for the squad initiatives, shaping the vision and influencing roadmaps for your product area and facilitating discovery sessions with both your squad and the wider business.
• You will be responsible for overall design quality and outcomes within your area.
• You will also be joining a collaborative team of highly motivated design and research professionals from diverse backgrounds, who use their deep understanding of our customers to create seamless, accessible (WCAG 2.1 AA), and intuitive experiences that maximise customer value across the full end-to-end experience.

Day to day
• Partner with your product team and researcher on discovery that informs the squad vision, roadmaps, and priorities.
• Ground everything you do in a deep understanding of user needs, motivations, behaviours, accessibility, and performance measures.
• Collaborate with partners across the business to influence on UX best practices and ways of working.
• Spot opportunities for growth within our design capability and work with the UX Manager and team to drive forward solutions.
• For more experienced Designers, the opportunity to mentor and coach junior designers (including the opportunity of line management if aligned to career goals).

What you’ll bring
• Proven experience in UX design with a portfolio of work designing across platforms and devices
• A data and insight-driven mindset that works collaboratively and openly with our UX Research team
• Demonstratable experience of the techniques and artefacts needed to communicate and deliver an end-to-end product experience effectively (including personas, journey maps, wireframes, user flows, UI designs and prototypes etc)
• Ability to facilitate workshops, design sprints and other collaborative sessions
• Experience of working in a multivariate testing environment, getting work in front of customers so we can learn, iterate or pivot
• Collaboration with researchers, data analysts, product managers and developers to bring products to life through storytelling
• Ability to champion our UX/UI design principles and contribute to our Design system with a constant lens on accessibility and inclusive design

Some of our benefits
• Flexible, hybrid working model
• Inclusive culture and environment, check out our Glassdoor reviews
• Flexible benefits allowance to suit your needs
• 30 days holiday + bank holidays
• Udemy learning platform
• Bonus potential (performance and business-related)
• Up to 25% discount on Very.co.uk
• Matched pension up to 6%
• More benefits can be found on our career site

How to apply

Please note that the talent acquisition team are managing this vacancy directly, and if successful in securing this role, you may be required to undertake a credit, CIFAS and CRB check.

What happens next?

Our talent acquisition team will be in touch if you’re successful so keep an eye on your emails! We’ll arrange a short call to learn more about you, as well as answer any questions you have. If it feels like we’re a good match, we’ll share your CV with the hiring manager to review, and then be in touch to move to the interview process. Our interview process is tailored to each role and can be in-person and remotely. We will always look to make the adjustments you need to bring your best self to interview.

Equal opportunities

We’re an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accomodate

title: UI/UX Designer and 3D Artist
description:
Benefits
£26,000 - £30,000 depending on experience.
Liverpool office.
20 holidays + bank holidays.
Sometimes we will take you and the rest of the team on trips to Barcelona and Prague to meet with our clients at expo’s.
We ask all of our employees to use the first 45 minutes of their working day for learning and self development. We’ll pay for any online courses for you to do during this time, as well as paying for any talks or conferences that you would like to attend.

About Us
We are an ambitious Liverpool based media agency, creating bespoke websites and producing videos and social media content for our clients in the hydroponics industry and with brands that have an excellent social corporate responsibility strategy. We’re looking to expand our work with larger businesses.

Summary
We are looking for a confident cross discipline designer who is prepared to throw themselves into a range of design challenges. You will take responsibility for the UI and UX of our clients' websites... and work closely with our developer to ensure they get built as you intend. You will represent the users you are designing for to ensure you deliver the best websites for our clients and their users. You will also be responsible for delivering motion graphics to our video team when required. Ocassionaly producing still and animated 3D product renders for our clients. We are a small team, working on videos and social media campaigns as well as websites. Because of this, you may be required to help designers with branding and print design on occasion.

Responsibilities
Produce still and animated product renders for use on clients websites and social media. This may require 3D modelling at times. Blender experience necessary.
Translating client website briefs into proposals. Working with the Director and Developer to price up proposals.
Conceptualising user experiences with user flows and wireframes. Conceptualising user interfaces using Figma or Adobe XD and presenting them to clients for sign off. Experience producing animated mockups with After Effects is a bonus.
Producing pixel perfect, responsive user interfaces across desktop, tablet and mobile breakpoints on Figma to handover to the Developer.
Using analytics and running user tests to see if the solution you have designed meets the needs of its users.
Main point of contact for our web clients.

Flexible hours
40 hours per week, including 1 hour per day for lunch. Work these hours whenever you like. Prefer a lie in? Just start later and finish later. More of an early bird? Start work at 7am if you want an early finish. Or if you’d rather a day off in the week, then you’re free to make the time up at the weekend, it’s completely up to you.
You must be able to commute to our Liverpool office. Most of our staff work several days in the office each week and several at home, but we are flexible on this.

Skills required
Proficiency in Figma or Adobe XD, with a willingness to learn Figma.
Understanding of a user centred design approach and proficiency in; user flows, wireframes (hand drawn or on Figma), user testing,
Solid understanding of typography, spacing, colour theory (including accessibility for web) and responsive design.
3D modelling and rendering with Blender/Cinema 4D.
Proficiency with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop.
Knowledge of HTML and CSS in order to communicate effectively with developers.

What we’re looking for
We’re looking for someone with experience leading web design projects, who knows their way around Figma and has a good eye for detail. You need to be comfortable talking to clients and working with developers. You should also have experience producing animated 3D renders. You should be well organised and able to manage your time well while juggling UI design projects with 3D render creation simultaneously.
You must be self motivated and well organised, and a good communicator. You will be comfortable presenting your work to clients and able to take feedback on board.

To apply
Send us your CV and a portfolio of your work.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Permanent

Salary: £26,000.00-£35,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Company events
• Company pension
• Flexitime
• Free parking
• On-site parking
• Sick pay
• Work from home

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

Experience:
• UI/UX Design: 2 years (preferred)

Work Location: One location

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
The energy industry is undergoing the largest transformation since industrialisation at an unprecedented rate of change and we are positioning ourselves to be at the heart of that change.

Our aim is to be the leading global provider of solutions that enable customers release £30bn of value per annum from distributed energy resources (DERs). We are building a Software as a Service (SaaS) subscription business with a global addressable market of £2.4 billion per annum, by digitally connecting hundreds of thousands of DERs with energy markets.

We have already attained a market leading position and KrakenFlex is a recognised thought leader and innovator in the industry. Our efforts have not gone unnoticed and we are pleased to announce that we now have the full support and backing of Octopus Energy, an award-winning UK energy supplier who share our passion and values.

Help us make a big green dent in the universe. We're on a mission to drive the global

renewable energy revolution, and... we need loads more people to help us make our vision a reality.

We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who is creative and passionate about designing simple, elegant user experiences, and using human-centred design as a source of inspiration to solve complex problems in the energy industry on behalf of our customers.

You'll be working in a vibrant environment where people strive to solve the world's biggest problems.

Octopus is a great place to learn, work with some talented people and level-up your skills.

What you'll do
• Work side-by-side with a talented team of engineers to build world-class applications and services, focusing on a range of large and small scale, complex design challenges.
• Ownership of application features, from concept to design to engineer handoff.
• Develop and maintain our in house design system and style guides.
• Create exceptional visual interfaces.
• Create mock-ups, prototypes, and simulations to validate the user experience early on, and coordinate with the developer’s implementation details to secure the quality in the final product.
• You will have access to the global design/UX/UI team at Octopus Energy, to share ideas and opinions.
• You will understand and implement user friendly layouts, taking on the challenge of displaying complex data.

What you'll need
• Strong UI design skills, a proven ability to create pixel perfect layouts and components.
• Solid experience in wireframing, user flows, process flows and site maps.
• Strong experience in Figma.
• Excellent attention to detail & an ability to work with complex data.
• Experience working closely with software engineers.
• A user-first approach to design thinking.
• An ability to pick up work in a fast paced environment with a willingness to learn.
• An ability to take ownership over a product.
• An ability to respond to complicated briefs from stakeholders, make decisions and communicate an appropriate response/strategy.
• Previous experience across digital design and UX/UI.
• The ability to be a confident and flexible designer. Your sweet spot is the intersection of design and social impact.
• An agile mindset; you can both nurture a cohesive product vision and finesse visual designs at a vector or pixel level.
• An ability to relate to individuals and nurture other team members.
• A degree in Graphic Design, UX/UI, Visual communication, or equivalent work experience.
• Extensive experience with a variety of graphic design tools.

Why else you'll love it here
• Wondering what the salary for this role is? Just ask us! On a call with one of our recruiters it's something we always cover as we genuinely want to match your experience with the correct salary. The reason why we don't advertise is because we honestly have a degree of flexibility and would never want salary to be a reason why someone doesn't apply to Octopus - what's more important to us is finding the right octofit!
• Octopus Energy is a unique culture. An organisation where people learn, decide, and build quicker. Where people work with autonomy, alongside a wide range of amazing co-owners, on projects that break new ground. We want your hard work to be rewarded with perks you actually care about! We won best company to work for in 2022, on Glassdoor we were voted 50 best places to work in 2022 and our Group CEO, Greg has recorded a podcast about our culture and how we empower our people
• Visit our perks hub - Octopus Employee Benefits

Ideally you will be based in the Greater Manchester and happy to come into the office a couple of days per week! But we appreciate that things have changed and flexibility is at the top of everyone's agenda, so if you would rather be remote please let us know.

If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You'll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren't always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

A proficient use of Figma

A background of digital product experience

A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: IT UI/UX Designer
description:
Airswift is seeking applicants for the role of IT UI/UX Designer to join the team in the UK.

Role Description

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer to turn our software into easy-to-use products for our clients. UI/UX Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our client’s needs and help us grow our customer base.

Working closely with the business needs, as we embark on our Digital Transformation Journey within the Airswift business. Although based in the UK the post holder will work alongside global colleagues in supporting the business and would be expected to work across multiple time zones, on... a per-project basis. This position provides exposure to a broad range of IT-related projects and activities, and new technology introductions to the business.

Key Roles, Tasks and Responsibilities
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images

Person Specification

The successful candidate will have the following qualities
• A can-do attitude and positive outlook
• Ability to multitask and work under pressure
• Ability to think outside the box, and work with stakeholders to provide best-in-class design
• Ability to map time requirements to design timelines in order to meet release schedules
• Proven work experience in software development
• Takes ownership of challenges through to the conclusion
• A service and customer-centric approach
• Excellent analytical capabilities, research, problem-solving, and time management skills required.
• Ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Knowledge and Experience

To include but not limited to:
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Ability to drive discussion using wireframing
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software such as Figma
• Experience working with react libraries
• Strong verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, and the ability to build solid business relationships.
• Demonstrated ability to function in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities.
• Ability to handle and prioritise a varied and sometimes heavy workload.
• Proven experience in providing a high level of customer service

Qualifications/Skills
• Azure DevOps
• Experience working under AGILE / SCRUM development methodologies
• Experience working in a global environment
• BSC in Design, Computer Science or a relevant field

About Us

Airswift is the leading workforce solutions provider to the STEM industries. We have talented colleagues in over 60 global offices and 45 countries. We are a people business – we transform lives through the world of work. We care about mental health and wellbeing, community engagement and our planet – we plant a tree for every person placed in a job globally! We have a passion for growth, including investing in the development of our people.

What we can offer you!
• Attractive monthly base salary + competitive commission/performance bonus.
• Genuine career progression opportunities, either locally or globally!
• World-class training programmes and development opportunities
• Virtual Onboarding Events exclusively for new hires.
• Team driven environment, supportive culture with a focus on work-life balance.
• Career breaks available after one year.
• Mental Health First Aiders to signpost you to support when you need it.
• Monthly Excellence Awards nominated by your peers.
• Quarterly roundtable with CEO for Excellence Award winners
• Yearly destination trips as part of our Highflyers program (Dubai, Buenos Aires, etc…)
• Charity days for various importance causes such as Relay for Life and Earth Day.

Our Core Values
• Growth - In life and business, one must grow to flourish and achieve high ambitions. Growth requires change, challenge, risk and sacrifice - we will always choose growth.
• Safety - We create a safe and inclusive environment to protect the physical and psychological well-being of everyone we work with.
• Excellence - We deliver, holding ourselves accountable for results. Our customers see excellence in everything we do.
• Integrity - We are ethical, open, honest and authentic. People trust us to do the right thing for the right reason.

Visit our website and social medias to find out more! - www.airswift.com

Disclaimer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Airswift, we believe that diversity is critical to our sccess and makes us a great place to work. We are committed to building an equal opportunity workplace, the more inclusive we are - the better our work will be

title: UX UI Designer
description:
We are looking for a talented UX UI Designer to join my client, a digital marketing and design agency based in Macclesfield, Cheshire East.

As part of the Web Design Team, you will be their go-to creative for new websites and existing projects.

You will work closely with your squad (Front-End Developers, Back-End Developers, Creative Strategists, Graphic Designers, Project Managers and more team members) to produce high-quality, engaging, modern websites.

Your role will be to deliver full design concepts and mockups whilst collaborating with developers to help quickly and effectively deliver your designs.

You will understand how their clients operate commercially and how our services can support them in meeting their business goals.

Your

Responsibilities

To take a design brief from clients, alongside a project manager, and propose a practical solution.
Understanding our client's brand so that it is reflected through all digital design collateral.
UI design with strong emphasis... on UX principles to ensure the solution provides a simple user experience that delivers commercial results.
Creating layered design concepts using Adobe XD that are in-line with the design brief
Creating innovative, accessible design concepts including animations and interactive elements
Designing and maintaining our website component library
Ensure every design produced delivers an effective experience across desktop, mobile and tablet.
Working with your squad to ensure the web project is delivered to the brief, on time and within budget.
Staying on-top of the latest design practices and industry trends

The

Requirements /Key Skills

Proficiency using the Adobe Creative Suite (XD, Illustrator and Photoshop)
Strong understanding of UX/UI Website Design;
Graphic design and web asset creation
Experience in UX design, Visual design, interface design, layouts, and graphics.
Strong hands-on experience creating website wireframes, and prototypes.
Proactively contribute to both plans and development of client sites.

Experience working alongside developers

Experience working with custom CMSs

Experience working in an Agency environment - Fast-paced
A design for development approach
Commercial - always looking to optimise value

In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: UX Designer
description:
UX/YI Designer
Radbroke

As a Barclays UX/UI Designer, you will be innovating, creating and shaping the user experience for both new and existing bank applications. You’ll be part of a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team of UX designers, UI designers and UX researchers. Working as a UX/UI Designer here at Barclays, you get the chance to use your creative skills to create accessible and usable designs that can be experienced via any channel or device. Additionally, you will deliver consistent, excellent, customer-focused design solutions.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

Working Flexibly
We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in... This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to
business needs.

Hybrid Working
We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally are able to request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances
Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.

What will you be doing?
• Creating accessible and usable designs that can be experienced via any channel or device

• Understanding complex digital concepts, and presenting them as simple design solutions

• Owning the end-to-end design process from concepts to developer handoff

• Being proactive in solving problems effectively, using multiple sources of factual information

• Working through complex problems and resolving to an appropriate solution

• Contributing to strategic concepts that can drive engagement

• Constantly pushing for a customer-centric approach whilst delivering on required business objectives

• Identifying and implementing process improvements within the team
What we’re looking for:

• Ability to create design documents from flows and low-fidelity wireframes to pixel perfect designs and prototypes
• Ability to translate a combination of business requirements, user needs and technical requirements into engaging and simple designs
• Proven experience of working with UX design principles and brand guidelines
• Excellent communication skills
Skills that will help you in the role :

• BSc degree in relevant discipline
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS
• Experience in the Fintech industry

Where will you be working?
The Barclays Technology Campus, just outside Manchester, is our transatlantic tech command centre for information security in the UK. It’s the vital strategic powerhouse behind our global operations. Radbroke is a place where big ideas become realities. Where the talent in the world can build careers full of scope, variety and reward, by creating the technical solutions that meet today’s demands, answer tomorrow’s questions and redefine the future of finance.

#Software #Hybrid

title: Creative Design (UX/UI)
description:
Creative Designer
40k DOE
Permanent

I'm currently partnered with a web and software development agency based in Crewe who are looking for a Creative Designer to join their team.

The Role
You will design the UI/UX on a variety of digital solutions for our clients including brochure websites, e-commerce platforms, online portals, and software applications. You will take ownership of the entire design process, from helping to collect insights from the client, to designing the UI/UX, reviewing concepts with the client, and handing over to the front-end development team. There may also be opportunity to work on several branding and print design projects (subject to experience).

More specifically, you will:
• Gather insights from the client and develop a thorough understanding of their business (market position, products/services), and users (demographics, psychographics, behavioural) to inform design decisions.
• Design UI/UX concepts for entire systems - driven by insights.
• Present... concepts to clients via screenshare calls, discuss the concepts, and provide rationale behind key design decisions.
• Design responsive views for concepts.
• Iterate design concepts until we reach final concept, working in a collaborative way with project stakeholders throughout the Design phase.
• Liaise with the Technical Lead to ensure that design concepts meet client briefs and functional requirements.
• Hand over designs to the front-end development team for front-end implementation and provide guidance to front-end developers when required.
• Provide updates to Project Support on the progress of Design concepts, identify and communicate any potential blockers.
• Proactively engage with the latest trends in Design and share ideas with the Head of Design.

You
• You will have experience in creating brilliant conceptual web design.
• On a personal level, a creative mind is key, and you must possess a perfectionist approach to detail. A calm and collected character is important as this is a fast-paced environment with several ongoing projects, all of which are time-sensitive.
• Finally, communication skills are critical as you will be working closely with several stakeholders (internal and external). A key component of this role is to effectively gather design requirements from clients, and present your concepts accordingly (via screenshare or face-to-face).
• Ideally, you will have experience as a UX/UI Designer in a similar role, preferably within an agency.

Essential Technical Skills
• Adobe XD or Figma
• Adobe Illustrator
• Adobe Photoshop

Desirable Technical Skills
• Adobe InDesign
• An understanding of HTML & CSS and how it can impact design decisions
• An understanding of React

title: UX Designer
description: UX Designer - London (Hybrid) - GBP 40,000-60,000 DOE A new and exciting position has recently become available with an award winning brand digital agency, who work closely with a range of ambitious companies. They are searching for a creative individual with strong UX experience, particulary in wireframing and site mapping to join their team on a permanent basis. As a UX Designer, you will work closely with clients to define goals for website design and content. This role requires you to work from the London-based office twice a week. This means you must live in and have the right to work in the UK. Responsibilities as a UX Designer include: * Translating business/campaign/organisational requirements into positive user experiences and behaviours * Analysing and auditing existing websites and digital assets for content, structure and functionality * Organising research, workshops and analytics reviews * Planning and designing information architecture * Developing user personas... customer journey maps, and task flows * Creating wireframes, prototypes and interactive designs for testing and presenting to clients * Support with feedback on prototypes * Liaise with both internal and client team members to communicate ideas, recommendations and decisions * Collaborate with designers * Support designers and developers throughout the process * Keeping abreast of UX industry trends, methodologies, technology and tools Knowledge and skills: * Solid digital UX experience - preferably in an agency environment * A strong portfolio of work * A background in planning and conducting user research using several methods * Proficient in Figma * Knowledge of user testing and agile working methods * Strong communicator * Ability to present technical and design solutions to non-specialist audiences * Passionate for user-centered design * Able to solve difficult problems * Self-motivated and a Multi-tasker * Familiar with: HTML, CSS, etc * Experience in analytics and metrics related to user experience * Experience in conversion optimisation principles My client offers a fantastic benefits package, some of which are included below: * 28-day holiday allowance including birthday off * Car and bike scheme * Bupa package * Wellness app subscription * Company phone * And much more! URGENT ROLE - IMMEDIATE INTERVIEWS - FAST OFFERS If you have experience in the above and you're interested in this amazing opportunity, please apply with your most up-to-date CV or get in touch with me on 0161 552 1007. Role: UX Designer Location: London (Hybrid) Salary: GBP 40,000-60,000 DOE Keywords: UX Design, UX Architect, UX, UI, UX Designer, Design, Website Architecture, Site Mapping, Site Map, Website Mapping, Wireframe, Wireframing, Figma, W3C WCAG, HTML, CSS BeTechnology Group Limited is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. * Contact: Megan Cleary * Reference: Totaljobs/PR/005858 * Job ID: 99374172

Company Name: BookingJob Description

Summary Tripsdesign&ux Tripsrides

In the Rides group, we craft the ground transportation experience for Booking.com. This design role in the Rides Booking experience will focus on helping our customers get around during their trip. Helping them find and book transport options that best fit their needs.

We collaborate closely with our colleagues across the Trips & Accommodation Business Unit to ensure our customers receive a joined up experience no matter what Booking.com... product they book.

We’re looking for an experienced designer who has:

Great eye for detail and applying this to their designs and prototypes
• Whilst we need someone autonomous, we also need a strong communicator who has great collaboration skills with other designers and disciplines
• Confident with running design research and presenting this back to a variety of stakeholders
• Experience in the use of Design Systems
• Experience with responsive web design
• Experience with App design is a bonus but not necessary
• Strong stakeholder management in and outside of your immediate teams

Responsible for understanding the needs and constraints of the user, the business, and the technical implementation, and applying their craft to create the most practical solutions to achieve the teams and businesses goals. Work directly in a team within their subject area to define and execute the design details and make our products and services useful, usable, and desirable through holistic, transparent, and accessible means. Produce innovative and comprehensively-detailed designs in order to drive the execution while ensuring their ideas are clearly understood by others through collaboration, testing and documentation. They ensure that design guidelines and best practices are applied. Works with product and engineering to ensure content is accurately portrayed.

Responsibility:
• Effectively utilises a variety of research and data to better understand and design for user needs and to inform design decisions, validate hypotheses and document insights.
• Seeks out timely feedback and critique as fuel to improve design solutions and strategy; proactively seeks out collaboration and co-design opportunities in order to provide well-rounded user experiences and shows willingness to iterate to define and refine solutions.
• Creates high-quality design assets and solutions for their team and track to improve the overarching user experience, usability and accessibility of the product(s).
• Acts consistently as an advocate for end user needs and perspectives in product area discussions, reviews, and critiques.
• Demonstrates applied understanding of Booking's brand standards and design systems, principles and guidelines and applies them in their work.
• Has knowledge of prototyping tools or prototyping environments and web coding languages such as HTML, CSS, etc where relevant to implement their solutions within the scope of their team.
• Communicates effectively, candidly, collaboratively and constructively so that team objectives are met and rapport and trust are established.

Knowledge and Skills
• 3 - 5 years of relevant experience designing for digital products / native mobile apps
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
• Basic knowledge about CSS / HTML
• Solution oriented and result driven
• Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
• Good communication and analytical skills
• Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude
• A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skills, a case study or two which illustrate challenges, methods, roles, and outcomes.
• Bachelor’s degree a plus.
• Language: English

Pre-EmploymentScreening:

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
This role will be instrumental in implementing the UX Design strategy across multiple product teams at TalkTalk, informed by the overarching UX strategy, working with multiple stakeholders from across the business to solve business problems.

Your knowledge of Design Thinking methodologies will enable you to support the UX/UI team with your strong understanding of the Double Diamond process and seeing it through from Discovery to Define.

Working as part of the wider Marketing team, you will be surrounded by innovative and creative thinkers and great leadership.

Our mission is to create innovative and user-centered experiences that create a positive impact in order to support the UCD cultural change within TalkTalk. We're passionate about creating services that enable anyone in the UK to access affordable and reliable internet - and for the user experience of this to be exceptional.

As a team, we're empathetic problem-solvers for both the customer and the business, and we understand... how business problems are linked to customer problems and vice versa.

As a UX Designer, you are expected to have a good understanding of the UX Design process as well identifying which methods to use and when. You will also be responsible for:
• Delivering UX Designs based on research and data that solve a clear customer or business need and seeing it through to delivery.
• Work with Product Owners to fully understand the problem they're trying to solve and set their expectations on how you will tackle the problem and how long the work will take.
• Communicate and share your work with stakeholders in a clear manner.
• Building relationships across the business to influence stakeholders, proactively collaborating and updating them early and often to keep them in the loop.
• Following the UX process and delivering your work on time.
• Recognising when to ask for further guidance and support.

As part of the wider UX team you will:
• Work with the team to implement the UX Strategy from a design perspective.
• Engage with the team workshops and share any new and exciting developments that you come across in the wider industry.
• Constructively add to the team dynamic and help us to grow.
• Work with the UX team to ensure we're designing a joined-up experience.
• Contribute to growing a customer-centric culture by being the voice of the customer in meetings.
• Feed into our new Design System to help it grow.
• Identify new opportunities to help solve business problems.

What do I need in order to deliver in the role?

You'll have experience with Design Systems and are aware of the AA accessibility requirements. You'll also be experienced in using a variety of methods of prototyping using tools such as Sketch, Figma, Mural Invision and Marvel

You'll be used to Agile ways of working and can identify and compare the best processes or delivery methods to use depending on the problem you're trying to solve.

You know how to use the UX Double Diamond and can communicate your work using the process of Discover, Define, Design and Deliver.

You're confident being the voice of the customer in product discussions when sharing innovative and pragmatic ways of solving a problem.

As a recognised Top 50 Inclusive Employer in the UK, we know that diversity means success and innovation. We want our workplace to reflect the communities and customer we serve. Being inclusive is part of our DNA; we are all 100% human, and we create a culture where you can truly be yourself.

We're also not your usual 9-5. We are a dynamic workplace and we want to talk to you about how you like to work

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Description

The Role

Here at Intercept IP, we are offering a talented, creative and innovative UI/UX Designer, the unique opportunity to come on-board and work on projects from discovery through to delivery, for a pioneering software consultancy. At IIP, we build and develop bespoke solutions using agile methods and digital technologies by working with senior leaders to shape and form strategies and solutions.

You will be responsible for creating and improving the user experience for our clients, helping to shape the end solutions and products so that they are intuitive and designed with the end-user in mind.

You’ll have the opportunity to get involved in cutting edge R&D initiatives, attend events on behalf of the company and take part in training programmes designed to help you learn and grow, no matter the stage of your career.

The Business

At Intercept IP, we offer a unique working life. With us you’ll get the chance to work on exciting projects for an impressive list of... clientele, as well as aiding in the development of our own in-house digital products.

We’re an eclectic and welcoming bunch, who enjoy spending time together both in and outside of office hours through regular social events and our weekly breakfast club. We allow each one of our employees to dedicate a percentage of their time to R&D activity, whilst providing a supportive and flexible working environment for our team of the best and brightest developers, testers, business analysts and project managers.

Responsibilities
• You will be developing concepts from wireframes, through to creating clickable prototypes, resulting in a pixel perfect design
• You will be working closely with developers and the product team to design products that are simple but great for the user, focusing on interaction and visual design
• Set the direction for client engagements and lead discovery engagements design, plan and lead user research, design and usability testing activities
• You will understand primary customer journeys and help build a clear picture of the customer to create leading edge designs
• As a team member you will have an entrepreneurial spirit, be resourceful, forward thinking and committed
• You will use the modern design and UX techniques to design simple and usable systems and products that create an excellent user experience
• Help define the UX Design Process working alongside other disciplines
• Ensure that applications and websites meet accessibility requirements
• Distributing assets in the formats required by developers, to incorporate into the finished product

Essential Skills
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software (Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Balsamiq or Axure)
• Demonstrated experience in applying user research techniques such as interviewing, contextual observation and surveys
• Preferably have experience working in agile teams to deliver rapid prototypes/proof of concepts
• Demonstrated experience creating key deliverable's such as detailed user journeys, user flows, wireframes, prototypes and UI Design for complex systems, web and mobile applications
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Understanding of UX concepts
• Evaluate the quality of the user experience
• Test, analyse and report results, and make recommendations to improve effectiveness, efficiency, and overall satisfaction of the user

Please register your interest by applying below

description:
UI/UX Designer
MediaCityUK
M50

Shoalter Automation UK Ltd (a HKTV Group Subsidiary) is embarking on an exciting and revolutionary new project. In a world-first, we are set to introduce our first completely Automated Convenience Stores to the UK market and beyond.

By utilising industry-leading robotics, self-designed machineries, and intelligent software derived from the HKTV Group s extensive experience, we aim to create a seamless shopping experience set to redefine the industry, while creating opportunities to adapt to the challenges of our times.

To help realise this dream we are looking for talented individuals to join our company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We re committed to maintaining a working environment for every colleague that s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth.

As an UI-UX Designer for Shoalter Automation (UK) Ltd, you will be responsible for delivering the best online user experience... which makes your role extremely important for our success and ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty.

You will be designing ideas using various methods and latest technology. You will be designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, forms, and widgets.

UI/UX Designer Duties and Responsibilities:
• Plan and implement new designs
• Optimize existing user interface designs
• Test for intuitivity and experience
• Communicate with clients to understand their business goals and objectives
• Develop technical and business requirements and always strive to deliver intuitive and user-centred solutions
• Combine creativity with an awareness of the design elements
• Create prototypes for new product ideas
• Test new ideas before implementing
• Conduct an ongoing user research

UI/UX Designer Requirements and Qualifications:
• At least 3 years of experience as an UI-UX Designer or similar role
• Familiar with the UK Grocery Sector
• UI/UX design portfolio
• Bachelor s degree in relevant field
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Ability to discuss and explain design options
• Detail oriented
• Critical thinker
• Problem solver and customer-centred
• Knowledge of Figma and Adobe range of products including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat and Dreamweaver
• 3 years of experience with HTML5 & CSS3
• Some knowledge of Usability Factors in Human Computer Interaction

Javascript / Typescript / HTML / CSS / UI Frameworks

Working with... market-leading products, you'll work with user empathy to deliver eye-catching web interfaces, designs and prototypes for new and innovative experiences. Our customer tackles new and exciting challenges on a daily basis, seeking to empower Developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Everyday we tackle new and exciting challenges to empower developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile, and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Couchbase delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments. The database market is one of the largest undisturbed markets for enterprise software. The main catalyst for this is the need for digital transformation. Join Couchbase to be a part of a greater change. Here you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most innovative, passionate and humble individuals in the database industry.

You are a UI/UX Designer/Engineer who crafts delightful web interfaces, designs, prototypes new and innovative experiences, and implements features while advocating for UX.

Here's a brief look at what success looks like in this role: In three months, you’ll have collaborated with the team to deliver a... material contribution, contributed to code reviews and fed into technical discussion.In six months, you’ll have earned the trust of the team and are actively collaborating on the design of new features.In twelve months, you are regularly delivering tasks through the entire SDLC and have established a cadence of timely delivery without cutting corners

Responsibilities
• Design, develop, test and deploy software.
• Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
• Support the definition and progress of team goals.
• Have fun building great software.

In this role you can expect to
• Ship code regularly.
• Be experimental.Learn new skills and work with modern technologies.
• Collaborate with a similarly forward-thinking group of frontend engineers on technical decisions.
• Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.
• Maintain code quality with unit tests and support delivery of automated integration and E2E tests.
• Work closely with UX designers, quality teams, product managers and systems engineers to build, iterate, and ship new features to enhance the user experience for our industry leading cloud solutions.

Key Technologiies

Couchbase focuses on Enterprise Software, Big Data, Databases, and Software. Their company has offices in San Francisco, London, Mountain View, Manchester, and Paris. Based in Manchester City Centre with hybrid remote working and flexible working hours, this position is paying between £60k and £70k per annum + bonus.

THE ROLE:

Working closely with a highly skilled and experienced Head of Product (who also happens to be one of the nicest people I have ever met), you will be joining the company at a very exciting stage as they are overhauling the look and feel of their existing flagship software products and launching a number of brand-new ones. You will be taking ownership of the full stack UX design from conception to delivery including research, wireframing, prototyping, and hands-on design of simple and intuitive experiences.

DUTIES:
• Develop a deep understanding technical end users and create user... personas and help build products that satisfy the jobs they are trying to do, with a lean mindset where possible.
• Help solve problems making the complex, simple.
• Design navigation flows taking functional requirements and turn them into simple user journeys
• Help develop our understanding of the customer and problem,
• Design and facilitate workshops to encourage collaborative ownership of problems and defining collective plans of action
• Continuously look for ways to improve the user experience and create more value for the business
• Leverage honest feedback - welcoming discussion leading to iterative design based on data and feedback

On offer:
• Annual Bonus scheme
• Flexible working hours
• Hybrid remote working (2-3 days a week in office)
• 9 % pension contribution from the company
• Non-contributory Life Assurance Scheme
• 25 days annual leave entitlement plus 8 public holidays
• Funded training and development

THE COMPANY:

Founded in 2006, with offices in Manchester, London and Denver, Colorado, this software company has created a suite of their own data backup and disaster recovery products that are used by over 10 million customers worldwide, ranging from large multinationals and small businesses, through to individual home users.

REQUIREMENTS
• 4+ years' experience as a UX or Product Designer with a portfolio that demonstrates thoughtful, impactful work
• Willingness and ability to engage with engineers about how stuff works. If you can develop an appreciate how things work, so you can maximise the experience!
• Demonstrated design acumen
• Ability to iterate quickly, based on data/feedback, and your recommendations tell the story of the customer experience we are delivering
• Experience running UX/UI projects from initiation to delivery
• Experience using Figma (or similar) to wireframe, design and create prototypes
• Experience performing competitor and user research/rapid feedback techniques

Beneficial:
• Experience working on any subscription-based (SaaS) or technical software.
• Understanding of design systems and pattern libraries; or familiarity with Windows based UI design
• Experience in Customer Journey Maps, JTBD, or Design Sprints would be great but if you don't have it, here's your chance to learn.

Interested, contact Philip at Lorien Global

IND_PC1

Carbon60, Lorien, SRG - the Impellam Group STEM Portfolio is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy

title: Product Designer (UI/UX)
description:
Product Designer UI/UX

What’s happening at PwC?

As part of PwC’s global strategy, The New Equation, we’re investing significantly in skills, capabilities and technologies to address the breadth and complexity of the challenges that our clients face with their businesses and in society. One of our responses to this was establishing Tech Central, a technology focused function working alongside other PwC teams.

What’s happening in the function?

Tech Central is rapidly growing and the environment that our people work in is fueled by ingenuity, collaboration and innovation. Our people are skilled and passionate about the work they do. As part of the team you’ll experience an environment consisting of a wide range of technologies with ample room for you to learn, grow and innovate.

About the team

This role offers the exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing Product Design function at PwC. We are responsible for creating a fantastic user experience across new & existing products... being built across the firm & for our clients.

Your role will include transferring your knowledge of Product Design practices and approaches into product teams as well as bringing experience in helping integrate a user centred design approach through technology, process & mindset.

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You'll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren't always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

A proficient use of Figma

A background of digital product experience

A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
UX/UI Designer

Your new company
Our client is a global leader in the creation of software tools for security testing of web applications

Your new role
Our designers are pivotal to the success of our product teams, working alongside highly experienced software developers and product experts. This means that you will be involved in a wide variety of activities, including:
• Modernization, research and design of future generations of our product.
• Working alongside the product team to define customer needs through bringing a design influence.
• Designing simple, elegant, data-driven, user-centric experiences that will delight our customers.
• Helping to shape the product strategy and vision, bringing your insight and expertise from a design perspective.
• Extensive and thorough user research with the primary responsibility of bringing forward new findings and learning to influence design decisions.
• Conducting user testing to validate all design solutions.
• Producing high quality... sketches, wireframes and mock-ups at various degrees of fidelity.
• Collaborating closely with development teams during the prototyping and building of UI components.
• Contributing to the wider design systems and practices

What you'll need to succeed
You come from a technical background as someone who may have started their career as a developer or programmer but have taken a keen interest into all things UX. You are a UX Designer whose career demonstrates technical experience, as well as a strong portfolio of visual design and problem solving using UX methodologies and principles. You thrive in a hands-on design role in a highly collaborative flat team environment. This means that:
• You have a good understanding of technical concepts.
• You are a strong visual communicator.
• You are naturally organized with great time management skills.
• You have the ability to adapt within fast paced agile environments.
• You are humble and open to constructive feedback.
• You are always looking for ways to improve your knowledge and skills .
Essential:
• Strong technical background and knowledge - comfortable having highly technical conversations with developers and customers.
• Full-stack, cross-platform design experience, from discovery to design, through to building and delivering an exceptional product.
• Previous experience modernizing the design for a desktop application and understanding the challenges and opportunities that go with it.
• Ability to keep the customer at the heart of everything you do. Validating your ideas with data and customer research to build products that will delight the user.
• Exposure or experience with working in a cross-functional agile team solving complex user problems and evolving your design in rapid iterations to meet changing requirements.
• Experience using design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Axure, XD.
• Experience with moderating user testing and conducting interviews.
• Experience using user story techniques.
• A depth of hands-on experience with various UX methods such as empathy mapping or customer journey mapping.
• Good understanding of interaction design, including common UI patterns.
• Experience in creating user personas.
• A healthy understanding of accessibility standards.
• Proven ability to multi-task and deliver continuous, incremental value to the team.
• Self-motivate with the ability to adapt quickly, forming outstanding and innovative ideas.

Although not essential to the role, it would be beneficial to have some knowledge or interest in the following area:
• Cybersecurity - although direct experience with Application Security is not required - you'll learn quickly!

What you'll get in return
Our client firmly believes in paying people what they're worth. Paying excellent salaries above the normal market level, and this is always determined based on your individual skills and contribution. In addition to a generous base salary, they offer share options and a comprehensive benefits package.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #4330167

• Understanding our client's brand so that it is reflected through all digital design collateral.
• UI design with strong emphasis... on UX principles to ensure the solution provides a simple user experience that delivers commercial results.
• Creating layered design concepts using Adobe XD that are in-line with the design brief
• Creating innovative, accessible design concepts including animations and interactive elements
• Designing and maintaining our website component library
• Ensure every design produced delivers an effective experience across desktop, mobile and tablet.
• Working with your squad to ensure the web project is delivered to the brief, on time and within budget.
• Staying on-top of the latest design practices and industry trends
The Requirements/Key Skills
• Proficiency using the Adobe Creative Suite (XD, Illustrator and Photoshop)
• Strong understanding of UX/UI Website Design;
Graphic design and web asset creation
• Experience in UX design, Visual design, interface design, layouts, and graphics.
• Strong hands-on experience creating website wireframes, and prototypes.
• Proactively contribute to both plans and development of client sites.
• Experience working alongside developers
• Experience working with custom CMSs
• Experience working in an Agency environment - Fast-paced
• A design for development approach
• Commercial - always looking to optimise value

title: UI/UX Designer - UK Retail Sector
description:
UI/UX Designer

MediaCityUK

M50

Shoalter Automation UK Ltd (a HKTV Group Subsidiary) is embarking on an exciting and revolutionary new project. In a world-first, we are set to introduce our first completely Automated Convenience Stores to the UK market and beyond.

By utilising industry-leading robotics, self-designed machineries, and intelligent software derived from the HKTV Group’s extensive experience, we aim to create a seamless shopping experience set to redefine the industry, while creating opportunities to adapt to the challenges of our times.

To help realise this dream we are looking for talented individuals to join our company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to maintaining a working environment for every colleague that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth.

As an UI-UX Designer for Shoalter Automation (UK) Ltd, you will be responsible for delivering the best online user experience... which makes your role extremely important for our success and ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty.

You will be designing ideas using various methods and latest technology. You will be designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, forms, and widgets.

UI/UX Designer Duties and Responsibilities:
• Plan and implement new designs
• Optimize existing user interface designs
• Test for intuitivity and experience
• Communicate with clients to understand their business goals and objectives
• Develop technical and business requirements and always strive to deliver intuitive and user-centred solutions
• Combine creativity with an awareness of the design elements
• Create prototypes for new product ideas
• Test new ideas before implementing
• Conduct an ongoing user research

UI/UX Designer Requirements and Qualifications:
• At least 3 years of experience as an UI-UX Designer or similar role
• Familiar with the UK Grocery Sector
• UI/UX design portfolio
• Bachelor’s degree in relevant field
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Ability to discuss and explain design options
• Detail oriented
• Critical thinker
• Problem solver and customer-centred
• Knowledge of Figma and Adobe range of products including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat and Dreamweaver
• 3 years of experience with HTML5 & CSS3
• Some knowledge of Usability Factors in Human Computer Interaction
