title: UX/UI Designer
description:
What you'll do
• Work side-by-side with a talented team of engineers to build world-class applications and services, focusing on a range of large and small scale, complex design challenges.
• Ownership of application features, from concept to design to engineer handoff.
• Develop and maintain our in house design system and style guides.
• Create exceptional visual interfaces.
• Create mock-ups, prototypes, and simulations to validate the user experience early on, and coordinate with the developer’s implementation details to secure the quality in the final product.
• You will have access to the global design / UX / UI team at Octopus Energy, to share ideas and opinions.
• You will understand and implement user friendly layouts, taking on the challenge of displaying complex data.

What you'll need
• Strong UI design skills, a proven ability to create pixel perfect layouts and components.
• Solid experience in wireframing, user flows, process flows and site maps.
• Strong experience in... Figma.
• Excellent attention to detail & an ability to work with complex data.
• Experience working closely with software engineers.
• A user-first approach to design thinking.
• An ability to pick up work in a fast paced environment with a willingness to learn.
• An ability to take ownership over a product.
• An ability to respond to complicated briefs from stakeholders, make decisions and communicate an appropriate response / strategy.
• Previous experience across digital design and UX / UI.
• The ability to be a confident and flexible designer. Your sweet spot is the intersection of design and social impact.
• An agile mindset; you can both nurture a cohesive product vision and finesse visual designs at a vector or pixel level.
• An ability to relate to individuals and nurture other team members.
• A degree in Graphic Design, UX / UI, Visual communication, or equivalent work experience.
• Extensive experience with a variety of graphic design tools.

Why else you'll love it here

Wondering what the salary for this role is? Just ask us! On a call with one of our recruiters it's something we always cover as we genuinely want to match your experience with the correct salary.

The reason why we don't advertise is because we honestly have a degree of flexibility and would never want salary to be a reason why someone doesn't apply to Octopus - what's more important to us is finding the right octofit!

Octopus Energy is a unique culture . An organisation where people learn, decide, and build quicker. Where people work with autonomy, alongside a wide range of amazing co-owners, on projects that break new ground.

We want your hard work to be rewarded with perks you actually care about! We won best company to work for in 2022, on Glassdoor we were voted 50 best places to work in 2022 and our Group CEO, Greg has recorded a podcast about our culture and how we empower our people

Visit our perks hub - Octopus Employee Benefits

Ideally you will be based in the Greater Manchester and happy to come into the office a couple of days per week! But we appreciate that things have changed and flexibility is at the top of everyone's agenda, so if you would rather be remote please let us know.

If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you. Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements.

Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic.

Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
An opportunity to directly contribute to Burp Suite, by bringing your niche expertise in desktop application design to enhance our user's experience.

Background

Based in Cheshire in the United Kingdom, PortSwigger Web Security is a global leader in the cybersecurity sector. Our cutting-edge software is used by over 50,000 customers in 150 countries to help them secure their web applications. We go beyond just selling software. Our educational and research output is used by millions of people globally to learn about web security.

We first made our name with Burp Suite, the leading software for web penetration testing. We have since broadened our focus with the release of Burp Suite Enterprise Edition, which is aimed at software development teams and large organizations with extensive web assets to defend, and the Web Security Academy. Our software products include our customer-facing website, the Customer Success Platform.

We are a fun group of people from a diverse range of... backgrounds, who pull together to produce amazing outcomes for our customers. We achieve this by continually investing in and supporting our people, giving them opportunities to flourish in our supportive and collaborative working environment. Want to find out more about our new fantastic office and what life is like at PortSwigger, check out; Life at PortSwigger

We now have a hugely exciting opportunity for a world-class UX/UI Designer to join our Burp Suite Professional team. Bringing your niche expertise in desktop application design, you will work with a high-performing team to solve complex design problems.

About You

Requirements

You come from a technical background as someone who may have started their career as a developer or programmer but have taken a keen interest into all things UX. You are a UX Designer whose career demonstrates technical experience, as well as a strong portfolio of visual design and problem solving using UX methodologies and principles. You thrive in a hands-on design role in a highly collaborative flat team environment.

This means that:
• You have a good understanding of technical concepts.
• You are a strong visual communicator.
• You are naturally organized with great time management skills.
• You have the ability to adapt within fast paced agile environments.
• You are humble and open to constructive feedback.
• You are always looking for ways to improve your knowledge and skills .

Key Responsibilities

Our designers are pivotal to the success of our product teams, working alongside highly experienced software developers and product experts. This means that you will be involved in a wide variety of activities, including:
• Modernization, research and design of future generations of our product.
• Working alongside the product team to define customer needs through bringing a design influence.
• Designing simple, elegant, data-driven, user-centric experiences that will delight our customers.
• Helping to shape the product strategy and vision, bringing your insight and expertise from a design perspective.
• Extensive and thorough user research with the primary responsibility of bringing forward new findings and learning to influence design decisions.
• Conducting user testing to validate all design solutions.
• Producing high quality sketches, wireframes and mock-ups at various degrees of fidelity.
• Collaborating closely with development teams during the prototyping and building of UI components.
• Contributing to the wider design systems and practices at PortSwigger.

Essential Skills
• Strong technical background and knowledge - comfortable having highly technical conversations with developers and customers.
• Full-stack, cross-platform design experience, from discovery to design, through to building and delivering an exceptional product.
• Previous experience modernizing the design for a desktop application and understanding the challenges and opportunities that go with it.
• Ability to keep the customer at the heart of everything you do. Validating your ideas with data and customer research to build products that will delight the user.
• Exposure or experience with working in a cross-functional agile team solving complex user problems and evolving your design in rapid iterations to meet changing requirements.
• Experience using design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Axure, XD.
• Experience with moderating user testing and conducting interviews.
• Experience using user story techniques.
• A depth of hands-on experience with various UX methods such as empathy mapping or customer journey mapping.
• Good understanding of interaction design, including common UI patterns.
• Experience in creating user personas.
• A healthy understanding of accessibility standards.
• Proven ability to multi-task and deliver continuous, incremental value to the team.
• Self-motivate with the ability to adapt quickly, forming outstanding and innovative ideas.

Desirable Skills

Although not essential to the role, it would be beneficial to have some knowledge or interest in the following area:
• Cybersecurity - although direct experience with Application Security is not required - you'll learn quickly!

Benefits

Be well rewarded

We firmly believe in paying people what they're worth to us, not just what we can get away with or what they could earn elsewhere. We pay excellent salaries above the normal market level, and this is always determined based on your individual skills and contribution. In addition to a generous base salary, we offer share options and a comprehensive benefits package.

Salary: We pay excellent salaries above the normal market level, and this is always determined based on your individual skills and contribution.

Benefits: Share options, 8% employer pension contribution.

Life assurance: 4x salary.

Income protection: full pay for first 6 months of incapacity followed by 75% of salary plus pension contribution.

Private medical insurance: Bupa

Holidays: 25 days plus public holidays.

Working hours: Core hours are 9am to 5pm, with flexibility to start any time between 8am and 9.30am.

Why join PortSwigger web security?
• We like to have fun (why else would we make a product called Burp?).
• We are professional without being corporate.
• We encourage a positive work-life balance. We work hard but keep to a normal working day. We don't do stress.
• We offer a healthy, high-tech working environment. All our people work on the latest Macs, with dual monitors, sitting-standing desks, and (if they are so inclined) walking treadmills.
• We are a close-knit team. We have regular team lunches, evening social events, and amazing parties twice a year

title: REMOTE Product Designer (UX/UI)
description:
Product Designer (UX/UI)

obodo is a digital agency based in the UK and our fully remote team of Product Designers facilitate and launch our client MVP requirements in startups, scale-ups and established businesses alike. These are fast paced projects which are scoped out against a work diary designed & validated by industry design veterans and ourselves - with a successful client track record to match!

This laser focus on MVP sprints means we know how to set up our design team for success, meaning you will enjoy and learn whilst working with us and also deliver a complete, and rewarding product at the end.

If you’d like to learn more here are our requirements for Product Designers…

What we can offer you
• 100% remote and flexible work environment.
• Genuine variety of clients - in 2020 alone we’ve covered off health, education, automation and aerospace!
• Bullet proof project and sprint planning with an established work diary we’ve had vetted by external product designers and... creative veterans.
• You will be challenged and grow - we build products, not cookie cutter banners and pop-ups!
• Dedicated project manager from outside to help with any project queries as well as an Ops support team for any back-end questions you have.
• Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) from across ecommerce, aerospace and tech within our team can advise, mentor and help you develop as a product designer going ahead.

What we expect from our designers
• 4+ years as a UX/UI/Product Designer
• 1+ years of agency or freelancing (client-facing) experience or equivalent stakeholder management experience
• Experience working with startups (at least one launched product) - web and mobile
• Design degree (university or vocational)
• Comfortable with at least one of Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch. Interactive/clickable prototyping tools, etc.
• Deep understanding of design thinking, UX principles, modular/atomic and interaction design
• Must have user testing and research experience
• Solid project management skills
• Strong visual skills
• Desire to continuously learn
• Motivated by desire to build their own brand
• Ability to guide/mentor clients and other designers
• Highly organized

In addition to the above, we would like to see a well throughout portfolio illustrating your understanding of UX. Live examples of work are also good, although we appreciate these aren’t always available!

Fluent in oral and written English is a must have for this role.

Obodo focuses on Mobile, Healthcare, Marketplaces, Recruiting, and Freelancers. Their company has offices in Manchester. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://obodo.co.uk or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: Senior UX & UI Designer
description:

DeliveryApp is one of the fastest-growing technology start-ups in the UK aiming to revolutionise the logistics industry with time and cost-saving technology.

Our team is made up of passionate innovators who love to challenge sector conventions to find better solutions. title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Our client are a fast growth business.

As UX/UI Designer, you’ll work with stakeholders across the business to create and deliver user-centred designs and experiences on the company website and connected digital platforms.

Operating within an agile methodology, you will champion the value of user-centred design within the business and set the standards for every digital product that the business delivers and maintains.

Working in close collaboration with product owners, developers, analysts and marketeers, you’ll balance customer insight, business need and market understanding to deliver innovative products and features that customers love.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities:
• Deliver effective design assets such as prototypes, high-fidelity designs, personas, user flows and wireframes to support business deliverables
• Set and maintain the design standards for all digital experiences, whether delivered internally or via external parties
• Understand and advocate for the user... and design accessible products and services to meet their needs
• Plan and run design workshops and present your work back to business stakeholders
• Balance business rules and constraints with a user-centric approach
• Conduct competitor analysis and report on areas of improvement by using analytics and design rationale
• Validate your designs through a range of testing methods
• Work in close collaboration with graphic designers on the Marketing team to ensure a consistent approach between digital platforms and sales/marketing collateral
• Collaborate with other teams and specialisms, for example Optimisation & Insight, Development, Product Ownership and Content
• Work closely with the wider digital team and business to share knowledge, learn new skills, and design transformational services
• Champion user-centred design within the business

Qualifications

Essential:
• Proven track record as a UX/UI Designer
• Experience of using tools like Adobe XD and Photoshop
• A solid understanding of UX and UI principles, and WCAG accessibility standards
• Regulated experience needed i.e finance / education / law
• Experience working as part of an agile scrum team
• Effective organisation and stakeholder management skills
• Experience owning, and shaping, brand guidelines, design patterns and standard
• Experience of wireframing and user testing

Excellent package on offer

Salary: £45,000.00-£50,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Flexible schedule
• On-site parking

title: UX UI Designer
description:
We are looking for a talented UX UI Designer to join my client, a digital marketing and design agency based in Macclesfield, Cheshire East.

You will work closely with your squad (Front-End Developers, Back-End Developers, Creative Strategists, Graphic Designers, Project Managers and more team members) to produce high-quality, engaging, modern websites. title: IT UI/UX Designer
description:
Airswift is seeking applicants for the role of IT UI/UX Designer to join the team in the UK.

Role Description

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer to turn our software into easy-to-use products for our clients. UI/UX Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our client’s needs and help us grow our customer base.

Working closely with the business needs, as we embark on our Digital Transformation Journey within the Airswift business. Although based in the UK the post holder will work alongside global colleagues in supporting the business and would be expected to work across multiple time zones, on... a per-project basis. This position provides exposure to a broad range of IT-related projects and activities, and new technology introductions to the business.

Key Roles, Tasks and Responsibilities
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images

Person Specification

The successful candidate will have the following qualities
• A can-do attitude and positive outlook
• Ability to multitask and work under pressure
• Ability to think outside the box, and work with stakeholders to provide best-in-class design
• Ability to map time requirements to design timelines in order to meet release schedules
• Proven work experience in software development
• Takes ownership of challenges through to the conclusion
• A service and customer-centric approach
• Excellent analytical capabilities, research, problem-solving, and time management skills required.
• Ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Knowledge and Experience

To include but not limited to:
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Ability to drive discussion using wireframing
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software such as Figma
• Experience working with react libraries
• Strong verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, and the ability to build solid business relationships.
• Demonstrated ability to function in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities.
• Ability to handle and prioritise a varied and sometimes heavy workload.
• Proven experience in providing a high level of customer service

Qualifications/Skills
• Azure DevOps
• Experience working under AGILE / SCRUM development methodologies
• Experience working in a global environment
• BSC in Design, Computer Science or a relevant field

About Us

Airswift is the leading workforce solutions provider to the STEM industries. We have talented colleagues in over 60 global offices and 45 countries. We are a people business – we transform lives through the world of work. We care about mental health and wellbeing, community engagement and our planet – we plant a tree for every person placed in a job globally! We have a passion for growth, including investing in the development of our people.

What we can offer you!
• Attractive monthly base salary competitive commission/performance bonus.
• Genuine career progression opportunities, either locally or globally!
• World-class training programmes and development opportunities
• Virtual Onboarding Events exclusively for new hires.
• Team driven environment, supportive culture with a focus on work-life balance.
• Career breaks available after one year.
• Mental Health First Aiders to signpost you to support when you need it.
• Monthly Excellence Awards nominated by your peers.
• Quarterly roundtable with CEO for Excellence Award winners
• Yearly destination trips as part of our Highflyers program (Dubai, Buenos Aires, etc…)
• Charity days for various importance causes such as Relay for Life and Earth Day.

Our Core Values
• Growth - In life and business, one must grow to flourish and achieve high ambitions. Growthrequires change, challenge, risk and sacrifice - we will always choose growth.
• Safety - We create a safe and inclusive environment to protect the physical and psychological well-being of everyone we work with.
• Excellence - We deliver, holding ourselves accountable for results. Our customers see excellence in everything we do.
• Integrity - We are ethical, open, honest and authentic. People trust us to do the right thing for the right reason.

Visit our website and social medias to find out more! - www.airswift.com

Disclaimer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Airswift, we believe that diversity is critical to our sccess and makes us a great place to work. We are committed to building an equal opportunity workplace, the more inclusive we are - the better our work will be.

title: UX Designers
description:
About Us

Sharp Gaming is on an exciting journey and we need to add to our dynamic team of people so that we can continue to dominate the industry, delivering a seamless gaming experience that is a cut above the rest.

We are part of the Betfred family which means that we have the investment to innovate, drive advanced, creative technologies forward and to build unrivalled gaming experiences, but we also keep our freedom and independence. As a team we work fast, aim high, are focused and ambitious.

So, if you want to be part of something quite unique and drive the future of gaming, then it’s to time to join Sharp Gaming.

Job Purpose

We're growing our UX & Design team and we are looking for 3 UX Designers to become a key asset of the team, to carry out and deliver optimised wireframe solutions for front-end websites and apps to ensure the product surpasses customer's expectations.

Job Duties
• Independent & collaborative working with stakeholders for daily tasks and planning for... larger roadmaps.
• Applying your strong process-driven understanding of UX/UI to produce high-quality designs from scratch, creating concepts for new site features and enhancing existing areas of our digital platform. Ensuring it’s aligned with Betfred’s vision.
• Strong focus on the end-user and be data-driven to help improve customer conversion & retention.
• Responsibility of being a key member to help develop the design system that we deliver is scalable, maintained.
• Responsible for ensuring the technical teams are aligned with our design vision & objectives.
• Keeping up to date with new UI design techniques and UX processes, and reviewing how we can incorporate them into the design process.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience
• Strong level of written & verbal communication skills to communicate storytelling into designs and documents/presentations.
• Excellent organisation skills to ensure tasks are prioritised and maintained in an easy to understand and structured way.
• Comfortable to proactively speak in meetings, discussing changes or feedback.
• Able to work independently on daily tasks following UX/UI processes to ensure the final solution is best in practice and user-friendly.
• Sufficient knowledge and understanding of competitor analysis.
• Excellent attention to detail with strong UI visual skills.
• Ability to work to brand guidelines creating wireframes & designs to reflect Betfred’s brand.
• Excellent understanding of what works in a live environment such as understanding of how users will interact with devices and products.
• Efficiently working within design tools such as Sketch, Framer, Adobe CC, InVision.
• Strong understanding of how to design for multiple devices such as, mobile, tablet, desktop & native apps.
• Proven experience working either in an E-Commerce, Gambling, or fast passed growing industry. With the ability to understand how site traffic and conversion work.
• Have the ability to independently work, but also work closely with other team members when required.
• Strong portfolio demonstrating your UX process and UI design work.
• Exposure to analytic tools such as Google Analytics and Hotjar.
• Understanding of basic interaction design, such as animation & transitions.
• Understanding of user research with the confidence to collaborate in workshops.
• Exposure to CRO (Conversion Rate Optimisation) is beneficial but not required.

What is in it for me?
• Up to £55,000 per annum, depending on experience
• Work from home 3 days a week, 2 days in the office
• Flexi-time (start anywhere between 7.00am and 10am)
• Discretionary company bonus scheme
• Generous referral bonus
• 25 days holiday a year in addition to bank holidays
• Company Pension Scheme
• Employee Discount Scheme
• Free eye test vouchers
• Discounted Virgin Media offers
• Car scheme - reduced prices on a variety of brand new cars
• Enhanced Maternity & Paternity pay
• Bereavement leave
• Death in Service - Next of kin payment

title: UX Designer
description:
Job Title: UX Designer x2

Location: Handforth, Manchester / Hybrid (1 to 2 Days P/M)

Duration: 12 Months FTC

Role:

An exciting opportunity has arisen to join our rapidly expanding UX team in the role of UX Designer. As the UX Designer, you will form part of a decentralised UX team, working closely within an agile Product Squad to represent UX/UI Design best practice and application. With a keen eye for detail and a customer-driven focus in your approach, you will represent the UX team by putting our customers at the forefront of your design solutions, producing seamless friction-free journeys that drive impactful commercial and customer experience results.

Working closely alongside the Product Owner, you will champion and take accountability for ensuring that all proposed design/journey changes within your Product Squad are designed and prioritised with best practice UX/UI techniques in mind, and ensure that our customers are always at the forefront of any proposed... solution.

Your role will form part of a wider network of like-minded UX Designers, using a set of common processes and joined-up agile ways of working, following a test-and-learn evidence driven ethos to create easy to use intuitive user experiences that drive growth for our group digital teams.

Requirements:
• Commercial experience working within a UX/UI environment
• Ability to wireframe and prototype across desktop, mobile and tablet.
• A clear understanding and appreciation of design standards across the various screen formats.
• Prior experience of having worked within an Agile delivery framework.
• Skilled with Adobe Xd & Creative Cloud, Sketch or Figma
• Knowledge of InVision, Axure or Balsamiq
• Exposure Miro & Zeplin would be advantageous, but not essential.

title: UI Designer
description:
Apadmi prides itself on being one of the best mobile Digital Product Creation teams in the country. Our clients include the UK’s leading brands, and we get the chance to work with them and make a real difference.
Our design team is growing, so we’re looking for a Senior UI Designer who can create amazing new visual concepts and experiences that will delight our clients and their customers, and that are as innovative as they are impactful.You will be a senior and active member of the design team who has experience of working in agile teams and enjoys close collaboration with UX designers and developers - from idea to execution. You will be able to make deliberate design decisions and to translate any given user-experience journey into a smooth and intuitive interaction.
You’ll lead the UI for clients, so we’re after someone who’s with management experience and can direct junior designers as well as build great relationships with our customers. You’ll have a great portfolio of work... with proven mobile experience. You must have a passion for visual design – always in touch with the latest trends and looking for fresh inspiration.
You will:
• Lead the design of the full visual experience across the whole range of products we deliver
• Create high-level visual concepts that are as original as they are impactful,
• both hand sketches and in software tools
• Present to clients and colleagues, communicating and selling your ideas with confidence
• Work in close partnership with Senior UX Designer to create innovative and intuitive visual designs that meet user and product requirements
• Work with the UX designer to further develop wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flow and site maps where necessary.
• Work with the sales team to create high quality screen concepts that demonstrate to prospective clients initial ideas, how their brand can come to life within the context of the brief, and the calibre of Design at Apadmi.
• Design interactive prototypes that effectively explore and communicate process, interaction and design concepts.
• Produce high-quality visual designs in a variety of software tools that can be implemented by a development team.
• Analyse requirements and provide accurate estimates for the design phase of a project.
• Deliver design work on programs of any size with minimal oversight.
• Be experienced working in an agile/scrum development process.
• Give clear UI direction and helpful feedback to junior designers, to develop stronger designs and their careers

What you’ll need
• 4+ years of digital design experience, ideally in a digital agency or consultancy.
• A brilliant portfolio of UI designs, impactful and effective and with a significant number of mobile examples
• A passion for technology.
• Good knowledge of current official UI guidelines for mobile platforms.
• Expert in UI design software such as Figma and a good working knowledge of the primary Adobe apps (i.e. Photoshop, Illustrator and (to a lesser extent) After Effects).
• Knowledge of good UI design and interaction design practices and trends across multiple platforms, including web and mobile
• Experience of Scrum, SAFE, or other Agile principles.
• Good presentation skills
• Strong creative, organisational, problem solving and time-management skills.
• Must have been in client-facing roles and have project experience in working with teams on different projects.

Why work for Apadmi
• We are at the forefront of Digital Impact in the UK. We work with some of the brands, creating the future digital product solutions, and you will be able to look back and proudly say “I did that”.
• You will be surrounded by a team of experts, challenging yourself and others, to work with clients on solutions that will deliver real change and value.
• We offer an excellent remuneration package and excellent career progression prospects.
• We want to support you, so our life insurance, income protection scheme and group pension scheme are all included in our employee package.
• Not only that, we’re driven by your needs and your personal development. Together with your team leader, we’ll help you set objectives and track progress, whilst creating a personal development plan shaped around your needs and interests.
• Remote working has become the new normal for us at Apadmi, but should you wish to have a change of scenery, our custom-built Salford Quays office with free on-site parking provides a relaxed, socially distanced, environment to work in. Here you’ll find a fully stocked kitchen, a dozen state-of-the-art collaboration spaces and free-on-site secure parking.
• To maintain our sense of community across the business during the pandemic we have held company stand-ups every Friday and frequently welcome celebrity guest stars and run remote video tours. We’ve also continued to hold regular virtual social activities such as cocktail making classes, horse racing nights, bingo and quizzes – with lots of exciting real-life events planned for this summer!
• We also encourage you to get involved and get that feel-good-factor! We host weekly CrossFit sessions, group yoga and have sports teams to help you relax and make new friends within the Apadmi community

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
cinch is transforming the UK’s car buying experience. We’re taking one of the last industries to go digital and disrupting it with trailblazing tech and beautifully-simple customer experiences. Now as we accelerate from start-up to scale-up, we’re hiring talented, ambitious and passionate people to join us and drive our success.

Why join cinch? We’re dedicated to building and being a great technology business. Together, we’re creating a supportive, non-bureaucratic culture that is every bit as faff-free as our online customer experience, where communication is open, decisions are made quickly, and everybody has the freedom to bring in new ideas. Of course, working together doesn’t mean we’re in the same room every day. Our teams spend around 60% of their time working remotely – and that’s not going to change.
• The role *

Our business is built around good UX – but we give our UX team the autonomy and opportunity to get involved in the full lifecycle from user research through to... design. After all, making car buying faff-free depends on us creating simple, intuitive user-centric experiences. You’ll use a variety of methods and techniques to really get to know our target audience – their needs, their intentions, their dreams – and keep them front-of-mind throughout the design process. We’re not keen on ‘departments’ here – we work closely with people from different disciplines, sharing our specialist knowledge, exploring new ideas and collaborating to create best-in-class online experiences.

This is a challenging role - we’re taking a 100-year-old industry online for the first time. There are no right answers and no set processes to follow. You’ll need to think on your feet, stay creative and be open to trying, failing, and trying again. We are.
• The person *

Good UX is crucial at cinch. You’ll need a creative and innovative approach to iterative design, as well as a good understanding of lean principles. Sketching, wireframing, prototyping and UI design will all come naturally, as will the ability to present to and communicate with the wider team and senior stakeholders. You’ll need to be resilient, agile and confident enough to try new things and share big ideas.

We’re big on continuous learning, and we build Communities of Practice where our multi-talented teams can share ideas, kick the tyres on new technology and think differently. We’re moving fast, experimenting, learning and reinventing as we go. Can you keep up?

If you’re open to new ideas, you’re ready to collaborate, you’re ready to embrace new technologies - together, we’ll do great things. Apply now.

cinch focuses on Infrastructure, Automotive, Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence, and Product Design. Their company has offices in London, Manchester, and Hampshire. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.cinch.co.uk

title: UI Design Engineer
description:
The energy industry is undergoing the largest transformation since industrialisation at an unprecedented rate of change and we are positioning ourselves to be at the heart of that change.
Our aim is to be the leading global provider of solutions that enable customers release £30bn of value per annum from distributed energy resources (DERs). We are building a Software as a Service (SaaS) subscription business with a global addressable market of £2.4 billion per annum, by digitally connecting hundreds of thousands of DERs with energy markets.
We have already attained a market leading position and KrakenFlex is a recognised thought leader and innovator in the industry. Our efforts have not gone unnoticed and we are pleased to announce that we now have the full support and backing of Octopus Energy, an award-winning UK energy supplier who share our passion and values.
As we enter the stage of rapid commercialisation and customer growth we are now looking for an exceptional person to help... us improve our customer tools and dashboards, adding more interesting insights from huge amounts of data, and making them faster.
The KrakenFlex console is becoming an integral part of our system as we integrate with more and more customers so the UI Design Engineer is an important role within our organisation to help us migrate our legacy services to modern technologies & advise on best practices as we go along this journey.
What you'll do
Working with the Senior Frontend Engineer, enable the vision for our front-end codebase.
Champion best practices in coding standards.
Deliver customer facing features quickly and to a high standard.
Ensure best practices are adhered to.
Create quality mockups and prototypes.
Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies.
Collaborate across KrakenFlex to improve usability.
Get feedback from, and build solutions for, our wide range of users and customers.
Ensure high quality graphic standards and brand consistency.
Work day-to-day in a cross-functional team with different stakeholders (developers, PMs, users, clients) when designing new features and products.
You’ll be working closely with our communications team on building a new project and redesigning an existing platform.
Share designs for feedback early & often and give design critique.
Refining and adding to our design process documentation, and trying out new design processes with the team where possible
What you'll need
We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design.
Experience with Typescript
Experience with JavaScript frameworks, particularly React
Familiarity with browser testing and debugging (Jasmine, JEST)
Ability to write solid, semantic HTML and have experience writing SASS
Know how to develop websites that meet AAA accessibility guidelines.
Can take Photoshop/Sketch designs and bring them to life in codeIn-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)
Understanding of layout aesthetics
A proven ability to perform well in a rapidly changing agile environment.
Excellent analytical and multitasking skills
Design tools (Figma/Sketch/XD…) - Figma is our main design tool
Have at least 2 years of professional experience designing digital products
Working with Design Systems and component libraries
Being able to clearly communicate design decisions to team members and stakeholders
Attention to detail when designing, being precise and ensure something is done well rather than fast but poorly
Ability to focus on user needs and knowing how to improve usability/UX
Ideally you will be based in the Greater Manchester and happy to come into the office a couple of days per week! But we appreciate that things have changed and flexibility is at the top of everyone's agenda, so if you would rather be remote please let us know.
If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.
Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone

title: UX/UI Digital Designer
description:
UX/UI Digital Designer

Salary: £34,053 - £42,556 + 25 days hols + 8 bank holidays + employer pension contributions up to 10% of salary

Wider benefits include discretionary bonus, private health care, life assurance, enhanced maternity, and adoption packages (note: some are non-contractual).

Location: Bradford and hybrid work arrangement

At Yorkshire Water we believe technology holds the key to making the most of this precious resource, and taking care of it, now and in the future. We have a five-year plan that will see us investing heavily in our Technology. Enabling us as a department to focus on our capabilities, increase our delivery and responsiveness for our customers and develop skilled technical and data experts.

We are now looking for a UX/UI Digital Designer to join us on this journey, the purpose of your role will be to:
• Work alongside the digital development team to design sitemaps, wireframes and user journeys for new products and services 
• Monitor conversion and... designing A/B Multivariant tests on user journeys to increase on site conversion over several areas. Identifying, analysing, and creating market leading experiences  
• Collaborate effectively with business and technical teams balancing business requirements with what is right for our users 
• Effectively deliver measured improvements to our sites and applications and contribute to a UX roadmap. 
• Take the lead on large scale projects, and from concept to launch endeavour to deliver experiences our users want, can easily use, and remember using.  
• Continually look for areas of improvement from both detailed analytics, and own experience in UX using usability testing and designing with the user in mind. 
• Analyse and design user journeys, monitor performance and identify areas for improvement across all digital channels. 
• Looking to improve the design of the company's brand and enhance the digital experiences for customers 
• Utilise relevant software throughout the UX process from research, through to designing and testing
• Work with other UX designers to build design frameworks and share ideas.

What skills are we looking for?

Essential
• Strong understanding and practice of UX and design principles  
• Outstanding design and spatial skills to gauge the usability of the website or application 
• Knowledge of responsive design of desktop, mobile & web applications  
• Strong knowledge of User Research Techniques and User testing with Prototyping 
• Experience with raster and vector graphics  
• Good working knowledge of site-mapping and user journey plotting 
• Effective communication skills to liaise with team members and business stakeholders to ensure that high quality end-user designs meet customer requirements  
• An aptitude for using a logical, step-by-step approach to ensure designs are user friendly and simple for end users 
• A high level of concentration and resilience to stay focused on a project to the end and meet deadlines 
• Highly motivated and self-reliant with a personal drive for continuous development and demonstrates a strong customer service ethos. 
• Experience of developing and maintaining effective internal and external relationships within one or more technology disciplines. 
• Ability to demonstrate relentless drive, energy, and determination to deliver sustainable outperformance that rigorously achieves against demanding competitive industry benchmarks and metrics from other organisations. 
• Commercial awareness to support the technical preparation of RFPs (Request for Proposals), bid proposals and contracts for infrastructure projects and large scale or mission critical projects 
• Ability to prioritise and execute tasks in a dynamic, changing environment and make sound decisions in emergency situations. 
• Ability to absorb complex technical information and communicate effectively to all levels, for technical and non-technical audiences both written and oral communications. 
• Ability to develop and work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. 
• Ability to pick up and own issues or projects on behalf of the management team. 
• Strong organisation and personal management skills. 
• Ability to influence individuals and ensure completion of activities. 
• Possess a keen sense of purpose and proactively seek responsibility and ownership. 
• Creativity and lateral thinking. 
• Highly motivated and self-reliant with a personal drive for continuous development and demonstrates a strong customer service ethos. 
• Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. 
• High standards of integrity & ethics. 

Desirable
• Experience with JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, SASS and React
• Exposure of SEO principles (meta-data) to optimise page designs 
• Advanced Adobe Creative Suite skills  
• Previous experience in an operational and / or strategic leadership role in a commercially orientated and / or regulated environment. 
• Previous experience gained within the water or wastewater sectors or within the broader utilities, process, or manufacturing industry sectors. 

Although you will have a permanent friendly office to inspire collaborative thinking, and there may be occasions when there is a business need to attend the office we do offer flexible hybrid working arrangements. We appreciate that we all live busy lives and crave now more than ever a decent work/life balance, so together we can discuss what this might look like for you as an individual.

Apply now to find out what a career in tech with Yorkshire Water could offer you

title: UX Designer
description:
UX Designer - Manchester - Up to £55,000 - Gaming

The Candidate is recruiting for a UX Designer to join a well-funded, growing technology division of an industry-leading gambling group who operate in physical shops and online in Europe with an exciting scaling project underway in the USA.

Our client has spent the last few years and £30 million developing a new platform to accommodate their online business. With plans to scale their international products over the next 5+ years.

The platform accommodates products such as sports betting, gaming and player management with a consumer facing web and mobile apps and all the systems that make the business work.

They aspire to build and operate the sports gambling sector's best tech platform and have the full backing from their parent company. As the UX Designer you would be based in the Manchester office working with 150+ employees who enjoy a balance of time in the office and time working from home as after all this is the 'new... normal'!

A typical day to day as the UX Designer will be varied from collaborating with stakeholders for BAU activities to larger roadmaps as well as applying process driven understanding of UX/UI in order to produce the highest quality designs from scratch. You'll also create brand new concepts for brand new site features which will enhance customers digital experience of the platform. This role also has a strong focus on the end-user therefore ideally you are data-driven to aid conversion and retention rates.

Salary on offer up to £55K with companywide (performance based) annual bonus of 10%.

Key Responsibilities & Skills
• Strong communication and organisational skills
• Able to speak up in meetings and when discussing changes/feedback
• Able to work independently on BAU tasks to ensure best practise is delivered and that its user friendly
• Fantastic attention to details with strong UI visual skills
• Work to brand guidelines creative wireframes to reflect brand identity
• Efficiently work with design tools such as Sketch, Framer, Adobe, InVision (or any others!)
• Understanding of how to design for various devices (tablet, mobile, desktop and native apps)
• Understanding of user research and therefore able to collaborate in workshops
• Any exposure to analytics tools and CRO is beneficial but not essential

What's in it for you?
• Salary up to 55k
• 25 days holiday + bank holidays
• Hybrid working model with 2 days in the Manchester office with the rest working from home
• 10% annual bonus (based on company performance)
• Free eye tests
• Discounted home broadband/internet/TV packages
• Reduced prices on new cars
• Enhanced maternity/paternity leave
• Great progression opportunities in a fast-growing company

Apply now to be considered for this fantastic opportunity!

Please note due to high volumes of applications unfortunately we are not always able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants. However we wish everyone who applies the very best with their job search

title: Principal UI Designer
description:
Matillion is building the next-generation Data Operating System. The Principal UI Designer is responsible for making user interactions with the product second to none, empowering our customers to achieve their goals with delight. Working alongside the Director or User Experience in close collaboration with Principal UX Designers and Product Marketing Managers, you’ll establish a resonant, evolving vision of the future and a strategy to realise it.

As the go-to person for all things UI, you’ll lead the way towards UI and visual design excellence. By establishing and continuously improving principles that encompass interface, interaction, visual and animation design in accordance with the validated needs of our customers, you’ll empower the end-end UX Designers building the products of tomorrow with an informed strategy for us to carry out together.

You will own the continued creation of the Matillion Design System and work with the Platform UI team to build a pattern library, which... will include creative direction in building out a visual language that creates distinctive and memorable brand experiences across the Matillion product suite.

A key part of this role is ensuring that first-class UI Design happens invariably, constantly striving for better — inspiring, mentoring and coaching UX team members and the wider business, eventually building out and leading a team of UI Designers.

What you will be doing

-Set and expand the vision and strategy for UI across the Matillion product suite

-Work with Principal UX Designers to define the vision and milestones for UI as part of the UX strategy

-Work with Product Marketing to form strong narratives — defining unifying product and UX principles that strongly resonate with the customers of today and tomorrow

-Devise, instigate and lead market/trend analysis and research initiatives to uncover and validate UI design opportunities

-Attain alignment and strategic adoption by regularly communicating out the vision for UI business

-Collaboratively realise the vision for Matillion’s UI future

-Support and align the outputs of UX Designers in individual product areas — forming a consistent, coherent omnichannel

-Cultivate a comprehensive Design System that allows efficient, consistent UX/UI Design to take place at scale

-Participate in user research activities to optimise extendable components and pattern

-Work with the Platform UI team (Front End Engineers) to build out a Pattern Library that promotes consistent and accessible foundations for product teams to build upon + enables repeatable solutions to be rapidly engineered and tested

-Provide mentoring and coaching end-end UX Designers to deliver UI that meets defined standards as part of a collaborative (non-waterfall) effort.

-Support non-UX Designers to bring visual coherence to the customer experience outside of the Matillion product suite (brand, web, marketing, video, events collateral)

What we are looking for
• 6+ years UI experience (or you’re really good)
• Experience in Principal / Lead / Senior roles
• Experience creating / contributing to / maintaining design systems
• Experience designing software products — ideally SaaS
• Experience mentoring other designers / non-designers
• Proven skills in user research techniques
• Proven skills in ideation, sketching, wireframing, user flows, information architecture and visual/UI design
• Fluency with modern UI and animation tools such as Figma, Sketch, Principle, After Effects etc.
• Understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and their limitations (no we don’t want you to code

title: Head of Design (UI)
description:
Head of Design (UI)
£65,000
Manchester / Hybrid
M1

Head of Design / Digital Agency / Hybrid Working / Huge Scope Projects / International Clients and Brands / Flexible Working / 25 days Holidays / Private Healthcare / Social Budgets - Trips Away

We're working with one of the World's fastest growing, award winning digital agencies, providing their expansive client list with a full range of creative and digital solutions from full scale, huge budget ecommerce websites to digital marketing, brand experience and pioneering technology solutions. With offices across Europe and the US, they are an employee focussed, innovative and thought provoking agency with plans to continue their growth.

As part of this growth, they are looking for a Head of Design for their Manchester-based Design and Technology team. The role is to lead and grow the creative offering and to make it a number 1 design destination for clients in the UK.

As the Head of Design, you will work alongside the Head of UX to... craft award-winning digital experiences and intuitive interfaces. You'll challenge the status quo, bringing new thinking and approaches to the agencies work. You'll have the opportunity to work with both enterprise-level and SME organisations, delivering both B2B and B2C digital experiences across a range of platforms. This is a great opportunity for a talented design professional to step up their experience working with international brands in a fast-moving environment.

The Head of Design will be responsible for the creative output of the department and work with the managing directors to shape the design team's processes and approaches. This will involve reviewing team software and methods frequently to improve efficiency and stay up-to-date with developments in the industry. In addition to supporting new business opportunities, identifying skills gaps, training needs and recruitment opportunities.

You will act as a coach, mentor and leader, ensuring all the design team members are supported in their progress and development, identifying the right projects to help each team member grow and develop. You will inspire creativity and pride amongst the team, ensuring the department's creative reputation thrives and develops under your stewardship.

The Head of Design will work in a vibrant environment with clever minds that work for a variety of large global clients. The agency is eager to hire the most talented experts in the game; people who continuously strive to improve their craft, are eager to learn, who want to inspire others, and strive for a better World.

You will:

- Have at least 6 years of experience working in a similar role (preferably within an agency)

- Can establish, lead and guide a design department

- Have experience in all stages of the design process, from discovery through to execution

- Are passionate about design and ready to take any project to the next level

- Manage time efficiently and are capable of overseeing multiple billable projects simultaneously

- Have excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills

- Are able to think quickly on your feet and come up with creative ideas that help define a project's creative direction

- Can successfully critique designers' work in order to get the best results

- Are industry aware, always on the lookout for fresh approaches to engage and motivate your team, creating a positive team culture

- Experience working in an agile environment using Digital Experience Platforms (DXPs), Design Systems, Digital Patterns and Interactions is preferred.

On Offer:

- Possibilities to do what you do best and to develop your skills further with training, development and certifications

- An excellent salary based on experience and equal pay policies

- Flexible working, with a few days a week of working from home

- Pension, free private healthcare, mental health support, and company sick pay scheme

- 25 days paid holiday with the opportunity to buy extra days

- Annual social budget which is used for team events (think virtual escape rooms or a gaming competitions), as well as away-days, and meals out

This truly is a unique and rare opportunity to challenge yourself as a creative leader, push the boundries of what other agencies can only dream of, work on projects with budgets that have upwards of a £1M and really impact the agencies clients with unique and pioneering digital work. If this sounds like just the opportunity that you've been looking for then don't hesitate to get in touch

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
We are a digital product studio based in Shropshire, UK.

We are our people. If you have a genuine love for all things digital design, are keen to take on a mix of design challenges and are comfortable working in a fast-paced studio environment, we want to hear from you. We’re ideally looking for a middleweight or above, but if you're a talented junior, be bold. Join our established, innovative, fast-moving digital product studio.

We’re looking for a UI/UX designer to join our team. You have exceptional design skills generally, with the ability to create innovative interfaces for digital products.

You've got
• A creative portfolio
• Preferably 2+ years of commercial experience
• Proficient using Figma and the adobe suite
• A focus on creative web and mobile design
• A passion for UI/UX design and testing
• An understanding of technical constraints and possibilities
• A positive attitude to self-learning
• A team player nature

Our projects

Our projects typically fall into three... areas:

Digital products – web applications and mobile apps - This will be your core area.

Design-led websites – visually beautiful websites

Product development/research – concept development, emerging design trends and user testing

You’ll be working in a sociable, open-plan Shrewsbury office when we're not on lockdown, with a supportive development team in a great culture.

About the company

We're an established digital product studio, working on an eclectic mix of custom web applications and apps for clients all over the world. From start-ups to international brands like Sony, Volvo, Tesco and Volkswagen Group.

In addition to our client work, we also have several in-house digital projects and are building our own SaaS platform.

We invest in your career development with the tools, kit and learning opportunities you need to be the best developer and team member you can be.

Role

As a mid - senior-level designer, you’ll be working with an experienced, close-knit team of strategists, creatives and developers who learn and grow together.

You’ll be involved in every part of the design process, including strategy sessions with clients, idea development, building wireframes and prototypes, designing interfaces and working with our developers on final delivery.

Beyond the basics – typography, interaction and human-centred design – the thing we’re looking for most is the ability to deliver elegant, innovative, pixel-perfect interface designs that will set our clients' products above the rest.

Most of your work will be on greenfield web application projects for clients, designing brands and products from the ground up. The rest of your time will be spent visualising new features for existing applications and mobile apps, including our in-house web platforms, and curating our profile across our communications, social and website.

Salary and benefits: Our remuneration package includes a competitive salary and above-law benefits, including 32 paid days off per year (*plus your birthday!) and a great company pension. And of course, bean-to-cup coffee and a stocked kitchen will keep you fuelled while you work side-by-side with other talented, committed, enthusiastic members of a growing team.

Attitude

The ideal person in this role will match the values of our existing team; smart and quick to use your initiative, with a lot of drive, a natural love of development and good-natured when working in a team.

You’ll be happy to share your opinions and experience, suggest solutions to challenges and support others. You’ll be keen to learn new methods and tools; develop your skills and master your craft in a supportive environment. You’ll be happy to work hard in a team, determined to do the best you can to make sure the project journey is enjoyable for everyone involved

Role Requirements and Responsibilities

The job

You’ll get to:
• Be part of a talented, supportive, dynamic Agile Scrum team
• Analyse design briefs, user needs, and business requirements
• Design and maintain design systems
• Create amazing digital UI designs for digital products and design-led websites
• Build wireframes, screen flows, and user journeys
• Use prototyping tools to convey movement and functionality of concepts
• Facilitate and participate in workshops and discussions to promote the communication of ideas
• Work with developers for handover and design review
• Participate in design research, user research and validation testing
• Participate in the communication of your work to the client
• Work within and respect a client’s brand but also adapt and evolve it to current digital standards.
• Work on multiple projects simultaneously
• Work on a large variety of different projects in a wide range of industries
• Bring systems thinking in order to create robust design systems that can scale effectively

Bonus points if you have experience in:
• Branding
• Interaction design
• Digital graphic design
• User research
• Usability testing
• Working knowledge of HTML / CSS

What you bring to our team:
• A passion for learning
• An openness to share knowledge with others
• A natural curiosity for new trends
• Willingness to pick up the phone with our clients and take part in meetings
• Comfort with lean design processes and iterative prototyping using common design software
• Comfort when conveying ideas and breaking down concepts clearly to a diverse range of stakeholders (verbally and written).
• An ability to work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams of designers, developers and product managers using Agile and Lean principles
• Original thinking, strong design practice and advocating for the user
• Holistic thinking about the big picture when designing a product, whilst being detail-oriented and delivery-focused.
• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
• A desire for opportunities to learn, advocating good feedback with those who you work with

Must-haves
• English language fluency
• References for your accomplishments as a designer

Environment

The studio is based in the town centre of Shrewsbury, one of the finest market towns in England. Lockdown has proven how well we work remotely, and so we're open to applications from those who would prefer to work remotely, as well as those who love the energy of working with a team in an open-plan office.

We provide an open, friendly and collaborative working environment, where teammates solve challenges together, share knowledge, and present to each other on emerging trends in technology, software engineering and self-development.

Culture

Dress: We dress how we like in the studio - it’s important that we all feel comfortable while we work - and only brush up for meetings and if we have a client visiting.

Flexibility: Outside of lockdowns, we work together as a team in the studio most days. We’ve learnt to be flexible over lockdown, so don’t mind if you want to work from home occasionally.

Location: We’re a 5-minute walk from the centre of Shrewsbury, just across the river, by the Theatre and right next to Frankwell car park, which means you’ll always find it easy to get into work. A couple of our team members cycle, and there are also bike racks in the studio.

Remote working for this role is also an option. Ideally, you'd live close enough to join the studio for the odd team event, but it's not essential, as long as you're in our timezone so you can work in sync with the rest of the team.

Our values

Our success starts and ends with our team. We aim to inspire our people and provide a connection to how what we do has a larger impact on our clients, their teams, and their communities.

We’re a growing, supportive and collaborative team, working together to build exciting and innovative projects. The great thing about joining a company like us is that there are lots of opportunities to learn, and directions for your career to grow, which will depend on your interests, where you excel and what you aspire to be.

Our core values guide and influence everything we do:
• Comradery - We are in it together and have the good of the company, our clients and the wider community at heart;
• Mastery - We aim to reach the highest standards, personally and professionally and share knowledge to create an environment of learning and growth;
• Adventure - We push outside of our comfort zone with curiosity, explore what’s possible and enjoy the ride;
• All-in - We are confident in the decisions we make, and committed to seeing through projects to a successful outcome.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Flexitime
• On-site parking
• Work from home

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Shrewsbury, SY3 8RJ: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:
• UX Design: 1 year (preferred)

Work Location: One location

title: UX Designer
description:
Summary Tripsdesign&ux Tripsrides

In the Rides group, we craft the ground transportation experience for Booking. This design role in the Rides Booking experience will focus on helping our customers get around during their trip.

Helping them find and book transport options that best fit their needs.

We collaborate closely with our colleagues across the Trips & Accommodation Business Unit to ensure our customers receive a joined up experience no matter what Booking product they book.

We’re looking for an experienced designer who has :

Great eye for detail and applying this to their designs and prototypes
• Whilst we need someone autonomous, we also need a strong communicator who has great collaboration skills with other designers and disciplines
• Confident with running design research and presenting this back to a variety of stakeholders
• Experience in the use of Design Systems
• Experience with responsive web design
• Experience with App design is a bonus but not necessary
•... Strong stakeholder management in and outside of your immediate teams

Responsible for understanding the needs and constraints of the user, the business, and the technical implementation, and applying their craft to create the most practical solutions to achieve the teams and businesses goals.

Work directly in a team within their subject area to define and execute the design details and make our products and services useful, usable, and desirable through holistic, transparent, and accessible means.

Produce innovative and comprehensively-detailed designs in order to drive the execution while ensuring their ideas are clearly understood by others through collaboration, testing and documentation.

They ensure that design guidelines and best practices are applied. Works with product and engineering to ensure content is accurately portrayed.

Responsibility :
• Effectively utilises a variety of research and data to better understand and design for user needs and to inform design decisions, validate hypotheses and document insights.
• Seeks out timely feedback and critique as fuel to improve design solutions and strategy; proactively seeks out collaboration and co-design opportunities in order to provide well-rounded user experiences and shows willingness to iterate to define and refine solutions.
• Creates high-quality design assets and solutions for their team and track to improve the overarching user experience, usability and accessibility of the product(s).
• Acts consistently as an advocate for end user needs and perspectives in product area discussions, reviews, and critiques.
• Demonstrates applied understanding of Booking's brand standards and design systems, principles and guidelines and applies them in their work.
• Has knowledge of prototyping tools or prototyping environments and web coding languages such as HTML, CSS, etc where relevant to implement their solutions within the scope of their team.
• Communicates effectively, candidly, collaboratively and constructively so that team objectives are met and rapport and trust are established.

Knowledge and Skills
• 3 - 5 years of relevant experience designing for digital products / native mobile apps
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
• Basic knowledge about CSS / HTML
• Solution oriented and result driven
• Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
• Good communication and analytical skills
• Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude
• A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skills, a case study or two which illustrate challenges, methods, roles, and outcomes.
• Bachelor’s degree a plus.
• Language : English

Pre-Employment Screening :

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law.

Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position
