This is a predominantly remote role however occasional travel to the Manchester site may be required.The successful UI/UX Designer will help turn the organisation's software into easy-to-use products for clients. UI/UX Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, this is ideal. Ultimately, you'll be creating both functional and appealing features that address client needs and help grow the customer base.The organisation is about to embark on a Digital Transformation Journey so, although based in the UK, the post holder will work alongside global colleagues in supporting the business... and would be expected to work across multiple time zones, on a per-project basis.
Key Roles, Tasks and Responsibilities* Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers* Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps* Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets* Build page navigation buttons and search fields* Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like* Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)* Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders* Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)* Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback* Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and imagesKnowledge and Experience* Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role* Portfolio of design projects* Ability to drive discussion using wireframing* Up-to-date knowledge of design software such as Figma* Experience of working with react libraries* Strong verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, and the ability to build solid business relationships.* Demonstrated ability to function in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities.* Ability to handle and prioritise a varied and sometimes heavy workload.* Proven experience in providing a high level of customer service
Qualifications/Skills* Azure DevOps* Experience of working under AGILE / SCRUM development methodologies* Experience of working in a global environment* BSC in Design, Computer Science or relevant field
Person Specification* Ability to multitask and work under pressure* Ability to map time requirements to design timelines in order to meet release schedules* Proven work experience in software development* Takes ownership of challenges through to conclusion* A service and customer-centric approach* Excellent analytical capabilities, research, problem-solving, and time management skills required.* Ability to work effectively in a team environment

title: UX Designer
description:
Summary Tripsdesign&ux Tripsrides
In the Rides group, we craft the ground transportation experience for Booking.com. This design role in the Rides Booking experience will focus on helping our customers get around during their trip. Helping them find and book transport options that best fit their needs.
We collaborate closely with our colleagues across the Trips & Accommodation Business Unit to ensure our customers receive a joined up experience no matter what Booking.com product they book.
We’re looking for an experienced designer who has:
Great eye for detail and applying this to their designs and prototypes
Whilst we need someone autonomous, we also need a strong communicator who has great collaboration skills with other designers and disciplines
Confident with running design research and presenting this back to a variety of stakeholders
Experience in the use of Design Systems
Experience with responsive web design
Experience with App design is a bonus but not necessary
Strong... stakeholder management in and outside of your immediate teams
Responsible for understanding the needs and constraints of the user, the business, and the technical implementation, and applying their craft to create the most practical solutions to achieve the teams and businesses goals. Work directly in a team within their subject area to define and execute the design details and make our products and services useful, usable, and desirable through holistic, transparent, and accessible means. Produce innovative and comprehensively-detailed designs in order to drive the execution while ensuring their ideas are clearly understood by others through collaboration, testing and documentation. They ensure that design guidelines and best practices are applied. Works with product and engineering to ensure content is accurately portrayed.
Responsibility:
Effectively utilises a variety of research and data to better understand and design for user needs and to inform design decisions, validate hypotheses and document insights.
Seeks out timely feedback and critique as fuel to improve design solutions and strategy; proactively seeks out collaboration and co-design opportunities in order to provide well-rounded user experiences and shows willingness to iterate to define and refine solutions.
Creates high-quality design assets and solutions for their team and track to improve the overarching user experience, usability and accessibility of the product(s).
Acts consistently as an advocate for end user needs and perspectives in product area discussions, reviews, and critiques.
Demonstrates applied understanding of Booking's brand standards and design systems, principles and guidelines and applies them in their work.
Has knowledge of prototyping tools or prototyping environments and web coding languages such as HTML, CSS, etc where relevant to implement their solutions within the scope of their team.
Communicates effectively, candidly, collaboratively and constructively so that team objectives are met and rapport and trust are established.
Knowledge and Skills
3 - 5 years of relevant experience designing for digital products / native mobile apps
Strong interpersonal skills
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Basic knowledge about CSS / HTML
Solution oriented and result driven
Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
Good communication and analytical skills
Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude
A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skills, a case study or two which illustrate challenges, methods, roles, and outcomes.
Bachelor’s degree a plus.
Language: English
Pre- Employment Screening:
If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.
This employer is a corporate member of
myGwork - LGBTQ+ professionals, the business community for LGBTQ+ professionals,
students, inclusive employers & anyone who believes in workplace equality

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Apadmi prides itself on being one of the best mobile Digital Product Creation teams in the country. Our clients include the UK’s leading brands, and we get the chance to work with them and make a real difference.

Our design team is growing, so we’re looking for a Senior UI Designer who can create amazing new visual concepts and experiences that will delight our clients and their customers, and that are as innovative as they are impactful.

You will be a senior and active member of the design team who has experience of working in agile teams and enjoys close collaboration with UX designers and developers - from idea to execution. You will be able to make deliberate design decisions and to translate any given user-experience journey into a smooth and intuitive interaction.

You’ll lead the UI for clients, so we’re after someone who’s with management experience and can direct junior designers as well as build great relationships with our customers. You’ll have a great portfolio of work... with proven mobile experience. You must have a passion for visual design – always in touch with the latest trends and looking for fresh inspiration.

You will:
• Lead the design of the full visual experience across the whole range of products we deliver
• Create high-level visual concepts that are as original as they are impactful,
both hand sketches and in software tools
• Present to clients and colleagues, communicating and selling your ideas with confidence
• Work in close partnership with Senior UX Designer to create innovative and intuitive visual designs that meet user and product requirements
• Work with the UX designer to further develop wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flow and site maps where necessary.
• Work with the sales team to create high quality screen concepts that demonstrate to prospective clients initial ideas, how their brand can come to life within the context of the brief, and the calibre of Design at Apadmi.
• Design interactive prototypes that effectively explore and communicate process, interaction and design concepts.
• Produce high-quality visual designs in a variety of software tools that can be implemented by a development team.
• Analyse requirements and provide accurate estimates for the design phase of a project.
• Deliver design work on programs of any size with minimal oversight.
• Be experienced working in an agile/scrum development process.
• Give clear UI direction and helpful feedback to junior designers, to develop stronger designs and their careers

What you’ll need
• 4+ years of digital design experience, ideally in a digital agency or consultancy.
• A brilliant portfolio of UI designs, impactful and effective and with a significant number of mobile examples
• A passion for technology.
• Good knowledge of current official UI guidelines for mobile platforms.
• Expert in UI design software such as Figma and a good working knowledge of the primary Adobe apps (i.e. Photoshop, Illustrator and (to a lesser extent) After Effects).
• Knowledge of good UI design and interaction design practices and trends across multiple platforms, including web and mobile
• Experience of Scrum, SAFE, or other Agile principles.
• Good presentation skills
• Strong creative, organisational, problem solving and time-management skills.
• Must have been in client-facing roles and have project experience in working with teams on different projects.

Why work for Apadmi
• We are at the forefront of Digital Impact in the UK. We work with some of the brands, creating the future digital product solutions, and you will be able to look back and proudly say “I did that”.
• You will be surrounded by a team of experts, challenging yourself and others, to work with clients on solutions that will deliver real change and value.
• We offer an excellent remuneration package and excellent career progression prospects.
• We want to support you, so our life insurance, income protection scheme and group pension scheme are all included in our employee package.
• Not only that, we’re driven by your needs and your personal development. Together with your team leader, we’ll help you set objectives and track progress, whilst creating a personal development plan shaped around your needs and interests.
• Remote working has become the new normal for us at Apadmi, but should you wish to have a change of scenery, our custom-built Salford Quays office with free on-site parking provides a relaxed, socially distanced, environment to work in. Here you’ll find a fully stocked kitchen, a dozen state-of-the-art collaboration spaces and free-on-site secure parking.
• To maintain our sense of community across the business during the pandemic we have held company stand-ups every Friday and frequently welcome celebrity guest stars and run remote video tours. We’ve also continued to hold regular virtual social activities such as cocktail making classes, horse racing nights, bingo and quizzes – with lots of exciting real-life events planned for this summer!
• We also encourage you to get involved and get that feel-good-factor! We host weekly CrossFit sessions, group yoga and have sports teams to help you relax and make new friends within the Apadmi community

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
Help us with redesigning the navigation on our Website
Numberfit is a social enterprise that works to make Maths learning fun and engaging for children across all age groups. We are looking to grow our reach, and with this our team.

We would like the volunteer to work with us to redesign and simplify our existing website, creating a clear and enjoyable user journey.

Develop mock-ups for our development and design teams.

You will be working in the Design team, where visual assets such as the Numberfit logo will be provided to you. You will also work with the lead developer, who oversees administration of the Numberfit website on Wordpress and the development of web applications across Numberfit products.
With your help we will be able to launch a new website that showcases our programmes and their... impact, and helps us continue raising the profile of mathematics, enjoyable learning and children's wellbeing

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You'll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren't always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

A proficient use of Figma

A background of digital product experience

A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
• Are you an experienced UI / UX Designer who crafts delightful web interfaces, designs and prototypes new and innovative experiences, as well as implementing features while advocating for UX?
• Would you like to tackle new and exciting challenges to empower Developers to build responsive and flexible Cloud, Mobile and Edge Computing Applications that scale effortlessly?

If you’ve answered yes to the above and are looking for the next challenge in your career as a Senior UI / UX Designer, then this might be the perfect opportunity for you.

Senior UI / UX Designer
Javascript / Typescript / HTML / CSS / UI Frameworks
• Whilst our customer has a fantastic office in Central Manchester and have created an exceptional working environment there, there could be flexibility for home-working for this opportunity.

Due to our customer's ongoing successes and growth, we are currently searching for an experienced and enthusiastic Senior UI / UX Designer to join their expanding team. Working with... market-leading products, you'll work with user empathy to deliver eye-catching web interfaces, designs and prototypes for new and innovative experiences. Our customer tackles new and exciting challenges on a daily basis, seeking to empower Developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Our customer delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments.

Some anticipated targets and timeframes for this role would include:
• during first three months, you’ll have successfully collaborated with the team to deliver a material contribution, contributed to code reviews and fed into technical discussion.
• within six months, you’ll have earned the trust of the team and are will actively collaborate on the design of new features.
• within the first year, you'll be regularly delivering tasks through the entire SDLC and will have established a cadence of timely delivery, without cutting corners.

We believe that the Senior UI / UX Designer joining the team will be responsible for the following:
• ship code on a regular basis.
• be experimental.
• learn new skills and work with modern technologies.
• collaborate with a similarly forward-thinking group of Front-End Engineers on technical decisions.
• improve engineering standards, tooling and processes.
• maintain code quality with unit tests and support delivery of automated integration and E2E tests.
• work closely with UX Designers, Quality teams, Product Managers and Systems Engineers to build, iterate and ship new features to enhance the user experience for our industry leading solutions.

This is an exceptional opportunity to join rapidly growing team and business, to play a critical part in a team of UI / UX Designers in crafting first-class solutions. We’re hiring now, so to find out more, or if you’re a Senior UI / UX Designer and would like further details to assess if this might indeed be the right role for you, please click ‘Apply' now or contact Ieuan Savage for more details.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
About the Role:

We’re on a mission to make buying and selling cars an easy and straightforward process. As a Senior UX Designer, you will be key to enabling this for the thousands of retailers that use our applications and sites each month. Working day-to-day with developers, user researchers and product managers you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from discovery through to delivery.

Your role will involve taking responsibility for product design within a cross-functional team, continuously improving our experiences and building continuity across web and mobile apps.

You’ll be working with product managers, engineers, and researchers to guide our products through both discovery and iterative delivery tracks, contributing strongly to the full lifecycle of design. This would include running and participating in design workshops and sprints as well as designing, prototyping and testing ideas with your team and in more formal testing... environments.

Working alongside the rest of your team you’ll be playing a key part of decision making throughout the product lifecycle: articulating when and where design thinking and design craft are needed and communicating the value of each. You’ll also play a key role in influencing, persuading, and evangelising our design system and user experience design within your product team and the wider design team.

We are a very data-driven company at heart, so while working at pace you’ll have the confidence to make decisions, knowing when to use qualitative or quantitative data and when it’s acceptable to rely on your knowledge and experience. Our work requires us to be flexible so you’ll be able to switch from high level, big picture thinking to the detail of user stories and UI designs.

Our collaborative approach is key to our success, so as part of the broader design team you’ll be learning from and helping others, identifying and implementing improvements to the way we work. We’d want you to give and welcome feedback and critique from other team members and designers to help encourage personal and professional growth. As a Senior Designer, you’ll also help coach and mentor more junior designers or colleagues in other roles.

What We're Looking For:

Experience with end-to-end UX/product design in a commercial environment - including scoping, researching, prototyping and testing.
Experience in designing digital products for a B2B audience.
Comfortable working closely with developers & testers to bring products to life.
Experience with user testing/research and using data to define outcomes and measure improvements.
Experience in interaction design work, sketches, storyboards, prototypes, and visual design. We would be interested in seeing examples of these in your portfolio.
Appreciation of front-end development technologies.
Good communication & influencing skills, and the ability to synthesise different perspectives.
Although not a requirement, useful experience includes:

Experience of working with design systems.
In house/client-side experience.

Benefits and more:

We offer a competitive salary plus private healthcare, 28 days holiday, plus half-day office closures on both Christmas and New Year's Eve, pension and lots of extras that you can personalise to suit your lifestyle.

Our hybrid working model, Connected Working, gives you various options, including combining office with home working and flexible start and finish times.

To help you get the best out of the working week, we’ve split it into fixed, flex and focus days. Everybody has two fixed office days with their team, a flex day where you decide the day you come in, and two focus days which can be spent at home or in the office. Find out more about Connected Working here, or speak to a member of our resourcing team

title: Junior UX​/UI Designer
description:
Junior UX/UI Designer | SaaS/Sporting industry | Up to £35,000 (DOE) | Hybrid (2 days in the office) | Warrington
This is an opportunity to join a SaaS company that specialise in building mobile applications for Healthtech and Sportstech.
As the UX Designer you will be responsible for the user experience for all mobile applications, across the full product lifecycle (with accessibility being front.)

The Role:

The role within this SaaS will involve working closely with stakeholders and high profile brands to create seamless and eye catching designs that drive User Experience.
You and your team will be responsible for the design process of a variety of high-profile collaborations, ultimately giving you free creative reign over concept and seeing it through to completion - a real chance to take ownership of your work and create beautiful and seamless UX/UI across a range of brands.

You will work cohesively with mobile developers on a daily basis to guarantee your projects are built to... exceptional standards. The importance of establishing a level of consistency within the brand will be key, whilst maintaining strong working relationships with your colleagues and an evolving clientele.
This is the perfect chance to develop and action a refined level of design methodology and create a high standard of work that you can be super proud of!

Skills:

Strong Visual Design
Adobe Creative Suite
Figma/Sketch
UI/UX Experience
Wire framing/ Prototyping
Mobile Design experience
The Company:
A SaaS company specialising in building mobile applications for Health and sport tech which has grown exponentially in recent times due to their 'people first' attitude and huge collaborations.
Their state of the art office in Warrington is easily accessible by public transport links. Hybrid working is prioritised, you will have the flexibility to define what way of working suits your lifestyle.
They value honesty and integrity and take pride in creating an enjoyable and vibrant social working culture. They have a tight-knit team in place and retain their staff by focusing on personal development and internal growth.
Apply now!
This is a company that really values their people and is a great place for a junior UX/UI Designer to really make their mark in the industry.
Click "apply now" to be considered immediately!
Junior UX/UI Designer | SaaS/Sporting industry | Up to £35,000 (DOE) | Hybrid (2 days in the office) | Warrington

title: UK Product Design (UX/UI) Intern - Summer 2023
description:
Mark43 is approved to hire in 27 states, including AL, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WV, and WI. Mark43 is approved to hire in the United Kingdom. Before applying to a remote role, please ensure that you are able to perform the position in one of the states or countries listed above. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.

Mark43's mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new design standard for the tools our first responders rely on.

Come join our design team as a remote paid intern, and learn what it's like to design software for police officers, detectives, and 911 dispatchers. You'll be working not only with award-winning designers, but also directly with some of the... industry's best product managers and engineers. The intern projects at Mark43 are real problems we need solved and have in the past included: a real-time map for dispatchers to keep track of first responders on the street, a dark mode color theme to keep first responders safe at night, and a command line feature to control our dispatch software. Get ready to be challenged and grow!

We are primarily looking for students graduating in the Spring/Summer of 2024. Our internship program will be running from June 6th, 2023 - September 1st, 2023.

What You Can Expect To Achieve
• Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of designers, product managers, and engineers.
• Work on complex, challenging, and meaningful projects.
• Practice accessible and inclusive design.
• Practice design techniques and processes (user research/product testing, flow diagramming, wireframing, prototyping, graphic design, etc.).

What We Expect From You
• Solid grasp of design fundamentals (layout, hierarchy, typography, common UI patterns)
• Self-motivated (we love side projects), detail oriented, and committed to quality
• Willingness to empathize with users who may be unlike yourself
• Willingness to justify and defend design decisions
• Interest in technology, civic, and public safety issues
• Portfolio submission so we can get a sense of your work

What You Can Expect From Us
• Mentorship on becoming a great product designer
• Building mission critical and socially responsible software to enable first responders to better serve their communities
• Constructive and actionable feedback on your work from designers at all levels
• Gain experience at the arising intersection of design/technology/government

Read more about our work from our design team on Medium:
• Records Privacy: Designing for our Users and their Communities
• Designing for First Responders: Keyboard Usability & Outdated In-Vehicle Computers
• My Remote Product Design Internship Experience at Mark43

We feel passionately about equal pay for equal work, and transparency in compensation is one vehicle to achieve that. Compensation for this role is paid at an hourly rate of £33 per hour

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
Lead UX Designer | Remote | Permanent | £60,000 + Career Progression + Flexible Hours + Extended Company Benefits
Peaple Talent have partnered with the UK's largest hosted IT and Telecoms service provider to the Public Sector in search of an IT Field Engineer.
Established in the 1980's, this long-term staple of the public sector is now looking to grow their UX/UI team, in order to breathe new life into their internet presence.
Our partner is looking for someone with extensive industry experience providing UI/UX solutions within a leadership role, with experience in application development.
If this sounds like you, why not give us a call or apply now?
The Role:
In this role, you will be responsible for the improvement and delivery of User Experience design across the Software Development function, and web presence teams.
This is a varied and autonomous remote position, giving you the freedom to work from home, with the option of flexible hours included.
Responsibilities:
• Work... alongside development teams, product managers and business analysts to deliver a high standard of UX solutions
• Lead in the execution of projects, and structure the suite of artefacts that need to be produced for each project. This can include information architecture, creating wireframes and prototyping, depending on the needs of the project.
• Develop re-usable designs to aid in the creation of a fresh and uniformed appearance and experience to the company's product portfolio
The Candidate:

• Extensive knowledge and experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
• Figma experience is crucial
• Must be SC Eligible (have lived in the UK for 5+ years)
The Package:
Basic salary: £60,000 + Career Progression + Flexible Hours + Extended Company Benefits
Interested? If you think you're right for this role, then click the 'Apply Now' button, send us your CV and we'll consider you for the first round of interviews

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
Lead UX Designer (IT and Digital) required to join User Experience and Visual Design team of an international organisation. The team leads efforts to improve the quality and consistency of customers’ digital experience across a global home website plus 100+ websites for country operations around the world, all registration, booking and payment systems, as well as numerous product-based websites, learning platforms and apps.

Lead UX Designer is a hybrid role and can be based anywhere UK-wide and pays up to £52,000 pa plus bonus & exceptional benefits including attractive pension scheme (employer contributions up to 22%) and 32 days holiday plus bank holidays. The client’s main offices are located in London, Manchester, Cardiff and Edinburgh.

UX Designer - key skills & experience:
• Substantial experience in a user experience role
• Extensive experience of practising a full range of UCD techniques
• Understanding of the theory and benefits of a variety of user research methodologies
•... Leading a range of end-to-end user research activities; from selecting and designing the appropriate research method / format through to facilitation and analysis
• Experience of creating and amending existing information architectures
• Collaborating with the visual design process, following wireframes through to ensure that the purpose of the design is retained, while allowing creative input from designers
• Working independently across multiple projects, defining his/her own work schedule on any given project
• Sketching, design and annotation of wireframes and prototypes, using tools such as Axure/Sketch/Figma
• Collaborating with visual designers, able confidently to feedback on how well a graphic design supports the functional

UX designer will be responsible for embedding User Experience practices and principles into complex projects and online products across the organisation. This will ensure delivery of a seamless digital experience to customers, enabling the organisation to fulfil its global mission and deliver against its commercial objectives.

You will act as a lead UX Designer for complex projects across our client’s digital platforms; their global home, country websites, registration or ecommerce platforms, as well as online products. This may involve both external-facing platforms and the internal staff experience. Including playing a key role in embedding inclusive design into the way the organisation’s approach and deliver design solutions; as well as advocating the benefits to wider teams involved in digital delivery.

For further information, please forward your CV to our Consultant Steve Hallworth who will provide further information regards this exciting permanent opportunity that is offering a salary up to £52K + bonus & exceptional benefits including attractive pension scheme (employer contributions up to 22%) and 32 days holiday plus bank holidays. Salary is to £48,700 + £3,300 London allowance

title: UX Designer (80-100%)
description:
About the role

At Swiss Re we are building a Risk Data & Service Platform (RDS) with an aim to deliver outstanding risk insights and services to our customers based on risk data and advanced analytics to make corporates and ultimately the world more resilient. You can find out more about our current offering here.

We are looking for a new member to join a growing cross-functional team focusing on delivering an excellent user experience. You will join two senior UX designers and work closely with the UX Design Lead and the Platform Product Owner.

You will design the experience of our new platform offering and of new services offered on the platform together with the design team.

As a UX Designer, you will be accountable for our user experience process, engagement, and delivery, specifically:
• Support the definition of key user journeys and flows – from research, design, delivery and continuous testing of them
• Collaborate with the product streams to ensure consistent and... excellent experience across the platform
• Design user flows from wireframes to high fidelity designs working closely with the design, product and engineering teams
• Leading and conducting (human centered) design research, gathering behavioral insights to inform scope / definition of client frictions, and improve service design

We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?

About You

Are you a passionate design practitioner who grounds user-centric design solutions in product, tech, and business strategies? You will be part of a motivated, cross-functional team, implementing user experience design for RDS and its core services.

You are required to have an intimate understanding of how to reduce complexity for clients with best-in-class user experience methodologies and strong design principles. You will have the opportunity to grow your skills under the guidance of our UX Design Lead and collaborate closely with other designers, product and tech teams.

What we are looking for:
• Relevant experience in creating user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity designs for complex products
• Entrepreneurial mentality and willingness to take on different tasks to build the desired user experience for new propositions
• Proficiency in design platforms such as Figma
• Standout colleague excited about collaborating across levels and functions of the organization with a growth mind-set
• 1-2+ years of experience in a digital agency with CX/UX/UI focus is a plus

Success in this role will be realized through championing needs via strong collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams within the business and embedding new ways of problem solving across our product streams. Are you ready to "roll your sleeves" up?

You will have a forward-thinking, intellectually curious approach to everything you do; and you are likely someone who is continually learning from a variety of sources.

Business proficiency in English is needed. The role might require occasional travel.

About Swiss Re Corporate Solutions

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer. We anticipate and manage risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.

Swiss Re Corporate Solutions is the commercial insurance arm of the Swiss Re Group. We offer innovative insurance solutions to large and midsized multinational corporations from our approximately 50 locations worldwide. We help clients mitigate their risk exposure, whilst our industry-leading claims service provides them with additional peace of mind.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. Swiss Re Corporate Solutions embraces a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.

title: Trainee UI/ UX Designer
description:
Junior Designer - Training to become a Fully Qualified UI/ UX Designer
Location:
UK based - Expected to travel to customer sites UK wide; working from client/office/home locations as appropriate. Flexible working arrangements will be available
Candidates must be eligible to obtain BPSS clearance.

Experis Consulting has an exciting and unique opportunity for Developer's who are looking to train and upskill to become UI/ UX Designers whilst working onsite for one of the leading Technology and Outsourcing clients within the IT industry. This is a great opportunity to join Experis' ever growing consulting division where you will be trained and developed whilst representing Experis on one of our key accounts.
We're looking for dynamic Developers who possess the desire to enhance their current skills and are looking to accelerate their career within UI/ UX Design. An interaction designer works out the best way to let users interact with services and products in terms of both overall flow... and at the level of individual design elements. You will be a part of a multiple disciplinary team ensuring the accelerated application development across our clients. You will demonstrate knowledge and experience of working with Agile/Scrum.

Coding knowledge & experience of HTML/CSS
GDS experience

title: Chapter Lead UX/UI Design
description:
A leading premium automotive business and leading to move towards electric autonomous vehicles.

Join Jaguar Land Rover as we drive a revolution in luxury vehicles and digital experiences.

Our mission is to power Jaguar and Land Rover's Digital Transformation, by rapidly growing digital capabilities to meet the needs of our luxury brands and an evolving market.

We believe in the power of bespoke software technology to create a seamless customer experience within our vehicles, our dealerships and our connected lives.

This is a real moment of change, for a big brand in an exciting and unique industry in the North, and it's happening right now.

WHAT TO EXPECT

To lead the implementation of user experience, user interface and user testing of products through the development lifecycle. Using techniques such as prototyping, wire framing, storyboards, process flows and customer journey maps to deliver the best possible user experiences and to be the window into our products. To lead this... discipline for the whole of the Digital function.

Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
Line manage a team of UX/UI designers including personal and professional development.
Provide UX/ UI / UT chapter leadership as part of mentoring chapter members.
Create and evolve frameworks, practices and tools relevant for the UX/ UI Specialist chapter.
Lead and own technical UX/UI standards relevant to the Digital function.
Lead the development of technical assets and standards across the Digital domain and beyond.
Partner with all disciplines in Digital Engineering to develop/ improve the UX/ UI / UT capability.
Introduce and drive the concept of design thinking throughout the Digital function.
Influence and, in some cases, lead the creation and maintenance of style guides for content production including fonts, colours and images.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED

Essential
Ability to assess and communicate different design options in a UX/UI/UT context.
Technical expertise in relevant technologies for UX/ UI design. (e.g. Figma, Sketch, Photoshop etc.)
Proficient in prototyping tools and able to extract lessons learned.
Attention to detail and aesthetics.
Strong understanding of bringing the customer journey to life

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
With Ubuntu, Canonical created the first Linux for human beings. Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into intuitive products that can change the face of enterprise IT. We are looking for an exceptional senior user experience designer, who shares our passion.

Our mission is to make enterprise-grade open source software, applications and services available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of engineers, enterprises, entrepreneurs and consumers every day. Our multi-disciplinary web design and production team includes visual designers, UX designers, front-end and back-end developers to bring exciting web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and strive to improve our work and processes.

We value:
• Excellent academic results at school and university
• Bachelor's or equivalent in User Experience, Design, or STEM
• Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
•... Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
• Drive to finish work and celebrate success
• Confidence in user research practices
• Engagement with the latest design research and innovation

UX designers should be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, designers and executives. They represent us at cross-functional company meetings and must present their design position with clarity and precision. They should be confident and excited to take on complex design challenges. They should also be able to connect their design leadership to the strategic vision of the company.

Read more about the design team
What we offer
• An opportunity to shape a company and products
• Influence in the open source community
• An inclusive work environment
• Learning and development
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Annual leave
• Priority Pass for travel

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior UX Designer - Design System Team
description:
Senior UX Designer - Design System Squad

ADLIB are excited to be partnering exclusively with Hargreaves Lansdown’s UX design team as they look to scale in several key squads. It’s an exciting time to join as the team continue their mission to put people at the heart of product with huge investment in digital transformation.

This particular ad is to apply for the Design System Squad.

About Hargreaves Lansdown

Here at HL, we’re the UK’s number 1 investment platform for private investors, based in Bristol. For more than 40 years we’ve helped investors save time, tax and money on their investments.
To achieve our mission, we believe we have a workplace like no other, with constant learning, dynamic teams, and a great ethos. We're steered by core values that promote service, quality, innovation, and opportunity in everything we do.

Our mission is to 'help people save and invest with confidence'. We are looking for great people to join us, so please come and invest in YOUR future at... Hargreaves Lansdown.

Our user-centred design team is growing and we’re looking for an experienced UX designer to join our growing design system team.

About the UCD team

As part of the user centred design team, you’ll be joining over 25 practitioners in UX Design, User Research, Content Design and Visual Design. You’ll also work closely with Product Managers, Business Analysts and Developers as well as the wider HL team.

As a Senior UX designer within the design system team, you will:

The design system is a relatively new endeavour for us and we're growing the team tasked with helping improve the quality, consistency, and development speed of our digital products.
• Help define and promote organisational design standards
• Identify, capture and communicate the needs and capabilities of the design system's users
• Lead the co-creation of the governance, processes and principles needed to manage the design system
• Collaborate with your team and external squads to assure and document design standards
• Conduct regular reviews with external squads to simplify, consolidate, and challenge design patterns
• Collaborate with engineering to define and deliver design system platform architecture and tooling
• Evaluate the quality, consistency, and usefulness of design system guidance with users
• Iterate the design system based on evidence and sound rationale
• Proactively communicate changes and updates to colleagues across the business
• Assist colleagues across the business with design and accessibility questions
• Create a shared understanding of users and their experience through the collaborative creation of UX artefacts
• Present complex information and concepts to colleagues in a clear and articulate manner
• Work with the UX Design Lead and user centred design practice to promote and shape UX design at HL

About you
• Are a passionate advocate for both high design and engineering standards with a meticulous attention to detail
• Are an open, confident, and considered communicator and collaborator
• Have excellent knowledge of established design and interaction patterns
• Have excellent knowledge of web accessibility guidelines
• Have experience using and contributing to design systems
• Have experience developing and evaluating information architecture
• Have experience facilitating effective collaborative workshops
• Can follow a rigorous, yet flexible, user-centred design process within an Agile environment
• Can produce testable prototypes (using varied tools and methods) for design research and evaluation
• Can clearly articulate design rationale to both designers and stakeholders
• Can employ excellent analytical, and critical thinking skills in your work

Desirable experience
Not essential, but we would also like to see:
• A degree in UX Design, HCI, or a related field
• Working knowledge of front-end development
• Experience working in distributed teams
• Experience with Figma
• Experience with ZeroHeight
• Experience with GitLab (or similar)
• Experience with Adobe Analytics (or similar)

What you’ll get in return
• Discretionary annual bonus & annual pay review
• 25* days holiday plus bank holidays and 1-day additional Christmas closure time
• Option to purchase an additional 5 days holiday per year
• Flexible working options available, including hybrid working
• Pension scheme up to 11% employer contribution
• Sharesave scheme - have a real stake in HL’s future
• Income Protection & Life insurance (4 x salary core level of cover)
• Health care cash plans - including optical, dental, and out patientcare
• Help@hand and an Employee Assistance Programme
• Gympass - gym memberships and wellbeing apps available
• Variety of travel to work schemes with free bike storage and shower facilities
• An inhouse barista serving subsidised coffee and snacks
• Join HL’s sports, I&D networks and volunteering groups (two paid volunteering days per year)
• LifeWorks Discounts on services, restaurants and retailers
• * up to 30 days depending on role level & increasing with length of service

What next?

We have chosen to work with our partner ADLIB recruitment who are managing the recruitment process for these roles. Please apply with a CV and they’ll be able to brief you fully on the roles and manage your application

description:

title: User Experience Designer
description:
This role will be instrumental in implementing the UX Design strategy across multiple product teams at TalkTalk, informed by the overarching UX strategy, working with multiple stakeholders from across the business to solve business problems.

Your knowledge of Design Thinking methodologies will enable you to support the UX / UI team with your strong understanding of the Double Diamond process and seeing it through from Discovery to Define.

Working as part of the wider Marketing team, you will be surrounded by innovative and creative thinkers and great leadership.

Our mission is to create innovative and user-centered experiences that create a positive impact in order to support the UCD cultural change within TalkTalk.

We’re passionate about creating services that enable anyone in the UK to access affordable and reliable internet and for the user experience of this to be exceptional.

As a team, we’re empathetic problem-solvers for both the customer and the business, and we... understand how business problems are linked to customer problems and vice versa.

As a UX Designer, you are expected to have a good understanding of the UX Design process as well identifying which methods to use and when.

You will also be responsible for :
• Delivering UX Designs based on research and data that solve a clear customer or business need and seeing it through to delivery.
• Work with Product Owners to fully understand the problem they’re trying to solve and set their expectations on how you will tackle the problem and how long the work will take.
• Communicate and share your work with stakeholders in a clear manner.
• Building relationships across the business to influence stakeholders, proactively collaborating and updating them early and often to keep them in the loop.
• Following the UX process and delivering your work on time.
• Recognising when to ask for further guidance and support.

As part of the wider UX team you will :
• Work with the team to implement the UX Strategy from a design perspective.
• Engage with the team workshops and share any new and exciting developments that you come across in the wider industry.
• Constructively add to the team dynamic and help us to grow.
• Work with the UX team to ensure we’re designing a joined-up experience.
• Contribute to growing a customer-centric culture by being the voice of the customer in meetings.
• Feed into our new Design System to help it grow.
• Identify new opportunities to help solve business problems.

What do I need in order to deliver in the role?

You'll have experience with Design Systems and are aware of the AA accessibility requirements. You'll also be experienced in using a variety of methods of prototyping using tools such as Sketch, Figma, Mural Invision and Marvel

You'll be used to Agile ways of working and can identify and compare the best processes or delivery methods to use depending on the problem you’re trying to solve.

You know how to use the UX Double Diamond and can communicate your work using the process of Discover, Define, Design and Deliver.

You’re confident being the voice of the customer in product discussions when sharing innovative and pragmatic ways of solving a problem.

As a recognised Top 50 Inclusive Employer in the UK, we know that diversity means success and innovation. We want our workplace to reflect the communities and customer we serve.

Being inclusive is part of our DNA; we are all 100% human, and we create a culture where you can truly be yourself.

We’re also not your usual 9-5. We are a dynamic workplace and we want to talk to you about how you like to work

title: UI/ Digital Designer

One of my amazing Northern digital retail agencies is looking for a Digital/ UI Designer to join the creative team and work on a range of big brand retail clients across all things visual and crafting effective user experiences.

Ideally you will be a Midweight - Senior level Digital/UI Designer who enjoys the analytical and technical processes as well as enhancing the customer satisfaction journey and loyalty by improving the ease of use and the interaction between the customer and end products.

Experienced designing low and high fidelity wireframes

Prototyping experience from Adobe CS to Figma, Sketch etc.

Confident contributing in client meetings, team meetings and brainstorms

A portfolio/website demonstrating solid web experience design and ecommerce

Local... to Manchester or Leeds would be advantageous.

In house or agency retail background is a bonus!

This is an opportunity to work for an incredible digital retail agency who work hard but really appreciate work life balance;

You will get to work 4 days per week (day is on rotation) + 25 days annual leave

Salary is up to 40k DOE

Hybrid working across the 4 days

title: Chapter Lead UX/UI Design
description:
REQ ID: 103026
JOB TITLE: Chapter Lead UX/UI Design
SALARY: Competitive
POSTING END DATE: 30/12/22
LOCATION: Manchester
Jaguar Land Rover is harnessing technology to make driving smarter, safer and cleaner. You can help create a world in which responsible, sustainable vehicles revolutionise the driving experience for generations. Our vision is to leverage the incredible potential of technology to build vehicles that not only offer a premium, all-encompassing digital experience, but that also make our customers lives better.
Join Jaguar Land Rover as we drive a revolution in luxury vehicles and digital experiences.
Our mission is to power Jaguar and Land Rover's Digital Transformation, by rapidly growing digital capabilities to meet the needs of our luxury brands and an evolving market.
We believe in the power of bespoke software technology to create a seamless customer experience within our vehicles, our dealerships and our connected lives.
This is a real moment of change, for a big... brand in an exciting and unique industry in the North, and it's happening right now.
WHAT TO EXPECT
To lead the implementation of user experience, user interface and user testing of products through the development lifecycle. Using techniques such as prototyping, wire framing, storyboards, process flows and customer journey maps to deliver the best possible user experiences and to be the window into our products. To lead this discipline for the whole of the Digital function.
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
• Line manage a team of UX/UI designers including personal and professional development.
• Provide UX/ UI / UT chapter leadership as part of mentoring chapter members.
• Create and evolve frameworks, practices and tools relevant for the UX/ UI Specialist chapter.
• Lead and own technical UX/UI standards relevant to the Digital function.
• Lead the development of technical assets and standards across the Digital domain and beyond.
• Partner with all disciplines in Digital Engineering to develop/ improve the UX/ UI / UT capability.
• Introduce and drive the concept of design thinking throughout the Digital function.
• Influence and, in some cases, lead the creation and maintenance of style guides for content production including fonts, colours and images.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED
Essential
• Ability to assess and communicate different design options in a UX/UI/UT context.
• Technical expertise in relevant technologies for UX/ UI design. (e.g. Figma, Sketch, Photoshop etc.)
• Proficient in prototyping tools and able to extract lessons learned.
• Attention to detail and aesthetics.
• Strong understanding of bringing the customer journey to life
Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you’ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan, private medical cover and performance related bonus scheme. As a manager, you’ll also be able to select one of our luxury premium vehicles to lease at a fraction of the cost. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.
This role may offer the opportunity for hybrid working where you can split your time between working from home and in the office. At Jaguar Land Rover, hybrid working is a voluntary, non-contractual arrangement providing employees with more choice and flexibility around how, when and where they work, if suitable for their role. Further details can be discussed with the Hiring Manager at interview stage.
Please be aware that we may close this vacancy for applications before the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of interest. We strongly advise you to submit your application as early as possible.
Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.
What We Offer
We look after our employees by offering a host of benefits and investing in their talent through award-winning training.
Job Segment: User Experience, Testing, Engineer, Technology, Engineering Privacy Preference Center
Manage Consent Preferences
Always Active

title: Interaction Designer
description:
Interaction Designer

Looking for a role that's for life? At one of the World's biggest consultancies? Why wouldn't you be?!?
• Up to £47K-£71K + a generous benefits package
• Opportunity to work on huge brand and public projects
• Remote role - Officed based in Telford

To apply please email or call

WHO ARE WE?

We pride ourselves in being a leading partner in providing strategy, design and operations management all around the globe, we use technology like no other which allows us to accomplish business transformation that others strive to achieve. We would not be able to create the results we do without the team of industry experts we have, they are the answer to our successes.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?

As our interaction designer we need someone who is able to independently analyse journeys and create explanations and better visions of how we connect to audiences; ensuring optimisation, security and accessibility is at an expert level. To be successful in this, you will have 10/10... skills in wireframing and prototyping across both web and mobile. Working in an agile environment, you will need to be able to understand design thinking processes, create persona and empathy. You will be able to absorb data from user research to create and apply strategic changes.

YOU WILL NEED…

4+ years' experience in user focused design - across both web and mobile projects

Prototyping and wireframing abilities in Code and using Sketch and Figma

Ability to work proactively in agile working environments

Ability to create persona and empathy

An understanding of security

IT'S NICE TO HAVE…
• Experience working across public service projects

TO BE CONSIDERED…

Please apply by clicking online or emailing me directly at .

For further information, please call me on . If unavailable, please leave a message and either myself or one of my colleagues will respond. By applying for this role, you give express consent for us to process & submit (subject to required skills) your application to our client, in conjunction with this vacancy only. Follow me on Twitter @SearchableShan and connect with me on LinkedIn, just search Shannon Harrison in Google.

I look forward to hearing from you

title: Trainee UI/ UX Designer
description:
Junior Designer - Training to become a Fully Qualified UI/ UX Designer
Location:
UK based - Expected to travel to customer sites UK wide; working from client/office/home locations as appropriate. Flexible working arrangements will be available
Candidates must be eligible to obtain BPSS clearance.

Experis Consulting has an exciting and unique opportunity for Developer's who are looking to train and upskill to become UI/ UX Designers whilst working onsite for one of the leading Technology and Outsourcing clients within the IT industry. This is a great opportunity to join Experis' ever growing consulting division where you will be trained and developed whilst representing Experis on one of our key accounts.
We're looking for dynamic Developers who possess the desire to enhance their current skills and are looking to accelerate their career within UI/ UX Design. An interaction designer works out the best way to let users interact with services and products in terms of both overall flow... and at the level of individual design elements. You will be a part of a multiple disciplinary team ensuring the accelerated application development across our clients. You will demonstrate knowledge and experience of working with Agile/Scrum.

As a minimum, ideally, we require candidates to demonstrate the following experience and attributes:

Coding knowledge & experience of HTML/CSS
GDS experience
Any experience of UX, wireframing, visual design or an Agile environment is desirable.
Successful candidates will then undertake a UX/UI boot-camp aligned to the outputs of the attached role.Once training has been completed, your day-to-day responsibilities may include:

Create prototype, wireframes, mock-ups, workflows, user flows, site maps, and storyboards, interactive design, graphic design, information architecture.
Proficient with tools such as Sketch, Invision Studio, Balsamiq, Axure, and (url removed) Prototype Kit - Interpret evidence-based research, identify user issues/difficulties and important needs, engagement with websites, platforms, and services and incorporate into your work.
Understand the usability issues of a diverse population and develop ways of engaging those users.
Design a consistent user experience across mobile devices and desktop platforms.
Collaborate with user researchers and content designers to test, iterate, and launch products and services that satisfy stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with Product Owners and Stakeholders to clarify requirements.
Work with Business Analysts on refining and updating designs aligned with business requirements.
Liaise with development teams to clarify feasibility of a design and ensure the UX solution is accurately transitioned into development.Benefit

Competitive salary based on a 37.5 hour working week, with bonus opportunities
A sophisticated training programme comprised of online and in role training to develop skills in an area that is ever growing in demand
An opportunity to be part of the next generation of Digital experts
Work for an organisation at the leading edge of technologyOther benefits include

Contributory pension scheme
Enhanced Life Insurance Cover
Employee Assistance Program
Enhanced Accident Insurance
22 days holiday + bank holidays
Sick payFor further information please contact Conor Fox on (phone number removed

title: Senior UI Developer
description:
We are looking for someone with 3+ years in UI development with strong Javascript, HTML and CSS skills to work in our Manchester office.

As a frontend developer you will be working on the full lifecycle of frontend development, this includes working with UX team members and contributing to design yourself, development, testing, and support.

You will be part of the R&D team, developing a new UI platform and standardised UI building blocks to be used by all projects both solutions delivered to the customer and internal tools, across the whole of Dematic.

What we offer :

Tasks and Qualifications :

Essential Skills :
• 3+ years Javascript / Typescript
• 3+ years Working knowledge of any major UI framework (React, Angular, Vue, etc.)
• Strong proficiency in using HTML5
• Strong proficiency in using CSS / Sass / Less
• Use of web bundlers (Webpack, Parcel etc.)
• Experience using Git
• Experience using Unix based environments
• Has an eye for what looks good
• Self-starter with the... desire to learn and improve.

• A team player with a desire to learn more
• You like a challenge and are willing to take responsibility

Desirable Skills :
• Prototyping and Wireframing
• Experience using Javascript testing frameworks (Jest, QUnit etc

title: UX UI Designer
description:
We are looking for a talented UX UI Designer to join my client, a digital marketing and design agency based in Macclesfield, Cheshire East.

As part of the Web Design Team, you will be their go-to creative for new websites and existing projects.

You will work closely with your squad (Front-End Developers, Back-End Developers, Creative Strategists, Graphic Designers, Project Managers and more team members) to produce high-quality, engaging, modern websites.

Your role will be to deliver full design concepts and mockups whilst collaborating with developers to help quickly and effectively deliver your designs.

You will understand how their clients operate commercially and how our services can support them in meeting their business goals.

Your

Responsibilities

To take a design brief from clients, alongside a project manager, and propose a practical solution.
Understanding our client's brand so that it is reflected through all digital design collateral.
UI design with strong emphasis... on UX principles to ensure the solution provides a simple user experience that delivers commercial results.
Creating layered design concepts using Adobe XD that are in-line with the design brief
Creating innovative, accessible design concepts including animations and interactive elements
Designing and maintaining our website component library
Ensure every design produced delivers an effective experience across desktop, mobile and tablet.
Working with your squad to ensure the web project is delivered to the brief, on time and within budget.
Staying on-top of the latest design practices and industry trends

The

Requirements /Key Skills

Proficiency using the Adobe Creative Suite (XD, Illustrator and Photoshop)
Strong understanding of UX/UI Website Design;
Graphic design and web asset creation
Experience in UX design, Visual design, interface design, layouts, and graphics.
Strong hands-on experience creating website wireframes, and prototypes.
Proactively contribute to both plans and development of client sites.

Experience working alongside developers

Experience working with custom CMSs

Experience working in an Agency environment - Fast-paced
A design for development approach
Commercial - always looking to optimise value

In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy
