title: Senior UX Designer - Design System Team
description:
Senior UX Designer - Design System Squad ADLIB are excited to be partnering exclusively with Hargreaves Lansdown’s UX design team as they look to scale in several key squads. It’s an exciting time to join as the team continue their mission to put people t of product with huge investment in digital transformation.

This particular ad is to apply for the Design System Squad. About Hargreaves Lansdown Here at HL, we’re the UK’s stment platform for private investors, based in Bristol. For more than 40 years we’ve helped investors save time, tax and money on their investments.

To achieve our mission, we believe we have a workplace like no other, with constant learning, dynamic teams, and a great ethos. We're steered by core values that promote service, quality, innovation, and opportunity in everything we do.

Our mission is to 'help people save and invest with confidence'. We are looking for great people to join us, so please come and invest in YOUR future at Hargreaves Lansdown.

Our... user-centred design team is growing and we’re looking for an experienced UX designer to join our growing design system team. About the UCD team As part of the user centred design team, you’ll be joining over 25 practitioners in UX Design, User Research, Content Design and Visual Design. You’ll also work closely with Product Managers, Business Analysts and Developers as well as the wider HL team.

As a Senior UX designer within the design system team, you will:
The design system is a relatively new endeavour for us and we're growing the team tasked with helping improve the quality, consistency, and development speed of our digital products.
Help define and promote organisational design standards
Identify, capture and communicate the needs and capabilities of the design system's users
Lead the co-creation of the governance, processes and principles needed to manage the design system
Collaborate with your team and external squads to assure and document design standards
Conduct regular reviews with external squads to simplify, consolidate, and challenge design patterns
Collaborate with engineering to define and deliver design system platform architecture and tooling
Evaluate the quality, consistency, and usefulness of design system guidance with users
Iterate the design system based on evidence and sound rationale
Proactively communicate changes and updates to colleagues across the business
Assist colleagues across the business with design and accessibility questions
Create a shared understanding of users and their experience through the collaborative creation of UX artefacts
Present complex information and concepts to colleagues in a clear and articulate manner
Work with the UX Design Lead and user centred design practice to promote and shape UX design at HL
About you Are a passionate advocate for both high design and engineering standards with a meticulous attention to detail
Are an open, confident, and considered communicator and collaborator
Have excellent knowledge of established design and interaction patterns
Have excellent knowledge of web accessibility guidelines
Have experience using and contributing to design systems
Have experience developing and evaluating information architecture
Have experience facilitating effective collaborative workshops
Can follow a rigorous, yet flexible, user-centred design process within an Agile environment
Can produce testable prototypes (using varied tools and methods) for design research and evaluation
Can clearly articulate design rationale to both designers and stakeholders
Can employ excellent analytical, and critical thinking skills in your work
Desirable experience Not essential, but we would also like to see:
A degree in UX Design, HCI, or a related field
Working knowledge of front-end development

Experience working in distributed teams

Experience with Figma

Experience with Zero Height

Experience with Git Lab (or similar)

Experience with Adobe Analytics (or similar)
What you’ll get in return Discretionary annual bonus & annual pay review
25
• days holiday plus bank holidays and 1-day additional Christmas closure time
Option to purchase an additional 5 days holiday per year
Flexible working options available, including hybrid working
Pension scheme up to 11% employer contribution
Sharesave scheme - have a real stake in HL’s future
Income Protection & Life insurance (4 x salary core level of cover)
Health care cash plans - including optical, dental, and out patient care
Help@hand and an Employee Assistance Programme
Gympass - gym memberships and wellbeing apps available
Variety of travel to work schemes with free bike storage and shower facilities
An inhouse barista serving subsidised coffee and snacks
Join HL’s sports, I&D networks and volunteering groups (two paid volunteering days per year)
Life Works Discounts on services, restaurants and retailers
• up to 30 days depending on role level & increasing with length of service
What next? We have chosen to work with our partner ADLIB recruitment who are managing the recruitment process…

title: User Experience (UX) Designer
description:
User Experience (UX) Designer Macclesfield Closing Date : 16th December 2022* Competitive salary & benefits on offer. Do you have expertise in, and passion for UX Design?

Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines?

If so, AstraZeneca might be the one for you!*About astrazeneca*AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious disease.

But we're more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies.At AstraZeneca we're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work.

Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and spark your entrepreneurial spirit. There's no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society.

An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth... and development.

About our it team*Here our work has a direct impact on patients - redefining our ability to develop life-changing medicines.

We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining pioneering science with leading digital technology platforms and data.

All with a passion to impact lives through data, analytics, AI, machine learning and more. Join us at a crucial stage of our journey in becoming a digital and data-led enterprise.

Make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems, creating new ways of working and driving scale and speed to deliver exponential growth.

Focused and committed, and backed with the investment to succeed, we're driving cross-company change to disrupt the entire industry.

Ours is a place to innovate, take ownership and run with it. You're trusted to explore and to find new solutions, experimenting with pioneering technology and grappling with challenges in a modern technology environment that might never have been taken on before.

It's a dynamic and challenging environment to work in - but that's why we like it. There are countless opportunities to learn and grow, whether that's exploring new technologies in hackathons, or transforming the roles and work of colleagues, forever.

Shape your own path, with support all the way. Diverse minds that work cross-functionally and inclusively together. Be part of a team that has the backing to innovate, redefine an industry and change lives.

WHY JOIN US?*We're a network of entrepreneurial self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. There's a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that's unique to AstraZeneca - it allows us to dive deep intoexploring new pioneering technology.

We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science.

We optimise and evolutionise AstraZeneca by maximising efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification.

We're not afraid to take ownership and run with it. Empowered with unrivalled freedom. A place to be open and transparent - we speak up, think creatively and share ideas.

Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. But we have a constant drive to innovate,and an appreciation for high standards.

It takes challenging the status quo to add value in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because put simply, we make a meaningful impact.

Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors!*The mid-level UX Designer is responsible for designing products & services, from user insights, that are easy and delightful to use.

These products and services will include both external (patient- and / or doctor-facing) and internal colleague-facing tools, and cover a range of platforms (devices, websites, mobile apps, etc.

We are looking for someone who has experience across the full, end-to-end UCD process, not just an 'expert designer'.You will work with experienced researchers and / or carry out qualitative / quantitative user research studies (e.

g. user interviews or observation) yourself. You will use the outputs of this research to inform the early design process;

for example, creating personas or user journey maps.Using the available insights, you will design the product's high-level UX (e.

g., via flows and wireframes), plus lower-level interaction designs (e.g., via interactive prototypes) which unambiguously describe the product experience.

The focus is on usability, not aesthetics.You will iteratively improve your designs based on results from usability testing (carried out by yourself or others).

You will work closely with technical developers during the build process to manage compromises and ensure the best possible UX is launched.

You will find ways to measure and prove the value that your research and design interventions have made.As well as the tactical side of UX Design and Research, the role also includes a more strategic side.

You will support the Head of UX and the UX Leads in evangelizing the benefits of UX / UCD across AZ, using a set of excellent case studies where UCD has made a measurable difference to business performance.

You will help to develop new business for yourself and the wider UX team. You will also support training non-UX colleagues into UX / UCD methods.

If you are not already an experienced user researcher, you will be supported in improving these skills.Please note : this is not a Visual Design or 'UI' role;

the core skills and experience required are very much 'UX'.*Requirements (Technical) Degree-level qualification (preferably postgraduate) in Ergonomics, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design or a related relevant field* Understanding of UX principles, both from academic learning and on-the-job experience* Real-world experience as a UX Practitioner in an industrial (not just academic) environment - working either in or for large, client-side companies* Experience or practical understanding across UX Research methodologies - e.

g. interviews, surveys, usability testing, field trials - and how they fit into a full UCD process. (Direct experience moderating such research is preferred but not essential).
• Experience using research insights to make design decisions, and in creating strategic design documents such as Personas, User Journey Maps and Storyboards.
• Experience creating high-level information architectures, low-level flows and wireframes, interaction designs, interactive prototypes, etc.
• Experience with UX design and interactive prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch, InVision, Axure, Adobe XD)* Experience designing for mobile (web and apps), with up-to-date knowledge of UX / Interaction Design patterns for iOS and Android.

Also experience working across digital channels, including fixed-web and tablet too.* Strong analytic skills; comfortable working with big, complex, numerical data* A portfolio of case studies where good UCD has made a measurable (quantitative) difference to the quality of digital products and services* Experience or exposure to Accessibility / Inclusive Design - i.

e. ensuring the best experience for all users, independent of their (dis)ability - would be nice to have* Experience working with pharmaceutical / medical products and services is not essential but would be nice to have* Experience in Behavioural Science or Psychology is not essential but would be nice to have*Requirements (Soft Skills) A self-starter, not requiring handholding.
• The energy and pro-activity to develop relationships and new business opportunities for yourself and the wider UX team* An active member of the external UX community, with an interest in sharing and keeping up with the state-of-the-art in design tools and research methods* An excellent listener, with the ability to quickly filter the relevant user insights for design* An excellent presenter, succinctly imparting UX designs, with appropriate rationale, in both written and spoken formats, and in plain, non-technical, language* Great influencing skills, including the ability to evangelize UCD to stakeholders* A great team player, able to work well as part of a small UX team and collaborate closely with Product Managers, Business Analysts, Technical Developers, etc.
• Motivated to both give and receive constructive criticism on UX designs* Able to successfully juggle the competing demands of multiple concurrent projects within a global corporate environment.
• SO, WHAT'S NEXT? *Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we'd love to hear from you! Click the link to apply and we'll be in touch as soon as we can.
• WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE? *Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills.

We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics.

We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements

title: Snr UI/UX Designer
description:
Stenn is one of the leading FinTechs in Europe and a category leader in digital trade finance for international SMEs. Founded in 2015, Stenn's purpose is to connect international SMEs to the global financial system, helping to bridge a reported $3.6 trillion (USD) financing gap through a fast, simple online platform. To date, Stenn has issued over $10 billion (USD) of finance to SMEs in more than 70 countries, with capital provided by several blue-chip banks and institutional fund managers across the globe.

Rapid expansion continues at Stenn, as under-served SMEs seek financing solutions to manage significant macroeconomic and supply chain disruption; and this follows our $50 million Series A fundraise earlier this year, valuing Stenn at $900 million.

Our HQ is in London with employees across the globe, including the USA, Europe and China. We are made up of diverse, highly skilled professionals who work in an innovative way to develop and drive our business further. Our people are... empowered to work autonomously through a trusting leadership style which encourages learning.

Stenn are looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer. Could this be you?

You probably want to know what's involved?

Our designers work closely with product managers, engineers, and analysts to apply their passion for creating great user experiences and engaging features across every stage of product creation. A typical day may involve conducting user interviews, designing user flows, rapid prototyping, wireframing or creating polished final designs for release.

This role presents a unique opportunity to not only be hands-on with product development, but to establish a customer-centric design culture at a fast-growing startup in the early stages of growth.

How will we measure success in this role?

To be successful in this role, you will need to have a deep understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies, as well as experience with industry-standard design tools and software. You should also have excellent communication and leadership skills, and be able to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment.

In your first 12 months we will be looking for you to deliver a great user experience with elegant design solutions within your product area, create a beautiful and flexible design system and level up our existing design capability.

How do you know if you are the right candidate?

You will currently have a great portfolio of work that clearly outlines both great design and value generated for the end customer, comfortable working with both in-person and remote teams using scrum methodology and hands on experience building products and/or features.

Last but not least - Who are Stenn?

Stenn is one of the leading FinTechs in Europe and a category leader in digital trade finance for international SMEs. Founded in 2015, Stenn's purpose is to connect international SMEs to the global financial system, helping to bridge a reported $3.6 trillion (USD) financing gap through a fast, simple online platform. To date, Stenn has issued over $10 billion (USD) of finance to SMEs in more than 70 countries, with capital provided by several blue-chip banks and institutional fund managers across the globe.

Rapid expansion continues at Stenn, as under-served SMEs seek financing solutions to manage significant macroeconomic and supply chain disruption; and this follows our $50 million Series A fundraise earlier this year, valuing Stenn at $900 million.

Our HQ is in London with employees across the globe, including the USA, Europe and China. We are made up of diverse, highly skilled professionals who work in an innovative way to develop and drive our business further. Our people are empowered to work autonomously through a trusting leadership style which encourages learning

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Location: Hybrid

The Product team at SamKnows aims to:

With over 30 million homes around the world reporting data into our platform every month we have an abundance of data. Our challenge is to build products that demystify home connectivity issues, find faults in real time across internet service provider’s networks, test the internet performance and reliability of your favourite applications. You can help us improve the internet for everyone, everywhere.

We’re looking for a UI/UX Designer to work in a multi-disciplinary team to:
• Develop structured understanding of business and user needs
• Prototype iterative solutions, validating usability, value, and feasibility
• Apply user-centred design practices
• Turn meaningful insights into product improvements that evolve our existing user journeys

You should have:
End-to-end UX design experience, from gathering insights through user research and analytics to designing the detailed workflows and interactions. You should have a... curious mind and a desire to teach and learn with an open mind to work transparently with your team members as well as being able to effectively present and articulate complex design concepts to diverse audiences.
• At least 2 years of UX/UI/Product design experience
• Experience with hypothesis-driven design to define quick and efficient ways of learning and iterating
• Confidence in choosing appropriate user research and user testing methods
• Experience using a design system and contributing to it
• Experience using Figma in a professional setting
• A good understanding of how design can inspire and impact development, along with a knack for creating design solutions that are elegant but practical
• Experience working within focused agile teams and finding solutions within a well reasoned approach

Recruitment process:
• Screening Call (20 mins)
• Questionnaire (At-home Assessment)
• Technical Interview, with Design Task (1h)
• Cultural Contribution Interview (1h)

What we offer:
• Team: Friendly team from all over the globe and a supportive company culture
• Environment: Amazing brand new HQ in Bermondsey, includes genderless bathrooms, collaborative and social spaces
• Pension: Pension contribution of 5% of your annual salary per year
• Sick Pay: Full sick pay for 15 days in any calendar year
• Hybrid working: Flexibility to work at home and at the office, allowance of £312 per year for you to spend on your home workstation
• Growth: Individualised career plan. And, own your personal development with a £1,500 training budget and 5 training days
• Family friendly policies: Enhanced parental leave for birthing and partner parents
• Financial support: Interest free loans including cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan and discretionary employee loans up to £5,000
• Holiday: 25 days holiday each year (pro rata) plus bank holidays. And an extra day off to enjoy your birthday!
• Health care: Medical insurance includes cover for dental, optical, private healthcare and mental health care for you, your partner and dependents
• Recognition: Company bonus
SamKnows

Founded in 2008, SamKnows is recognised as a leader in internet performance measurement, providing a research and monitoring service for internet, in-home and application performance. Over the last 14 years we have built a global measurement platform, considered vital to governments, ISPs and consumers, especially now. You can find lots of useful information about us at www.samknows.com and we’d also encourage you to listen to our podcasts and view our Spotlight magazine.

SamKnows welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional needs that require accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
About Us

Encord is a London-based startup building a comprehensive training data solution for computer vision AI applications. We are backed by CRV, Y Combinator Continuity, the Harvard Management Company, top industry executives, and other leading Bay Area investors.

Started by ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt firsthand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building practical AI. AI feels to us like what the early days of computing or the internet must have felt like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are terrible. We have devised a unique methodology for automating the tasks related to preparing quality training data, in effect turning the training data problem into a data science problem.

The Role

We are looking for an experienced UI/UX design engineer to help us build, design, and ship delightful and innovative products and features for modelling... creating, and managing training data for building AI applications. You will be collaborating closely with our customers to understand how they interact with our web-based UI’s, and how we can make them more intuitive and look prettier.

Our ideal UI/UX designer has taken part in designing technical B2B/Enterprise SaaS products from ideating using wireframes and all the way to production. Needless to say, the right candidate is passionate about beautiful product UX and design.

Qualifications

The right candidate will have proven experience working with web frontend development and design, with any of the following is a plus:

• Rapid prototyping of user interfaces using commonly used tools such as Figma, Photoshop, or similar

• A good understanding of the formal elements of design, not just limited to the web and including typography, layout, balance, and proportion

• Experience building public facing websites that work elegantly across commonly used browsers

• Advanced knowledge of modern HTML and CSS

What We Offer

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, and agriculture.

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields. We offer competitive compensation and equity options in the business for the right candidate

title: UI/UX Designer - Veeva Link (Remote)
description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

You will create satisfying and compelling experiences for users of a product, drawing on results from user research and workflow analysis. You need to possess strong creative and problem-solving skills. Areas of focus include use case identification and definition, UI and UX design, asset creation and communication with... agile development teams.

This is a Work Anywhere role, however, you have to be based in the United Kingdom and be eligible for employment in the United Kingdom, as Veeva does not sponsor an employment visa for this opportunity.
What You'll Do
• Visualizing and presenting ideas for new functionalities
• Creating full designs and screen flows
• Creating product prototypes
• Creating and communicating assets and elements needed for development
• Analyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experience
• Explaining user research results to internal stakeholders
• Conducting competitor and customer analysis
Requirements
• 3+ years of Design experience. You’ll ideally come from a similar industry, working in B2B saas companies with a strong emphasis on Design.
• A strong view on what good design means, you are detail-oriented and you can articulate to a variety of stakeholders what good should look like.
• Ability to understand business metrics and translate company goals and objectives into digital experiences
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to communicate ideas to developers
• Knowledge of main industry design tools; very good knowledge of Figma.
• Multi-tasking and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks
• Analytical mind with business acumen
• Ability to work both independently and in a team
• Experienced with UX for mobile (both iOS and Android) and Web
• Experience with the Design System
• Fluent English
Nice to Have
• Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry
• Experience building data-driven products
Perks & Benefits
• Attractive compensation
• Annual charity contribution
• Annual learning budget
• Fitness reimbursements
• Home internet connection reimbursement

#RemoteUK

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams

title: UI/UX Designer - DApps
description:
UX/UI Designer - Blockchain - Dapps

Location: London, Soho

Industry: Blockchain | Tech

Salary Range: Industry leading base, crypto LTIP (Tezos tokens) and great benefits

About:

TriliTech is a Tezos blockchain research and development hub based in London, UK. We are on a mission to advance the state of the art in blockchain technology, building the most scalable, secure and energy-efficient decentralised platform in the world.

Tezos is an open-source platform for assets and applications that can evolve by upgrading itself. We are one of the original proof of stake smart contract layer one blockchains. Since launching in 2018, Tezos has been utilised for hundreds of projects, attracted a vibrant, global community, and logged millions of transactions. Our proof of stake design means it can operate in an energy efficient manner, consuming over two-million times less energy than popular proof of work networks.

Our current corporate partners include Redbull Racing, McLaren, Ubisoft... Societe Generale and many others. Projects built on the Tezos blockchain include Hic Et Nunc, , Interpop, OneOf and Kukai.

The Role:

Here at Trilitech, we are moving through rapid growth and are currently offering a fantastic opportunity for a UX/UI designer to come and join our small and expanding team.

You will be responsible for designing applications on the Tezos blockchain and digital tools - including websites and design resources - that foster ecosystem growth. To this end, you will contribute to design-related efforts surrounding product development and community outreach, including user research, prototyping, testing and iterating on attractive consistent UX.

Day to Day you will:

Work with cross-functional teams to define scope and features of product

Support the development team with the implementation of prepared design concept

Develop design concepts for web and mobile applications and interfaces driven by personas, user-stories and user experience

Develop user scripts, design layouts, development of user-first interfaces

Essential Requirements:

Based in London or Berlin

A creative, current portfolio that shows potential for experimentation

Demonstrable UX skills: experience translating project specs to user flows, wireframes and final designs

Visual design skills: the ability to present clear information architecture and craft inspiring visual designs

Design systems experience: comfort working within and maintaining design systems

User Research experience: Familiarity with different methods and use cases

Accessibility and ethics familiarity: familiarity with principles and experience integrating into designs

Genuine interest in Blockchain

Nice to have:

Experience designing for open source projects

Familiarity with front end programming languages

Benefits:

You will have the opportunity to:

Become an expert in blockchain technologies

Spend 20% of your time working on blockchain-related passion projects

You will also receive:

Highly competitive compensation package

Generous pension scheme and core benefits

Tez (Tezos tokens) LTIP scheme

Flexible hybrid working policy

25 days holiday plus a day off for your birthday

Culture:

We care deeply about our culture and have developed it across five key pillars:

Autonomy: we believe in hiring great people, then giving them the space and flexibility to work in the way that's best for them. We will agree on goals, and then expect you to decide how you want to pursue those goals.

Collaboration: as a fast growing small business we all work together across multiple workstreams. We have a flat structure and encourage frank discussion, honesty and openness.

Learning and development: the blockchain space is developing at an incredibly fast rate. Having a growth mentality and being open to continuous learning is an important part of our culture. It's always OK to not know the answer to something and have to do some research! We cement this by offering more formal perks to help fund employees' continued education.

Diversity and Inclusion: inclusiveness is one of our blockchain's core strengths, and in the same way we are committed to inclusiveness across all diversity dimensions. We are also actively looking for talent outside of the immediate blockchain space. What we primarily look for is general markers of excellence and ambition.

Mission driven: we believe that the Tezos blockchain is going to change the world and our goal is to promote its adoption. Blockchain technology will power new positive change, increase the democratisation of previously restricted systems and create transparency and trust

title: Product Designer - UX/UI
description:
Product Designer - UX/UI

An excellent opportunity for a Product Designer with good experience in both UX and UI design to work for our industry leading client based in South West London. This role will be remote based with ideally a trip to the office 1 day per week.

They key responsibilities of the Product Designer role will be to;
• To create comprehensive, tech-current and user-centered product designs (wireframes, prototypes, visual design) for different platforms and products
• Ability to iterate on the designs and present various concepts for experiments
• Work collaboratively within Feature teams and Creative teams, Copywriters, front-end developers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, Data Analysts, Solution Architects and other internal and external stakeholders as required
• Plan, brief, collaborate and/or conduct remote and in-person user tests to research and validate proposed designs and other additional UX recommendations reports
• Proactive research and innovation, new... technologies, techniques, process improvements, etc

Our client is looking for a Product Designer with the following experience;
• Proven digital design skills. Ability to create wireframes, prototypes and visual designs. Hierarchy, grids, components, use of colour, contrast, accessibility, typography, photography, illustrations, video or animations.
• Knowledge of wireframes and prototyping tools: Figma and Adobe XD
• Design systems, device optimization
• Remote user testing knowledge and analysis

Please apply by responding with an up to date copy of your CV

title: UI/UX Designer & Researcher (German speaking)
description:
Playbrush is the innovation leader in smart Oral Care in Europe and beyond.

Since 2015 we have been pioneering Smart Toothbrushes and Oral-Care-As-A-Service Subscriptions to revolutionize dental health for children, families and adults alike. Our interactive smart toothbrushes connect via Bluetooth to a smartphone or tablet. Children control mobile games with their toothbrush, and consequently get better at toothbrushing. Adults also interact and receive smart feedback via the toothbrush, so they can improve their brushing performance.

Playbrush is a startup that has received multiple millions of investment, won several awards and was recognised by the media globally. Only recently it has been acquired by the Swiss-Japanese consumer health champion Sunstar Global!

Now we are looking for an experienced and ambitious UI/UX Designer to own user research and UI/X design end-to-end for web and mobile apps to join our team in London or Germany.

Aufgaben
• Ability to lead and ideate... products from scratch and improve features for web and apps within a user-centered design process
• Create consistent user flows across all touchpoints, wireframes and UI designs to support agile development teams
• Conduct user research through interviews, field visits and usability studies
• Support the product team in strategic product development decisions based on your user research
• Work in an agile environment with cross functional teams
• Ensure design consistency across all platforms (web & mobile apps)
• Regular UX analysis and improvements of our customer experience

Qualifikation
• 3+ years professional experience in the field of UX, usability & information architecture
• Experience with design and concept software tools (e.g. Sketch, Invision, Figma) to create user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes and customer journeys
• Ability to design and conduct user research like usability tests
• Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy
• Self-driven, organised and diligent personality
• Proficiency in German and English. Please note that we can only consider candidates that speak German on a native speaker level.

Benefits
• Flexible working hours
• Variety of perks (e.g., bonuses, travel support, trainings, lunches and free books)
• The opportunity to become a part of one of the most exciting software startups in the consumer space (multiple award winner), which recently exited to a Global Consumer Health Champion
• Location for this position: London( we also offer help with relocation - VISA & relocations costs) or Vienna
• Market adequate remuneration ( for this position we offer an annual gross salary of GBP 35.000, based on qualifications we are willing to overpay)

We are looking forward to your application

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Company Description

Pharma Intelligence is a leading operator in the global pharma and life sciences analytics markets. The company holds the leading position in the clinical trial intelligence space, providing insights on patient enrolment and demographics, trial progress, individual trial sites and investigators for more than 375,000 clinical trials across 180 countries. The company’s solutions are used by 3,000 pharmaceutical companies and CROs in their clinical trial design, commercial strategy, and regulatory compliance processes to maximize the likelihood of success of introducing products to market.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our growing technology team. This is an opportunity to join a strong development team utilising the latest set of progressive technologies, for an expanding global intelligence business as well as investigating new technologies such as AI and ML to enhance the platforms and services that we offer our customers.

The... ideal candidate should have an eye for clean user centred design, possess superior UI/UX skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artefacts, and transform them into intuitive and functional user interfaces.

Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate with product and engineering teams in developing new and exciting features for upcoming versions of intelligence-based sites
• Produce UI designs, assets and prototypes of a consistently high quality
• Iterate through early wireframing to hi-res mock-ups
• Conduct UX interviews and workshops; and evaluate feedback
• Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders
• Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards
• Find creative ways to solve UX problems
• Work with the UI/UX Lead Designer to develop and grow your skillset

Qualifications

Key requirements
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Experience with design software such as Adobe XD
• Excellent communication and writing skills.
• Ability to clearly articulate design decisions
• Ability to give and receive constructive and actionable feedback

Knowledge, Skill and Experience
• Clear written and verbal communication
• A passion for UIUX design
• Good understanding of UX processes and UI design principles
• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user
• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets
• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team

Desirable experience
• Experience working with design systems
• Experience in Scrum or Agile ways of working
• Worked in a remote team

title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer
description:
Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global audience of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly-owned subsidiary of SEGA, having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. No matter how big we dream, though, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented UI/UX Designer for our fast-growing Design team. Collaborating with the UI and Games Design teams you will be assisting in improvements being made to the overall UI of the product, with a specific focus on usability. This role offers the... chance to work on and develop for the world’s leading football management simulation titles. We are also aiming to improve our accessibility support to ensure our games are enjoyed by a wider range of audiences and would hope the successful applicant shares that passion.

The successful candidate will be organised, self-motivated and able to communicate with all disciplines, both within the design team and across the wider studio. You'll be keen to share your expertise and experience as well as committed to the constant improvement of your own skills and knowledge.

Please note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive any applications without a portfolio link showcasing your best work will be discounted.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with Games Design in developing new and exciting features for upcoming versions of Football Manager.
• Produce UI designs & assets of a consistently high quality.
• Communicate your work through Site Maps, User flows and early stage wireframing through to hi-res mock-ups.
• Work with the UI/UX Design Lead and Production to develop and grow your skillset.
• Within cross-disciplinary Feature Pods, collaborate with QA, Production, and other development disciplines to ensure all new features are placing the user and usability as a top priority.

Knowledge, Skill and Experience:
• Strong understanding of key UI design principles
• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets
• Ability to communicate clearly and tell stories throughout the design process
• Experience with visual design software such as Figma and Miro
• A passion for UIUX design
• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user
• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team
• Clear written and verbal communication.

Desirable:
• Experience creating prototypes, wireframes and developing user flows
• 2+ years UI/UX professional experience within software production (ideally within the games industry but not exclusively)
• Experience in Unity
• Animation or motion design skills (e.g. After Effects, Principle etc.)
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS or similar
• Basic Understanding of Accessibility settings in games
• Experience of Adobe Suite (Illustrator/Photoshop)
• Interest in Football Manager and Football, whilst very helpful, is not essential

Working Here:

We approach everything with passion, whether that’s leaving our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who works here.

We like our talent to be tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to consistent improvement and encourage our people to truly realise their own personal potential.

We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do and that’s one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry 2021 Large studio category).

If you want a positive work/life balance, we’re right behind you. While we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on, so you can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.

Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid, and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.

When you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.
• We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.

Inclusivity Matters:
We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.

SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process.

This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment

title: UX/UI Graphic Designer
description:
Company Description

A new sports betting and gaming brand operating in Franco-Africa. They aim to become a leading omni-channel igaming operator in Africa and expand the brand across the continent.
Job Description

As a UX designer you will be user-centred and have a strong advocate of pursuing the optimal user outcome, through the early ideation phase, storyboarding and user journeys to wireframing, interactive prototypes and signed off UI.

Reporting to the Chief Product Offer in a Product Team of 4 you will be responsible for designing user focused products that delight users.
• Design user flows across all devices, highlighting key touch points and user expectations
• Provide design proposals, wireframes and prototypes to present to stakeholders
• Take a customer-centred approach working with product and development, test and QA teams
• Work with designers to provide support and feedback on tasks such as, user interface design, user experience journey analysis and... configuration.
• Liaise with relevant parties (Creative Team, UI Designers, Product Owners & Developers) to progressively move from low fidelity wireframes to high fidelity designs.
• Carry out usability studies and provide feedback to the Product and Business Teams.
• Provide design services to the Creative Team where necessary including Projects, BAU tasks & Creative initiatives.
• Heavily involved in kick-off sessions with other teams to provide a voice for the UX team
• You will work closely with other departments, delivering creative designs for print, web, marketing (digital and offline), social media and merchandise
• Deliver exciting and relevant content and campaigns for all channels and touchpoints
• Create original concepts, graphics and assets for Brand marketing materials, including print

The team work 5 days in the Victoria office.
Who Fits The Bill
• 3+ Years commercial digital experience including UX design
• Degree in design, technology, psychology, human factors or Human Computer Interaction.
• Knowledge of Figma, Axure, Balsamiq, Invisionapp, Sketch, Principle, Zeplin, Adobe Suite etc.
• A deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design
• Comfortable in a fast-paced, environment
• A good working knowledge of user centred design methods
• Passionate about all things UI and other areas of design and innovation.
• Good analytical, planning, organisational and reporting skills
• Able to tackle complex user interactions

Bonus points for
• Knowledge of the online gaming industry experience

title: UI/UX Designer with Analytics Dashboard Experience (Contract)
description:
Overview

Job Type: Freelance, Contractor for 1 to 3 months

Industry: Audience profiling, Analytics, Ad Tech, Video , DMP, DataViz

Company size: 15-50

Company type: Private / Startup

Streamhub is a London based data tech startup providing audience analytics & targeting tools for video streaming services. We support a broad range of media and publishing companies around the world providing VOD and Live streaming services to their audiences.

Streamhub bridges the relationships and transactions between publisher, advertisers and audiences, bringing you unparalleled access to cutting-edge big data technologies and martech / media-tech exposure. Our purpose is to understand how video shapes our everyday life, and our mission to be the most actionable data platform for the video business. We work fast and innovatively, driven by our entrepreneurial culture.

Who We’re Looking For

We are looking for a Freelance UI/UX Designer to help us deliver exciting new features and improve... usability in our data management and analytics platform.

UI/UX Designer responsibilities include the understanding of user requirements, designing graphic elements and building the flow or navigational components to simplify the complex.

To be successful in this role, you must have a good understanding of user experience of data products, truly understanding the business needs / personas. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web based analytics/ B2B SaaS solutions, we’d like to meet you.

Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our customer’s needs - helping improve user experience and grow our customer base.

Responsibilities
• Evaluate user requirements in collaboration with our product manager and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps (using InVision)
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets - this is all about data visualisation and information management experience
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mockups and high fidelity prototypes that clearly illustrate how components function and display in active/ inactive states
• Respond to new briefs in a timely fashion and give transparent estimates for delivery
• Prepare and present designs to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to Streamhub’s style standards on fonts, colors and images

Requirements
• 5+ years experience as a UI/UX Designer
• 1+ year or several projects with Analytics Dashboards, or DMPs or other B2B software that helps manage large pieces of data in simple UIs
• Excellent knowledge of InVision for UX prototyping
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator, Figma etc.
• Team spirit; excellent communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders across the business, iterating quickly and asking the right questions.
• Good time-management skills to estimate work upfront and deliver on time
• Big plus, if you are able to come to our London office once a week or at the start of the assignments

Terms
• available asap
• depending on your skills and assignment we will have projects ranging from a few days to a month on an ongoing basis
• from $200 per day

title: Lead UI / UX Designer (Flexible Remote Location)
description:
Dorian is a social creator platform that enables fiction writers to easily turn fiction 📚 into games 🎮, stream them to their fans and make money 💰 from their hobby!

As Dorian UI / UX Designer you will focus on empowering creators by inventing and designing amazing creative tools. Have you ever felt passionate about working on a creator platform, like Twitch or TikTok? If so, this position would be a great opportunity for you to flex your design muscles 💪

This position is 100% remote available globally 🌍

What you'll be doing:

• Collect and apply creator insights to produce design solutions that unlock creativity on Dorian and delight fans!
• Design mockups, wireframes, flow charts and paper prototypes to illustrate general layout, functionality and product flow for the Dorian platform on mobile and web
• Develop and run playtesting programs for our innovative solutions
• Produce and pitch designs to Product, Engineering, Partnerships and other teams
• Plan experiments and... conduct A/B tests to discover the right UX iteratively
• Keep up to date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques and technologies

What we're looking for:

• 5+ years experience in UI/UX Design, preferably with experience in games and/or creator platforms
• Understanding of free-to-play game market and economics is a big plus
• Knowledge of 2D image applications (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects)
• Experience working with Figma or similar UX visual prototyping workflows
• Capable of quick iteration on designs while still maintaining strong attention to detail
• Portfolio of work showcasing samples of UI / UX design for mobile applications
• You’re a self-starter, enjoy experimentation and are comfortable with limited direction
• Passionate about creator platforms!

What we offer:

• Competitive salary and equity
• Global work from home

title: Senior UI UX Designer
description:

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Experience level: All

Compensation: Competitive Salary
Employment Type: Full-time and Permanent
Location: Hybrid, London, Cambridge
Visa sponsorship: Available

About us
Machine Medicine Technologies (MMT) uses computer vision and computational statistics to enhance the neurological assessment of patients. Our first product, KELVIN, allows motor assessments in Parkinson’s disease to be performed, recorded and used both faster and better than has ever previously been possible. KELVIN-PD is already in use at clinical sites across several countries and possesses a CE mark, being a class-I medical device. MMT aims to build the platform into a generalised tool for patient selection, surgical planning and device programming for machine brain interfacing, a revolutionary therapeutic innovation.
Culture
A fast-moving startup, with an energetic and dynamic team, looking to disrupt the MedTech industry with AI. Our employees are encouraged to take on the sort of career development... opportunities that cannot be found at larger, more established, companies. We are in the highly regulated medical device industry, so our engineering team has to have an even greater focus on quality, usability and versatility. We also like to blow off steam, whether that’s playing a few rounds of table tennis in the office, or arranging an online gaming session.
Company Benefits
• Competitive salary – 30K to 80K (dependent on experience)
• Employee equity programme
• Pension
• 25 days annual leave (+UK bank holidays)
• Offices close to Cambridge, London Bridge, Bermondsey Street and Borough Market

About you
Are you a UI/UX designer looking for the next step in your career? This is an opportunity for a new or experienced Designer looking for a new opportunity in the MedTech space. You will join a small team that is growing and help us with the challenge of melding agile practices into regulatory frameworks.

Key responsibilities:
You will be responsible for driving our development pipeline building UI/UX prototypes on Figma or similar, design reviews and engaging with developers, senior management and clients to ensure quality products are delivered on time. You must:
• Extract key requirements from quarterly high level product meetings
• Prioritise and build the resulting UI/UX designs in the order and priority decided
• Work with clients and product owners to amend and finalise designs
• Work with developers to realise designs
• Facilitate contracted (eventually other full time designers) to assist with delivery of the work
• As a self-starter, plan and drive your own work

Necessary Requirements
• Excellent knowledge of Figma or similar design software
• Experience creating interactive prototypes.
• Excellent spoken and written English to effectively communicate your ideas.
• Impressive, extensive portfolio displaying entire design process
• Thrives off working in a fast paced environment.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills – as a MedTech our output is regulated and audited

Desirable Requirements
• Between 1 to 10 years of work experience as a UI/UX Designer
• Experience of working within a ‘security development lifecycle’
• Experience working as member of a development team using tools such as Jira and Confluence.
• Ownership of past projects
• Experience of DevOps release processes
• Experience of using Scrum or similar

Qualification
• Formal UI/UX design training programme at university, bootcamp or similar

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Requirements
• At least 3 years of proven experience designing digital products that offer clear and simple user interfaces and provide "best in class" user experiences for customers,
• Excitement for the challenge of trying something new,
• Data-driven and research-focused mentality,
• The ability to work well in a fast-paced environment, communicate effectively, and remain open to feedback from people in a variety of disciplines,
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills,
• Excellent organizational and time management skills, and the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time,
• A proactive mindset,
• A commitment to results,
• Passionated and motivated - you sweat the details and are obsessed with quality,
• The ability to "think outside of the box",
• Fluent in English

What the job involves
• Work with a collaborative team of engineers, product managers, and designers,
• Contribute to the vision and long-term strategy in your domain of expertise,
• Design... features that fit our branding and delight our customers using Figma,
• Design tools for our internal users that streamline enterprise workflows,
• Challenge yourself to keep always growing,

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job Title:
Senior UX Designer

Requisition ID:
R016586

Job Description:

Your Mission

As a Senior UX Designer you will join Sledgehammer’s Global UIX team tasked with creating the User Experience of our titles across in-game systems and the front-end, from pre-production through to shipping.

You will be building UX systems, interaction design and documentation for multiple features as well as being responsible for ensuring systems are implemented to AAA standards.

Our Culture

UIX at Sledgehammer is a core pillar of the team with a culture built around the pursuit of excellence at the apex of game design and usability. We have built an inclusive creative process where the team’s collective interface and experience vision fuels the overall direction of the game.

We’re seeking an imaginative, skillful, and versatile designer who has a deep understanding of the diverse audiences video games attract and how to create inclusive interfaces and systems. If you share our passion for... developing deep and engaging games with simple, elegant user experiences then we’d love to hear from you.

Responsibilities

Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
• Working with the UX Lead and Designers to create an exceptional user experience throughout the game.
• Working on the design of the interface (flows, menus and HUDs) to meet design goals.
• Creating engaging prototypes and documentation.
• Working closely with artists and engineers to deliver the best possible user experience while staying within technical and aesthetic requirements.
• Working closely with User Research to ensure systems are rigor tested and informed by data
• Taking an active role in implementation and feature delivery.
• Taking an active role in refining the UX development process, tools and pipeline.

Player Profile
• Exceptional knowledge of the UX field for games.
• 5+ years of practical experience in the field of UI/UX.
• Has basic knowledge of LUA or any other scripting language.
• Has experience in animation and can demonstrate how wireframes translate to motion .
• Is proactive in seeking feedback from peers and leads. Supports others to do the same.
• Proficiency in Figma, Photoshop and Illustrator.
• Can communicate complexity through easy to understand documentation and presentation.
• Proactively manages and communicates their workload to production and leads.

Extra Points
• Proficiency in visual design and aesthetics.
• Deep understanding of games is a requirement but experience working on games is not.
• Has created UX systems and flow for at least one shipped AAA product.
• A clear portfolio of work that demonstrates previous projects and personal values.

Your Platform

Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker.

We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project.

Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4

Our World

Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!

Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
