title: UX/UI Designer
description:
A little about us…

When Rightangled received its first NHS backing in 2017, we wanted to see a change in the way testing was performed and delivered to our close family members. We had a vision to personalise the way treatments are administered and prescribed; Our mission today is to change the status quo. We believe that the future of healthcare lies in precision medicine coupled with advanced digital tools. Our goal is to enable the use of medical technologies in everyday life so that we can improve the health and wellness of our users. Today, Rightangled is a CQC registered health-tech company based in Hammersmith, London and we are rapidly expanding our healthcare services across the UK.

About The Role:

Our UX/UI Designer should be talented, creative, and self-motivated who wants to make an immediate impact on a range of exciting upcoming projects. You will be tasked to maintain and design our platforms to support business growth. We are looking for an energetic and... enthusiastic person, who is passionate about healthcare. Ideally you would have previous experience within a health tech scale up.

What you'll be doing:
• Responsible for design and maintenance of company website and marketing materials
• Create materials for current and prospective customers
• Identify user requirements by researching and analysing user needs, preferences, objectives, and working methods.
• Take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for thousands of people
• Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps
• Work closely with our team to ensure overall brand consistency is maintained
• Present new ideas and designs to advance our brand
• Create, maintain, document and support a common visual language as well as common reusable components, principles and design specifications
• Take ownership of the user experience: mapping user journeys, designing interactions, present and defend design and deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders
• Collaborate with the CS and Marketing teams to identify areas in which design can improve the storytelling + customer experience
• Gather, synthesise, understand and communicate user needs, motivations and behaviours and translate them into digital experiences using design thinking and related methodologies

What you will need:
• BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field
• Minimum of 3 years experience as a UI/UX Designer
• Excellent CSS and HTML skills; up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
• Good knowledge of responsive web design, cross-browser compatibility, creating excellent user experiences
• A high level of concentration and resilience to stay focused on a project to the end and meet deadlines
• Clear communication skills; team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Strong User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) design skills.
• Familiarity with Shopify Plus
• Sketch DesignVideo editing
• Biotechnology and/or Healthcare sector
• Basic understanding of life science and genetics

What we’re looking for…

Rightangled is being scaled up by young and mighty professionals. We strive for diversity, growth mindsets, and excellent work ethics. We believe in meritocracy and redefining standards. We are looking for talented, determined, ambitious, autonomous people to join our family & be part of our story.

The Benefits:

Competitive salary

Annual discretionary performance bonus

All the latest tech you need

Discounted Gym membership

Private Medical Insurance

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Title

UXUI Designer

Location

London

Reports to (job)

Digital Design Lead & Creative Head of Department

Jobs that typically report into this role

-

Department/
Function

Digital

Role Status

-

What’s it like working for one of the most vibrant brands in the UK?

Virgin Media is one of the largest broadband, TV, mobile and home phone providers in the country. We pride ourselves on being brighter, bolder, smarter and faster than our competition, so when we say we’re obsessive about helping our customers make connections that really matter – we really mean it.

The Digital Team brims with passionate creatives with a flair for innovative disruption. We’ve created inclusive, diverse environments perfect for ambitious minds to drive our digital transformation forward. As we move towards an agile approach, we’re looking for an ambitious person who shares our fixation on world-class customer experiences and who isn’t afraid to turn the familiar on its head.

So, what’s it like... working for one of the most vibrant brands in the UK? Why not join us and find out for yourself?

About the role

You’ll be joining as UXUI Designer and be a part of a group of seasoned creatives and specialists. You will be crafting best in class digital experiences that engage our customers and compel them to transact with us and have a seamless experience through a high priority digital transformation programme.

We are seeking a logical thinker and creative problem solver to join the ever-growing team in London. You get under the skin of real user needs and balance them with business requirements to create well rounded solutions and you love taking ideas from whiteboard sketches all the way through to beautifully crafted and polished UI.

You will be working on projects from initial research and conception all the way through to final designs and dev implementation while maintaining our pattern library and ensuring we remain easy to use and accessible. You'll be working with insights to make sure all the experiences we design are fully user-tested and validated before and after launch, ensuring we stay user-centric at all times.

People development is core to our Virgin Media values and you’ll be surrounded and supported by a leading team of digital and technological experts that deliver and evolve at a fast pace, and will help and push you to develop at an equally rapid rate.

About you…
• You are obsessed about providing customers with a world-class digital experience
• You are efficient, motivated, principled yet pragmatic
• You are unflappable and have an inspirational can-do attitude
• You are resilient, methodical thinking and a strategist in nature
• You are a visionary with a desire to dive deep into understanding user needs and balance them with where we can deliver real business value
• You are user-centric and insight driven
• You are not afraid to challenge the status quo in a constructive way when necessary, focusing on solutions rather than problems
• You are able to problem solve with rapid prototyping based on workflow
• You enjoy working collaboratively and influentially with stakeholders
• You have fluent knowledge of user centred design methodologies and approaches
• You have the energy and passion to thrive in a fast-paced environment and delivery squad, finding simple, yet elegant solutions for all aspects of customer experience
• You have an interest in emerging technology, and evolving customer needs
• You are design-system driven, maintaining and improving pattern libraries, design principles and specifications
• You are a self-starter, happy to work autonomously through the design process from research and inception through to high-fidelity design and implementation

Your experience and supporting qualifications
• Degree in a design related discipline
• Minimum of 3 years' experience in a transformational digital environment, telco experience is a bonus but not essential
• Experience as a multi-disciplined Designer and have an obsessive attention to detail
• Understanding and experience of agile methodologies
• Personable, clear communication and presentation skills
• Solid and fluent proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Zeplin, InVision and Adobe CC
• Experience reading/ pulling data from Adobe Analytics/ UserZoom/ Session Camp is a bonus but not essential
• Experience in storytelling a vision through illustration of life-cycle states
• Experience in conducting user testing, remote and face-to-face
• Good understanding of analytics, using data to inform decisions
• Good understanding of A/B and multi-variant testing

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
WE EXIST TO IMPROVE THE PERFORMANCE OF ATHLETES AND TEAMS

Our mission is to improve the performance of athletes and teams, which we do by engineering the premier technology platform for sport. We've been at the forefront of sports technology and science since 2006 - we don't just work in the sporting industry, we are actively changing its future. Our solutions are designed to help athletes and coaches “play smart” in a world where 1% can literally mean the difference between winning and losing.

We work with over 3,000 teams around the world, empowering coaches, managers and trainers in premier teams in the NFL, NBA, NHL, MLS, EPL, AFL, NRL, NCAA and more. We provide the information they need to optimise athletes’ health, game-day readiness, and performance, as well as in-game tactics. Our solutions include wearable technology, video analytics, and athlete monitoring solutions, and we are passionate about helping sports organizations at all levels to better scout, recruit, teach, and... win.

WE WANT PEOPLE WHO ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT PRODUCT DESIGN

We are looking for a talented Senior UX/UI Designer whose curiosity and determination for continuous improvement aligns with our ambitious, fast-growing and transforming company. Based in London, you will add user experience and visual design expertise to our product delivery squads, promoting the importance of a collaborative and iterative design process. As Senior UX/UI Designer you are responsible for defining our customer exploration and user research plans, as well as leading the creation of usable, accessible and compelling user interfaces on projects ranging from wireframes and individual components to complete design systems.

We believe that our customers deserve the best platform and we are on a mission to maximise and enhance their performance through delivering a high quality experience. Our Senior UX/UI Designer needs to match this ethos by taking responsibility for constantly improving productivity and development of self and others and be able to lead in a fast-paced environment with short project timelines from conception to deployment.

What you’ll do:
• Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers and Designers to create world-class user experiences
• Create, evaluate and modify intuitive, elegant and compelling UI interfaces for complex interactions.
• Lead the creation of wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups and visual design specifications
• Define key experience design activities including user research, workshops and interviews
• Use ongoing customer testing, research and analytics to understand user behaviour
• Promote and execute user-testing within and across teams
• Provide mentorship and guidance to other UX designers
• Help drive continual improvements to processes, design activities, testing and operations
• Collaborate with Engineers to create and maintain well-documented design systems that include guidelines and examples of how to apply design and brand styles
• Integrate multivariate tests to learn why variants work, as well as conduct around-the-office user testing in all stages of the product cycle

What you’ll need:
• 8+ years recent UX/UI design experience leading and delivering multiple projects to production
• Problem solving, team-work, communication and collaboration!
• Sound knowledge of user-centred design and best practice to be able to define the customer exploration and user research strategy
• Solid understanding of desktop, web, mobile accessibility and standards, common UI patterns and usability best practices.
• Confident presenting to groups, facilitating testing sessions and explaining design options
• Proven experience working with Agile methodologies for delivering software
• Familiarity with web and native UI technologies (React) would be helpful
• Nice to have: Past experience with product-related UI such as wearables or data visualization

WHY CATAPULT?
• We have amazing people. We can promise you will work with some of the most ambitious and intelligent people in an exciting industry, and you will do some of the best work of your life.
• We encourage our people to have constructive, open and honest communication; to make Catapult extraordinary; innovate and create smart solutions; establish a collaborative, yet challenging, environment to develop our performance and the performance of our customers.
• Our workforce spans more than 20 countries, you'll get the opportunity to work across multiple nationalities and cultures, and build your global awareness and capability even beyond what it is today.
• We value improvement and development. We are challenging ourselves to continuously grow and become a high-performance company. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do, and our people are always looking for ways to do things better. There is unlimited opportunity to grow, do more, and do better.

Whether you’re interested in sports or not, you’ll have the satisfaction of knowing your work is supporting some of the most successful teams and individual athletes on the planet! While we have access to many exciting opportunities, we also realise that we are here to do a very important job for our customers. As a result, we aim to work with purpose and intention. We look for people that fit into our team culture, those who actively contribute and individuals who are excited about what they do.

In order to build the future of sports performance, we need the brightest talent in order to do so. If you think you can contribute to the empowering, enjoyable and exciting Catapult environment, then we invite you to apply

title: Principal UI UX Designer
description:
The people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Imagine what you could do here!

We at core, believe in Customer, Community and Compassion and looking for like minded individual's to create a difference with us!

Vamstar is a data science-powered B2B healthcare marketplace that helps suppliers find the most relevant healthcare contracting leads using Artificial Intelligence (AI). We apply real-time machine learning forecasts, analyse buyers and competitor behaviours, and perform analytics at scale. Learn more about us at www.vamstar.io

We are looking for a full-time remote UI designer who will be applying interactive and visual design principles, for an attractive and cohesive user experience and wants to solve big user experience challenges that will reshape the healthcare industry for generations. You will get the opportunity to be involved in, design and implementation of... the UI. The successful candidates will be working in a team of highly skilled and experienced developers, data scientists, Head of Product and CTO.

Education & Experience
• Degree in design-related field or equivalent experience.

Ideal Candidate:
• Understanding of apps and web app will be mandatory.
• Working with a wide range of channels, Offline, Online Digital & affiliate contributing ideas and design artwork to the overall brief.
• Has experience working with multi geography teams based in India, US, UK etc.
• Strong communication and presentation skills
• Deep fascination of technology and willingness to learn.
• Capacity to make sound decisions.
• Outstanding organizational skills and process oriented thinking.
• Infectious energy and enthusiasm.
• Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Their designs are required for a huge variety of products and activities, such as web application, advertising, exhibitions and displays, corporate communications and corporate identity, e.g. giving the organisation a visual 'brand'.
• Build highly detailed design specifications that enable developers to implement the experience.
• Expertise in core UX disciplines including information architecture, interaction design, application of design systems, and UI design.
• Knowledge of CSS extension languages. Expertise in standard UX software such as Figma, HTML and CSS is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

Requirement
• 4+ years of professional experience with the design and development of highly interactive products and digital interfaces such as websites, m-web, and native apps
• A basic understanding of semantically sound HTML5, CSS3 code and basic
• Excellent knowledge of web standards, native mobile design systems (iOS and Android), progressive improvements, dynamic content retrieval, and responsive/adaptive design techniques
• Should have a portfolio that details strong interaction, thought process, and graphic design skills
• A tendency to think between the layers and drive your goals via motion rich interactions

Vamstar is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build. Below add ons will be a merit:-
• An in-depth understanding of Internet technologies and architectures and general application development.
• Flexible attitude and willing to take on new challenges - someone who is dynamic, high-energy and works with a sense of urgency.
• Strong understanding of the full life-cycle development process. Must understand both agile and traditional development techniques, and be eager to influence the processes adopted by the team in delivering projects.
• Adhere and contribute towards architectural & development techniques and standards.

Before applying, read more about us at www.vamstar.io

title: UI/UX Designer - Gaming Industry - 50K Base
description:
UI/UX Designer

Gaming Industry - Remote - 50K Base

Please note this role cannot provide sponsorship you will need full right to work within the UK.

We are an interactive learning company, with the mission of making education fun! Having started our journey through a series of print products, many of which became best sellers. We have since transitioned to the Educational Tech space (Ed-Tech), where we are currently edifying the gaming industry through a series of exciting games.

We recently partnered with Roblox to help build an educational game that'll be setup within schools on a global scale! We are now looking for a UI/UX designer to help make this dream a reality and to help build out the UI for a truly fantastic user experience.

You will help design, wireframe and implement the UI based on our current concept, while working with the wider creative team to integrate our trademark style into your work. Working with multiple points within the team to help deliver the project... but also with our QA team to test the UI/UX and help identify and mitigate critical bugs as they arise.

title: Technical UI Designer
description:
Job Title:
Technical UI Designer

Requisition ID:
R019058

:
Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the video game development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker.

We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last... Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project.

Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4

Your Mission:

Sledgehammer Games is seeking a Technical UI Designer for an exciting, unannounced project. You will bridge the gap between UI Engineering, UX Design, and UI Art. You will be responsible for converting design wireframes into maintainable, extensible script in our custom Lua-based UI engine. You will also be responsible for making prototype UI using our proprietary UI tool.
Candidates should have a good understanding of human-software interaction and experience communicating complex information with simple aesthetics. The ideal candidate is passionate, loves making great games and has a fundamental understanding of art, design and engineering principles. We value a culture of collaboration and are seeking an imaginative, resourceful, and versatile technical designer to join our team. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking gameplay with a validated team, then this may be the position you've been waiting for!

Responsibilities:
• Work closely with UI artists, UX designers, and UI engineers to create an exceptional overall player experience throughout the game
• Use proprietary UI editor and scripting (Lua) to implement UI art & motion, in collaboration with various team members, to ensure visual fidelity
• Create in-engine functional prototypes based on UX wireframes
• Evaluate performance and ensure the UI is as optimal as possible by balancing art needs with technical restraints
• Debug and work with QA to meet functional standards
• Contribute documentation to uphold a practice of knowledge sharing around processes, best practices, and workflow

Player Profile:
• 3+ years of experience in technical design, UI tech art or another similar field
• Good understanding of UI, UX and motion design principles
• Solid implementation and technical design knowledge foundation using a scripting language such as Lua or other engines’ UI editor tools
• Creative problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills
• Work ethic that leans towards communication, collaboration, and empathy
• Working knowledge of Photoshop

Extra Points:
• Understanding of materials and shaders for UI
• Experience with visual design
• Proficiency with other Figma and Adobe Creative Suite tools
• Practical experience with other C-based languages

Our World:

Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!

Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

title: UI/UX Designer (Mid Level)
via: via Jobs At Pulselive | Pulselive Careers - Pinpoint
description:
UI/UX Designer (Mid Level)

Department: Design

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: London, UK

Reporting To: David Strachan
Description

As a Midweight Product Designer at Pulselive you will play a hands on role in the way in which some of the most followed clubs and organisations in world sport engage and inspire their millions of fans. You will play a key role in the delivery of visuals for multiple projects across our entire client base, factoring in both UI and UX considerations, across both web and native mobile platforms.

As a Midweight Product Designer you are expected to demonstrate a strong ability for creating clean, precise and impactful visuals that demonstrate sound UX principles and deliver on the objectives set. Often led by a Senior Product Designer, although not always, you will be responsible for delivering a range of visuals that continue a vision throughout the rest of the project, ensuring consistency and quality throughout. You will also play a key role in... wider delivery squads, being the voice for creative across ongoing project workstreams.

You will be comfortable in talking through visuals, evolving ideas, and providing solutions that meet the requirements of the client and internal development teams. In addition to working on longer term client projects, you will also be expected to support the wider team with smaller tasks from time to time, as and when is necessary.

You will demonstrate a positive attitude and a willingness to develop your own personal skills as a designer. You will seek to involve other members of the creative, product, and development teams into your own design process to ensure you design solutions that meet all necessary requirements. Pulselive promotes a culture for continuous improvement and collaboration so leaning on and learning from Senior and Lead designers is encouraged for whatever task or project you are working on.

Key Responsibilities
• Producing high quality visuals that demonstrate good UI and UX principles
• Work across numerous major clients and multiple projects, web and app
• Taking ownership of the visuals you are working on, ensuring each design meets requirements across internal teams, the client and, most importantly, the user
• Managing your own time and workloads
• Supporting across other projects where necessary
• Striving to ensuring every piece of work meets Pulselive standards for visual and usability quality, seeking input from Senior and Lead Designers where necessary
• Presenting your designs and concepts both to internal teams and to clients when required

Skills Knowledge and Expertise
• A talented mid-weight creative with a minimum of 3 years design experience
• A keen eye for design, capable of delivering high quality, impactful visuals
• A positive and open attitude to collaboration and input from other stakeholders
• A drive and determination to continually improve, hungry to learn every day
• An good communicator, able to articulate their thoughts clearly
• An obsession for creating pixel perfect work, never accepting of ‘good enough’
• A methodical and well organised approach to your work and time management
• Good understanding of UX and the ability to design intuitive, interactive experiences
• Passion or good knowledge of sport
• Clear understanding of latest trends in digital design
• Excellent working knowledge of Sketch, Photoshop, Zeplin & InVision

Benefits

At Pulselive we truly value our team and have developed our approach to ensure you are not only rewarded for your contribution but have access to unique benefits along with a positive approach to wellness. We want to ensure that your career, health and well-being are of the utmost importance at all times.

Benefits & Wellness
• Flexible & Remote Working
• Buy and Sell Annual Leave
• Pension Scheme
• Sporting Events and Tickets
• Health & Wellness Activities
• Complimentary Headspace Access
• Annual Wellness Contribution
• Mobile Phone Contribution
• Sony Discounts

﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
A digital agency are on the hunt for an innovative and collaborative UI/UX Designer. The team is close-knit & are looking for someone to join the team who is passionate about new technologies & creating unique digital experiences.

Key Responsibilities
• Design end-to-end through collaborative brainstorming, sketching, user journeys, wireframes, prototypes, & visual design
• Working across a range of clients across web, app & product experiences
• Presenting ideas internally & externally to clients

Salary & Benefits
• £40K-£55k
• Hybrid working

title: Web & UI/UX Designer
description:
Who are we?

Y-combinator backed and recently voted ‘Fintech Startup of the Year 2022’ at Fintech Awards London, Verto helps businesses in emerging markets reach the world by making cross-border payments easy.

We enable businesses to accept payments and send payouts globally in one single platform. Each year we process billions of dollars of payments and provide companies with solutions which help them to save money, automate processes and grow. We have worked with thousands of businesses globally since our launch in 2018 and have high growth aspirations for the future. By 2028, its forecasted payments revenue from emerging markets will exceed that of mature markets by $400bn, join Verto to make us the number one B2B payment provider in this space.

The role

As a Web Designer at Verto you’ll report directly to our VP of Growth but also work collaboratively with the product, marketing and content team to iterate the product and make the brand consistent across channels. We’re about... to embark on an overhaul of our marketing website and we’re looking for an ambitious and experienced web designer to lead the change.

Success in this role requires outside-the-box thinkers, we believe that the best designs are made with bold yet thoughtful decisions. With a keen eye for detail and a customer-driven approach, you will be focused on producing seamless friction-free journeys that drive impactful customer experience and commercial results. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, can take ownership of design deliverables, and confidently bring their ideas to the table while having a seat at it too.

What you’ll be doing
• Leading the redesign of our marketing website from initial research and mapping end-to-end journeys all the way through to final designs and dev implementation, all while keeping our customer experience at the forefront.
• Leading the creation and maintenance of a reusable component library as part of our emerging design system to create a cohesive customer experience and improve efficiency.
• Presenting design concepts and negotiating with stakeholders to arrive at a design that supports both the business and a strong user experience.
• Working with our other designers to develop brand guidelines and assets that support our creative vision and ensure design consistency
• Working collaboratively to deliver the best possible experiences for our users, taking into account commercial goals and realities, and technical constraints.
• Working to strict deadlines with a proactive approach. Schedule management is key for this role to ensure projects are delivered on time to the specified requirements.
• Keeping up to date on current trends, competitors, and the overall market to ensure that Verto is an industry leader.

Requirements
• 3+ years of experience in a web designer role, preferably within a B2B, Fintech or SaaS environment
• Good knowledge of Figma, Sketch, XD, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, or any other tool is also welcomed as long as you can transition to Figma.
• Fluent knowledge of user-centred design methodologies and approaches
• More than just a keen eye for visual design and great taste: you design with purpose and with user experience in mind.
• You speak the language of designers, developers, stakeholders, and most importantly - users
• Basic awareness of web development principles and coding languages (HTML, CSS, REACT and Javascript)
• A passion for learning, the world of design is constantly evolving, and we want our Designers to match this. You’ll bring a proactive approach to problem-solving, always striving to improve.
• Ownership and growth mentality with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively, with excellent communication and influencing skills
• A strong design portfolio. We’d love to see your portfolio as part of your application.

What We Offer

• 31 days holiday each year (Including Bank Holidays)

• 5% Employer contribution towards Pension

• Hybrid working policy

• Regular company social events

• Perkbox Subscription and private health and dental for employees and their family

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
At Behaviour Lab, we’re changing the way the world makes investments — but we can’t do it alone.

We empower asset managers, private equity firms, insurance companies and executive boards across the globe to solve their trickiest problems. Our approach brings together analytics, research, algorithms, and science to help organizations continually improve their decision-making.

Behaviour Lab’s vision is to help transform how the £70 trillion active asset management industry makes their investment decisions through our smart decision-making platform using behaviour science and advanced analytics.

How our platform is designed is a critical component to ensuring our clients can easily make the behavioural changes that will ultimately make the difference to their decision making.

We are looking for a UX/UI Designer who can be part of enabling us to do so. The successful candidate will ideally already have experience working on challenging design problems for complex applications.
They... will have an entrepreneurial mindset and be excited to colour outside the lines and wear whatever hat needs wearing to get the job done. If you are a passionate problem solver with a can-do-attitude, driven by being part of a team that is at the forefront of innovation, and wanting to go that extra mile, then we may be just the team for you.

Requirements
• 2+ years hands-on experience in the UX/UI Design field
• Solid understanding of UX design processes, information architecture, web and application usability and best-in-class UI design
• Experience with Figma
• Experience working with / creating design systems and component libraries
• Experience designing for complex web/desktop applications
• Excellent teamwork and communication skills, ability to handle pressure and adapt to new and complex domains
• Excellent portfolio with examples of work involving complex applications and an outline of your approach to tackling these challenges
• Experience working in the financial services industry / fintech is a plus or other similarly complex domains
• Experience with advanced prototyping tools such as Axure RP, Protopie etc. is a plus
• Experience working on data visualisations is a plus
• Practical familiarity with modern technologies and frameworks such as React and Typescript would be a bonus
• Familiarity with accessibility standards and best practices

What the job involves

We are currently entering the initial launch phase of our smart decision-making platform. We are looking for someone to join the Behaviour Lab Design team who can hit the ground running, help us accelerate through this phase and craft experiences for some incredibly exciting new features. They will always be striving to identify ways to continuously improve the platform and maintain a high-quality experience.

Day to Day Responsibilities will include:
• Leveraging, contributing to, and helping build & maintain our design system in Figma.
You will be documenting existing components and styles; creating new highly flexible componentry where needed and looking for ways to improve scalability
• Creating detailed UX and Visual Design specs to hand over to engineering teams to implement, ensuring they have all the details necessary.
• Producing high quality visual designs
• Working collaboratively with product owners and the rest of the design team - asking the right questions to gain an understanding of product requirements and user needs; synthesising these into neat, intuitive solutions
• Utilising sketches, flow diagrams, wireframes, and interactive prototypes to explore and craft design ideas iteratively
• Presenting design concepts and interactions to the rest of the design team as well as various other stakeholders
• Incorporating feedback from users, stakeholders, and the rest of team
• Helping to refine and evolve our design processes, from user research to implementation

How do we know you're the perfect match?
• You’re passionate about using design to find solutions to complex challenges
• You have experience working on complex design challenges in enterprise, financial services or similar
• You welcome constructive feedback
• You are an evangelist for quality design and want to part of a fast growing team
• Thrive in high-pressure constantly evolving environments
• Inquisitive and passionate about learning new things
• Willing to roll-up your sleeves and get stuck in
• Take great pride in your work and the value you create for clients, the organisation and team you work with
• Wanting to go that extra mile to help this young firm and the team become successful for years to come

Company Benefits
• An organisation that recognises the importance of design and considers it a key component for the success of all our products
• The opportunity to be part of building and shaping the culture of a company focusing on a highly innovative space within the investment industry.
• Somewhere you can instantly see the impact you have on your team and clients’ performance, and where you are helping change the way investment decisions are made.
• A chance to learn from a group of individuals with world leading experiences across investment classes, change management and behavioural science.
• A learning culture with dedicated time to learn new skills.
• Great office in central London with a gym and wonderful rooftop.
• Private health insurance
• A competitive salary, option plan and performance-based bonus.

Other FAQs
• This is a full-time role
• We are open to visa sponsorship
• Option to work remote up to 3 days per week

title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer
description:
Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global audience of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly-owned subsidiary of SEGA, having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. No matter how big we dream, though, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented UI/UX Designer for our fast-growing Design team. Collaborating with the UI and Games Design teams you will be assisting in improvements being made to the overall UI of the product, with a specific focus on usability. This role offers the... chance to work on and develop for the world’s leading football management simulation titles. We are also aiming to improve our accessibility support to ensure our games are enjoyed by a wider range of audiences and would hope the successful applicant shares that passion.

The successful candidate will be organised, self-motivated and able to communicate with all disciplines, both within the design team and across the wider studio. You'll be keen to share your expertise and experience as well as committed to the constant improvement of your own skills and knowledge.

Please note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive any applications without a portfolio link showcasing your best work will be discounted.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with Games Design in developing new and exciting features for upcoming versions of Football Manager.
• Produce UI designs & assets of a consistently high quality.
• Communicate your work through Site Maps, User flows and early stage wireframing through to hi-res mock-ups.
• Work with the UI/UX Design Lead and Production to develop and grow your skillset.
• Within cross-disciplinary Feature Pods, collaborate with QA, Production, and other development disciplines to ensure all new features are placing the user and usability as a top priority.

Knowledge, Skill and Experience:
• Strong understanding of key UI design principles
• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets
• Ability to communicate clearly and tell stories throughout the design process
• Experience with visual design software such as Figma and Miro
• A passion for UIUX design
• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user
• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team
• Clear written and verbal communication.

Desirable:
• Experience creating prototypes, wireframes and developing user flows
• 2+ years UI/UX professional experience within software production (ideally within the games industry but not exclusively)
• Experience in Unity
• Animation or motion design skills (e.g. After Effects, Principle etc.)
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS or similar
• Basic Understanding of Accessibility settings in games
• Experience of Adobe Suite (Illustrator/Photoshop)
• Interest in Football Manager and Football, whilst very helpful, is not essential

Working Here:

We approach everything with passion, whether that’s leaving our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who works here.

We like our talent to be tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to consistent improvement and encourage our people to truly realise their own personal potential.

We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do and that’s one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry 2021 Large studio category).

If you want a positive work/life balance, we’re right behind you. While we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on, so you can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.

Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid, and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.

When you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.
• We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.

Inclusivity Matters:
We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.

SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process.

This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
We're on a mission to help people build credit: a simple mission that requires a simple user experience.

We are building the tools that empower the next generation of homeowners, families, explorers, thinkers and people to live a healthy, strong financial life: tools that matter to people. Founded in 2018, Bits is now the default way for building credit, for anyone.

Our design studio is based in London, UK, while our development team is situated remotely across Europe and South America. We're a diverse team of individuals, with decades of experience in finance, design, development and we all care greatly about the quality of products we release.

We’re still a small team, and we love new experiences and product building. With regard to design, we’re looking for someone who likes to build openly, picking up problems and solving them. The UI is what the consumer sees, touches, and manipulates, and that’s why we are hiring a UI designer who believes that the smallest of details... matter.

Requirements:
• 5 years experience of UI design
• Excellent visual and interaction skills
• Excellent social skills

What you’ll do:
• Work towards the main product and design direction of the whole company
• Create UI designs (for web and mobile) for Bits and Bits Card
• Work at the epicentre of design alongside our Product Lead and Engineers
• Use, and mainly evolve our internal design system
• Create flows, prototypes and high-fidelity visuals for new features
• Be the first step towards establishing a design culture at Bits

What we value:
• A passion for design and finding UI/UX solutions and interaction obstacles
• Strong written/verbal communication skills
• Expressing ideas through prototyping (We use Figma and Framer)
• Experience with tools like PS, AI, AF, Figma

What Bits Offers:
• Impactful work. Our product literally helps people build credit and get a mortgage
• MacBook Pro + other tools you may need (Monitors, etc.)
• Interesting and challenging work
• A healthy work life balance
• Competitive salary
• Regular paid lunch and coffee during work days
• Regular team events/breakfasts
• 28 days paid annual leave, incl. bank holidays

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Salary 55,000 - 70,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
-2-5 years' experience in a UX/UI role
-Strong experience with classic UX tools such as Figma or InVision
-Sound understanding of user experience practices and methodologies
-Aesthetic skills with the ability to combine various colors, fonts and layouts into striking and uncluttered comps
-Hands-on experience with imaging/sketching software, such as Sketch, Photoshop, Indesign and Adobe Illustrator
-Experience conducting and drawing insight from user research through user-testing workshops and A/B testing
-Able to seamlessly switch between UX and UI perspectives
-A degree in a related field eg Psychology, Design, Visual Arts
-Strong portfolio of related works

Responsibilities:

- KEY ASPECTS OF THE ROLE
-Leading our UX initiatives by acquiring a deep understanding of the motivations and behaviours of our customers
-Using a variety of UX research techniques including user interviews, surveys and A/B tests... to understand things our users love and what challenges they face
-Designing mockups, sketches, wireframes, high fidelity prototypes and visual designs in order to create fantastic customer experiences within our ecosystem
-Deriving insight from our analytics platforms to inform our understanding of our products and help shape them in the future
-Drawing out personas and plotting customer journey maps to fully understand how our customers move around the ecosystem we are creating
-Communicate UX/UI design decisions and the rationale behind them throughout the company

Technologies:

- Figma
- InVision
- Sketch
- Indesign

More: TLC has become THE global MarTech solution to reward consumer behaviour with experiences. Now operating from 14 worldwide hubs, the TLC Platform connects millions of consumers with over 150,000 experience reward venues. We trust in decades of proprietary data to ensure we offer the right experience to every individual.
At TLC, we know that experiences make life more rewarding!

WHAT WE OFFER
-A dynamic & collaborative team
-Creative work environment
-Career Pathway & Progression
-Opportunity for training and upskilling
-Global Clients & Team exposure
-TLC 'Fun Club' & Social Calendar (known to include doggy days in the office )
-TLC Gives Back - Opportunity to get involved with our Charity partner/off site days.
-'The Frankies' - Our very own awards/staff recognition event.

Being a people-led agency, we hire upon values and believe that our people are what make the beloved TLC culture.
At TLC we aim to create a world within the world' that is free from prejudice, bias and inequity.
A world where diversity is valued and celebrated, and where we work hard to ensure all our wonderful people are given equal opportunity to succeed.
If you want to be part of the TLC Marketing Worldwide success story, then make sure you click to apply today!

We look forward to seeing your application

title: UI / UX Designer - REMOTE
description: UX-UI Developer - Fully RemoteOur client is a prestigious international Financial Services / online trading Company. The Company is looking for a candidate with great design skills and an excellent online portfolio.Our client will focus on candidates with work examples within similar industries (banking, financial services, cryptocurrency etc).Main requirements: Bachelor or Master's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), UI/UX design or equivalent degree At least 3 years' experience in a similar position Portfolio that demonstrates experience with problem-solving, and technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms (e.g. desktop and mobile, Android and iOS) Experience in best practices for information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques Knowledge of industry tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Zeplin and Principle. Experience with planning and conducting... user research, user testing, A/B testing and rapid prototyping Agile Experience Strong communication skills with ability to articulate and optimize design based on the value to the user and the businessThe Role: As our UI/UX Designer, you will help shape the end-to-end journey of how clients interact with our products. The UI/UX team works on delivering an intuitive and user-friendly trading experience by focusing on design, usability and function. As part of the UI/UX Team, you will be responsible for measuring, optimising and improving ease-of-use; as well as exploring different approaches to solving end-user problems.Some of your responsibilities will include: conducting user research and testing, creating personas, and developing wireframes, prototypes and task flows. You will be working closely with Graphic and Product Designers to come up with inspirational UI designs, as well as working with the Web Development Team to implement and test your work.The main responsibilities of the position include: Translate concepts into user flows, journeys, wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences Create user stories, personas, and storyboards Apply user-centric methodologies and common practices to design websites, UIs, mobile UIs and online content Optimise designs by devising elegant solutions Facilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products Plan and conduct competitor analysis & user research Collaborate with project managers, designers, developers and other departments to create engaging content and interfaces

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Description

Our Client is a renewable energy organization that is undergoing rapid growth. It aims to help facilitate the energy transition demands of the UK and EU by developing and investing into large-scale solar and battery storage projects.

Their team comprises individuals with a proven track record in both infrastructure investment and the renewable spheres. As the team expands, we seek a Senior UI/UX Designer
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, and widgets
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g... responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images
• Excellent understanding of databases.
• Experience of working within teams that use AGILE methodology (preferred); management, as required.

Requirements
• Bachelors Degree;
• Degree in Computer Sciences, Design, or relevant field
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
• Aptitude for organization and analytical reasoning;

Benefits

They are, an innovative scale-up renewable energy company with backing from a blue-chip investment fund provides a fast paced and dynamic workplace environment. A people focused company with a passion for environmental sustainability. Continuous learning and development opportunities, financial stability, healthcare benefits, attractive salary and bonus:
• Share ownership and profit-sharing scheme
• Premium Private Health Insurance plan
• Life Insurance
• Income Protection
• Corporate Gym membership
• EV Car Scheme (Electric vehicle purchase facility for employees)
• Season Travel Ticket Loans
• Company funded Training and Certification opportunities
• Flexible, hybrid working model

Requirements

Skills and Qualifications Proven success as a technical team leader, with at least 2 years' experience in scoping, developing and implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Cloud solutions including Dynamics configuration, custom assembly development, integration code, and data migration Proven experience with M365 governance and data protection services including Information Protection and DLP Experience in developing reporting and business intelligence tools using as a minimum PowerBI, Report Builder, Dynamics reporting and dashboarding Excellent code review and quality assurance skills as well as experience with source control management systems, deployments and integrations 5+ years' experience of .NET Framework and C# development and working with SQL server solutions Strong knowledge of C# and .NET, JavaScript, HTML Design, Canvas or Model Driven frameworks Understanding of ADO.NET, ASP.NET, Windows Communication and Workflow Foundation Strong knowledge of SharePoint and Microsoft Teams environments Microsoft Dynamics developer certification preferred Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field A flexible team player with excellent communication skills

title: UX Designer
description:
Company Description

Merkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices. For more than 30 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. The agency's heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive people-based marketing strategies. Its combined strengths in performance media, customer experience, customer relationship management, loyalty, and enterprise marketing technology drive improved marketing results and competitive advantage. With 9,600 employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, with 24 additional offices in the US and 29 offices in Europe and APAC. In 2016, the agency joined the Dentsu Aegis Network.

Job Description

We are seeking a... talented UI/UX Designer for our fast-growing Design team. Collaborating with the UI teams you will be assisting in projects delivering visual design and UI, with a specific focus on usability.

This designer will have +2 years of experience and would have worked on 2 – 3 projects with limited exposure to visual design and best practices.

Key Responsibilities

• Produce UI designs & assets of a consistently high quality.

• Work with the UI/UX Design Lead to develop and grow your skillset.

• Collaborate with senior designers to create and extend a design system to provide consistency across multiple touchpoints

• Help plan, conduct and interpret usability testing

• Iterate through early wireframing to hi-fi mock-ups.

Qualifications

• Strong understanding of UI design principles and prototyping

• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets (e.g. buttons, icons, menus etc)

• proficiency with Figma is a must have

• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user

• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team

Additional Information

At Merkle, we believe that a diverse environment improves us as a community and as a business. We want to foster an environment of growth, where all ideas and contributions are encouraged. We need this culture of courage to continue to thrive in our fast-paced industry. We embrace differences of opinion. We value diversity of experience and thought, which help us to challenge and define industry-leading solutions, and support our goal of being a great place to work.

Merkle fosters a diverse environment that encourages original thinking about our business and empowers us to communicate with a global world of customers. We embrace differences of opinion and diversity of thought as they help us challenge and refine our solutions. Merkle, as a best-in-class marketing agency, welcomes big ideas, and believes they can come from anywhere.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
About us

Innovation is fuelled by the power of possibilities. A few years ago, it was virtually impossible to innovate because building software needed a degree, it was simply too expensive, too complex, too risky and ultimately too inefficient. That’s why only 16% of projects were ever done on budget and 78% failed.

We're changing that. We’re flipping software development on its head and kicking out the notion that you need to be an expert or do boot camps to learn how to make your app. Builder.ai’s platform lets you order the perfect software app for whatever problem you’re trying to solve. Our AI powered assembly line brings together Lego-like reusable features and experts from around the world to bring world-class ideas to life – ANYONE’s world-class ideas.

Building software needs to be like ordering pizza – pick what you want, get recommendations for the features you need and simply wait till it's cooked and ready for you.

Our human-assisted AI platform helps anyone build... run & scale tailor-made software. Everyone from the bakery in Riyadh and nursery in London, to large fortune 100 companies like the BBC or Pepsi.

Life at Builder

It’s a place where everything moves at lightning pace and most definitely not for the faint hearted. We celebrate diversity, push everyone to do more with less and yet provide a culture that allows everyone to experiment, push boundaries and learn by doing. Every Builder runs to our core value system of HEARTT (Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust & Transparency) and we’re always looking for team players, with a point of view, a sense of humility and a let’s-get-stuff-done attitude.

Our scale up is at the intersection of a quirky startup where designers and machine learning specialists work on problems together to savvy commercial teams working with finance folks to invent new business models. #WhatWouldYouBuild

Why we need this role
We are looking for a UI/UX Designer with a proven history of delivering successful and engaging user experiences to join our Design team. The UI/UX Designer will work closely with the Experimentation team who are relatively new. We are looking for a creative design thinker to help build experiences that will change a major industry. Our ideal candidate will understand product specifications, whilst maintaining a genuine interest in user psychology. The team is a fast-paced environment, and there will be lots to do. Plus, working with the experimentation team means you’ll get to understand the real impact of your designs on our users, as well as the bottom-line.

Key Responsibilities
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with Optimisation Consultants/CRO.
• Translate requirements/briefs into engaging, interactive and customer-centric experiences
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps.
• Create wireframes, user flows, sitemaps, user research, personae creation.
• Identify and troubleshoot UI/UX problems.
• Adhere to and help evolve the design system
• Keep up with interaction design trends.
• Researching technology trends.
• Iterative prototyping and usability testing with users.
• Analytical and data driven insights that drive design.
• Executing interaction design and visual design as a part of a multi disciplinary team.
• Champion a customer-centric culture of world class UX execution throughout the business
• 5yrs+ experience in UI/UX design.
• Experience working in a collaborative team and directly with developers.
• Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail.
• Ability to create user flows and wireframes, as well as pixel perfect design for developers.
• An excellent sense of typography, layout and general design principles.
• Efficient working in Figma, Sketch and associated design tools.
• Knowledge and experience of user research and usability testing.
• Experience with user interface design patterns and standard UCD methodologies.
• Experience of working alongside experimentation teams is a plus, but not required
• Strong communication & presentation skills (written, oral and visual).
• Health and wellness benefits
• Performance-based bonuses and stock options
• Employee friendly policies
• Generous vacation and time off benefits, including paid holidays
• Generally flexible working hours

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Live UI/UX Designer Role

UX/UI Designer role with a Market Leading IT Security Company - 55k + Bonus Central London - Hybrid - 1-2 days a week in office

Your New Company

you will work for a Global IT Security Company, who are looking to expand on their 2000 wide employee base as a world leader in. They have over 40,000 customers across a range of 100 countries, looking to further expand globally. They are known for their ability to mitigate risk and create advanced solutions to a range of complexities, such as technological fallibility and malicious cyberattacks, and you will be responsible for preserving the brands legacy and boosting their popularity as the market leader in their field. Your New Role You will be responsible for ensuring both the user interface and user experience are optimized for improved usability and exceptional visual design across their various digital assets, for both the user and the brand. Font end coding is also crucial of this role, such as designing UI... elements for their digital asset's library. Collaboration with the marketing team as well as a variety of stakeholders will be necessary to ensure the creation of a tailored experience of the user, as well as presenting this tailored experience to these shareholders. The UX element will require testing to analyse and predict user behaviour, whilst working in an agile environment among highly skilled designers, developers and user strategists.

What you will need to succeed
• A Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 1-4 years' UI/UX design experience for digital products or services
• Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Figma, InVision, Axure, HTML, CSS, Design Systems, Miro and Adobe Creative Suite.
• A team player but can work independently too.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
• Up-to date portfolio detailing skill sets.

What you will need to do now

Does all of this excite you and entice you to learn more? Apply with your CV now below, or contact me for more information on the role, or any other similar roles you may be on the look-out for; I can certainly open some doors for you!

title: Product UX Designer
description:
Marex is a technology-enabled provider of essential liquidity and associated market infrastructure to participants in global energy, metals, agricultural and financial markets.

The Group provides comprehensive breadth and depth of coverage across five core services: Market Making, Execution and Clearing, Hedging and Investment Solutions, Price Discovery and Data & Advisory. It has a leading franchise in many major metals, energy and agricultural products, executing around 38 million trades and clearing over 193 million contracts in 2021. The Group provides access to the world’s major commodity markets, covering a broad range of clients that include some of the largest commodity producers, consumers and traders, banks, hedge funds and asset managers.

Marex was established in 2005 but can trace its roots in the commodity markets back almost 100 years. Headquartered in London with 21 offices worldwide, the Group has over 1,100 employees across Europe, Asia and America.

Designers at... Marex shape the entire customer experience across all digital touchpoints. The Design Team is growing and is looking for a talented UX Designer to bring empathy to problem solving, and craft compelling digital experiences for our clients and employees.

It's a great time to join our ambitious team and get involved with a business that is focused, humancentred and a really great place to work. You'll be encouraged to share your ideas, try new things, and take ownership of your own development.

As a Designer you'll be responsible for creating appealing and cohesive experiences across several digital touchpoints to increase user satisfaction and productivity, whilst supporting the commercial growth objectives of the company.

Accountabilities

• Discovery exploration and research: problem finding before problem solving.
• Craft UI prototypes for digital products leveraging and informing reusable and scalable design patterns.
• Represent UX/UI design in scrum ceremonies: daily stand-ups, backlog grooming, sprint planning and demos.
• Work closely with developers to minimise the gap between ideation and execution.
• Engage with stakeholders in defining user needs and business problems, designing and iterating on product features across platforms.
• Create wireframes, sketches, or other forms of low-fidelity prototypes to communicate ideas and solutions to solve specific problems.
• Develop elegant user experiences by producing user flows and service blueprints that are simple and easy to communicate.
• Contribute to the evolution of the existing Design System. Create visual, interactive, and hifidelity prototypes leveraging on the Design System’s core components.
• Be a champion of design thinking and bring empathy to problem solving

Skills and Experience Required

• 3+ years Product / UX / UI Design experience.
• A detailed portfolio of recent end-to-end work cases to show.
• Exceptional working knowledge of Figma and FigJam: team libraries, project branching and merging, component variants, and auto layout is all your bread and butter.
• Experience working collaboratively with developers and business analysts on digital products in an Agile environment – you know how a UI is technically implemented.
• Eagerness to push boundaries, think creatively and challenge design ideas for the better.
• Excellent visual design skills with extensive knowledge of typography, layout best practices, spacing systems, and colour theory.
