title: Product Designer ( UI/UX )
description:
We are looking for UI/UX designers who are excited about wearable devices and their potential.

Our customers, who are developers themselves, utilize our products and services on a daily basis to obtain their users’ wearable data, visualize trends, and learn more about wearables from our blog. Hence, the design of our products and services is crucial to showcase who we are and what we do. An intuitive user experience is essential for our customers to understand the why, what, and how of Terra and wearable devices.

Responsibilities

You will lead design projects for all our user touchpoints, including our landing page, blog, developer documentation, in-app widget, mobile SDK’s, and more

Establish and maintain our UI/UX design across touchpoints, ensuring the experience is intuitive and straightforward

Collaborate closely with the entire Terra team, from developers to operations, and lead design review meetings for internal feedback

Structure brainstorming sessions for new product... ideas, drafting UI/UX designs using whichever tools you feel would work best: wireframes, end-to-end flows, prototypes, etc.

Quickly deploy test concepts and iterate fast by utilizing customer feedback/analytics

Ensure our overall design and user experience communicate effectively our vision and our culture, always keeping in mind customers’ needs

Must Haves
• Must have done this before, or be willing to learn fast.
• Must be fast. We operate at 200mph, and so do you.
• Must be relentless. We never stop, so you are even faster than us.
• Must have customer driven. We think customers first and so should you.
• Must be driven and go above and beyond.
• Must be able to explain and communicate clearly.
• Must be prepared to challenge us and disagree. We are thinking and acting as a team.
• Must be able to work autonomously.
• Must want to work hard.
• Last but not least, you are genuinely a nice person.

Big plus You are an athlete, or care about quantifying your data

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
via: via Jobs At Pulselive | Pulselive Careers - Pinpoint
description:
Senior UI/UX Designer

Department: Design

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: London, UK

Reporting To: David Strachan
Description

As a Senior UI Designer (Product Designer) at Pulselive you will shape the way in which some of the most followed clubs and organisations in world sport engage and inspire their millions of fans. Your role means you are responsible for leading the design and visual direction for multiple projects across our client base, factoring in both UI and UX considerations, across web and native mobile platforms.

You’ll thrive on creating products that have high visual impact, portraying the energy and emotion of live sport. This will be coupled with an appreciation for creating products that make the complex simple and are a delight to use.

You will have a confidence and conviction that sells your vision and designs through excellent communication skills, demonstrating knowledge in your subject matter, instilling confidence with the client and internal... stakeholders from the start.

For the majority of your time you will be acting as a Design Lead across numerous projects responsible for all aspects of design including but not limited to, visual identity, user experience and brand application. You will often work hand in hand with the Research and UX team, working collaboratively to deliver perfectly designed solutions that marry creativity with simple and intuitive interfaces.

You will also play an integral role in supporting the wider product strategy, acting in a consultative role with the client and internal team members, challenging thoughts to deliver the best possible outcome.

In addition, you will be required to support the creation of conceptual work that brings to life new ideas to excite and engage internal teams, existing clients, and supporting new business opportunities.

You will often be required to adapt your approach to design, depending on the nature of the project, its timelines and objectives, adopting an open and positive approach to each task.

Key Responsibilities
• A talented senior product designer, experienced in leading design projects across the entire lifecycle from ideation to launch, including sketching, user flows, wire-framing, prototyping, hi-fi designs
• Initiating and leading the design process across numerous major clients and multiple projects, taking ownership of the products you lead
• Ensuring every piece of work meets Pulselive standards for visual and usability quality
• Solid time management skills, from scoping & estimates to delivery of designs
• You have empathy for customer needs but also consider technical constraints and business goals to achieve the best possible outcome
• Accomplished in presenting your product vision, designs & concepts to internal teams and to clients
• Provide thought leadership on design and creative approach
• Inspiring and motivating other members of the design team to fulfil their roles effectively, helping to develop their skills and knowledge

Skills Knowledge and Expertise
• You live and breathe design, demonstrating a keen eye for delivering high impact visuals with pixel-perfect attention to detail
• A thorough understanding of all aspects of product design
• Ability to adapt your approach to suit each individual task, making best use of the time you have available to deliver value for our customers
• You have a clear rationale for your design decisions - everything is purposeful, you are strategic, analytical and a great problem solver
• Experienced working closely with Product Managers, Engineers and wider teams
• Excellent presentation and communication skills, able to sell a vision and ideas to other designers, internal stakeholders and clients
• Excellent client management skills, capable of building strong, trusted relationships
• Highly driven to succeed, inspiring the team to continually improve their standard of work
• Highly experienced and proficient in Sketch, Invision, & Zeplin. Adobe Creative Cloud products (e.g. Photoshop, After Effects) and other popular tools (e.g. Figma, Principle) are a bonus
• Passion or good knowledge of sport

Benefits

At Pulselive we truly value our team and have developed our approach to ensure you are not only rewarded for your contribution but have access to unique benefits along with a positive approach to wellness. We want to ensure that your career, health and well-being are of the utmost importance at all times.

Benefits & Wellness
• Flexible & Remote Working
• Buy and Sell Annual Leave
• Pension Scheme
• Sporting Events and Tickets
• Health & Wellness Activities
• Complimentary Headspace Access
• Annual Wellness Contribution
• Mobile Phone Contribution
• Sony Discounts

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job Title:
Senior UX DesignerRequisition ID:
R016586Job Description:

Your Mission

As a Senior UX Designer you will join Sledgehammer’s G lobal UIX team tasked with creating the U ser E xperience of our titles across in-game systems and the front-end , from pre-production through to shipping .

You will be building UX systems , i nteraction design and documentation for multiple features as well as being responsible for ensuring systems are implement ed to AAA standards .

Our Culture

UIX at Sledgehammer is a core pillar of the team with a culture built around the purs uit of excellence at the apex of game design and usability . We have built an inclusive creative process where the team’s collective interface and experience vision fuel s the overall direction of the game .

We’re seeking an imaginative, skillful, and versatile designer who has a deep understand ing of the diverse audiences video games attract and how to create inclusive interfaces and systems . If you share our... passion for developing deep and engaging games with simple, elegant user experiences then we’d love to hear from you .

Responsibilities

Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
• Work ing with the UX Lead and Designers to create an exceptional user experience throughout the game.
• Work ing on the design of the interface ( fl ows , m enus and HUDs) to meet design goals.
• Creat ing engaging p rototypes and documentation .
• Working closely with artists and engineers to deliver the best possible user experience while staying within technical and aesthetic requirements.
• Work ing closely with User Research to ensure systems are rigor tested and informed by data
• Tak ing an active role in implementation and feature delivery .
• Tak ing an active role in refining the UX development process , tools and pipeline .

Player Profile
• Exceptional knowledge of the UX field for games .
• 5+ years of practical experience in the field of UI/UX .
• Has basic knowledge of LUA or any other scripting language .
• Has experience in animation and can demonstrate how wireframes translate to motion .
• Is proactive in seeking feedback from peers and leads . Supports others to do the same.
• Proficiency in Figma , Photoshop and Illustrator .
• Can communicate complexity through easy to understand documentation and presentation .
• Proactively manages and communicates their workload to production and leads .

Extra Points
• Proficiency in visual design and aesthetics .
• Deep understanding of games is a requirement but experience working on games is not .
• Has created UX systems and flow for at least one shipped AAA product .
• A clear portfolio of work that demonstrates previous projects and personal values .

Your Platform

Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker.

We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project.

Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4

Our World

Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!

Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

#textio

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, information governance, surveillance, and eDiscovery solutions to the global finance sector. We help financial services firms preserve and supervise their communications data for regulatory compliance, risk mitigation, and litigation readiness.

We deliver our services to over 20,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, text, market data chat, social media, enterprise social networking, voice, trade data, websites, and more. Recently, we also launched a compliant messaging platform specifically for the finance industry.

We’ve won major awards for our growth, management, and culture – including the Deloitte Fast 50 Leadership Award, Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and the Deloitte-sponsored Canada’s Best Managed Companies awards. Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada... In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.

Having established our dominance in the North American finance industry, we have been expanding our London operations to better serve our UK and EU customers. Our four-story EMEA headquarters on Cannon Street (near St. Paul’s Cathedral) features state-of-the-art amenities, a spectacular view of the city, and an Executive Briefing Center for customer forums and other events.

About the role:

Global Relay's enterprise applications have a substantial footprint in the messaging & archiving space for compliance. This role provides an excellent opportunity to help solve tough problems and create great experiences that have a significant impact on our customers.

We are looking for a UX Designer who champions our users in all phases of the product management cycle. From context and problem framing all the way through to the delivery of meaningful solutions. You will conduct research to understand our customers’ problems, work with the business to understand their needs, collaborate with UI designers and developers to design the final product.

Responsibilities:
• Advocate for our customers by gaining a deep understanding of their work and the challenges they face
• Be a key partner to stakeholders and product management in helping to come up with approaches that work—you’re not here to just “gather” requirements
• Proactively apply research techniques that are appropriate to the problem being addressed
• Concept, prototype, validate, fine-tune and present design solutions
• Communicate those solutions to our developers in an agile software development environment
• Create sketches, flows, wireframes and other design artifacts
• Help identify and leverage metrics to drive product management and measure success
• Guide and coach other designers and non-designers to uplift their design thinking capabilities
• Join a diverse team using modern tools

About you:
• 6+ years’ experience doing user experience design for web, desktop or mobile applications
• A portfolio showing your UX process and how it resulted in products that people love
• Experience with a range of tools and the willingness to adopt to new tools as needed
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to multi-task and keep organized in a dynamic environment
• Very good understanding of web technologies
• Empathy, intellectual curiosity and openness to learn about compliance in finance
• Experience in an Enterprise business environment is definitely an asset

Primary Skills: User Flows, UI/UX, Usability, Agile
Secondary Skills: User Focused
Seniority: Senior

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
UI / UX Designer

Surrey / 4 days remote pw

Up to £50k + benefits

This is a great opportunity for an aspiring UX / UI Designer to work on an exciting technology programme for a leading business. Your role will focus on improving the look and functionality of their systems which includes websites, applications and mobile software.

You'll be developing mockups, doing stakeholder research and looking at w

Applying for this role is straight forward Scroll down and click on Apply to be considered for this position.

title: Mid-Level / Senior UI / UX Designer
description:
Working Location

We are a mixture of remote and hybrid working. Our primary location and only hybrid office is in London and we have remote teams across locations globally which overlap well with the GMT time zone.

Applicant requirements
• Able to overlap with the GMT UK timezone and hours of 10am - 5pm
• Our common company language is English and applicants must be able to communicate in this language fluently
• Must be able to travel to London for in-person company events/workshops 2-5 times a year without a requirement of a visa or long-haul travel

What we are looking for

We are currently looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our multidisciplinary design team, crafting innovative features for the future of mobile fashion games.

You will work from design concepting through to interface delivery of game features: working with game designers and PMs to outline the spec, create user flows and wireframes. You will collaborate with engineers and artists to make your... experiences come to life in Unity, and ship these to millions of users. this role you can expect to be working all the way from sketches and (digital) whiteboards through to prototypes, animation and high-fidelity UI screens. Designers at Drest are T-shaped, with broad knowledge of the product design process while having something they really excel at- whether it's qualitative research, prototyping or icon design!

We're looking for a player-centered designer who's passionate about mobile games- bonus if you've got experience in agile environments, the fashion industry or app development teams. We like to move fast, test things and get stuck in together to build the world's top mobile fashion game, while keeping our players at the core of what we do.

What you will do..
• Work with game designers to translate concepts into user flows and wireframes
• Create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and documentation to clearly convey design ideas and direction
• Present and pitch designs to key stakeholders
• Develop the look and feel of the UI in collaboration with the Head of UI/UX, advocating for design consistency, functionality and accessibility throughout the product
• Work closely with engineering team to ensure proper implementation of your designs
• Grow knowledge of industry design trends and best practices
• Stay up to date on the fashion and lifestyle gaming market and competitors' titles.

What you will bring
• 3+ years' experience working in a design role
• A portfolio demonstrating stylish visual and interaction design skills
• Demonstrated ability to translate complex designs into clear wireframes and user flows
• Experience in Figma, Sketch or similar prototyping and mockup tools
• Love for creative collaboration and ability to take constructive criticism
• Knowledge of UX design processes
• Ability to present your ideas thoughtfully in both written and visual format
• Interests in Fashion and Games is a strong plus

Bonus points if you have
• Demonstrated experience of released products as a UI/UX designer - games or lifestyle apps preferred
• Worked on games targeted at a female audience
• Experience working on games in which players can create content
• Experience working as part of a development team
• Interest in luxury design and fashion

What you will get in return
• A competitive salary
• Private Medical Insurance
• Dental, Optical and Hearing cover
• Pension Scheme
• Cycle Scheme
• Life Assurance
• 25 days annual leave + Local Bank Holidays
• Birthday Leave
• Cross-team learning opportunities
• Hybrid/Remote working options

More About DREST

DREST is the world's first interactive luxury lifestyle & styling game, combining state-of-the-art technology with a luxury fashion and beauty styling experience that has real-time content at its core.

We are an award-winning fast-growth digital platform led by industry experts from the tech, luxury fashion, gaming and e-commerce worlds.

Centered around gamification, entertainment and creativity, DREST combines state-of-the-art technology with in-game fashion discovery, styling and shopping, all inspired by a real-time content feed reflecting the daily global fashion and lifestyle zeitgeist.

Our mission is to open up the fun, fantasy and creativity of the exclusive world of fashion, lifestyle and luxury to all via social gaming. By doing this, we are creating new and meaningful communications for one of the most exciting and impactful industries in the world through the application of gaming and proprietary technology and seminal art and design.

The leader in the development of luxury, lifestyle & beauty games, DREST partners with the very best of luxury brands worldwide including Gucci, Prada, Valentino, Burberry, Cartier, Breitling, Fenty, Armani, NARS and Bang & Olufsen amongst 250 others. DREST's e-commerce partner is Farfetch, the world's leading luxury fashion marketplace where everything one plays with is shoppable in real life. Named by Fast Company as one of The Most Innovative Gaming Companies' in the world (2021) DREST is forging ahead in this groundbreaking gaming genre.

Our employees are spread across the globe and we pride ourselves on our multiculturalism & diversity. We hire from the exciting worlds of gaming, tech, luxury fashion & lifestyle bringing a variety of perspectives closer together with the aim of creating inclusive, dynamic, equitable & original products tailored to our audiences around the world

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
UI/UX Designer Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX Designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of our various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.

The successful candidate will show evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

UI/UX Designer Responsibilities
• Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the user and brand.
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual designs, workshops, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.
• Skills/knowledge of front-end coding of websites and other digital online platforms.
• Designing UI elements and tools such as navigation... menus, CTAs, carousels, search boxes, for our digital assets library.
• Collaborating with the marketing team and developers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user.
• Communicating with various stakeholders and holding meetings to presents visual concepts and research.
• Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyse and predict user behaviour.
• Meeting team’s deadlines, organising your time wisely while working in an agile environment and a team of designers, developers, and user strategists.

UI/UX Designer Requirements
• A Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 1-4 years’ UI/UX design experience for digital products or services
• Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Figma, InVision, Axure, HTML, CSS, Design Systems, Miro and Adobe Creative Suite.
• A team player but can work independently too.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
• Up-to date portfolio detailing skill sets.

Why Mimecast?

We’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.

And the Mimecast way is also a hybrid-working way. We empower our people to balance their time between home and the office in a way that works best for them, their team, and our stakeholders.

Become a Mimecaster and put corporate data under your protection. Fill our teams with respect. And bring cybercrime-obstructing energy to your work. Be passionate. Be powerful. Be alive with purpose.

DEI Statement

Cybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.

We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.

We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.

If you require any adjustments or accommodations due to a disability, or any other reason that may help you in your interview process, please let us know by emailing careers@mimecast.com.

Due to certain obligations to our customers, an offer of employment will be subject to your successful completion of applicable background checks, conducted in accordance with local law

title: UX Designer
description:
Company Description

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are... helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VC&A) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful and financial results for Visa’s network clients, including both financial services and merchants. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, data analytics, brand management, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, Visa Consulting and Analytics solves the most strategic problems for our clients.

Visa Managed Services (VMS) is an augmentation of Visa’s consultancy offering, supporting the execution and implementation of recommendations to help scale competitive advantage and operate to succeed in the digital age. We are looking for an experienced UX Designer to supplement the Visa Managed Services (VMS) team in an important Visa client (the “Client”) in London.

Visa is heavily investing in its Global Design Team to help support its growing digital product line. Visa Global Design is comprised of five specializations: Design, Design Engineering, Design Operations, Design Strategy, and Research & Accessibility. We are looking for a Staff Designer to join our team.

We believe that great design could engage and inspire users, and we strive to rethink and redefine how users interact with Visa's products and services. Our team members are innovative thinkers and strategic problem solvers who are as analytical as they are creative. We value hard work, accountability, and collaboration, and we prize proven skills and team success over personal gain.

In this role, you will model excellent design principles and mentor junior staff. The UX Designer is an experienced individual contributor responsible for designing usable, accessible, and engaging user experiences.

What you will be doing?
• Collaborating with our cross-functional design, product, and business teams to build upon their vision using sound design principles to ensure project success.
• Facilitating workshops, presentations, and walkthrough sessions to explore business requirements and promote shared knowledge.
• Creating, delivering, and supporting high-quality design deliverables like concepts, user journeys, wireframes, UI flows and detailed UI design.
• Ensuring all designs adhere to all relevant policies and standards e.g., channel, accessibility, brand, design language.
• Proactively exercising independent judgement with minimal direction from supervisors.
• Creating, using, or contributing to design systems.
• Managing client expectations whilst designing responsive and/or app UI design and interactions through collaboratively working with the build teams

Qualifications

Skills we’re looking for

· Proven UX design experience in designing digital products for complex systems across web and mobile applications.

· Financial services, consulting, and management experience.

· Experience working in Agile/ Waterfall environment. (Jira/ Confluence)

· Experience in client engagements, demonstrating excellence in presentation polish, and strong client orientation.
• Experience in creating wireframes, prototypes and user flows using specialist tools such as Figma, InVision, Marvel, OmniGraffle, and Sketch.

Ability to drive change in a matrix environment

Additional Information

Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law

title: UI/UX Designer - OutThink
description:
Remote (CET +/- 2 hours)

We are excited to be partnering with OutThink to support them in hiring for a UK based UX / UI Designer.

OutThink is seeking a UI/UX Designer to join their exciting start-up, working within a high-performing agile engineering squad, and playing a key role in building and delivering OutThink’s ground-breaking SaaS (Software as a Service) Cybersecurity Human Risk Management Platform.

The platform provides innovative and just-in-time learning experiences, nudges, and simulations to hundreds of thousands of users worldwide via desktop and mobile devices. At the same time, the system monitors training responses, collects security system data and continually gathers feedback. All this data is collated and processed by our cloud engines in Azure, culminating in the provision of sophisticated predictive human risk management models. Our models can drive automated countermeasures, and present analysis results via the delivery of highly visual and interactive online... dashboards.

The Role

You will have a design background with valuable UX knowledge gained from commercial experience. You will need to be a master at eliciting requirements from stakeholders, internal and external, and be able to design beautiful, elegant, and perfectly realisable user interfaces.

You should possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level business requirements into effective design artefacts such as task flows and wireframes, and further ensure that they can be transformed into intuitive and functional user interfaces.

You will need to communicate scenarios, end-to-end experiences, interaction models, and screen designs to stakeholders and be able to realise complex data visualizations.

This is a predominantly remote role in a remote team where open feedback, new ways of working and thinking out of the box are encouraged and expected.

Responsibilities
• Investigating user experience design requirements for OutThink’s digital SaaS platform, in collaboration with Product Owners and other stakeholders.
• Translating complex business processes into intuitive and elegant use and product experiences.
• Working with teams internally to ensure the creation and delivery of beautiful and elegant experiences for users.
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, process maps, flow diagrams, storyboards, and prototypes.
• Assisting in developing and evaluating user stories and usability studies.

What You’ll Need
• A solid appreciation of art, beauty, and a keen sense of aesthetics to drive design innovation.
• A positive and proactive attitude with strong initiative and team-working skills.
• Good communication skills, with the ability to communicate in English in all forms.
• An understanding of the basics behind great software design.
• An eye for clean and artful design.
• Experience building data-centric web visualizations with an understanding of the limitations of web architecture design choices.
• 3+ years of solid commercial experience with UI design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Zeplin, Axure, Figma or Invision.
• Experience with Agile Development Methodology, working in short sprint cycles.
• Experience with Purpose-Driven Design processes.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and self-assured to present your work and represent the team at all levels.
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Ability to learn new processes and concepts fast with a demonstrated sense of curiosity.
• Intrinsic drive and motivation to build a ‘world first’ and share our start-up vision.

In Return, You’ll Receive
• This a rare opportunity to help build a global SaaS business and have full visibility of the entire operation
• You’ll learn and grow at a breakneck speed
• Great start-up culture in a fun, friendly, and hardworking team.
• Flexible remote working
• Share options package - a rare opportunity to get in early and have a stake in what could potentially be a unicorn start-up, with a huge financial payback
• 34 days paid holiday (including public holidays)
• Plus, an extra day off on your birthday!

Join us!

We are a remote-first company headquartered in London with teams across EMEA. You will be based in the UK, Spain or South Africa and are willing to travel, as the role requires.

We believe in: Trust and Integrity, Innovation, Customer Centricity, Purpose and Collaboration and are looking for someone who lives and breathes our values. We strive to be ‘exceptional’ in everything we do and have a lot of fun along the way!

All OutThinkers are part of our journey, so we offer equity options with every role and benchmark against other VC-backed companies to provide above-market-rate salaries for companies of our size.

Beyond this, plenty more makes OutThink an incredible place to work

title: Technical UI Designer
description:
Job Title:
Technical UI DesignerRequisition ID:
R019058Job Description:
Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the video game development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker.
We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than... the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project.
Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4
Your Mission:
Sledgehammer Games is seeking a Technical UI Designer for an exciting, unannounced project. You will bridge the gap between UI Engineering, UX Design, and UI Art. You will be responsible for converting design wireframes into maintainable, extensible script in our custom Lua-based UI engine. You will also be responsible for making prototype UI using our proprietary UI tool.
Candidates should have a good understanding of human-software interaction and experience communicating complex information with simple aesthetics. The ideal candidate is passionate, loves making great games and has a fundamental understanding of art, design and engineering principles. We value a culture of collaboration and are seeking an imaginative, resourceful, and versatile technical designer to join our team. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking gameplay with a validated team, then this may be the position you've been waiting for!
Responsibilities:
• Work closely with UI artists, UX designers, and UI engineers to create an exceptional overall player experience throughout the game
• Use proprietary UI editor and scripting (Lua) to implement UI art & motion, in collaboration with various team members, to ensure visual fidelity
• Create in-engine functional prototypes based on UX wireframes
• Evaluate performance and ensure the UI is as optimal as possible by balancing art needs with technical restraints
• Debug and work with QA to meet functional standards
• Contribute documentation to uphold a practice of knowledge sharing around processes, best practices, and workflow

Player Profile:
• 3+ years of experience in technical design, UI tech art or another similar field
• Good understanding of UI, UX and motion design principles
• Solid implementation and technical design knowledge foundation using a scripting language such as Lua or other engines’ UI editor tools
• Creative problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills
• Work ethic that leans towards communication, collaboration, and empathy
• Working knowledge of Photoshop

Extra Points:
• Understanding of materials and shaders for UI
• Experience with visual design
• Proficiency with other Figma and Adobe Creative Suite tools
• Practical experience with other C-based languages

Our World:
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
#textio

title: UI/UX Designer (Trust Wallet)
description:
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

Trust Wallet is a decentralized, multi-chain mobile wallet designed for speed, security, and ease of use. After 5 years of development by the team and community, Trust provides a secure wallet to send, receive, stake and store more than one million cryptocurrencies on 63 blockchains, including Ethereum and EVM chains, Solana, Polkadot, etc - making it the world’s most inclusive, chain-agnostic decentralized wallet.

Trust now serves tens of millions of users globally on a monthly basis. We are looking for someone who will have the vision to design the gateway experience for web3 world and scale it to... hundreds of millions of users.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world? We welcome anyone whose goal is to make a global impact, shape the future of web3 and make history together.

Regardless of your role, you'll have massive ownership and have the opportunity to work with a variety of products and technologies across the stack.

This role is for you if:
• Like the idea of working in a fast startup environment with the backing of one of the most established crypto companiesYou are excited about the opportunity to grow with the company from an IC to a design leadership role.
• You want to help define the vision and strategy to onboard the next 100M users onto crypto and Trust WalletYou see the endless potential to differentiate wallets with exciting new features and user experiences that make crypto more accessible to the masses.
• You’re passionate about crypto and the role wallets play across DeFi, NFTs, DAO, tokenomics, and the overall Web 3.0.
• You can think big, push the boundaries of what is possible and are able to communicate and influence these ideas effectively. You live and breathe Figma or SketchYou're agile and can thrive in fast moving environments - especially since Web3 is constantly evolving. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on the next day, and that excites you.
• You’re not looking for a traditional web2 job.
• You share the mindset that ‘Nothing should be someone else’s problem’. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving goals and results.
• You want to be part of a winning and agile team with global and diverse background

What you will do:
• You will design the short and long term roadmap - impacting the millions of Trust Wallet users.
• Design across web (chrome extension) and mobile (iOS and Android) experiences that solve the needs for a wide range of users, from the newbie to the crypto expert.
• Take new features from ideation to prototyping, user testing and production.
• Collaborate closely with product managers, engineering, and customer support teams.
• You will be interacting directly with end-users and Trust Wallet developers to collect feedback and develop user empathy.
• You'll be a key part of a small agile team.

What skillset you will need to possess:
• Extremely user-focused mindset.
• 5+ years full-time UI/UX Designer experience.
• 3+ years full-time experience of designing consumer-facing experiences for web and mobile apps.
• Knowledgeable and interested in Web3 spaceCollaborative and open minded.
• Ability to create thoughtful UI and UX and written communication to both frame and explain concepts.
• Demonstrated interest in open and community-driven platforms.
• Basics of HTML/CSS knowledge.
• Thrive in uncertainty and challenges: proactive, hands-on, self-starter and perseverance.
• Strong communication in oral and written English.
• Strong values, ethics and integrity.
• Strong intellectual curiosity and honesty, Bachelor’s or Master's Degree

What we offer:
• Be at the front seat of the fast-growing blockchain and crypto industry.
• An organization at hockey-stick growth stage with numerous opportunities to stretch out of your comfort zones and explore new roles when you prove to have good track records.
• Global role to work with very diverse and talented teams.
• Flexibility to work from anywhere in the world, as long as you deliver results

Working at Binance
• Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry
• Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems
• International work environment and flat organisation
• Great career development opportunities in a growing company
• Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career
• Competitive salary
• Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Senior UI/UX designer London
description:
Senior UI/UX designer London

A Leading provider of video surveillance, security and AI solutions company are looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer who can join their London based team who are at the forefront of the development function

They have deployed numerous projects worldwide and are looking to grow their client base across Europe and the US. This role focuses on a complex backend syste

Before applying for this role, please read the following information about this opportunity found below.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:

This role is for an ambitious UI/UX Designer who would like to join a fast-emerging technology company aiming to take a lead role in designing creatives to create a positive impact for our users and clients. You’ll be expected to deliver projects on time, and to the highest quality. We are looking for someone with excellent design skills and who is ambitious to develop further. We don’t want use templates to make static, conventional sites. We offer creativity and aim to put breath into business ideas.

It is a full time role offering flexibility to work on-site and from home on certain days. You must be in the UK and eligible to work.

title: Product UI/UX Designer
description:
Mobeus is a remote-first human connections company focused on reducing people’s friction with the technology around them. Mobeus believes that technology should enhance humanity and positively impact the relationships between people. Our platform of technology, content, and marketplaces enables entirely new interactions and solutions, inspiring a novel form of expression that is more compelling than any other product in the market.

We do things a little differently at Mobeus. Our commitment is to create and improve global solutions across industry sectors supporting B2B and B2C business models. We will operate at scale to create a platform capable of supporting multiple solutions, for a variety of audience types, in numerous industries, worldwide. Our passion and why we exist is to liberate humanity through better technology. We value relationships and build teams through partnerships and are not shy to experiment and pivot when needed.

At Mobeus, we are empowered to create a... corporate culture that draws together a diverse group of world-class, respectful, fun, and high-fidelity communicators across multiple areas of expertise who will work together to create significantly important new technologies. If that sounds like you, we’re looking forward to getting to know you!
Overview:

We are searching for a passionate Product Designer to join our team!

As Product Designer, you'll be the key contributor to our design system, working on a variety of projects spanning multiple levels of scale (i.e., simple to complex scenarios, edge cases, different states, etc.).

You will also participate in testing the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.

What you'll be doing:

• Fully comprehend and translate business requirements, specifications and designs into detailed technical tasks
• Ensure agility throughout the processes, facilitate internal communication, effective collaboration and improve transparency
• Lead the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative products
• Establish shared vision across the company by building consensus on priorities leading to product execution
• Coordinate change management in platform scope, schedules, prioritization and resources
• Identify conflicts, risks and bottlenecks, collaborate with the team to pinpoint the root-causes and devise solutions to fix the issues
• Create and maintain all necessary platform documentation
• Continuously monitor and research new techniques and generate innovative solutions, in order to enhance development efficiency, reliability, maintainability, scalability and application performance

Required Skills/Abilities:

• 2 years’ experience in UI UX design
• Experience with at least two of these software, such as: Figma, Sketch, Adobe Products (Photoshop, XD, Illustrator) or other design software/tools
• Experience in web front-end web design
• Good knowledge of design fundamentals and workflow
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision)
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
• Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Good time-management skills
• BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field

Diversity, Belonging, & Inclusion are important to us. Our products and platforms are for everyone. So is our workplace. We need you and your experiences to join a team where all voices are included and amplified in our business so we can all thrive together!

Mobeus is committed to pursuing and empowering a diverse high-performing workplace. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that provides our employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We support an inclusive workplace where our Mobeus team members can excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

So, bring us your experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing human connections

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Plentific is one of the fastest growing property technology companies in the world, backed by renowned investors including Brookfield, Highland Europe, A/O Proptech, Target Global and Mubadala. We are headquartered in London, UK, with offices in Germany, USA and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making property work better for everyone. We do so by streamlining how repairs, maintenance and compliance services are delivered. Our platform gives clients rich insight into management, operational and performance data, helping them deliver their customer service promise, while optimising supplier costs and adhering to their environmental, social and governance goals.

Come and be a part of:
• A leading Proptech with a global footprint and an HQ in heart of London's bustling centre
• A diverse, multicultural workplace with over 30 nationalities amongst our employees
• A stimulating atmosphere and fast-paced growth led by our recent $100m funding round
• A flexible work culture and a... number of programmes built around your physical and mental wellbeing

Developing acclaimed technology is only possible when we've got a great team on our side. Our culture is open and empowering. If you are passionate and driven, you will fit right in.

The Role

The role designs a wide variety of graphics, layouts and user interactivity for web pages, prototypes and product illustrations across digital and offline media both on the marketing side, and UI side with a primary focus on Plentific's core product. It is a hands-on role, helping to set the vision and driving concepts to create innovative and interactive design experiences.

To be successful in this position, the role holder will be a self-starter, high energy, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail.

Responsibilities
• Support the design team objectives by accomplishing tasks as needed on time.
• Creating user-centred designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback
• Work with product managers to create prototypes for new product ideas.
• Create and help maintain the design system and style guides.
• Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders as necessary throughout the lifecycle of projects
• Collaborate with other designers and help disseminate design best-practice across the team.

Requirements
• Proficient with Sketch and inVision, basic experience in Abstract workflow, general proficiency with Adobe CC, Office, Google apps, Dropbox.
• A deep understanding of mobile app design patterns.
• Strong attention to detail with a keen eye for aesthetics
• A good understanding of accessibility patterns in design.
• High energy, happy to learn, positive attitude, passionate about design.
• Ability to collaborate across teams.
• Expert understanding of how visual layouts affect user experiences.
• Proficiency in prototyping tools such as Sketch, InVision, Abstract and Figma.
• Extensive experience in the industry as a digital designer, preferably in a start-up or a digital design agency.
• Excellent communication skills and can clearly articulate your ideas, designs, and suggestions
• Experience designing web and mobile apps with complex user flows.
• Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus

Benefits

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here's what we offer:
• A competitive compensation package
• A flexible working environment + 25 days annual holiday
• Private health care including discounted gym membership
• Life insurance
• Employee assistance program
• Company volunteering day and charity salary sacrifice scheme
• Learning and development fund
• Referral bonus and charity donation if someone you introduce joins the company
• Season ticket loan, Cycle to work, Electric vehicle and Techscheme programs
• Pension - 3% employer contribution, 5% employee contribution
• Regular company-sponsored lunches, dinners and social gatherings
• Fully stocked kitchen with drinks, snacks, fruit, breakfast cereal etc.
• An inherently diverse culture with over 18 nationalities and 25 languages spoken

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
WeArisma is an influencer marketing solution helping brands and agencies understand, measure and optimise influencer marketing RoI. We help clients increase the effectiveness of their influencer marketing strategy and grow brand equity.

As the importance of influencer marketing grows and as the industry matures, so does the need for independent effectiveness specialists. Join us in our mission of bringing independent measurement, accountability and effectiveness to the industry.

You will be joining us at a very exciting time of growth, we have received investment from Morgan Stanley and have been named one of the most promising AdTech companies by Business Insider.

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer looking to accelerate their career in design leadership as a part of a creative and dynamic team.

We have a fantastic culture with a collaborative environment where everyone pitches in and has the chance to excel.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a UI/UX Designer at Wearisma, you will be an... advocate for crafting a visually rich, intuitive, and user-centric design across the whole customer experience, providing information for management to make decisions and delivering platform tools in an effective and efficient manner through design, user research, prototyping, and storytelling.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Drive end-to-end design initiatives to create an intuitive and delightful experience for our users.
• Create high quality responsive UI designs and optimize existing designs for user-facing web applications ensuring intuitive and best user experience.
• Create user stories, journeys, intuitive and user-centric wireframes, page layouts, prototypes, mockups, and UI designs with an application of usability principles.
• Research and synthesize user data to create 'simple' practical design solutions to complex design challenges.
• Maintain design standards throughout the products' interface, as well as continue to improve our existing design system.
• Collaborate with various stakeholders and the wider product and development teams to ensure delivery of the user interface designs and design standards.
• Assess the competitive landscape, understand patterns and trends, analyze customer behaviour and collaborate with others to improve the overall design, holistic experience, and quality.
• Follow up on the final implementation of all features to ensure proper execution.
• Work with developers to ensure pixel-perfect UI implementation.
• Performing tests for intuitive and best user experience.

REQUIREMENTS
• At least 5 years of professional experience as a UI/UX designer in an agency or client side.
• Demonstrating solid understanding of web technologies and application of user-centered design methods with knowledge of high-fidelity interaction design, UI/UX principles, best practices, and techniques.
• Portfolio of UX/UI works demonstrating quality examples of clean and clear designs, easy-to-use flow and principles that meet user stories.
• Prior experience designing for Analytics and SaaS products preferred
• Strong background in visual design with an understanding of graphic design communication skills, like colour, iconography, typography, and layout a plus.
• Proficiency in industry-standard tools for design, presentation, and prototyping, such as Adobe Suite, Figma, Sketch, etc.
• Understanding front-end concepts such as HTML and CSS is a plus.
• Knowledge of social media, websites, applications, and digital marketing is a plus.
• Experience with creating simple and clear design documentation for multiple audiences (developers, product owners, and other stakeholders).
• Experience working within an Agile environment using Agile methodologies and comfort with fast-paced Agile/Scrum environments.
• Ability to communicate effectively using tools such as JIRA, Confluence and Slack.
• Self-starter with strong analytical and critical thinking skills to learn and apply with problem-solving skills.
• A positive, can-do attitude and strong task follow-up skills.
• Great team player who communicates openly, honestly and completely; seeks input from other team members and shares knowledge openly and regularly.
• Excellent communication, fluent in English, good time management and organization skills.

To Apply:

Please share your portfolio and CV at job@wearisma.com with high quality samples of your work so that we can get a better understanding of your style and design skills. In addition, for a project of your choice within your portfolio, a paragraph with the user stories and your thinking behind the design and how the design achieves the goals.

LANGUAGES
• English Mandatory.

BENEFITS
• Team Offsite trip to a European location
• 20 days annual leave in addition to public holidays
• Incentivized bonus plan
• The hybrid co-working space environment
• Monthly coaching and team lunch/dinner

Annual Package:

Competitive

About WeArisma:

With the boom of social media, the growing need for authenticity in brand communications and the recent changes in advertising personal data policies, brands are shifting budgets from traditional media and social platforms to influencer marketing. The channel is now a key part of the digital media mix, expected to grow by 32% p.a. over the next 4 years.

3 in 5 consumers trust influencer recommendations. Done well, influencer marketing can grow brand equity and increase RoI for brands. Yet, 4 in 5 brands say measuring influencer marketing RoI is a challenge. This is where we come in to solve one of the industry's biggest challenges.

Our solutions enable professionals from brands and agencies to develop impactful influencer strategies, evaluate the effectiveness of influencer partnerships and optimise return on investment.

We empower our clients across multiple sectors with the tools they need to revolutionise their influencer marketing approach, and our technology is designed to be easy-to-use for everyone – from practitioners to C-level executives.

WeArisma was one of the first influencer marketing solutions, founded in 2015 by Jenny Tsai, a prominent and inspiring leader in digital marketing whose work enabling influencers and brands to connect and establish hugely successful partnerships had transformed the world of influencer marketing.

Since our inception in 2015, we have been powering some of the world’s most valuable luxury brands and fortune 500 brands like Unilever, Hermes and more, with user-friendly software, intelligent and independent data and actionable insights

title: Senior UI & UX Designer
description:
SENIOR UI & UX DESIGNER

CENTRAL MARKETING

BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD

REPORTING TO THE HEAD OF DESIGN AND UX
A BIT ABOUT SEGA

SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our seven development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, HARDlight, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.

At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.

Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.
WORKING THE SEGA... WAY

We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours, even more so with everyone working remotely during COVID-19…
• For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our online gaming nights and free SEGA games on Steam
• Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership and ride to work scheme. You can find your zen with our weekly virtual yoga classes as well as online physical therapy with our masseuse.
• We hold regular company updates to keep everyone in the loop and we stay connected with social events like virtual pub quizzes and art workshops
• We support your learning & development with access to online courses through Udemy, and webinars and resources on mental health and financial wellbeing
• When you’re in the virtual office, we’ll make sure you have everything you need when it comes to tech/furniture, and we pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of your home office
• You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be.

We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!

And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!

POSITION OVERVIEW
• ** PLEASE NOTE THAT YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A LINK TO YOUR PORTFOLIO AS PART OF YOUR APPLICATION ***

We’re looking for a passionate UI Designer to join our growing and ambitious Product team! We’re looking for someone that understands that good design is not about trends but is built on top of principles and trade-offs, and that makes well-reasoned design decisions always advocating for the best possible user experience, inclusive design and accessibility.

The ideal candidate for this role will be an enthusiastic and experienced UI Designer. You will have some UX knowledge but perhaps your passion really lies in the UI-focused aspect of design. You'll understand the need for easy-to-use, well-designed applications that enable the user to access what they need and complete their task in a timely manner, ensuring that enabling speedy patient care is at the heart of the process.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Focus on building collaborating relationships with key stakeholders, a cross-disciplinary team, to set priorities towards meaningful design solutions to meet player and business goals.
• Responsible for all design artefacts produced, from initial discovery and user journey mapping through to the execution of final UI design details.
• Identifying sudden and gradual consumer trends, cross gravitations, churns & attrition & pinpoint future data-driven opportunities through your learnings.
• Deeply understand the customers you're designing for. Whether it's joining user research sessions, learning from previous insights, or running your own research and analysis, you'll strive to understand how our consumers use and interact with our services.
• Maintain best practices, create opportunities for challenge and growth, develop solutions and collaborate effectively with other departments.
• With focus and determination all the above will lead to learning & building Customer LTV (Customer Lifetime Value) – You will Experiment and Develop proven ideas to drive consumer adoption, retention & loyalties to SEGA brands.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

The successful candidate must have experience:
• Significant experience working within the digital sector
• Expertise in Adobe CC, Adobe XD or Figma.
• Demonstrable, basic level of HTML5 and CSS experience
• Using a user-centred approach, access and evaluate behaviours of our target audiences, to help inform and improve the experience and design of our online platform.
• Communicating ideas with senior client stakeholders while also managing their expectations.
• Delivering responsive/mobile friendly and content-rich website projects.
• Working in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams.
• Prototyping, creating story maps, writing user stories and agile software development practices.
• Must keep up to speed with legal compliances GDPR, PECR & ESRB

title: UX Designer
description:
JOB TITLE: Senior UX Designer

LOCATION: Brighton, UK (with option to work remotely)

FUNCTION: Design

REPORTS TO: Game Director

CONTRACT: Permanent

What We Need:

You're a collaboratively minded designer eager to work with a global design team to pitch and develop game experiences.

Everything we build from a game design perspective you get your hands on; from systems to mechanics, from the HUD and menus to control schemes, from usability testing to player advocacy, you make sure that player experience is always at the forefront of your mind! We encourage you to share that passion with the Directors, Leads, and Implementers responsible for putting our game together. We love games that play well and look great; our view is that well designed UI / UX positively contributes to a great overall game experience. We can't build phenomenal games without you!

What You Will Do:
• Understand the needs of players and pair them with complex game mechanics to produce creative and effective UX... solutions
• Understand what our players’ motivations, agency, and habits are. Make meaningful UX choices backed by research
• Work closely we UI Team to ensure they style guide and user experience can come together in one cohesive vision
• Communicate effectively and collaborate with a dedicated team of visual designers, UI/UX designers, and motion designers
• Create interactive prototypes that demonstrate the design and reduce risk in the production phase of development
• Collaborate with Leads and Directors to define the overall vision, design and interface of our next titles.
• Build documentation to communicate the vision, including but not limited to research, persona designs, user journeys, wireframes, flow diagrams and prototypes
• Create working prototypes that demonstrate the design and reduce risk in the production phase of development
• Take an iterative approach to development by working closely with the rest of the development team to improve the end user’s understanding of how to interact with the UI and improve the overall user experience
• Champion the design department’s UX related work, guiding future approaches to UX
• Ensure an overall high-quality level of UX design and User Experience
• Collaborate actively with teams across the globe

Who We Think Will Be A Great Fit:
• You are skilled in Adobe XD or other prototyping tools that help you produce strong prototypes
• You take and iterative approach to development. Working closely with the development teams in the creation of intuitive UI systems
• Comfortable working with using technical toolsets
• You share our love for video games and good UX and UI approaches
• Example of calm under pressure, team-oriented and the ability to accept critique from creative director as well as clients
• You have a proven ability to digest complex and critical feedback and channel it into strong solutions
• You’re self-motivated and motivate others
• Humble at all times, not driven by personal ego
• You have excellent communication skills - must be ready to work with teams across the globe

Good to have:
• Experience with HTML, CSS, XML, XAML or similar
• Experience with Unreal Engine and UMG

Bonus:
• WPF (windows presentation foundation) and XAML knowledge used in Noesis UI/UX pipeline

Who We Are:

Hangar 13 is an internal 2K development studio based in four locations: Novato (California), Brighton (UK), and Brno & Prague (Czech Republic), working collaboratively as one team.

Each of our locations provides the opportunity to Bravely Create on big-budget, AAA console titles in a diverse and inclusive environment.

At Hangar 13, we want people driven by curiosity — Visionaries who aren’t afraid to explore new territory. Intrepid individuals who embrace the weird, the challenging, the unconventional.

We’re continuing to build a space that empowers you to take risks and redefine what’s possible,

Where your inquisitive nature is nourished —

A home for people who aren’t satisfied with what is, but who are obsessed by what could be.

So bring your talent,

Your unique point-of-view, Your fearless tenacity,

And together, we’ll Bravely Create

Brighton:

Located just 45 minutes via train from London, Brighton is one of the UK’s most diverse and downright interesting cities. Sat right on the south coast of England, the city is home to a vibrant creative community and is known as an easy-going and tolerant place to live and work. Brighton is home to Victorian piers and palaces, brightly coloured stucco homes and a 5-mile long shingle beach which becomes a post-work social hub during the summer months.

Onsite amenities inside our state-of-the-art Brighton studio include a fully equipped kitchen, games room, gym (with showers) and our very own bar. We’re a 30 second walk from Brighton station.

Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com and hangar13games.com accounts.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation

title: Principal UI UX Designer
description:
The people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Imagine what you could do here!

We at core, believe in Customer, Community and Compassion and looking for like minded individual's to create a difference with us!

Vamstar is a data science-powered B2B healthcare marketplace that helps suppliers find the most relevant healthcare contracting leads using Artificial Intelligence (AI). We apply real-time machine learning forecasts, analyse buyers and competitor behaviours, and perform analytics at scale. Learn more about us at www.vamstar.io

We are looking for a full-time remote UI designer who will be applying interactive and visual design principles, for an attractive and cohesive user experience and wants to solve big user experience challenges that will reshape the healthcare industry for generations. You will get the opportunity to be involved in, design and implementation of... the UI. The successful candidates will be working in a team of highly skilled and experienced developers, data scientists, Head of Product and CTO.

Education & Experience
• Degree in design-related field or equivalent experience.

Ideal Candidate:
• Understanding of apps and web app will be mandatory.
• Working with a wide range of channels, Offline, Online Digital & affiliate contributing ideas and design artwork to the overall brief.
• Has experience working with multi geography teams based in India, US, UK etc.
• Strong communication and presentation skills
• Deep fascination of technology and willingness to learn.
• Capacity to make sound decisions.
• Outstanding organizational skills and process oriented thinking.
• Infectious energy and enthusiasm.
• Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Their designs are required for a huge variety of products and activities, such as web application, advertising, exhibitions and displays, corporate communications and corporate identity, e.g. giving the organisation a visual 'brand'.
• Build highly detailed design specifications that enable developers to implement the experience.
• Expertise in core UX disciplines including information architecture, interaction design, application of design systems, and UI design.
• Knowledge of CSS extension languages. Expertise in standard UX software such as Figma, HTML and CSS is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

Requirement
• 4+ years of professional experience with the design and development of highly interactive products and digital interfaces such as websites, m-web, and native apps
• A basic understanding of semantically sound HTML5, CSS3 code and basic
• Excellent knowledge of web standards, native mobile design systems (iOS and Android), progressive improvements, dynamic content retrieval, and responsive/adaptive design techniques
• Should have a portfolio that details strong interaction, thought process, and graphic design skills
• A tendency to think between the layers and drive your goals via motion rich interactions

Vamstar is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build. Below add ons will be a merit:-
• An in-depth understanding of Internet technologies and architectures and general application development.
• Flexible attitude and willing to take on new challenges – someone who is dynamic, high-energy and works with a sense of urgency.
• Strong understanding of the full life-cycle development process. Must understand both agile and traditional development techniques, and be eager to influence the processes adopted by the team in delivering projects.
• Adhere and contribute towards architectural & development techniques and standards.

Before applying, read more about us at www.vamstar.io

title: UX/UI Design Lead Remote working
description:
