title: UI/UX Designer
description:
We are an FCA-regulated Foreign Exchange (“FX”) brokerage offering global currency solutions. Following significant investment from two previous directors of an FX firm valued at over £800 million, you will be joining our business during a phase of rapid growth.

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer to turn our software into easy-to-use and engaging products for our clients. The UI/UX Designer will be responsible for gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components to improve our products' user experience. In this role, you will create functional and appealing features that address our client's needs and help us grow our customer base.

Responsibilities
• You will work to identify target user groups and carry out interviews or other types of inquiry to help understand user needs
• You will provide guidance on the implementation of UX research techniques and testing activities to assess user behaviour
• You will ensure the creation and... implementation of customized experiences for the digital user
• You will produce high-quality solutions through flow diagrams, graphic designs, storyboards, site maps and mockups
• You will collaborate with the development team to ensure the live experience meets the criteria and functionality as presented in the visual concepts
• You will perform tests on user interface elements such as CTAs, layouts, target links, landing pages and banners
• Finally, you will work to understand product specifications and user psychology and predict what might work for both
• A proven track record of UI/UX design, ideally evidenced with a portfolio of websites, social media graphics and professional pdfs
• Expert knowledge of related graphic design applications such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc), Sketch
• Proficiency in creating designs for a responsive experience across mobile, tablet, and desktop concepts
• Ability to lead and/or participate in projects from the design phase through final testing and QA.
• Knowledge of or experience using email service providers such as MailChimp, Marketing Cloud or similar email platforms is a plus
• Understanding of HTML and CSS best practices
• Experience in working with financial products would be useful
• Proficiency in verbal and written English.
• The opportunity to work within an ambitious, founder-led organisation. This will provide the opportunity to shape and develop our business and share in the rewards of its growth
• Training and development to become a true specialist in your industry, we operate in a culture of continuous learning.
• Sponsorship towards qualifications in financial markets to continue your professional development

title: Junior UI/UX Designer
description:
My client is an innovative healthtech company, working with multiple healthcare providers worldwide. They are seeking a Digital UI/UX Designer (Junior) to join their rapidly growing team.

Located in Didcot, my client offers hybrid working, flexible working hours and a salary of up to £30,000, along with other benefits.

As a Junior UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for designing projects through the entire design cycle. You will design mobile apps and web portals, fulfilling a pivotal role and impacting future design and development on the product.

In this role, you will have a clear career progression path, as well as lots of training opportunities and autonomy. This is a great opportunity to work on products and technologies that make a real difference in people's lives!

As a Junior UI/UX Designer you will have experience with:
• Previous commercial experience (internship or a full-time)
• Prototyping and user research for digital products
• Industry tools (Adobe CC, Figma... or anything similar)

Please note this is a full time position and all applicants are required to be located in the UK.

If you are looking for any other information, please contact Paula Kastrouni at IC Resources.

We have a number of other Frontend, Backend, and Fullstack positions across different industries and locations available too

title: Senior UI & UX Designer
description:
SENIOR UI & UX DESIGNER

CENTRAL MARKETING

BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD

REPORTING TO THE HEAD OF DESIGN AND UX

A BIT ABOUT SEGA

SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our seven development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, HARDlight, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.

At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.

Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.
WORKING THE SEGA... WAY

We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours, even more so with everyone working remotely during COVID-19…
• For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our online gaming nights and free SEGA games on Steam
• Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership and ride to work scheme. You can find your zen with our weekly virtual yoga classes as well as online physical therapy with our masseuse.
• We hold regular company updates to keep everyone in the loop and we stay connected with social events like virtual pub quizzes and art workshops
• We support your learning & development with access to online courses through Udemy, and webinars and resources on mental health and financial wellbeing
• When you’re in the virtual office, we’ll make sure you have everything you need when it comes to tech/furniture, and we pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of your home office
• You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be.

We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!

And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!

POSITION OVERVIEW
• ** PLEASE NOTE THAT YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A LINK TO YOUR PORTFOLIO AS PART OF YOUR APPLICATION ***

We’re looking for a passionate UI Designer to join our growing and ambitious Product team! We’re looking for someone that understands that good design is not about trends but is built on top of principles and trade-offs, and that makes well-reasoned design decisions always advocating for the best possible user experience, inclusive design and accessibility.

The ideal candidate for this role will be an enthusiastic and experienced UI Designer. You will have some UX knowledge but perhaps your passion really lies in the UI-focused aspect of design. You'll understand the need for easy-to-use, well-designed applications that enable the user to access what they need and complete their task in a timely manner, ensuring that enabling speedy patient care is at the heart of the process.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Focus on building collaborating relationships with key stakeholders, a cross-disciplinary team, to set priorities towards meaningful design solutions to meet player and business goals.
• Responsible for all design artefacts produced, from initial discovery and user journey mapping through to the execution of final UI design details.
• Identifying sudden and gradual consumer trends, cross gravitations, churns & attrition & pinpoint future data-driven opportunities through your learnings.
• Deeply understand the customers you're designing for. Whether it's joining user research sessions, learning from previous insights, or running your own research and analysis, you'll strive to understand how our consumers use and interact with our services.
• Maintain best practices, create opportunities for challenge and growth, develop solutions and collaborate effectively with other departments.
• With focus and determination all the above will lead to learning & building Customer LTV (Customer Lifetime Value) – You will Experiment and Develop proven ideas to drive consumer adoption, retention & loyalties to SEGA brands.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

The successful candidate must have experience:
• Significant experience working within the digital sector
• Expertise in Adobe CC, Adobe XD or Figma.
• Demonstrable, basic level of HTML5 and CSS experience
• Using a user-centred approach, access and evaluate behaviours of our target audiences, to help inform and improve the experience and design of our online platform.
• Communicating ideas with senior client stakeholders while also managing their expectations.
• Delivering responsive/mobile friendly and content-rich website projects.
• Working in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams.
• Prototyping, creating story maps, writing user stories and agile software development practices.
• Must keep up to speed with legal compliances GDPR, PECR & ESRB

title: Lead UX/UI Designer
description:
At IAG Loyalty (IAGL) we know that great user experience design is critical to fostering the long-term customer relationships that are core to our loyalty programmes. We have evolved as a product organisation over the last five years, with UX and UI design being done locally within product teams. We're now at a scale where we are ready for greater leadership across our design approach, to build a more coherent customer experience. We're looking for someone to take on this leadership role and step up the maturity of our UX/UI design model.

In this newly created role, as our Lead UX/UI Designer you'll relish the opportunity to write the rulebook on how we design at IAGL – specifically building our design system from the ground up. You'll enjoy the challenge of designing across four established airline brands, whilst bringing to life a unifying identity for loyalty that is relevant, inspiring and rewarding. You'll have the vision and influence to lead across multiple product teams in a... matrix organisation to achieve our design goals, working confidently with both contract and permanent design colleagues.

You'll enjoy the challenge of shaping this new role and playing a leadership role in the next phase of our growth. You'll have the opportunity to work across our wide-ranging product set, covering leading-edge technologies and touching partners in the airline, travel, finance and retail sectors.

How will I add value in this role?

You'll get under the skin of our user experience design today, identifying the assets, tools and ways of working in play, and how they ultimately come together to create our user experience. You'll set a strategy for world-class UX/UI design and provide the leadership to get us there.

You'll create IAG Loyalty's visual language by building a design system for use across cross-functional product teams, developing and designing products for our partner airlines (British Airways, Iberia, Aer Lingus and Vueling). You'll drive adoption of the design system across our design and product community, working with teams to ensure a clear set of design standards are being met whilst actively utilising the input of our teams to continuously improve the system.

You'll always see the bigger picture and help build a holistic view of all the customer touchpoints, setting a strong foundation to build coherent and delightful customer experiences on. You'll also bring a fresh pair of eyes to the role, spotting opportunities to improve the way UX design is done at IAG Loyalty.

You'll act as a leader, coaching and supporting designers with design system adoption and ways of working. You'll implement best practices to bring our design community across IAGL together, as well as translating your design vision for audiences across the organisation.

You'll enjoy the visibility you'll have at all levels of our organisation, providing a ‘consulting' style approach to the way to you influence, shape and challenge our thinking.

What experience would you like me to have?

You'll be a senior UX/UI designer with experience across web and app channels, and with a range of design tools including Figma.

You'll have a strong track record in developing design systems that power brilliant and inclusive customer experiences. You'll be well versed in the design landscape with an understanding of how the best organisations are approaching design today.

You'll have the ability to embed yourself across the Product organisation and become the go-to for UX/UI leadership. Your communication skills will extend to both design and non-design audiences, to ensure the importance and strategy for design is understood by all. Your ability to manage stakeholders will be key to your success. You're able to influence without having direct control.

You'll have experience setting and leading UX/UI strategy and have the desire to go beyond the ‘doing' and into a functional leadership role.

What we can offer you
• Annual Bonus (dependant on Company & Individual Performance)
• One non-contractual Annual Bookable Travel Concession for employee, partner and dependants after 12 months service.
• Discounts on BA flights and holidays from day one for you, your friends and family
• Unlimited standby and premium standby fares for you and your nominees on the full BA network and numerous other partner airlines
• Exciting global travel industry discounts including flights with hotels, rail, cruises & tour operators also available through travel providers
• Company Pension
• Private Health Care
• 20 days working from abroad
• 25 days annual leave, plus 2 days charity leave and a day off on your birthday
• Travel Insurance
• Life Assurance
• Cycle to work scheme
• New Joiner Avios/Birthday Avios/Thank you Avios

This role will be based out of our London office (Thomas House, Eccleston Square, London). 'The Blend' is our interpretation of hybrid working, where our colleagues are empowered to choose the location for them to produce their best work. Based on your to-do list, colleagues either choose the office or home working that day. We expect this will mean roughly half your time will be at home and the other half in one of the offices

title: UX/UI Design Contract
description:

The UX Design Contract / UX Designer Interim / UX&UI Designer will:

-Proactively seek qualitative and quantitative customer insight and data to inform design decisions.

Intelligent People are a specialist UX Design Contract recruiter

title: UX Designer
description:
UX Designer
12 Month Contract

We are EA

Over the last twenty years we've entertained millions of players around the world with our award-winning and massively entertaining games. We are a team of accomplished people who create games with joy and passion.

At Criterion, we place enormous value on creative collaboration, fresh ideas, and unique perspective. Our studio is a healthy mix of industry veterans and newcomers working together to inspire, support, and educate one another.

Criterion's latest game is Need For Speed: Unbound, with its very bold stylized look for characters and driving effects, and a photorealistic world and vehicles. We think it looks awesome.

The Challenge Ahead

Criterion is looking for an accomplished UX expert, someone with a formal or practical training in all the psychological and design principles, and methodologies surrounding UCD, from research methodologies to heuristic evaluation.

What You'll Do:
• Report directly to the UX Director.
• Gather and... elicit requirements, with Game Design and Franchise teams.
• Work with our dedicated UX Research team to construct and document research that informs design decisions, at all stages of the development cycle.
• Use the research and requirements to design player experiences, on well-known AAA games using standard UX tools (personas, journeys, wireframes, interaction design, information architecture, prototypes, metrics).
• Represent the User Experience Design craft, and find ways to educate us in UX methods and design principles.
• Oversee the design, and work with the entire team to bring these experiences to life throughout the development lifecycle, and find pragmatic solutions when challenges arise.
• Ensure your experiences meet our UX/Game Design goals.

What We're Looking For:
• Passionate about computer games, player experience and the UCD process.(User centered design process)
• 4+ years of professional user centered design experience.
• Full knowledge of the theoretical and practical UX design rules (e.g. heuristics), with evidence of application.
• Knowledge of UX Research tools and methods (e.g. personas, journey mapping, use cases, competitor analysis, surveys, etc.). When to use one over another etc.
• Create detailed UI specifications, that can convey complex design details to colleagues from all disciplines.
• You will have created prototypes (low or hi fidelity) using standard prototyping tools (e.g. PowerPoint, Visio, Balsamiq, Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, Axure, Unity, and Unreal)
• You do not have to have made a video game before (personally or professionally), but do tell us if you have.
• Committed to inclusive design, including accessibility

title: UX Developer
description:
The Team

The EMEA IT team are responsible for understanding the IT demands, priorities and issues within the business teams and making sure all IT requirements are understood and systems appropriately managed. Working closely with the Global Development Centre (application development & infrastructure, based in Crawley) and Business Change team, the EMEA IT team ensure that all service issues are addressed and project demand is met and managed through the agreed governance process.

The Role
• As a UX Developer you will work as a member of the EMEA P&C Systems team and assist on the work associated with the UI/CX programme. As part of the role you will drive a best in class user experience across all of EMEA IT’s systems and contributing to the implementation of the UX standards for the region.
• You will utilise your core UI/UX skills and knowledge of usability issues and techniques to contribute to projects through their full life cycle. Based on the business cases, business... processes of the customer and an overall user-centric approach to system design you will develop use cases from the requirements and model these into high quality applications UI/CX changes as part of a small team.
• You will be able to work independently and with others, both within the P&C Systems team and other EMEA IT development teams. You will propose and sketch out a range of visual concepts both on paper and using software applications. You will create user personas, journeys and site maps as well as translate concepts into wireframes, prototypes and user flows using specialist tools.
• You will work on cross-platform applications to develop user experiences and work collaboratively with other designers, product design and development teams, business analysts, engineers and project managers. You will redesign apps and websites to make them more user responsive based on business requirements.
• You will ensure that all work undertaken by yourself adheres to and progresses the EMEA IT Strategy as well as underlying architectural principles.
• You will be enthusiastic and be interested in sharing good practices within the team. As well as having a positive, constructive approach with an emphasis on collaboration.

Your Responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:
• Be responsible for the UI/CX development from your own programming
• Be responsible for the timely deliverables of work within remit. Accountable for the quality and on-time delivery of said work and be able to lead by example setting a culuture of accountability within the team
• Engage and work with, where applicable, other IT and business teams within Chubb, including those at the Global Development Centre, building an effective peer network and relationships to ensure a smooth and co-operative outcome on joint-resource initiatives.
• Be responsible for implementing EMEA UI and CX designs including styling, wireframes, user personas.
• Working with any other teams on any downstream systems connecting to EMEA systems as appropriate.
• Look for continuous improvements in the EMEA systems space, constantly looking to increase performance, quality and reduce support and maintenance overheads all whilst giving our customers excellent UI and a consistent experience.

Qualifications

What skills & experience are required?
• UI/ CX development experience in previous roles as well as using modern tools and methodologies.
• A good understanding of UX best practice and web standards, as well as applying these to real life systems and projects.
• Experience of delivering and refining UX solutions through the software development life cycle.
• Proactive self-driven individual with a passion for driving demonstrable improvements.
• Positive can-do attitude, happy to work in a fast-paced business with cross functional teams.
• Be highly collaborative
• Analytical thinker with the ability to devise solutions to business problems
• You must have a thorough understanding of the software development life cycle, including but not limited to customer requirements gathering, data modelling, application analysis, development, testing, documentation, system acceptance and post migration validation. You must have experience in the design and programming of software from its inception, including UI design
• You must possess strong judgement, leadership, communication, diplomacy, collaboration and organisational skills
• You must have excellent verbal and written communication skills, being structured and accurate, and have the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers and subject matter experts
• You must be independent and also have the ability and desire to work within a team
• Have delivery focus and be comfortable with taking accountability
• You must have a proactive attitude and be willing to make any extra effort required to ensure that the company delivers and maintains its enviable reputation
• Experience working with the Agile Scrum

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
Great opportunity to join a high calibre team and use your skills for good. This is a growing organisation looking to significantly impact climate change. We are looking for a UI / UX designer with a background in analytics, design and presenting data. You'll be working closely with product management, modellers and software engineering.

Growing SaaS organisation based in Cambridge supporting organisations to achieve Net Zero.

In this role you sit within the Product team and work to enhance the climate analytics platform. You will collaborate with data scientists, modellers and software engineering and create compelling data visualisations and drive the overall design of the platform.

In this role you will be expected to:
• Evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product management, modellers and software engineering
• Develop UI mock-ups and high fidelity prototypes that clearly illustrate how components function and display in active/ inactive states (using Figma or... similar)
• Design data heavy graphic user interface elements such as tables, graphs maps to simplify and highlight key insights
• Prepare and present designs to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Ensure brand guidelines are adopted to harmonise look and feel and improve readability

This is a great role for a candidate looking to join a rapidly expanding company:

Essential Skills
• Demonstrable experience as a UI/UX Designer
• Proven experience with data visualisation design
• Experience of design software like Figma, XD or similar
• Team player with good communication and collaboration skills
• Good time-management skills
• Inquisitive and creative mindset - willing to learn new concepts

£60,000 to £70,000 plus bonus and shares.

EA First Ltd are acting as an Employment Agency for this permanent vacancy

title: UI/UX Designer - Digital & ECommerce
description:
Company Description

Maker&Son is one of the world’s fastest growing luxury furniture businesses. We design and make the world's most comfortable chairs, sofas and beds, entirely from natural materials. We’re an ambitious, young company, with a vision to become a global brand, changing the face of luxury home retail.

We are based in Balcombe [40 mins from London by train, 20 minutes from Brighton] and you will only need to be in our offices 3 days a week.

Job Description

We are looking for an ambitious UI/UX Designer who is passionate about building digital experiences for mobile and web that customers love to use.

You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy. You will be responsible for our digital presence, brand display, e-commerce platforms, and champion the customer by making consistent improvements to the user journey.

Experience in a start-up... company and e-commerce is preferred, along with a passion for and appreciation of luxury brands and/or interior design.

Responsibilities
• Gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components.
• Work with brand ambassadors, product development, marketing and other departments of the business to develop our digital brand
• Create digital assets for software developers to build the online interfaces
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
• Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images
• Create and develop our design system

Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing experiences that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.

Qualifications

Key Skills and Requirements
• To be successful in this role, you should have experience with designing mobile and web interfaces
• You must have experience in using design softwares to collaborate with software developers
• Created prototypes from and wireframe tools, low and high fidelity clickable simulations
• Conducted user interviews and usability research.

If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you.

Additional Information

Our Brand Values
• Authenticity - we love what we do, we do what we say we do, we are what we say we are.
• Awareness - we are aware of the needs of our customers, we enjoy the continual process of understanding them and we go out of our way to ensure that we show them that we have this understanding.
• Respectfulness - we are respectful of the gift that we have been given to create this brand in the first place. We are respectful of and cherish the people that work with us as employees and suppliers. We are respectful and very grateful for the customers that engage with us. We are deeply respectful of the environment and all the resources we use to create the products that we do. We respect that customers have many choices and that we constantly need to be delivering to the best of our abilities in order to meet their needs.
• Comfort - we create extraordinarily comfortable sofas and chairs. This level of physical comfort can often enable the individual that sits in them to experience a level of mental comfort, a peaceful mindfulness that they may otherwise find difficult to access. The element of comfort is further enhanced by the fact that the furniture is made with natural materials in a sustainable way, by highly skilled people who love what they do and will last a lifetime.
• Connection - we create content that connects and emotionally engages with people by conveying the main benefits of what our sofas and chairs provide, namely physical and mental comfort.
• Trust - we build trust through every part of what we do. Trust in the benefits of what our sofas and chairs bring, trust in the product, trust in the service. trust in the authenticity, trust in the brand.
• Resilience - we design and build products that last. We are designing and building business processes, teams and supplier networks to sustain our growth that, like our products, are robust enough to manage all the experiences required of them. We welcome employees and suppliers that have an inherent understanding of the need for these qualities in their work

title: Senior Web Designer (UX/UI)
description:
Role

We’re looking for a passionate individual that is a 360 web designer skilled - someone who is a confident, experienced, understands the market and can create designs that outshine those of our competitors. You will be working on a range of sites, landing pages and creatives for paid advertisement channels, from social media to native ad networks and display campaigns. Experience with WordPress is a must.

Requirements

• 5+ years of experience as a UI/UX Designer, with a MA/BA in Digital Media/ Communication Design OR MA/BA in Graphic Design OR Human Computer Interaction degree OR Design related University degree;

• A strong design portfolio demonstrating the above

• Strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders.

• Good understanding of user centred design principles.

• Experience in digital health and/or e-commerce is ideal.

• Extensive experience with Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator.

• Experienced with WordPress - Website content management system... (CMS).

• Experienced creating motion graphic ads is not essential but a nice to have.

• Outstanding in typography and layout design.

• Experience with design systems.

• Excellent understanding of user centred design principles.

• Design tools expert use.

• Understanding of CSS3, HTML5.

• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, diagrams, and sitemaps.

• Design graphic user interface elements, including navigational menus, and data visualizations.

• Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like.

• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches, digital wireframes).

• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders.

• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness).

• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback.

• Making usability recommendations, rapid prototyping, and translating user requirements to development teams, and performing UI assessments on existing applications and providing recommendations. Ideal candidates should have Wireframing/prototyping, and end user interaction.

• Evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers.

• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images.

Desirable Experience and Skills

• Knowledge of industry tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD or Figma to create user interfaces(web application and mobile application).

• Experience with Grid Layout and Flexbox Layout.

• Experience with responsive interfaces.

title: UX Designer (Fully Remote)
description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced, fully remote UX designer to join the design team at our award-winning studio. This is an auspicious opportunity for the right candidate to champion the latest UX methodologies and best practices on a first-in-class AAA game IP.

The perfect candidate will have at least 2/3 years’ experience on a published game title in the role of UX Designer and be able to demonstrate excellent creative and technical skills. You will ensure that the user experience is both objectively efficient and subjectively pleasurable.

You will determine the end user experience for every single feature with the game designers, as well as create the best possible user flows with UI. You should expect plenty of design overlap, from signs, feedback and usability, to accessibility and onboarding. As such, we are searching for a candidate with strong game design knowledge, as well as strong visual design skills.

On this project you will be involved in the development of... experiences for a clearly defined, console-based target group. You will therefore be required to have strong knowledge of player motivations and requirements for console demographics and couch gameplay. It would therefore be beneficial if you are a keen gamer, the perfect candidate ideally a gamer on both console and PC, with knowledge of demographics and player requirements for these platformsRequirements

On a day-to-day basis, you will be required to:

• Analyse the objective and subjective of game features.

• Interact, brainstorm, and collaborate with team members from different departments (design, programming, art etc.)
• Propose UX designs via a range of visual and written means, from paper sketches to wireframes.
• Produce proof of concept UX prototypes.
• Create user stories and user journeys.
• Write detailed reports communicating the results of your work.
• Liaise regularly with external stakeholders and partners to ensure that design needs and core product requirements are being met.
• Communicate with leads to plan development needs.
• Host and attend meetings for reviews, internal playtesting, and progress sharing.
• Work with research resources and stakeholders to plan and conduct user testing.
• Identify areas for workflow improvement and optimisation to improve productivity.
• You will strive to keep up to date with emerging UX design practices, methodologies, technology and tools.

Requirements

• Provable working experience in a UX design role in game development.
• A solid understanding of UX methodologies and the application of game design.
• Knowledge of the latest tools and technologies, as well as the capabilities of those tools (for example, Photoshop, After Effects, Figma, Sketch, Illustrator etc.)
• An aptitude for taking theory and concept to UX wireframes and ideally, UX prototypes.
• Strong visual communication and game design skills - for example typography, iconography, layout, colour theory, motion design, accessibility, signs & feedback.
• An ability to create and work with a variety of artistic styles.
• Designing experiences to a strict vision.
• Have excellent problem-solving skills and an aptitude for logical approaches and simple, intuitive end user experiences.
• An aptitude for designing experiences which meet objective and subjective end user requirements.
• A solid understanding of UX methodologies and how they apply to game design.
• A team player who is flexible and open to ideas and criticism from their colleagues in a respectable manner.

Desirable

• Planning and conducting user research and carrying out competitive analysis.
• Interpreting data and working with feedback.

Notes

Applications for this role must include a portfolio/showreel (or supply a link). Applications that do not supply a portfolio/showreel will not be considered.

Benefits

• Regular social events
• Cycle To Work Scheme
• Pension
• Fresh fruit and snacks
• A friendly, focused, ambitious and relaxed working environment
• Ongoing training and development, with career progression
• Discount card for all the shopping centre stores
• Great seafront location, a short walk from the rail station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops
• Group Private Medical Insurance provided by BUPA
• Group Life Insurance
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Private Dental Insurance
• Group Income Protection
• Company Pension Scheme
• Cycle To Work Scheme
• Eye-Care Vouchers

Perks

• Bring your doggo to work! We're a dog friendly studio, bring your pooch in to meet us.
• Bean to cup coffee machine in the studio.
• Fresh fruit and healthy snacks provided daily, breakfast and some not so healthy snacks.
• In-house clubs and socials. From board games, tennis, football to D&D nights, there are lots of opportunities to socialise.
• Regular Socials including Project Wrap Parties, team and studio events, Christmas and annual Summer parties and soem great charity fundraising events

title: Senior Manager, Software Product Design UI/UX
description:
Senior Manager, Software Product Design UI/UX

About InfoDesk

InfoDesk is the leading enterprise intelligence management SaaS platform, serving the top 100 companies across global life sciences, government, professional services, and investment services. InfoDesk's proprietary "Smarter Data" technology gathers, normalizes, enriches, and summarizes content in real-time from external and internal sources to deliver business-critical insights that help clients increase their competitive awareness, mitigate risks, and make confident data-driven strategic decisions.

About the role

The Product & Technology team is looking for a Senior Manager with strong user research, design, communication, and leadership skills to manage the Product Design team at InfoDesk, responsible for designing new product innovations as well as the redesign of our product portfolio into a single design system and UI platform. This is a great position for an UX agency or studio manager wanting to transition to an... in-house position, or an in-house senior designer looking to level up to manage staff. In this client-facing role, the Senior Manager will lead a small (currently two designers) but growing team in user research, UX, and UI design functions at InfoDesk. The Senior Manager is a foundational member of the Product Leadership team that reports directly to the Chief Product Officer (Head of Product and Technology), who strongly believes in the strategic value of UX design. As such, the role partners closely with the heads of PM, Development, Data Science, and Product Support functions.

What you'll do
• Lead and manage a talented team of product designers that delivers functional and usable designs that delights our software buyers and end users.
• Create a holistic UX vision and strategy, consolidating core use cases of multiple products in our
• portfolio into a single, consistent, usable, delightful UI.
• Facilitate design and user testing workshops, interacting with customers and internal stakeholders as part of the process.
• Oversee multiple design projects and deliver them on vision, on time.
• Set design goals and deadlines, shaping the product design roadmap.
• Mentor and grow the Product Design team in both size and capabilities, ensuring a high level of
• engagement and performance.

Who you are:
• 5+ years of experience as the lead UI/UX designer of responsive web and mobile app software products (B2B or B2C).
• Someone with an impressive design portfolio site.
• A working manager. You'll function as both a people manager and senior designer while the company and team grows.
• A proven leader and collaborator across functions with an excellent track record of design project execution and results.
• A great prototyper with strong knowledge of interaction design and UI patterns.
• An eye for great aesthetics and design, balanced with pragmatism to prioritize functionality and usability over beauty.
• A design thinker of minimum lovable products.
• Experienced with accessibility, with example projects of improving WCAG conformance.
• Expert using Figma, Miro, and additional design and collaboration tools.
• Clear, concise communicator with ability to present confidently to all levels of the organization and to VIP customers.
• Excellent estimator.
• Facilitator of Design Sprints.
• Experienced with user research.
• Experienced with usability testing.
• Experienced working in Agile Scrum teams.
• An initiative taker. You make it happen!

Even better if you have:
• A degree in a relevant discipline.
• Leadership training.
• Experience with software serving the Life Sciences sector, such as Pharma, Biotech, Medical Device, Healthcare, or related industries.
• Experience designing information architectures for content products.
• Data visualization experience.
• Front end development experience (JS, TS, React, CSS, HTML5) to align easier with our front end team.
• Previous experience managing product designers is a plus.
• B2B SaaS experience.
• Experience designing PWAs across web, desktop, and mobile

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
About Watchfinder

Watchfinder is one of the world's leading pre-owned watch retailers, catering to the needs of over 14.5 million visitors every year both online and in store. With 20 years' experience, Watchfinder continues to innovate and redefine the market for pre-owned watches, tirelessly developing new and exciting ways for customers to buy, sell and interact with pre-owned watches from over fifty different brands. This is a rare opportunity to join a company that is changing the way the industry works, and a great prospect for someone looking for a career in the watch industry. If you are a dedicated, enthusiastic, and intuitive person, Watchfinder could well be the company for you!

ROLE INSIGHT

Keeping customers at the core, our product team at Watchfinder is responsible for defining the product strategy, build and manage the short-long term roadmap across the many products within the Watchfinder product portfolio, that spreads across our omnichannel customer facing... applications to the ones that supports the day-to-day operations.

Reporting to the Global Head of Customer Experience, you will be part of the wider Product organisation at Watchfinder, driving state-of-the-art omnichannel customer experience.

You will ensure that users have an amazing experience at every step of the journey when visiting our digital real estate. You’ll be able to produce great design, great UI, and outstanding customer experience through optimisation of our digital touchpoints. A successful Senior UI/UX Designer at Watchfinder will be able to demonstrate expertise in defining user experience by validating design recommendations and solutions with data and insight. Experience with HTML, CSS and Javascript is desirable alongside exposure to the various frameworks: JQuery, Bootstrap, HTML5 Boilerplate, CSS3 (OOCSS).

You’ll be a master at balancing the needs of the business with the needs of the end user while focusing on the key priorities defined within the Product Backlog.

How will you make an impact?
• Work with UX and product teams to ensure delivery roadmaps are fully supported with an iterative design process.
• Materialise customer journeys through the creation of designs, user flows, wireframes and prototypes defining interactions, layouts, and functional components to support template definition.
• Present your deliverables to gather feedback and build consensus. Document your solutions for others to implement and collaborate with developers to check and refine coded designs
• Evaluate the user experience of the site through Google Analytics and provide regular reports to the business evaluating page performance and identifying opportunities for optimization
• Manage Watchfinder’s design system to ensure a consistency approach to design, development and brand identity considering opportunities to optimize and scale and grow component libraries to offer a better experience to the end user.
• Manage and facilitate focus group activities to ensure assessments are effectively run, feedback captured and analysed to help prioritise UX improvements
• Work alongside Product leads to create a culture of testing and validation by supporting deployment of optimisation tests to achieve clear outcomes.
• Work closely with data and product management teams to validate assumptions, prioritise optimisations and ensure that UX/UI solutions are clearly defined to support roadmap.
• Conduct regular market analysis, keep up to date with technology innovations to stay ahead of the curve and provide a great UX to our customers
• Work with growth and product teams on product discovery sessions and create high level user journeys for new product opportunities where relevant
• Work with CX and boutique teams to optimise the digital experience at our retail boutiques

How will you experience success with us?
• A creative problem-solver who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative environment
• Minimum 5 years’ experience with a strong portfolio of UX design projects
• Familiar with HTML, CSS and Javascript, alongside understanding of the various frameworks: JQuery, Bootstrap, HTML5 Boilerplate, CSS3 (OOCSS)
• Proficient in industry standard design tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Invision, Sketch etc.) and knowledge of UI (HTML, CSS, front-end) an advantage.
• Experience with performance and behaviour analytics tools such as Google Analytics, and Hotjar, would be a benefit
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• A great team player: Strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders with a positive outlook
• Familiar with analytics, SEO, and optimisation practices with a working knowledge of how techniques can be used to improve conversion and drive engagement

How do we keep you smiling?

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package which includes:
• Private healthcare and dental
• Competitive pension scheme
• Season ticket loan
• Holiday scheme
• Cycle to work scheme
• Employee Assistant programme
• Income protection
• Life Assurance
• Extensive group discounts

title: Senior UX / UI Designer
description:
Company Description

About Playtech BGT Sports

Playtech BGT Sports specialises in the provision of online betting and gaming software to UK and global service providers. Headquartered in London and founded in 2005, our GenBet product provides operators with a robust and secure central customer management platform onto which any number of products can be added and managed. Sportsbook, Lottery, Pool Betting and Fixed-Odds Games modules allow the operator to tailor their online service whilst a comprehensive back office and reporting suite provides powerful tools for event and market management. Playtech BGT Sports has been a part of Playtech since January 2012, meaning that existing and future customers now benefit from the industry leading GenBet product suite, delivered on Playtech's comprehensive IMS (information management solution).

This is an opportunity for you to join a fun and supportive, fast-paced team, with an emphasis and enthusiasm for technology. We offer a competitive... salary, training, health insurance, life assurance, child care vouchers, season ticket loans, pension scheme, cycle to work scheme, subsidised gym membership, 25 days annual leave and more.

Job Description

As a Senior UX designer you will work as part of the design team in close collaboration with the Sports Product and Development teams to deliver best-in-class digital products to our customers. You will work closely with the team lead to help develop and manage the more junior team members and their work.

With a strong understanding of UX practices and methodologies, you are an end-user advocate who produces experiences that engage even the most discerning audiences. You are a research and data enthusiast who consumes large amounts of information and distils it into simple, yet engaging, and useful products and services to serve a wide variety of experiences. Think research, testing, wireframes, and prototypes.

Main Duties
• Work closely within the team of UX and UI designers, and with the wider product and development teams to design end to end digital user experiences
• Provide support to and manage more junior staff in their duties, and help nurture their understanding of our products, processes, tools, and techniques
• Conduct user research, test and study usage, alongside reviewing and prioritising user and product requirements
• Develop sketches, wireframes, prototypes, and designs that succinctly illustrate user journeys, content structure, hierarchy, and navigation
• Facilitate workshops, champion UX within Sports and Playtech, and present and explain UX decisions to internal and external stakeholders
• § Support business development activities such as contributing expert input to sales and marketing documents, third party product reviews and partner products

Qualifications

Experience/Skills

Required
• 4+ years of relevant experience, at least 2 of which must have been in a professional capacity within a technology focussed environment
• Previous experience working as a senior practitioner within a design team with experience managing and supporting more junior team members
• Excellent knowledge in UX design processes and methodologies, understanding of current UX/UI trends with the ability to spot a good or bad one
• Knowledge and understanding of research methods including analytics, unmoderated and moderated user testing, and how these can help drive products forward
• Expert with an array of appropriate wireframe, collaboration, testing and prototyping tools (Figma, Zeplin, Sketch, Invision, Adobe XD etc.)
• Although the role is UX focussed, a good knowledge of visual and interaction design is essential
• Good knowledge of web technologies, analytics, accessibility, SEO, and responsive design and how these can affect user interfaces
• Comfortable with spoken and written English. We have offices in Sweden, Austria, Germany, Cyprus, and Ukraine among others (so there is opportunity to travel)

Desirable
• Prior experience working as part of a remote team
• Experience designing for complex transactional interfaces and back-office platforms, e.g. within the sports betting or financial industries

Additional Information

About our Office

We’re proud of our awesome new central London hub in Holborn, just minutes from Oxford Street and the famous West End. Of course, as of most of other tech companies we went full remote during the pandemic and it worked out unexpectedly well, thanks to all of our amazing colleagues and especially IT. At the same time, it’ll be great to see each other in person again when the world is back to normal. In part because our office is a really great place!

It houses more than 300 employees, bringing all the Playtech London teams together under one roof for the first time. We offer a stimulating work environment in a state-of-the-art, purpose-designed space, including a brand new communal area, with games including pool, table football, table tennis and video games. Our regular benefits include free cereal, fruit, tea, coffee and soft drinks, plus regular Friday drinks, Summer and Christmas parties and lots of other social events. Playtech also offers various other benefits after a full year of service. When you join Playtech, you join a global family!

Playtech is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome all applicants. Unless otherwise instructed, we will retain your details on file for 6 months in accordance with the data protection act

title: UX UI Visual Design
description:
Job Description
The Publicis Sapient Experience Design Capability is the bridge between business strategy and applied technology — we create meaningful, holistic experiences for our clients and their customers. We are multiskilled thinkers, computational designers, environmental designers, researchers, and architects. A big part of our work is collaboration – internally, and with our clients. That collaboration thrives on a can-do attitude and an interest for working across tenures, roles, capabilities, countries and cultures.
As Working Student in UX UI Visual Design, you become a full member of our international innovation team. Your role will focus on the creation of UI elements, accessibility topics, data visualization, and brand maintenance. Besides gaining practical work experience and working on exciting tasks, you will benefit from our open corporate culture and work with colleagues from various areas.
Sounds interesting to you? Great! If you are currently studying and are... looking for work for 20 hours per week, apply now.
Your Impact:
Insights into the entire creation process: From conducting research, defining user personas, user stories, flows, to wireframing (low and high fidelity) as well as testing using surveys, interviews and evaluation
Supporting the creation of a UX playbook
Development of UX and interaction pattern
Assisting in maintaining and developing the design system
Qualifications
Your Skills & Experience:
Studies in the realm of digital design such as Media, Graphic, Interaction, UX/UI or similar fields of study
Confident in using Figma and working with component libraries
Experience working with the digital workspace tool mural
First practical experience in the digital design field
Confident in raising your voice, regardless if it is about ideas, creative thoughts or project related concerns
High motivation and hands-on mentality
Team Player mindset and willingness to learn
Excellent English language skills
Additional Information
What’s in it for you?
We know the importance of health and wellbeing so offer you extensive retail discount offers and further reimbursement towards activities that contribute to a healthier lifestyle
Our beautiful Turnmill office is open
You can meet over a complimentary barista-made coffee and our teams have been busy replicating face-to-face social activities through learning languages virtually, yoga sessions, having a laugh at our online summer fairs and so much more
Diversity and inclusion aren't just buzzwords. We offer an inclusive environment through our inspirational business resource groups and work with you to give back to the local community through CSR efforts
As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.
Company Description
Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organisations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value

description:

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
At Improbable, we’ve been venturing into unexplored territory for over a decade, seeking new ways to connect people and amplify their lives.

We’re shaping virtual worlds of unprecedented scale for the gaming, web3, defence, and related sectors, creating world-changing technology from Morpheus to M2.

With us, you’ll tackle questions that no one else is asking and find answers that define the future.We’re leading the way in defining what the metaverse can be.

This is where you get to explore interconnected, immersive, exciting worlds that have never been seen before and where you decide what the future looks like. Are you ready?

Your Opportunity :
• Create high quality UI Art within industry standard timelines.
• Deliver the required concept related tasks to the quality set by the UI Art leadership in a dependable and professional fashion.
• Design user interface and HUD display systems that are visually appealing, intuitive and effective.
• Read and understand all game design... documentation in order to understand the intended user experience.
• Develop concepts for in-game menus with focus on functionality and user flow.
• Apply and maintain a consistent artistic standard for the entire interface of a project and respect brand guidelines in conjunction with the Art Director.
• Understand and respect technical constraints of the platform.
• Make sure that all game information is clearly, consistently and relevantly conveyed through the various user interfaces.

Why You're Made For This :
• A strong understanding of UI / UX design experience in AAA, indie, or mod games.
• Ability to clearly and effectively communicate and collaborate with other designers, artists and engineers to ensure delivery of the best possible User Experience.
• Ability to design UI flow and layout in conjunction with discipline leads.
• Expertise in graphic design and motion graphics software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects (preferred) etc...
• Unreal Engine or other commercial game engines experience (preferred).
• University or college diploma in graphic and multimedia design or equivalent work experience (preferred).

Everyone brings different experiences, perspective, knowledge and skills that makes each one of us brilliant. You don't have to meet all the requirements and experiences on this job advert to apply for and be successful in this role.

Apply now

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
JOB TITLE: Lead UX Designer

LOCATION: Brighton, UK

FUNCTION: Design

REPORTS TO: Game Director

CONTRACT: Permanent

What We Need:

We see UX designers as the glue that holds all the parts of great video games together. Everything we build from a game design perspective you get your hands on; from systems to mechanics, from the HUD and menus to control schemes, from usability testing to player advocacy, you make sure that at all times, the player experience is at the forefront of your mind, and on the minds of the Directors, Leads, and Implementers responsible for putting our game together. We can’t create a great game without you.

As the Lead UX Designer, you’re the glue-master. In addition to working with the Game Director to set the overall vision and direction for user experience, you are a master communicator; capable of ensuring that UX design is on the same page not only with each other, but with the UI artists and other team members that both rely upon and request help from... the UX team.

What You Will Do:
• Lead a team of UX and UI professionals to hit the shared vision for the video game
• Collaborate with Leads and Directors to define the overall vision, design and interface of next gen titles
• Create documentation to communicate the vision, including but not limited to wireframes and flowcharts
• Understand what our players are doing and get to the bottom of why they’re doing what they do
• Take complex game mechanics and use your knowledge of good interaction design to produce creative and effective UX solutions
• Create working prototypes that demonstrate the design and reduce risk in the production phase of development
• Take an iterative approach to development by working closely with the rest of the development team to improve the end user’s understanding of how to interact with the UI and improve the overall user experience
• Champion the design department’s UX related work, guiding future approaches to UX
• Ensure an overall high-quality level of UX design and User Experience
• Collaborate actively with teams across the globe
• Coordinate with external groups both within and outside of 2K to put together usability testing that gives you the data you need to validate your decisions

Who We Think Will Be A Good Fit:
• Experience in leading teams through all stages of UX development
• Experience in cross site communication of design, presentations and progress reporting
• Excellent communication skills - must be ready to work with teams across the globe
• Shipped at least one AAA console project
• Understanding and experience of in-game stores and monetisation UX desirable
• Understanding and experience of in-game stores and monetisation UX desirable
• Highly skilled in Wireframe Creation Software, Adobe Suite, primarily Photoshop, After Effects (Trapcode), Animate, or other tools that help you put together strong prototypes
• Love for our players, and a dedication to usability testing and practices
• Passion for games
• Strong ability to digest complex and critical feedback and channel it into strong visual designs
• Strong sense of aesthetics and how to communicate visually
• Comfort in working with technical toolsets
• Must be able to work well under pressure
• Self-motivate
• Humble at all times, not driven by personal ego

Who We Are:

Hangar 13 is an internal 2K development studio based in four locations: Novato (California), Brighton (UK), and Brno & Prague (Czech Republic), working collaboratively as one team.

Each of our locations provides the opportunity to Bravely Create on big-budget, AAA console titles in a diverse and inclusive environment.

At Hangar 13, we want people driven by curiosity — Visionaries who aren’t afraid to explore new territory. Intrepid individuals who embrace the weird, the challenging, the unconventional.

We’re continuing to build a space that empowers you to take risks and redefine what’s possible,

Where your inquisitive nature is nourished —

A home for people who aren’t satisfied with what is, but who are obsessed by what could be.

So bring your talent,

Your unique point-of-view, Your fearless tenacity,

And together, we’ll Bravely Create

Brighton:

Located just 45 minutes via train from London, Brighton is one of the UK’s most diverse and downright interesting cities. Sat right on the south coast of England, the city is home to a vibrant creative community and is known as an easy-going and tolerant place to live and work. Brighton is home to Victorian piers and palaces, brightly coloured stucco homes and a 5-mile long shingle beach which becomes a post-work social hub during the summer months.

Onsite amenities inside our state-of-the-art Brighton studio include a fully equipped kitchen, games room, gym (with showers) and our very own bar. We’re a 30 second walk from Brighton station

title: Lead UI/UX Designer - UK based Remote/Flexible
description:
Are you an experienced UI/UX Designer looking for a fresh challenge and opportunity where you can make a real impact?

We want you to #JOINTHEREBELLION!

For 30 years we’ve been creating incredible video games at our multiple studios, but Rebellion is more than just games. We have our own film and mo-cap studio, we create board games, publish books, and through 2000AD, publish comics and graphic novels such as the amazing Judge Dredd.

We operate across multiple UK locations, with studios based in Oxford, Warwick, Liverpool, and Wakefield. Work-life balance is important to us, and we want everyone at Rebellion to work in the way that works best for them. So, if you are based in the UK, we are always open to discussing how we can support remote and/or flexible working options.

We’re looking for a new Lead UI/UX Designer to lead a team of UI artists and technical designers to design and deliver the live service UX strategy for an unannounced co-op strategy shooter game.

Your job will... be to lead a team of UI Artists, Technical UI Designers and UX Designers to shape the vision, aesthetic and implementation of the UI for an unannounced action title.

You will be involved in building the UX pillars for the game alongside the Lead Game Designer, delivering scope and planning throughout the project, working as part of a multidisciplinary leadership team.

What we need is someone who knows how useful data is in analysing and reacting to user behaviour and feedback but also someone who loves working with other people. We believe that UI is never solved by a single person or a single point of view and that is why we want the best collaborators so that we can work together to make memorable experiences for us and for our players!

Responsibilities
• Lead the UI team, design and iterate UX and drive the UI/UX deliverables for the project
• Build a UX strategy for a brand-new game, helping to shape the UX vision in collaboration with experts from the Design team
• Design integral player experiences and get the joy of implementing and iterating some of those experiences yourself using a visual scripting toolset
• Drive the delivery and quality of the UI for the project, mentoring and supporting UI designers, artists, and technical designers
• Experience designing UX on at least one title
• Experience managing a small team through all phases of the project lifecycle
• Portfolio showing experience designing high fidelity UI using industry standard tools, e.g., Adobe XD, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc
• Able to effectively communicate whilst building long-term, trusting relationships with a wide range of people
• Games as a service experience required for this project

We offer an extensive benefits package to our team including:
• 26 days holiday + Bank holidays (increasing with service at 5 years – one day each year until you reach 31 days)
• Private Medical Insurance, healthcare cash plan, including dental and Vision
• Life Assurance, Income Protection & Critical Illness Cover
• Enhanced Family Leave
• Interest Free, Tax-Free loans
• Enhanced Pension Scheme
• EAP a range of Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
• Plus loads more… including a wide range of discounts, freebies, and social events!

About Us

Whichever team you join at Rebellion we are proud of our open, friendly, and creative atmosphere. We love what we do, and we have fun doing it! As a big indie developer, we have complete creative freedom over our titles which allows us to work on a massive variety of projects across all the major platforms.

Find out more about ushere

Our size, stability, and the variety of in-house expertise across multiple industries, makes Rebellion completely unique! We work in our own way, and we celebrate that as the key to our success. We foster an inclusive culture where you are encouraged to be yourself, to express your creativity and your talent. We are people focused and will support you in every way to can be the best at what you do. We recognise the importance of enjoying what you do and having a healthy work-life balance. We offer a friendly, creative, and relaxed working atmosphere, with sensibly managed projects and a wide variety of benefits and development opportunities for all our teams to ensure you are fully supported with your physical and Mental Well-being.

We are actively recruiting for a diverse team and continue to add to our culture of growth and inclusion. Rebellion encourages innovation in all areas, and we look forward to hearing how you can help us to be better. We encourage all demographics of culture, gender, ethnicity, neurodiversity and beyond, because a representative team makes better products.

If you are interested in working at Rebellion, but this role doesn’t sound quite like you, we’re recruiting for a range of positions across the studio and we’re always happy to receive speculative applications via our website. Visit our Careers website to view all our live vacancies: Rebellion: Careers

title: UX Designer
description:
We’re looking for a passionate and self-motivated designer with a keen interest in UX and technology and entertainment, to join our amazing UX/UI Design team. You will work on a wide variety of projects, where you will help provide the best user experience to our players.

We’re looking for someone who is not afraid to take their own initiatives, who likes to have fun at work, and who shares the Bally's core values regarding being a team player and being kind and respecting towards others.

Responsibilities

User Experience Design

In your day-to-day tasks you will run stakeholder workshops and conduct requirements gathering activities to understand business needs and find a balance with the needs of our end users. You will translate business and user needs into meaningful, easy to use, and engaging solutions across many platforms. You will be using tools such as Figma to develop sketches, wireframes, and prototypes to validate concepts and hypotheses with our end users. You should... have the ability to present design ideas with clarity and passion and receive feedback with open-mindedness.

User Research

In your role you will define, plan, and conduct user research (i.e., surveys, usability tests, interviews) to inform design decisions for various products and experiences. You should be able to identify, and articulate research needs and select the best approach where you utilise quantitative and qualitative research to generate meaningful insights that will drive impact.

Collaboration

You will regularly collaborate with our UI, CI, Product, and Engineering teams to make decisions on the features we build as well as working with the design team to develop, evolve, and refine our design system. You need to have excellent communication skills and the ability to get buy-in on ideas within a large organisation.

Qualifications
• You have 3 to 5 years of hands-on UX design experience.
• You are fully competent with the latest design tools such as Figma.
• Experience working in a deadline driven environment.
• Excellent communication skills.
• You have a 'Can-do' attitude, and you always deliver on time.
• Have a degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Social Science, or a related field.
• You have a keen interest in current trends in design and can spot opportunities.
• You have a strong UX portfolio and/or published references that you are proud of.
• You are looking for daily challenges and want to join an amazing team!

Please make sure to submit your portfolio as applications without any will not be considered.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer

About Elwood

Elwood’s seamless, end-to-end platform connects institutional clients to a universe of crypto exchanges, custodians, and liquidity providers via a single API. Built by industry experts with decades of combined experience in investment management and digital technology, Elwood’s order, execution and management solutions offer unparalleled breadth to the financial services industry. Providing market infrastructure at scale, we enable traditional financial institutions, neobanks, and hedge funds the means to access digital asset markets quickly and efficiently.

Built by industry experts with decades of combined experience in investment management and digital technology. Elwood provides market infrastructure at scale, enabling financial institutions, neobanks, and corporations to access digital asset markets quickly and efficiently.

We’re currently looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our Product team based in London. You will play a key role in... building our next generation of products, with a great eye for elegant design and user experience.

Job Description

• Own the end-to-end design process of the team to drive high-velocity high-quality product design.
• Work collaboratively with product managers and engineering
• Deliver a constant focus on improvement.
• Leverage metrics, user testing, innovative design-thinking to guide your design decisions.
• Conduct user research on Elwood products using both qualitative and quantitative methods to help us understand our existing and potential customers and how to create a better product that meets their needs.
• Improve the user’s experience through enhancing the information architecture and user workflows.
• Champion great UX in the face of technical constraints
• Create wireframes, and storyboard user journeys.
• Create high fidelity pixel perfect mockups and clickable prototypes.
• Maintain and update the product’s design component library and ensure visual design principles are consistent across all products and services.
• Follow an iterative approach to design and conduct user testing to validate the designs and adjust them accordingly to user feedback.

Qualifications / Knowledge

• Extensive experience designing products for mobile & web.
• Experience with financial services/crypto/trade execution products will be a strong plus.
• Promote Design Thinking throughout the organisation and help Product accelerate Design Sprints and prototyping
• Ability to go up-down-across. You will set and deliver the product design vision, align teams on common standards and patterns, but also get into the details to be passionate about the pixel-perfect outcomes.
• Exceptional design velocity: ability to take products from concept to implementation in a fast paced environment
• A solid understanding of design processes, information architecture, web and application usability, responsive design, and best-in-class UI design
• Experience working with design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, and Abode XD
• Excellent teamwork and communication skills, handle pressure and adapt to new and complex domains
• Robust and detailed design documentation that has high impact and is valuable to the team
• Stunning portfolio demonstrating how you work as well as your end product

Why Elwood?

• Join one of the fastest growing FinTech companies and help shape the future of finance
• A startup with deep financial backing and a strong market presence
• Our platform is enabling institutional access to the most exciting growth opportunity in Finance
• Work with a modern technology stack and help solve high impact problems
• Strong client focused team with a diverse background
• We’re a Global company and have offices in New York, Singapore & Geneva
• Competitive compensation package
• A hybrid mode of working in office and working from home

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunity employer, you can read more about our policy here

title: Senior UI/UX Designer - 12 Month Contract
description:
About the opportunity

The Alfresco Experience Design team seeks a highly motivated senior UI/UX designer to manage the definition and design of the cross-platform design standards and UI component library. The standards and components are a critical part in Alfresco’s vision to enable businesses to achieve accelerated time to value by developing and deploying their mission critical business applications, as well as delivering a consistently great, end to end Alfresco Digital Business Platform experience “out of the box.”

In this role, you will manage the XD standards and the UI component library, working closely with the Alfresco Developer Framework team. You will design new UI components for the library, ensuring they incorporate existing standard and affordances and meet user needs. To help us deliver on our goal of a consistently great UX, you will help oversee the incorporation of design standards in the team’s product designs, and when needed, assist in bringing designs to... production ready quality.

Key job responsibilities

You will take the lead in extending and maintaining our UI Standards and component library by designing individual components, and when needed, designing the contextual UI the components reside in. You’ll collaborate with XD designers and researchers, product management, and the software leads to produce UI components. You’ll also participate in design reviews, to help ensure Alfresco is providing engaging and intuitive product experiences that address user problems faced everyday by knowledge workers in enterprise environments.
• Design and refine simple and compound UI components, modeling after Google Material Design principles but refined for Alfresco users’ needs
• Design, maintain, and refine the product styles standards and guides, and skin new UI components (as needed)
• Create new icons (based off the Google Material Design icon components)
• Review the team’s designs to ensure compliance with the Product Standards Style guide
• Participate in team design reviews to provide feedback on the usability of designs
