title: UX Designer (Fully Remote)
description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced, fully remote UX designer to join the design team at our award-winning studio. This is an auspicious opportunity for the right candidate to champion the latest UX methodologies and best practices on a first-in-class AAA game IP.

The perfect candidate will have at least 2/3 years’ experience on a published game title in the role of UX Designer and be able to demonstrate excellent creative and technical skills. You will ensure that the user experience is both objectively efficient and subjectively pleasurable.

You will determine the end user experience for every single feature with the game designers, as well as create the best possible user flows with UI. You should expect plenty of design overlap, from signs, feedback and usability, to accessibility and onboarding. As such, we are searching for a candidate with strong game design knowledge, as well as strong visual design skills.
On this project you will be involved in the development of... experiences for a clearly defined, console-based target group. You will therefore be required to have strong knowledge of player motivations and requirements for console demographics and couch gameplay. It would therefore be beneficial if you are a keen gamer, the perfect candidate ideally a gamer on both console and PC, with knowledge of demographics and player requirements for these platforms

Requirements

On a day-to-day basis, you will be required to:
• Analyse the objective and subjective of game features.
• Interact, brainstorm, and collaborate with team members from different departments (design, programming, art etc.)
• Propose UX designs via a range of visual and written means, from paper sketches to wireframes.
• Produce proof of concept UX prototypes.
• Create user stories and user journeys.
• Write detailed reports communicating the results of your work.
• Liaise regularly with external stakeholders and partners to ensure that design needs and core product requirements are being met.
• Communicate with leads to plan development needs.
• Host and attend meetings for reviews, internal playtesting, and progress sharing.
• Work with research resources and stakeholders to plan and conduct user testing.
• Identify areas for workflow improvement and optimisation to improve productivity.
• You will strive to keep up to date with emerging UX design practices, methodologies, technology and tools.

Requirements
• Provable working experience in a UX design role in game development.
• A solid understanding of UX methodologies and the application of game design.
• Knowledge of the latest tools and technologies, as well as the capabilities of those tools (for example, Photoshop, After Effects, Figma, Sketch, Illustrator etc.)
• An aptitude for taking theory and concept to UX wireframes and ideally, UX prototypes.
• Strong visual communication and game design skills - for example typography, iconography, layout, colour theory, motion design, accessibility, signs & feedback.
• An ability to create and work with a variety of artistic styles.
• Designing experiences to a strict vision.
• Have excellent problem-solving skills and an aptitude for logical approaches and simple, intuitive end user experiences.
• An aptitude for designing experiences which meet objective and subjective end user requirements.
• A solid understanding of UX methodologies and how they apply to game design.
• A team player who is flexible and open to ideas and criticism from their colleagues in a respectable manner.

Desirable
• Planning and conducting user research and carrying out competitive analysis.
• Interpreting data and working with feedback.

Notes

Applications for this role must include a portfolio/showreel (or supply a link). Applications that do not supply a portfolio/showreel will not be considered.

Benefits
• Regular social events
• Cycle To Work Scheme
• Pension
• Fresh fruit and snacks
• A friendly, focused, ambitious and relaxed working environment
• Ongoing training and development, with career progression
• Discount card for all the shopping centre stores
• Great seafront location, a short walk from the rail station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops
• Group Private Medical Insurance provided by BUPA
• Group Life Insurance
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Private Dental Insurance
• Group Income Protection
• Company Pension Scheme
• Cycle To Work Scheme
• Eye-Care Vouchers

Perks
• Bring your doggo to work! We're a dog friendly studio, bring your pooch in to meet us.
• Bean to cup coffee machine in the studio.
• Fresh fruit and healthy snacks provided daily, breakfast and some not so healthy snacks.
• In-house clubs and socials. From board games, tennis, football to D&D nights, there are lots of opportunities to socialise.
• Regular Socials including Project Wrap Parties, team and studio events, Christmas and annual Summer parties and soem great charity fundraising events

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Netcall is a high growth business providing industry specific software solutions that accelerate and simplify the path to digital. Spanning the entire customer journey across the public, healthcare and corporate markets, our solutions combine the skills of business experts to craft incredible customer experiences.

Purpose of Role:

To develop UX and UI solutions using Adobe Creative Suite and implement custom SASS to modify the Liberty platform UI to a high standard.

Key Responsibilities:

Take responsibility for the development of tasks within any given project

Work proficiently with a range of stakeholders within the business and its customers.

Foster a culture of continuous improvement in all areas of technology and the software development process. Help instil the principle of this culture across the entire development organisation.

Help ensure that the Development Team adheres to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001, PCI-DSS and any future quality or security accreditations... that Netcall holds.

Essential Skills:

Demonstrate a deep understanding of SASS and Grid CSS and their role in building flexible front-end interfaces.

Demonstrate an excellent working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, in terms of UX and design.

You’ll have the ability to design user interfaces from a UX, design and development perspective on a range of products and systems

You have experience working within a multidisciplinary team including project managers, product owners, developers/builders and QA/test resources.

You have the ability to manage conflicting messages, influence stakeholders whilst retaining a focus on core business requirements

You are able to prioritise your work and deliver to tight timescales, demonstrating good organisational, communication and administrative skills.

You take responsibility for your own professional development and learning and encourage others in the team to do the same.

Desirable Skills:

Experience of the latest Vue.JS v3.

Experience of the Bulma CSS framework.

Experience of some of the tools and libraries used by the wider team, including PHP, MySql, Git and the Linux command line.

Behavioural competencies:

At Netcall we measure how results are achieved using a competency framework. Definitions of the competencies applicable for the role are listed below:

Teamwork – co-operates with others to accomplish common goals; works with others within and across his/her department to achieve shared goals; treats others with dignity and respect and maintains a friendly demeanour; values the contribution of others.

Communication – listens to others to gain a full understanding of issues; comprehends written material; presents information in a clear and concise manner orally and in writing to ensure others understand his/her ideas; appropriately adapts his/her message, style and tone to accommodate a variety of audiences.

Drive – having the sustained energy and determination to achieve results by overcoming obstacles.Drive is about demonstrating the urgency and motivation in setting and meeting challenging targets with required quality and service, and to time.

Accountability - accepts full responsibility for self and contribution as a team member; displays honesty and truthfulness; confronts problems quickly; displays a strong commitment to the success of the Company acting as a credible representative of the business.

Agility - adapts to change and different ways of doing things quickly and positively; does not shy away from addressing setbacks or ambiguity; deals effectively with a variety of people and situations; appropriately adapts thinking or approach as the situation changes.

Creativity & Innovation - applies creative problem solving skills in order to develop solutions; recognises and demonstrates the value of taking "smart" risks and learning from mistakes; develops multiple alternatives and understands the feasibility of each; effectively shares and implements ideas.

Customer Focus – understands that all employees have external and/or internal customers that they provide services and information to; provides helpful, courteous, accessible, responsive and knowledgeable customer service

Personal Development and Developing Others - enhances the capabilities of the organisation by openly and effectively sharing his/her expertise with others; supports a continuous learning environment by preserving and compiling intellectual capital which can be used by others within his/her team and the organisation as a whole.

Special conditions:

Satisfactory completion of pre-employment screening, including a DBS/NPPV3 check dependent on role and responsibilities.

There may be some requirement to travel to other locations within the UK

Implement and act in accordance with the Company’s Information Security and Acceptable Use policies.

The above list of duties is not exhaustive and you may be required to undertake other tasks within the scope of your role. Any job description provided to you by the organisation will not form part of your contract of employment unless specified otherwise

title: UX Designer
description:
Moma Title : UX Designer

Location : London, UK

Duration : from ASAP to 14th of June 2023

Onsite Working Schedule : Hybrid - 3 days in the office at least

Bonus : Company Plan
• Navigate project constraints with engineers and managers to ensure design quality achieves required results.
• Plan, balance, manage, and execute prioritised work, making progress independently to achieve well-defined design objectives.
• Independently make decisions that improve quality and / or consistency within a feature or project level scope of work (e.

g., process, team, deliverables).
• Address low-to-medium complexity design and / or user problems by leveraging established design principles and patterns.
• Proactively identify, define, and communicate problems within the project or product team(s), and deliver practical and / or creative ways to fix them.
• Recognize when the solution being proposed is not ideal and communicate with team leads to identify alternative solutions.
• Develop... relationships with one or more team(s) and contribute to cross-project collaborations by planning, navigating, executing, and communicating user needs, constraints, and opportunities.
• Provide training and guidance to junior UX designers.
• Integrate smaller teams where necessary to align assigned components of a project or program with the goals, timelines, and objectives of the overarching project or program.
• Leverage and improve upon team design principles and processes as needed.

Responsibilities under the direction of Manager :
• Advocate UX design
• Help gain support for design strategy across partners.
• Communicate design approach to other designers or partners (e.g., product manager), and identify challenges and questions.

Create design deliverables

Collaborate with engineers to communicate and / or influence design intention. Manage specifications (e.g., red-lines, mock-ups, or product models) for implementation.

Creating design solutions

Help create innovative design solutions to user, product, and business problems. Adapt to evolving design constraints and communicate rationale of choices related to design solutions.

Design execution
• Apply or adapt UX writing and content design frameworks for user experiences, including principles, patterns, and systems.
• Leverage standard writing and design tools to help visualise ideas or develop mock-ups or prototypes.
• Tailor deliverables to product or platform requirements with minimal guidance. Identify and follow design templates, style guides, and accessibility guidelines.

Design process and vision (UX Design)

Lead contributions to a holistic design process, design system, or design language across teams or products. Assist in design and testing processes, and generate support for a design vision with partners.

Designing for impact

Help create design solutions based on user insights, business needs, and industry trends that further business objectives.

Designing for user needs

Create design concepts (e.g., mock-ups, prototypes, models) for informing product ideation and user research / testing or conduct research independently to inform design.

Iteration of design

Iteratively improve design based on UX testing and partner / stakeholder input with minimal guidance, and provide feedback to engage stakeholders on product design and achieve product goals.

Planning and prioritisation
• Plan and prioritise design work across projects, and communicate priorities to team members.
• Collaborate with partners to identify opportunities to expand responsibilities within the immediate product team.

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.

BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES

title: Senior Product Designer UX/UI
description:
Senior Product Designer (UX/UI)

Hastings Direct is on a mission to become a truly digital first insurer, and we're growing our Digital Customer Experience team!

We're looking for a talented Senior Product Designer (UX/UI) to help evolve our digital service proposition and support our transformation for Claims.

This is a 12-month fixed term contract.

The Role

Reporting into the Product Design Lead, you will ensure our digital products deliver the best-in-class customer experience. You will research and design what our digital products need to behave and look like across different customer touchpoints, supporting the wider Digital Product and Marketing teams to create high quality branded journeys.

Flexible working is available from our London or Bexhill office, and remote working considered.

What we're looking for:

This role is critical to our customer experience. You will need a voice but also be able to listen, research and elicit key insights that help shape complex problems... into brilliant solutions.

You must be effective, versatile and proactive in your approach and be able to provide breakthrough thinking supported by strong rationale.

You will have a track record and proud portfolio of UX/UI design and it is essential that you have strong competency in using Figma and FigJam.

Your experience should include digital product design of transactional customer journeys and an understanding of service design. You must be capable of building strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

How you will make a difference:
• Producing high quality user flows for digital devices
• Produce and deliver designs of digital user interfaces
• Low and high fidelity wireframing and prototyping
• Usability testing and iterating user centred designs
• Assisting the maintenance of our design system and pattern library

Benefits for you
• Highly competitive basic salary
• Pension 1:1 match up to 10%
• £5k car allowance
• Up to 10% bonus earning potential (pro rata)
• 27 days annual leave

Hastings Group is an equal opportunities employer which means we treat people fairly. We welcome applications from all suitably skilled persons regardless of their gender, age, race, disability, ethnic background, religion/belief, sexual orientation, gender reassignment or marital/family status. Please also note that we have a thorough referencing process, which includes credit and criminal record checks

title: UI/UX Design Manager
description:
Puffy is one of America’s fastest-growing e-commerce retailers. Our award-winning mattresses are developed with unrivaled attention to detail and are loved by millions of sleepers in America and Canada.

Since entering the bed-in-a-box market in 2016, we have experienced consistent and considerable year-on-year growth. Driven by a mission to make optimal sleep health a priority for all, we’ve made headlines on Entrepreneur.com and TechCompanyNews, to name a few. Puffy’s product range now extends to the entire bedroom, including pillows, bedding, and bedroom accessories.

The Role

Puffy are looking for a talented UI/UX Design Manager to help take our user centric design to the next level. The is a strategic, people management and operational role within our business.

What you'll be doing
• Enhance the user experience by creating seamless navigation within the e-commerce website and Landing pages
• Develop UI/UX strategy to support AB testing and Landing pages
• Develop wireframes and... prototypes around the business needs for AB tests
• Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)
• Drive UI/UX strategy; manage and mentor junior designers about UX/UI design processes
• Communicate high-level design ideas and prototypes to stakeholders in meetings
• Understand user behavior and psychology, and review User testing results to support hypotheses made on UX.
• Understand and create compatible UI designs with UX wireframes in accordance with brand guidelines
• Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
• Build storyboards process flows, and sitemaps to conceptualize designs to accurately convey project plans to stakeholders.
• Collaborate with project manager and team for reporting, team assignments, status, and updates
• Take lead in creative development
• Keep UI/UX tasks up to speed and work closely with the digital project manager to ensure deadlines are met.
• Work closely with the Digital Marketing team to optimize the main funnel as well as dedicated landing pages for PPC.

Ideally you will have
• At least 3 years experience leading and managing a team of UX/UI Designers
• A minimum of 7 years of demonstrated experience in creating and implementing UX/UI design for e-commerce websites
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Design Manager
• Background in research is a plus
• Proficient in design software (e.g. Sketch, Figma, InVision, Zeplin)
• Proficient with visual design programs such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and others
• Up to date with UX/UI trends and current design strategy and technologies
• Ability to prioritize and manage several milestones and projects efficiently
• Experience creating storyboards and website mapping
• Account for challenges using problem-solving skills and seek to optimize data for the best possible outcome
• Strong portfolio of design projects, willing to share in the interview
• Professional written and interpersonal skills when communicating with stakeholders

Puffy Perks & Benefits
• “We challenge the status quo.” Work with young and supportive colleagues. The leadership team are highly entrepreneurial, it reflects. Ideas, challenges, think tanks, it is all in your day to day.
• Not in Dubai yet? We will cover your visa requirements and help you settle with flights and temporary accommodation (2-week hotel stay).
• Flights home once per year.
• A modern and stylish open plan office in the heart of Dubai Marina. Dozens of restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and shopping within a 5 min walk! Ps. Don’t worry we have free company parking.
• We promote a healthy lifestyle! On top of world class health insurance (dental & vision included), our kitchen is stocked with organic snacks, juices, fruits, tea & coffee.
• Top tier tech stack. We are young and modern. G suite, Atlassian, Re-tool, Asana, Slack. Need something more? Ask away.
• The best equipment, whatever helps you get your work done. Choose your own laptop, monitor (we prefer curved Samsung screens;)), Super ergo office chairs, and whatever else you need.
• Closing the week with a delicious catered lunch on Friday

title: Senior Product Designer (UK Remote)
description:
MOO set out to shake up the world of print back in 2006. And we’ve come a long way since. Today we’re a 400 + strong team (we’re thinking of getting matching jackets) who create print and digital products for companies of all sizes – from Google and AirBnB to the guy who makes those amazing prints you found at a craft fair.

Our global HQ is in London, UK, while we also have premises in Dagenham. In the US, you’ll find us in Boston, MA, as well as Lincoln, RI and Denver, CO.

We’re making new and exciting things – and we could really do with your help.

Are you a Product Designer that wants to own design for a completely new B2B Application? Do you want to work on a product that is critical to the growth of the business? Whilst being able to evangelise UI/UX Best practices?

As Moo scales we are constantly looking for ways to delight our customers and ensure we give them remarkable products and experiences. In doing so we uncovered the need to build a brand-new platform for our... growing base of enterprise customers and have a B2B focused application.

Therefore, we have a need for a Senior Product Designer to come in and be the go-to person for everything with regards to design for this new platform. The aim being to design a seamless, engaging, and commercially performing experience for all users of our platform.

The Product Designer will be coming in to own both UI and UX for the platform. You will be working closely with all the senior stakeholders including CEO, Engineering, Sales, Customer Service, and the Finance to understand the requirements and create a design and experience that engages and excites.

It will be for you to bring all the stakeholders on the journey of design by running discovery sessions, understand our users’ problems, wireframing solutions, validating these solutions, and ultimately presenting these back to the team.

Ultimately, The Product Designer will be coming in to evangelise design best practices and create a continuous improvements ethos in the business to make sure we are ahead of the curve when it comes to the latest services and tools, we can use to improve our users experience.

What’s it like to work at MOO?
MOO’s the kind of workplace where you can really be yourself. Dye your hair purple. Hit the sofa with your laptop. Whatever helps you feel comfortable and happy at work. We want to help you grow in your career and set you up for success – while also recognising the importance of a healthy work/life balance.

That’s why we offer 25 days holiday rising by one day for each year here (for 5 years), a matched pension scheme, MOO’s share option scheme, and paid parental leave. We’ll offer you private healthcare, life insurance, a season ticket loan, and a cycle to work scheme. We also offer flexible work schedules with hybrid and remote working for certain roles as well as a Work From Anywhere program.

Diversity Statement
We are working hard to create a representative, inclusive and super-friendly team, because we know that different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds make for a better workplace. And that creates a better experience for our customers. MOO doesn’t discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected class

title: UX Writer
description:
About the job:

We are looking for a talented UX Writer to help us develop clear and compelling messaging across Judge.me's suite of products. You will be part of the product design team and work with product owners, designers, engineers, and management to create a seamless experience that our users love.

About the company:
• Judge.me is a global e-commerce app company. We're bootstrapped, profitable, and growing fast.
• Our flagship app, Judge.me Product Reviews, is ranked first in Shopify's app store, with over 10,000 five-star reviews
• We've grown rapidly since our founding purely by word of mouth. We've never invested in any paid marketing.
• Our team of more than 50 is international, diverse, and spread across London Uk (our headquarters); Saigon, Vietnam; Casablanca, Morocco; and Lima, Peru.
• We make a global impact, with over 180K shops actively using our software in more than 140 countries. We fulfill over 40 million orders every month and generate over 1 million verified... buyer reviews per month.

Requirements:
• Excellent writing skills. The ability to write clear, error-free, and engaging content that inspires users to take action.
• Attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring that all product copy is right for the context and consistent with our brand.
• A business mindset. The capacity to grasp the underlying business purpose of each product, and reflect that in writing.
• Passion for UX. Expertise in UX writing best practices, and a willingness to champion the user and educate other team members about UX and how to write more effectively.
• Initiative. The ability to work autonomously, anticipate and solve problems.
• A strong writing background. Versatility and the ability to adapt to write in different ways and different contexts. Do share your portfolio showcasing your best work, especially for content created for digital products.

The ideal candidate will have:
• Previous product writing experience.
• Knowledge of UI/UX design, usability, wireframing, and interfaces.
• Native English language skills and be well-versed in the differences between British and American English.
• Experience working in an interdisciplinary team, with other UX/UI designers, product owners, engineers, and marketers.
• Complementary skillsets, such as SEO knowledge, an understanding of behavioral psychology and decision-making, go-to-market understanding, data analysis skills, and some knowledge of statistics.
• Experience with e-commerce platforms like Shopify, WooCommerce, and BigCommerce, as well as in the review apps space.
• Familiarity with our tools: Asana, Figma, Google Analytics + Tag Manager + Data Studio, Metabase, Google suite, Hotjar.
• An investment mentality, and a desire to build for the long term.

Responsibilities:
• UX Writing: Own the UX writing vision, best practices, and execution at Judge.me.
• Write, edit and improve the content that makes our products and features easier to understand and use. This includes product flows, app interface content, product education materials, product names, terminology, marketing materials, and other content.
• Turn big ideas and complex processes into simple and engaging humanized language.
• Ensure our products convey the right tone across the entire user journey.
• Define and maintain writing guidelines, and work towards ensuring they are being followed effectively across different teams.
• Content design: Collaborate with team members to solve design challenges and create user-centric products and experiences.
• Contribute to overall product ideation and design based on feedback and requirements from users and other stakeholders.
• Work with the team in the design to flesh out and draft clear design specifications for developers to implement.
• Research and analytics: Validate your approach to content with data.
• Experiment with A/B or multi-variant testing and interpret data to understand how effectively your content performs.
• Keep up with current trends. Conduct market research and competitor analysis about how others are designing and pitching similar products.

Why it's awesome to work with us:
• We're a diverse, international, and close-knit team that is growing rapidly.
• We make products that our customers love.
• We champion an open culture of continuous improvement, where everyone is heard and criticism is always constructive.
• Our hours are flexible. There's no overtime and no dress code. You can wear whatever you want (but wear something, of course).
• We offer great development and learning opportunities.

Benefits:
• Optional Hybrid Remote/Office working, you spend 2 days per week in the office.
• Company laptop.
• Private health package with Vitality.
• Employee discount: instant vouchers, cashback, reloadable cards, and the SmartSpending app.
• Employee Wellbeing Centre: exercise videos, recipes & nutrition, financial guides, and tools, and mindfulness videos.
• 30 days leave including bank holidays; you accrue 2.5 annual leave days per month.
• Weekly team lunches out, on us.
• Quarterly team events.

How to apply:

We prefer candidates that send us a cover letter with some information about why they are interested in this position.

Further information:
• Salary range: £30-45k
• Office in London, UK
• Located in Old Street in the heart of Shoreditch, easily accessible, with excellent transport links.
• Our team: https://judge.me/team

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- A min 3 yrs solid UX/UI experience within an enterprise environment.

A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.

A deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.

Knowledge of Figma.

Willing to attend the Abingdon office once a month.

Responsibilities:

-
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.

Facilitate the client's/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.

Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.

Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.

Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate... your designs.

Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Technologies:

- CSS
- Figma
- HTML5
- Mobile
- Web
- UX UI Design

More: Can you create ground breaking UI? Ready to flex your professional and creative muscles? Want to be part of a world leading company safeguarding the planets most precious digital assets?

We are Preservica and we are changing the way organizations safeguard their digital information. Our SaaS Solutions are at the razor's edge of commercial software addressing the need for smart digital preservation technologies. As a world-leader in digital preservation, our award-winning software is used by leading businesses, archives, libraries, museums and government organizations across the globe.

About You

A dynamic and adaptable professional with extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions. You will have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You may already be a UX/UI Designer or have the credibility and capability to step up into the role. Either way we want to hear from you!

The Role

Working across a growing development team, you will be a key contributor to our new roadmap, building on from the existing UX framework for our PLG SaaS solutions. We use Figma as our main tool so you will need to be an advanced user. Preservica is growing at pace and this is a great opportunity to join a team which is being built from the ground up and to contribute to the new landscape of digital preservation.

Our offices are in Abingdon, UK but this role can equally be based remotely within the UK.

Responsibilities

Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.

Facilitate the client's/stakeholders product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.

Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces using Figma.

Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.

Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.

Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Skills And Qualifications

Three or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for B2B / B2C applications.

The ability to be dynamic and adaptable is paramount. This role requires design support to multiple engineering teams.

The successful candidate will be proficient in Figma and have a design portfolio to demonstrate their case studies.

Proficient understanding of web mark-up, including HTML5, CSS3 (comfortable with CSS animations and flexbox) is a plus.

Ability to work with clients/stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.

A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.

Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.

Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.

Good understanding of accessibility.

Excellent analytical and multitasking skills.

Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.

BSc degree in Computer Science, BA in Multimedia or equivalent experience.

What We Offer
As well as a competitive salary, performance bonus and benefits package, we also offer great prospects in a fast-growing market sector. We are committed to maintaining high standards and ensuring our people have the access to the best learning and development.

Location & Reporting
This role can either be based in Abingdon or remotely within the UK base. You may be required to travel to customers premises. Some International travel may also be required. Preservica is an equal opportunities employer. Sorry - we are not in a position to sponsor candidates who do not have the right to work in the UK

title: UX Designer
description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced UX designer to join the design team at our award-winning studio. This is an auspicious opportunity for the right candidate to champion the latest UX methodologies and best practices on a first-in-class AAA game IP.

The perfect candidate will have at least 2/3 years’ experience on a published game title in the role of UX Designer and be able to demonstrate excellent creative and technical skills. You will ensure that the user experience is both objectively efficient and subjectively pleasurable.

You will determine the end user experience for every single feature with the game designers, as well as create the best possible user flows with UI. You should expect plenty of design overlap, from signs, feedback and usability, to accessibility and onboarding. As such, we are searching for a candidate with strong game design knowledge, as well as strong visual design skills.
On this project you will be involved in the development of experiences for a... clearly defined, console-based target group. You will therefore be required to have strong knowledge of player motivations and requirements for console demographics and couch gameplay. It would therefore be beneficial if you are a keen gamer, the perfect candidate ideally a gamer on both console and PC, with knowledge of demographics and player requirements for these platforms

Requirements

On a day-to-day basis, you will be required to:
• Analyse the objective and subjective of game features.
• Interact, brainstorm, and collaborate with team members from different departments (design, programming, art etc.)
• Propose UX designs via a range of visual and written means, from paper sketches to wireframes.
• Produce proof of concept UX prototypes.
• Create user stories and user journeys.
• Write detailed reports communicating the results of your work.
• Liaise regularly with external stakeholders and partners to ensure that design needs and core product requirements are being met.
• Communicate with leads to plan development needs.
• Host and attend meetings for reviews, internal playtesting, and progress sharing.
• Work with research resources and stakeholders to plan and conduct user testing.
• Identify areas for workflow improvement and optimisation to improve productivity.
• You will strive to keep up to date with emerging UX design practices, methodologies, technology and tools.

Requirements
• Provable working experience in a UX design role in game development.
• A solid understanding of UX methodologies and the application of game design.
• Knowledge of the latest tools and technologies, as well as the capabilities of those tools (for example, Photoshop, After Effects, Figma, Sketch, Illustrator etc.)
• An aptitude for taking theory and concept to UX wireframes and ideally, UX prototypes.
• Strong visual communication and game design skills - for example typography, iconography, layout, colour theory, motion design, accessibility, signs & feedback.
• An ability to create and work with a variety of artistic styles.
• Designing experiences to a strict vision.
• Have excellent problem-solving skills and an aptitude for logical approaches and simple, intuitive end user experiences.
• An aptitude for designing experiences which meet objective and subjective end user requirements.
• A solid understanding of UX methodologies and how they apply to game design.
• A team player who is flexible and open to ideas and criticism from their colleagues in a respectable manner.

Desirable
• Planning and conducting user research and carrying out competitive analysis.
• Interpreting data and working with feedback.

Notes

Applications for this role must include a portfolio/showreel (or supply a link). Applications that do not supply a portfolio/showreel will not be considered.

Benefits
• Regular social events
• Cycle To Work Scheme
• Pension
• Fresh fruit and snacks
• A friendly, focused, ambitious and relaxed working environment
• Ongoing training and development, with career progression
• Discount card for all the shopping centre stores
• Great seafront location, a short walk from the rail station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops
• Group Private Medical Insurance provided by BUPA
• Group Life Insurance
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Private Dental Insurance
• Group Income Protection
• Company Pension Scheme
• Cycle To Work Scheme
• Eye-Care Vouchers

Perks
• Bring your doggo to work! We're a dog friendly studio, bring your pooch in to meet us.
• Bean to cup coffee machine in the studio.
• Fresh fruit and healthy snacks provided daily, breakfast and some not so healthy snacks.
• In-house clubs and socials. From board games, tennis, football to D&D nights, there are lots of opportunities to socialise.
• Regular Socials including Project Wrap Parties, team and studio events, Christmas and annual Summer parties and soem great charity fundraising events

title: UX Designer
description:
JOB TITLE:

Senior UX Designer

LOCATION:

Brighton, UK (with option to work remotely)
FUNCTION:
Design

REPORTS TO:

Game Director

CONTRACT:

Permanent What We Need You're a collaboratively minded designer eager to work with a global design team to pitch and develop game experiences.

Everything we build from a game design perspective you get your hands on; from systems to mechanics, from the HUD and menus to control schemes, from usability testing to player advocacy, you make sure that player experience is always front of your mind! We encourage you to share that passion with the Directors, Leads, and Implementers responsible for putting our game together.

We love games that play well and look great; our view is that well designed UI / UX positively contributes to a great overall game experience. We can't build phenomenal games without you!

What You Will Do Understand the needs of players and pair them with complex game mechanics to produce creative and effective UX... solutions

Understand what our players’ motivations, agency, and habits are. Make meaningful UX choices backed by research

Work closely we UI Team to ensure they style guide and user experience can come together in one cohesive vision

Communicate effectively and collaborate with a dedicated team of visual designers, UI/UX designers, and motion designers

Create interactive prototypes that demonstrate the design and reduce risk in the production phase of development

Collaborate with Leads and Directors to define the overall vision, design and interface of our next titles.

Build documentation to communicate the vision, including but not limited to research, persona designs, user journeys, wireframes, flow diagrams and prototypes

Create working prototypes that demonstrate the design and reduce risk in the production phase of development

Take an iterative approach to development by working closely with the rest of the development team to improve the end user’s understanding of how to interact with the UI and improve the overall user experience

Champion the design department’s UX related work, guiding future approaches to UXEnsure an overall high-quality level of UX design and User Experience Collaborate actively with teams across the globe

Who We Think Will Be A Great Fit

You are skilled in Adobe XD or other prototyping tools that help you produce strong prototypes

You take and iterative approach to development. Working closely with the development teams in the creation of intuitive UI systems

Comfortable working with using technical toolsets

You share our love for video games and good UX and UI approaches

Example of calm under pressure, team-oriented and the ability to accept critique from creative director as well as clients

You have a proven ability to digest complex and critical feedback and channel it into strong solutions

You’re self-motivated and motivate others

Humble s, not driven by personal egoYou have excellent communication skills - must be ready to work with teams across the globe

Good To Have

Experience with HTML, CSS, XML, XAML or similar

Experience with Unreal Engine and UMGBonus

WPF (windows presentation foundation) and XAML knowledge used in Noesis UI/UX pipeline

Who We Are Hangar 13 is an internal 2K development studio based in four locations:
Novato (California), Brighton (UK), and Brno & Prague (Czech Republic), working collaboratively as one team.

Each of our locations provides the opportunity to Bravely Create on big-budget, AAA console titles in a diverse and inclusive environment.

At Hangar 13, we want people driven by curiosity — Visionaries who aren’t afraid to explore new territory. Intrepid individuals who embrace the weird, the challenging, the unconventional.

We’re continuing to build a space that empowers you to take risks and redefine what’s possible,Where your inquisitive nature is nourished —A home for people who aren’t satisfied with what is, but who are obsessed by what could be.

So bring your talent,Your unique point-of-view, Your fearless tenacity,And together, we’ll Bravely Create Brighton Located just 45 minutes via train from London, Brighton is one of the UK’s most diverse and downright interesting cities. Sat right on the south coast of England, the city is home to a vibrant creative community and is known as an easy-going and tolerant place to live and work.

Brighton is home to Victorian piers and palaces, brightly coloured stucco homes and a 5-mile long shingle beach which becomes a post-work social hub during the summer months.

Onsite amenities inside our state-of-the-art Brighton studio include a fully equipped kitchen, games room, gym (with showers) and our very own bar. We’re a 30 second walk from Brighton station. Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com and accounts.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity any. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion,…

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job Description

Senior UX Designer

Entertainment Company (eCommerce)

Central London, London

£60,000 - £65,000

Are you a Senior UX Designer looking to continue your passion for solving complex design problems in a forward-thinking eCommerce environment?

We have a rare opportunity for a UX Designer or Senior UX Designer to join a global Product Design team, helping to define and redefine online customer booking experiences for a world-renowned entertainment company.

Collaborating with business, product, development and UI teams, the Senior UX Designer will identify new product opportunities and experiences that respond to rapidly evolving customer needs across both web and native mobile.

You will form part of a culture that fosters innovation and promotes teams to have an impact on an international scale, crafting new enterprise-scale products to reach users across EMEA.

This role will suit someone with a strong portfolio of B2C web and native mobile apps and experience driving... the UX vision for new products (from strategy to development and rollout).

In this role, the Senior UX Designer will:
• Collaborate with senior team members, UX, UI, product and development teams on complex B2C products.
• Identify new product opportunities, defining problems as well as goals from long-term vision and strategic business goals.
• Champion UX throughout the business, forging strong relationships with business and technical teams.
• Generate wireframes, storyboards, prototypes to exceptional standards.
• Map user flows and prototype interactions, overseeing the development process.
• Design products and features across the full online landscape.
• Lead on customer research in order to identify new innovation opportunities and test new concepts.
• Make informed decisions, working with analytics teams to analyse both qualitative and quantitative customer insights.
• Lead cross-functional design workshops as well as design sprints in order to generate new concepts or build early prototypes.
• Mentor teams of UX designers.

The ideal candidate will have:
• A portfolio that demonstrates B2C UX design experience on either complex eCommerce on enterprise-scale products.
• Driven the UX vision for new products from strategy to development and rollout.
• Cross-platform experience including web and native mobile.
• Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud as well as wireframing & design tools such as Sketch, Axure, Visio, Omnigraffle, InVision etc.
• Experience designing and conducting research.
• A customer-centric approach to design and an interest in design for digital platforms.
• An understanding of Agile and Waterfall.

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Do you want to create memorable digital experiences that transform businesses? We believe in teamwork, fun, complex projects, and simple solutions. How about you? We’re looking for a like-minded Senior UI Designer with the experience, passion and skills to help us rid the world of crappy design – one project at a time.

Would you like to...?

• Deliver design with brilliant creative ideas, exceptional design and craft skills and smart strategic thinking
• Be responsible for digital design concepts and visual design across digital projects and platforms
• Get involved in projects from start to finish – setting the direction, identifying and solving problems
• Work with clients, colleagues, and external parties to make sure that our ideas are crafted, implemented and delivered to the highest level
• Share your knowledge and thoughts on anything new and exciting, from art and music to technology and business with both colleagues and clients
• Attend and participate in design community... meetings
• Encourage, support and guide designers and junior designers

We would like you to be...

• An experienced professional with deep knowledge in typography, colour, layout, and imagery and know how to bring these elements together in a digital interface
• A strategic thinker who understands how digital interfaces work, bringing your designs to life across all platforms
• Fully aware of the design possibilities within web technologies, mobile platforms, and excited about new possibilities in emerging technologies
• A problem solver with ideas that challenge the ordinary, together with the drive – and the guts – to bring them to life
• Someone with a ‘here to help' attitude, who absolutely, fundamentally believes that we’re better together
• A master in the latest Adobe Creative Suite, Figma or Sketch.
• Fluent in English – other languages are a bonus!

Would you like to join...?

• A team working and evolving remotely in this current climate – we truly are in this together!
• Virtual cook-alongs, lunches, team activities, and craft sessions that bring us together
• An inspiring, social, collaborative, and playful work environment, with an open-minded and diverse culture
• Local inspiration sessions all year round
• Free health insurance and other benefits too
• Remote friendly. You must be willing to come into the London office for key events or when a team and client require it.

Deadline

We’re ready to wait for the perfect candidate.

Interested?

Hit the Apply button! But before you do here’s a few insights on our application process.

• We’d like a quick idea of who you are, and the work you’re proud of, so share your portfolio with us (if you have one) and your CV, LinkedIn profile or similar.
• Even if you use LinkedIn to apply with, you should add it to ‘Websites’ in your application for us to see it.
• No cover letter or lengthy essay is needed, we’ll get to know you through some questions in the application form.
• Please apply in English, as that is our main language in Designit.

Thanks! And if you’ve read all this way through, please include a spaceship emoji in your answers to let us know. We like you already

title: Senior Product UI / UX Designer
description:
Senior Product UI / UX Designer *Hybrid WFH* to £90k

Are you a creative and ambitious Product Designer with both UI and UX experience?

You could be progressing your career in a senior role at a highly successful FinTech whose award winning software enables customers to build high-performance web trading apps that deliver real-time information securely and reliably.

• You're collaborative and have experience of working with software / frontend developers

Salary & benefits:

As a Senior Product UI / UX Designer you will earn a competitive salary (to £90k) plus bonus and benefits including pension, healthcare, life assurance, dental insurance and more.

title: Senior UX Designer - Star Wars
description:
We are BossAlien, an award-winning developer of mobile games based in Brighton, UK and part of the NaturalMotion family of game studios. Our mission is to bring AAA console visuals and deep compelling game experiences to mobile platforms, and we’re fortunate to have been named one of the Best Places to Work in the UK games industry by gamesindustry.biz for five years running. We are very proud to be a winner alongside our industry colleagues and strive to constantly improve the working culture for our staff.

Hiring Update: The safety of our candidates and team members is our top priority. During the COVID-19 pandemic, our workforce transitioned to working from home, with all interviewing and onboarding being conducted virtually until further notice.

Job Purpose

This is an exciting opportunity to join our incredible and award–winning Star Wars: Hunters game team as an Senior UX Designer. We’re looking for someone that loves creating and crafting outstanding user interfaces in... addition to being passionate about understanding and empathizing with the players of our game and creating experiences that are not only alluring but also functional and appropriate to the spirit of the game. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a game that is based on the award–winning and rich Star Wars universe of characters and storylines.

You will lead all phases of the design process, including conceptual design/development, graphic and interface design, interaction models, prototypes, user/task flows, and art production.

You will work closely with the Star Wars: Hunters Franchise Stakeholders to establish and maintain the visual integrity, interaction methods, brand standards, and consistency for the game and collaborate with Product Management and Engineering to implement design.

Key Roles & Responsibilities
• Create high-fidelity mock-ups for pre-visualization during pre-production
• Design (and create) functional animation for user interactions
• Collaborate with the product and design teams to conceptualize, define, and develop features that yield extraordinary experiences for our players
• Synthesize the needs of players and all game departments to find solutions that work for all
• Be competent in creating user flows, interface wireframes, prototypes, and design documentation
• Set examples, guides, and standard methodologies in UI/UX for others in your game team
• Lead and participate in company-wide UI/UX community events, critiques, product reviews, and feature retrospectives
• Participate in critiques, product reviews, and retrospectives
• Collaborate with UI/UX staff from other game teams to share findings and develop standard methodologies across the organization

Desirable Experience & Skills
• A mastery in classic graphic design principles
• Visual design skills with regard to color theory, layout and typography
• A veteran in adapting and adhering to an established visual style and building upon it
• Can consistently produce high-quality visual assets for user interfaces
• An accomplished expert with UI layout & design tools (Photoshop, Figma, Sketch, or similar tools)
• Familiarity with collaborative virtual environments (Miro, FigJam)
• Ability to adapt and work in a fast-paced setting. Be able to rapidly develop new skills and behaviors in response to changing circumstances
• Ability to prioritize tasks, work efficiency, handle time effectively, and complete your work with minimal oversight
• Demonstrates proactive self-development and interest in leveling up personal, interpersonal, and craft skills
• Find opportunities to mentor, share your knowledge, insight, and experiences with others
• Able to present complex ideas to diverse audiences and articulate a convincing point of view
• Highly proficient written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing
• Ability to co-work and connect with multiple studio locations, teams, and partners
• Able to collaborate with proactive communication and a willingness to build consensus with potentially opposing perspectives
• Experienced expert in designing for games vs. task completion, specifically supporting fun and engagement
• Experienced with prototyping design software (Figma, Sketch, or similar tools) and the prototype development process
• Third-person combat gameplay & sandbox shooter game experience is not required but desirable
• Familiarity with the Unreal Engine is desirable

What we offer you:
• Competitive salary and discretionary annual bonus scheme
• Create next-gen games that will be played and loved by millions of players
• around the world
• Work in a family-oriented, collaborative team that invests in your development and growth on-the-job
• A diverse team of friendly, fun and supportive co-workers
• Flexible working hours & crunch-free working culture
• Communal music and laid-back atmosphere
• Summer/Christmas parties and Happy Hour in the studio each Friday
• 25 days holiday, plus Christmas shutdown
• Private medical care and healthcare cash plan
• Life insurance and critical illness insurance
• Cycle to work scheme
• 6 months fully paid maternity leave or 3 months fully paid paternity leave
• Annual season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme

We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse and talented workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome job-seekers, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds to join us!

We will consider all qualified job-seekers with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at accommodationRequest@zynga.com to request an accommodation associated with your application for an open position.

#LI-Hybrid

Zynga does not engage in financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process. We do not conduct job interviews over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp or others. We will never ask you for your personal or financial information over unofficial chat channels. Our in-house recruitment team only contacts individuals via official company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com or naturalmotion.com email domain).

If you believe you have been the victim of a scam, you may wish to contact the authorities. In the United States, you may file a complaint with the FBI. More information is available here: https://www.ic3.gov

They are about to go into their next phase of funding and growth, meaning you'll be joining at a quintessential time to make an impact and grow with the business.

Apply here or email me with your CV: romy.duggal @ amberresourcing.co.uk

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Omeda Studios are a remote-first game studio working on our first title Predecessor, a fast-paced third-person MOBA for PC and consoles, due for release in 2022. Join a rapidly growing game studio as we scale up to support and deliver content for a game designed to be played for years to come.

As a studio founded by the community, developing games that players will love is truly at the heart of what we do. At Omeda Studios, we believe that community feedback is integral to the development of games that players will not want to put down.

Having recently closed a $20m Series A funding round, we've populated the studio with an exciting mix of industry veterans and community talent and we want you to be a part of shaping and executing our vision and the challenges that await us.
In This Role You Will
• Take ownership and design, prototype, and implement core gameplay UI, HUD, and game menus that are attractive, intuitive, and ergonomic within a multiplatform universe
• Work closely with... Game Designers, Tech Artists, and Engineers to craft an experience that delivers on player aspirations and facilitates deep immersive gameplay
• Build a deep understanding of competitors in the market to inform designs that will meet player expectations and create a best-in-class experience
• Contribute, innovate, and develop original ideas on all aspects of the game
What We're Looking For
• An experienced UI Designer that worked on implementing UI widgets and features in Unreal or similar game engines
• Ability to give and receive constructive feedback when interacting with other team members, keeping the focus on making the best game possible
• Strong expertise in design fundamentals and UI/UX design trends
• Good knowledge of the pipeline for motion design, UI animation, and VFX
• A strong portfolio showcasing your design projects and UI samples
• Technical knowledge of UE4/5, UMG and Common UI is a plus
Nice to Have
• Experience designing UI for cross-platform is a plus (PC/Console)
• Interest and understanding of F2P/GaaS
• A passion for Games and MOBAs
Benefits
• Global, remote team
• 33 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays
• EMI Stock Options
• Healthcare
• More to come

title: UI/ UX Designer & Researcher ( German speaking)
description:
Salary 35,000 - 45,000 GBP per year

Requirements:

- 3+ years professional experience in the field of UX, usability & information architecture
-Experience with design and concept software tools (e.g. Sketch, Invision, Figma) to create user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes and customer journeys
-Ability to design and conduct user research like usability tests
-Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy
-Self-driven, organised and diligent personality
-Proficiency in German and English. Please note that we can only consider candidates that speak German on a native speaker level.

- - Ability to lead and ideate products from scratch and improve features for web and apps within a user-centered design process
- Create consistent user flows across all touchpoints, wireframes and UI designs to support agile development teams
- Conduct user research through interviews, field visits and usability studies
- Support the product team in strategic... product development decisions based on your user research
- Work in an agile environment with cross functional teams
- Ensure design consistency across all platforms (web & mobile apps)
- Regular UX analysis and improvements of our customer experience

-

More: Playbrush is the innovation leader in smart Oral Care in Europe and beyond.

Since 2015 we have been pioneering Smart Toothbrushes and Oral-Care-As-A-Service Subscriptions to revolutionize dental health for children, families and adults alike. Our interactive smart toothbrushes connect via Bluetooth to a smartphone or tablet. Children control mobile games with their toothbrush, and consequently get better at toothbrushing. Adults also interact and receive smart feedback via the toothbrush, so they can improve their brushing performance.

Playbrush is a startup that has received multiple millions of investment, won several awards and was recognised by the media globally. Only recently it has been acquired by the Swiss-Japanese consumer health champion Sunstar Global!

Now we are looking for an experienced and ambitious UI/UX Designer to own user research and UI/X design end-to-end for web and mobile apps to join our team in London.

Benefits

-Flexible working hours
-Variety of perks (e.g., bonuses, travel support, trainings, lunches and free books)
-The opportunity to become a part of one of the most exciting software startups in the consumer space (multiple award winner), which recently exited to a Global Consumer Health Champion
-Location for this position: London( we also offer help with relocation - VISA & relocations costs) or Vienna

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
UI/UX Designer

About Vicon

Vicon is the world leader in Motion Capture, developing high performance software and innovative hardware products for the entertainment, engineering and medical industries. Vicon systems are a crucial tool for measurement and 3D tracking for cutting-edge science including biomechanics, robotics and virtual or augmented reality. Vicon products have been used in many major feature films, video games and commercials. We have offices in Yarnton, Denver, Los Angeles and Auckland.

Vicon Motion Systems Ltd is a subsidiary company of Oxford Metrics Plc.

Job Description

We are looking for an excellent user interface designer to join our applications team in Oxford, England. We work on a wide variety of interesting, technical projects and strive to produce easy to use, high-quality, robust applications. We have an informal and friendly company culture and a healthy work/life balance.

You would typically be working in a team of developers and product managers... Candidates should have a portfolio demonstrating high quality designs tackling complex problems.

Examples of the types of work include:
• Collaborating with business and development stakeholders to produce designs.
• Designing application workflows and the user experience.
• Wireframing user interfaces.
• Communicating with the software development team throughout implementation.
• Presenting designs to stakeholders.
• Conducting usability testing.

Candidates must have substantial user interface design expertise and evidence of work on challenging projects. You should be able to provide a portfolio showcasing mobile and desktop work.

Experience in some of the following would also be advantageous:
• Qt, QML, JS
• Vector graphical asset creation
• Agile Development

Rewards:
• 25 days annual leave.
• Private medical.
• Life insurance.
• Contributory pension scheme (company contribution equal to 10% of salary).
• Bonus dependent on company performance

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You'll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren't always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

A proficient use of Figma

A background of digital product experience

A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: Senior UI/UX Designer - Frontend Developer
description:
Everyday we tackle new and exciting challenges to empower developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile, and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Couchbase delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments. The database market is one of the largest undisturbed markets for enterprise software. The main catalyst for this is the need for digital transformation. Join Couchbase to be a part of a greater change. Here you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most innovative, passionate and humble individuals in the database industry.

You are an UI/UX Designer/Engineer who crafts delightful web interfaces, designs, prototypes new and innovative experiences, and implements features while advocating for UX.

Here's a brief look at what success looks like in this role:

In three months, you’ll have collaborated with the team to deliver... a material contribution, contributed to code reviews and fed into technical discussion.

In six months, you’ll have earned the trust of the team and are actively collaborating on the design of new features.

In twelve months, you are regularly delivering tasks through the entire SDLC and have established a cadence of timely delivery without cutting corners

Responsibilities
• Design, develop, test and deploy software.
• Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
• Support the definition and progress of team goals.
• Have fun building great software.

In this role you can expect to
• Ship code regularly
• Be experimental
• Learn new skills and work with modern technologies
• Collaborate with a similarly forward-thinking group of frontend engineers on technical decisions
• Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.
• Maintain code quality with unit tests and support delivery of automated integration and E2E tests
• Work closely with UX designers, quality teams, product managers and systems engineers to build, iterate, and ship new features to enhance the user experience for our industry leading cloud solutions

Key Technologiies
• HTML
• JavaScript / TypeScript
• CSS
• UI frameworks (eg. Svelte, React, Angular, Tailwind)

#LI- AS2

Why Couchbase?

Couchbase is named one of DTBA’s top 100 companies that matter in data. At Couchbase, we believe data is at the heart of the enterprise. We empower developers and architects to build, deploy, and run their most mission-critical applications. Couchbase delivers end-to-end technical solutions for all our customers with high-performance, flexible and scalable modern databases that run across the data centers and any cloud. Many of the world’s largest enterprises rely on Couchbase to power the core applications their businesses depend on. See our recent awards to learn what makes Couchbase such a great company to work at.

We Offer

This year Couchbase was recognized as one of the UK's Best Places to Work . Couchbase offers a total rewards approach to benefits for the value you create here. Couchbase recognizes the need for financial wellbeing.
• Flexible time off
• Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage
• Paid parental leave
• Flexible Spending Account for the things you care about most
• An ergonomic and comfortable in-office setup, with food and supporting technology, or assist in the setup of an efficient home office environment.
• And much more!

Learn More About Couchbase

News and Press Releases

Investors

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Who we are:

For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.

Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.

We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to... collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.

We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

Your Role:

Global Relay's enterprise applications have a substantial footprint in the messaging & archiving space for compliance. This role provides an excellent opportunity to help solve challenging problems and create incredible experiences that significantly impact high-profile customers.

The UI Designer focuses on visually guiding the user through a product’s interface via interactive elements across multiple platforms (web, desktop and mobile). This will involve creating high-fidelity mock-ups, iconography, UI illustration and other graphic assets for a range of products and services. The UI Designer will be responsible for taking Global Relay's Design System to the next level by delivering pixel-perfect designs that bring clarity and unity to our visual language.

Working with other UI and UX Designers, Product Managers and Engineering teams in a highly customer-focused agile environment, you will be involved in the product development lifecycle from concept to delivery to help define our products' vision.

Your Job:
• Design and evolve the look and feel of Global Relay's visual language
• Follow a Human Centred Design approach and adhere to UX best practices
• Apply with conviction the best principles of layout composition, typography, visual hierarchy and motion design
• Deliver pixel-perfect graphic assets that are aesthetically vibrant
• Lead and create user interfaces that are sleek and easy to use
• Translate high-level requirements and interaction flows into intuitive and functional user interfaces
• Communicate your design ideas with conviction within the UX team and non-creative stakeholders
• Develop storyboards, wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes to communicate design ideas and solutions effectively
• Design and document new components and interaction patterns for Global Relay's Design System
• Ensure new components and designs meet WCAG and WAI-ARIA accessibility standards
• Adhere to existing patterns and apply consistency accordingly
• Identify opportunities for UI improvement or differentiation
• Facilitate workshops to get cross-team alignment on new standards
• Support engineers focused on building the design system
• Measure and monitor the performance of the components you work on
• Champion and establish a solid UI practice and be accountable for the UI output
• Work alongside engineering teams to test and iterate on the interface design
• Guide engineering teams through the build and QA process
• Collaborate closely with other UI and UX Designers to find practical solutions to challenging workflows
• Coach and support junior UI designers in the team

About You:

We’re looking for a UI designer with true artistic talent and a clean, strong visual aesthetic. Relevant training and work experience are important, but we’re really looking for your talent to shine through in the work you have done.
• 5+ years of experience doing visual/UI design for web, desktop and mobile applications
• Portfolio of relevant UI design work from shipped products/ apps/ services
• Bachelor's degree in a design-related discipline is preferable
• Solid understanding of user-centered design best practices
• Strong typographic and colour theory knowledge
• Ability to create icons, illustrations and other graphic assets for the web
• Ability to create and quickly iterate on high-fidelity mock-ups
• Ability to create high-fidelity prototypes to communicate motion and screen transition
• Ability to communicate UI ideas verbally and visually in an efficient and clear manner
• Ability to take ownership and solve problems creatively
• Experience working with and contributing to design systems and component libraries
• Knowledge of responsive design and mobile design guidelines
• Knowledge of accessibility best practices and approaches
• Knowledge of conventional design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch etc.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to multi-task and keep organized in a dynamic environment
• Motion design experience is an asset
• Experience in an enterprise business environment and Agile is definitely an asset

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are personalized to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com
