title: Junior UI/UX Designer
description:
My client is an innovative healthtech company, working with multiple healthcare providers worldwide. They are seeking a Digital UI/UX Designer (Junior) to join their rapidly growing team.

Located in Didcot, my client offers hybrid working, flexible working hours and a salary of up to £30,000, along with other benefits.

As a Junior UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for designing projects through the entire design cycle. You will design mobile apps and web portals, fulfilling a pivotal role and impacting future design and development of the product.

In this role, you will have a clear career progression path, as well as lots of training opportunities and autonomy. This is a great opportunity to work on products and technologies that make a real difference in people's lives!

As a Junior UI/UX Designer you will have experience with:
• Previous commercial experience (internship or a full-time)
• Prototyping and user research for digital products
• Industry tools (Adobe CC, Figma... or anything similar)
• Degree in Interactive Design or related field

Please note this is a full time position and all applicants are required to be located in the UK.

If you are looking for any other information, please contact Paula Kastrouni at IC Resources.

We have a number of other Frontend, Backend, and Fullstack positions across different industries and locations available too

title: UI / UX Designer - Virtual Reality
description:
UI / UX Designer - Virtual Reality

14022022VSNFI1

UI/UX Designer

I'm currently recruiting for a highly-innovative company based in the North East, who design best-in-class products within the Virtual Reality simulation space. They truly are at the forefront of their field, pushing the boundaries of what's possible when you combine Virtual Reality with Artificial Intelligence technologies.

After receiving significant investment in the least year, they are looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join their expanding team in the North East. Their office is based in Gateshead, but you will have the flexibility to work from home or the office as much as you like.

As a UI/UX Designer, you will ensure that all of their VR products are design-led and built with the optimum user experience in mind. You'll work closely with clients and team members to requirements, and will design and propose visual concepts to describe end-to-end product experiences. You will create personas, user... journeys and site maps, as well as creating wireframes, prototypes and user flows, working in an Agile environment.

You will really champion design best-practices and apply these to all of the work that the team do, and collaborate with teams of software developers, QA people, project managers and others as part of the project lifecycle.

This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join a company who are truly at the forefront of their field, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible within the VR world.

Please note that you will be required to submit a portfolio showcasing your UI/UX skills and demonstrating a high level of artistic creativity as part to be considered for this role.

Requirements:
• 3 years of design experience in simulation software, games industry or similar
• Knowledge of best practices in design and Agile processes
• Experience with VR and product visualisation including Axure, InVision, OmniGraffle, Visio, Sketch and the Adobe product suite
• Ability to collaborate and work well as part of a results-oriented, remote team.
• Be able to demonstrate initiative, determination, high quality output and excellent communication skills
• Must be based in North East England

Benefits:
• Salary of around £30-40,000 depending on experience (negotiable)
• Share options
• Investment in your personal and professional development
• Flexible working hours and hybrid working
• Super exciting work that makes a real difference to people's lives

Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Nigel Frank are the go-to recruiter for Data roles in the UK, offering more opportunities across the country than any other. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. To find out more and speak confidentially about your job search or hiring needs, please contact me directly at v.simpson@nigelfrank.com

England

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Title: UI/UX Designer

Location: Gateshead/Fully Remote

Salary: £45k-£55k

Our client is an VR simulation training business based in the North of England who is looking to hire an experienced UI/UX Designer to join their team to work on their data driven VR simulation products. As a UX/UI Designer, you will create bespoke VR experiences, and all of their work is delivered using Scrum/Agile methods. Your job will be to ensure products are design-led and built with the optimum user experience in mind.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Work with clients and team members to gather information about requirements
• Design and propose visual concepts to describe end-to-end product experiences
• Create personas, user journeys and site maps
• Create wireframes, prototypes, and user flows
• Adopt and champion design best practices and apply to all the work we do
• Attend Agile and other team meetings to collaborate as required
• Ensure that colleagues understand design practices and that best... practices are adopted
• Collaborate with teams of software developers, QA, project managers and others as part of the project life cycle
• Document and review work with colleagues

Skills and Experience:
• 3+ years design experience in simulation software, games industry or similar
• Knowledge of best practices in Design and Agile processes
• Experience with VR and product visualisation including Axure, In Vision, OmniGraffle,
• Visio, Sketch, and the Adobe product suite
• Ability to collaborate and work well as part of a results-oriented, remote team.
• Be able to demonstrate initiative, determination, high quality output and excellent

Benefits:
• Health – including flexible office hours, remote working and team building.
• Wealth – including share options and pension contributions.
• Growth – investment in and time for your personal and professional development including two quiet mornings per week (no communication unless you want it).
• Sustainability – this runs through all that we do from looking at sustainable ways of working and how we create and manage data, to the projects we work on.
• Flexibility – including working hours that suit you, if that also meets the needs of the team and remote/hybrid working.
• Awesome, memorable and challenging work that makes a difference to the lives of end users.
• Competitive salary depending on your experience.

If this role sounds like something you would be interested in simply click “Apply” and one of our consultants will be in touch to to get things rolling

title: Senior UI Design Lead
description:
Vacancy Details

We are seeking a talented Senior UI Designer with significant experience in delivering best-in-class UI work in customer facing Mobile App, Websites and CRM.

Sitting in the Customer brand team, but working closely with the Customer Product Owner and UX/ User Researcher, this role supports the Greggs Customer and Technology teams in delivering the best possible visual identity to an exciting suite of innovative, greenfield products that will ensure that both digital and physical in-store experiences work seamlessly for our customers and colleagues to deliver a great overall experience.

This is an incredibly exciting and unique opportunity here at Greggs to work as part of a brand new product led approach and help shape the future of our digital products. The mission-critical products you will be working on will help millions of customers to engage with Greggs in a fast, friendly and frictionless way every day You will play a key role in the development of our digital... brand across

all channels and formats.

We are looking for passionate product designer people that loves working as part of a collaborative team that is delivering real value to our customers to join us on our journey.

You will have a proactive, can-do attitude and enjoy contributing towards an adaptive, fun and creative environment. You will be capable of working cross functionally and facilitating and collaborating with multiple stakeholder groups.

You will be a lifelong learner and will enjoy joining us on a continuous journey of learning and improving as we strive to become a high-performing, self-organising product team, applying adaptive planning techniques to deliver innovative solutions to business problems.

You will care about delivering high-quality products that are closely aligned to the needs of our customers and our business.

You will be curious, inquisitive and will enjoy delighting our customers.

Location

This is a full-time, permanent role based at Greggs Innovate House, Newcastle upon Tyne.

Salary

Upto £50,000 depending on experience.

Work Pattern

Our working hours are usually Monday - Friday however we are open to discuss flexibility with regards to this working pattern with the successful candidate.

What you'll do
• As a part of our Customer Brand Team, you will help to shape and develop our brand identity across all digital channels, and champion the consistent application of our brand across the business
• Working with the brand, teams to turn brand identity, campaign assets and creative into content within our digital products.
• Work with the Customer Product Owner and UX/User researcher to iterate and expand on wireframes, user flows flows, low fidelity mock-ups, interactive prototypes and design specifications.
• Create hi-fidelity UI work for the development team to help deliver new feature enhancements.
• Develop ad-hoc visuals and content in relation to our digital products for internal and external use.
• Lead our User-Centred Design practices at Greggs and championing design thinking to help educate and communicate to the wider team as to why design is important.
• Collaborate with our content lead and wider brand team and support agencies to ensure that all work is aligned, delighting our customers and delivering to Greggs overall commercial objectives.

About you
• Proven experience of delivering best-in-class visual designs for mobile app, websites and CRM activity.
• Experience of working in a similar role within a consumer-facing digital product team, ideally within a major retailer or consumer facing FMCG business.
• Highly skilled in the use of Figma as well as various industry standard software tools, such as Adobe CC, InVision, Miro, Sketch etc.
• Experience in translating brand identity into a coherent design system.
• Highly commercially savvy, and able to turn concepts into engaging visual content.
• Comfortable working with a variety of agency partners and perspectives to arrive at the best solution for end-users.
• Has a detailed knowledge of User-Centred Design practices
• Has a portfolio demonstrating outstanding visual flair and design.
• Is adept at using qualitative and quantitative data and insight to inform design thinking.
• Has a solid understanding the last designs tools and online marketing practices.
• Leads with accessibility best practice in mind at all time.
• Has a keen eye for detail - you’re a bit of a pixel perfectionist.
• Has experience designing for desktop, tablet and mobile.
• Enjoys bringing the wider team along with them and has experience communicating design decisions to the wider team and stakeholders.
• Has experience working in an agile environment.
• Experience in front-end development using the latest technologies.

What we can offer

As well as working with a great team we have the following fantastic benefits to offer the right candidate;
• You will be invited to participate in our Management Bonus Scheme which is worth up to 12.5% of your salary, subject to the Company meeting certain performance criteria
• Your holiday entitlement starts at 25 days (pro-rated for part time), in addition to Bank Holidays, which increases with service up to a maximum of 31days after 25 years’ service (pro-rata for part time)
• After 6 months service you may be eligible for our profit share scheme
• You will automatically join our Greggs pension scheme which is a fantastic way to save for your retirement and allows you to benefit from employer contributions and tax advantages
• If you elect to join the Management Pension Scheme then you will receive free life assurance. This is a death in service benefit which provides a lump-sum payment equal to 4 times your annual salary
• Private Medical Insurance which is free to you and subsidised for your dependants
• Permanent Health Insurance which is a replacement income scheme should you be unable to work
• Our Greggs Employee Discount Scheme is very generous, offering you up to 50% off our food

About Greggs

Here at Greggs, we love what we do and we have fun! What makes Greggs so special is our culture – the way we are, the way we behave and the way we support each other.

We're hard-working, but above all else we're family; and it doesn't matter who you are, where you're from or what your favourite bake is, we’d love you to join us!

We want everyone to feel welcome at Greggs and our colleagues to be able to be themselves at work, whatever their background, preferences, or views.

We recognise the importance of having diverse teams and the positive impact this can have and we actively encourage applications from all backgrounds.

Next steps

If you don’t already have a profile on the Greggs Family site, set one up and you’ll be ready to apply for any roles that take your fancy. If you need help or have any questions, we are here for you

title: UX Designer
description:
Company Description

Newcastle based technology business NBS provides technical information, specification and BIM tools to the construction industry. Ranked 13 in the Best Places to Work in North East and Winners of the Best Office in 2018.

Job Description

The Software Development team at NBS are currently recruiting for a motivated and passionate UX Designer to help shape the future of user experience. At NBS, we are committed to offering distinctive, innovative specification and information solutions to construction industry professionals and we are proud to be leading the construction industry in its digital evolution. You will work as part of a UX team to deliver products and services to our customers around the world.

UX Design serves a vital role at NBS, from creating great user experiences for new features to the finish of every detail in our products. We are looking for passionate designers who think deeply about user needs, love to collaborate and can generate elegant... solutions to complex problems. If this sounds like something you’re interested in then this could be the role for you!

What will you be doing?

Contributing to the production of design flows, prototypes, sketches, and high-fidelity visuals for product enhancements

Collaborating closely with Software Development peers and Product Managers to ensure the implementation of a consistent, high-quality user experience across our product range

Soliciting feedback from your peers and continually iterating your design work

Qualifications

What you should have:

Industry experience in UX principles and methodologies

Motivation and passion for UX and digital design

Excellent written and verbal communication: for presenting your ideas and communicating every aspect of designs

Strong collaboration skills across multiple disciplines

Experience of industry software tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, InVision, Google Analytics, Sketch

Additional Information

You’ll enjoy a superb benefits package including 25 days holiday plus bank holidays. In addition you will receive a day’s holiday to use on your birthday, as well as a half day in December for you to do some Christmas shopping. We offer a competitive pension scheme, 2 days of paid leave so you can volunteer in the local community, eye care and child care vouchers. Above and beyond these benefits we also have an onsite gym, cycle to work scheme and have fresh fruit available daily! We have one of the best office coffee machines around, all drinks and fruit are complimentary

title: UX Designer
description: The CompanyThis exciting company focuses on blended learning through e-learning software and VR programmes by creating attractive alternatives such as replicating dangerous work environments in order to provide a safe environment to learn and develop high risk skills. This is an opportunity to jump straight in with the latest technologies and get involved with new design systems. Alongside a competitive salary there are many other benefits: Contributory pension scheme Flexible/ Hybrid working Continued professional development support Career path development with opportunities to develop skills in other areas within the company Tech Scheme financing Health Plan Perkbox membership with a wealth of benefits and rewards Cobalt membership rates for a wide range of regional hospitality venues Cycle to Work scheme Complementary branded clothing (optional workwear) Social and leisure events 25 days holiday plus bank holidays Free parking Complimentary food and beveragesJob... DescriptionReporting to the Head of UX your day to day will involve designing and creating user-friendly and impactful experiences across our SaaS and VR solutions, while being proactive to improve existing designs and experiences. You'll play a key part in maintaining, developing and evolving the design system to ensure best UX practices and consistency is met across our product portfolio.You will be working directly with front-end and back-end software developers and the business analyst team to understand the requirements of each task, taking care to understand the user stories presented and then designing solutions in an iterative continuous improvement-based workflow. Were looking for a highly motivated, driven individual with a commitment to getting things done. The client will be at the centre of everything you do, and you will contribute to the growth and success of our business through your skills and experience. You'll need to be an effective storyteller, who can communicate and collaborate with product owners, business analysts, stakeholders, and developers to give strong reasoning for design choices and to present, experiment and iterate multiple concepts with supporting evidence.Role/RequirementsResponsibilities Champion the user while defining UX opportunities and identifying use cases. Create interactive prototypes and carry out research for remote usability testing. Share and communicate designs with cross-functional teams for review and feedback. Collaborate with Business Analysts to turn high level product requirements into work-flows and interactive prototypes. Contribute to the Design System design system and apply best UX practices to patterns and component behaviours. Collaborate with UX researchers and apply feedback from user research into designs. Work with the Customer Experience team to understand customer challenges that can inform your decision making. Create, manage, and provide design assets to VR and platform teams.Skills and experience 4+ years experience in UX and UI design for software and business systems. Sound knowledge of best UX and accessibility practices. Proficiency with Adobe creative cloud; Adobe XD and Illustrator. Knowledge of working within design systems and creating shareable libraries. Experience of working on large software platforms and eco-systems. Familiarity with quantitative and qualitative research methods to identify challenges and evaluate concepts, including user metrics, usability testing and surveys. Ability to establish user testing strategies with clients to understand current usability and establish improvements and developments. Ability to multitask, prioritise work and cope with competing demands. Strong work ethic, analytical mindset and a positive attitude to dealing with people. Familiarity with common scheduling, task and issue tracking tools such as Jira. Knowledge of VR user interface design is highly desirable. Experience in data visualisation is a bonus

title: UX UI Designer
description:
We are looking for a talented UX UI Designer to join my client, a digital marketing and design agency based in Macclesfield, Cheshire East.

As part of the Web Design Team, you will be their go-to creative for new websites and existing projects.

You will work closely with your squad (Front-End Developers, Back-End Developers, Creative Strategists, Graphic Designers, Project Managers and more team members) to produce high-quality, engaging, modern websites.

Your role will be to deliver full design concepts and mockups whilst collaborating with developers to help quickly and effectively deliver your designs.

You will understand how their clients operate commercially and how our services can support them in meeting their business goals.

Your

Responsibilities

To take a design brief from clients, alongside a project manager, and propose a practical solution.
Understanding our client's brand so that it is reflected through all digital design collateral.
UI design with strong emphasis... on UX principles to ensure the solution provides a simple user experience that delivers commercial results.
Creating layered design concepts using Adobe XD that are in-line with the design brief
Creating innovative, accessible design concepts including animations and interactive elements
Designing and maintaining our website component library
Ensure every design produced delivers an effective experience across desktop, mobile and tablet.
Working with your squad to ensure the web project is delivered to the brief, on time and within budget.
Staying on-top of the latest design practices and industry trends

The

Requirements /Key Skills

Proficiency using the Adobe Creative Suite (XD, Illustrator and Photoshop)
Strong understanding of UX/UI Website Design;
Graphic design and web asset creation
Experience in UX design, Visual design, interface design, layouts, and graphics.
Strong hands-on experience creating website wireframes, and prototypes.
Proactively contribute to both plans and development of client sites.

Experience working alongside developers

Experience working with custom CMSs

Experience working in an Agency environment - Fast-paced
A design for development approach
Commercial - always looking to optimise value

In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job TitleSenior UX Designer Sage is using the power of data to make strategic strides in our cloud (or cloud-connected) accounting and HR products. As a Senior UX Designer, you'll be trusted as the subject-matter expert for making our new payroll product a success. Pair your desire to help people with your strong design skills to enable small-midsized businesses achieve what they're capable of. Key ResponsibilitiesPeople-first design:

People are at the heart of what we do. We're not just designing software, we're crafting products that save time, money and, occasionally, downright frustration. As a team lead, you'll set the standard for our people-first design mindset not being afraid to ask questions and move quickly to choose the best solution even when a lot of ideas are presented.

Meet the team:

The team works closely, taking responsibility for their load, to ensure seamless integrations. You'll join a team of 11 people; 8 UX designers and 3 researchers. When it comes to core... design they collaborate with content and solutions designers.

Skills you'll expand on:
• Solving complex UI design problems-making decisions, often with large amounts of conflicting information
• Collaborate with designers to learn new perspectives
• Expand on a firm understanding of digital platforms
• Find new ways for understanding the customer and product

Minimum qualifications:
• Portfolio (examples of design decisions, strategy alignment)
• Understanding of cloud-based products
• Experience in the use of design systems and frameworks
• Keen to work with UX researchers to inject user insights

Your benefits:
• Top 5% salaries of similar sizes companies (according to Comparably)
• Annual bonus (15-20% based on performance)
• 25 days paid time off (plus bank holidays), option to buy/sell
• 5 days paid yearly to volunteer through Sage Foundation
• 5 days to invest in learning and development
• Options to join Sage Share & Save scheme
• 35 hour workweek with flexible work options

Hear from our employees:

According to our employee feedback on Comparably, we scored a 4.8/5 rating on company culture and our employees gave our CEO a score of 90/100. We also won awards in 2021 for Best Company when it comes to diversity, compensation, women, work-life balance, leadership, and career growth, to name a few.

Dig deeper about who we are:

Who is Sage: https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/about-sage/

Life at Sage: https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/careers/

Our Values & Behaviors: https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=vt5JXf-Gwno&feature=youtu.be

How we make a difference: https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/sage-foundation/

Sage Business Cloud - SaaS for Every Business: https://www.sage.com/en-us/products/

#LI-WM2 FunctionProduct CountryUnited Kingdom Office LocationNewcastle;Manchester Work Place typeHybrid AdvertPeople make Sage great. From our colleagues delivering ground-breaking solutions to the customers who use them: people have helped us grow for more than forty years, and people are driving our future as a great SaaS company. We're writing our next chapter. Be part of it!

At Sage, we recognize that the world of work has rapidly shifted over the last few years, particularly how we work. That is why we have committed to working in a hybrid way going forward. Human connection is an essential ingredient of the 4 principles that make up our Flexible Human Work hybrid framework and we want to be transparent in what that looks like when you join our Sage family. On one hand, our offices will continue to play an important role in our future and serve as a place for spontaneous conversations, connection, collaboration as well as focused time. On the other hand, we have learned to reimagine where and when we work and to unlock that flexibility and innovation for our colleagues offering them the opportunity to work flex across their home, Sage offices or customer sites.

We invite you to join us and help us write our next chapter. Follow us on our social media sites to join in conversations about open positions and company news! #lifeatsage #sagecareers. If you would like support with your application (or require any adjustments) please contact us at careers@sage.com for assistance. All qualified applicants will be thoughtfully considered and never discriminated against based on their race, color, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You'll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren't always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

A proficient use of Figma

A background of digital product experience

A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you a passionate and outsanding creative UX/UI designer who wants to work at a dynamic creative digital agency, based on the outskirts of Newcastle City Centre? We are on the hunt for a talented and experienced UX/UI Designer to join our special team. The successful applicant will have a great eye for detail and a HUGE passion for design, working on medium to large-scale brochure and ecommerce websites, as well as bespoke software applications for our growing client portfolio. Excellent communication skills are required, with a confident outlook, ensuring you can see through projects from start to finish. If you have real creative flair and love coming up with eye catching designs that deliver the best in user experience, then please read on... Here's what we need from you:

Job Description

We are looking for a user-experience (UX) designer able to understand our business requirements and any technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user... research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes. The UX designer will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing.

Responsibilities
• Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
• Facilitate the client’s product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
• Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
• Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
• Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
• Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
• Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
• Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.
• {{Add other relevant responsibilities here}}

Requirements
• Three or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments.
• Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, UXPin, Adobe XD, Figma, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.
• Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
• Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
• A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
• Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
• Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
• A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
• Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
• Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
• Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
• Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
• Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies

title: Trainee UI/ UX Designer
description:
Junior Designer - Training to become a Fully Qualified UI/ UX Designer
Location:
UK based - Expected to travel to customer sites UK wide; working from client/office/home locations as appropriate. Flexible working arrangements will be available
Candidates must be eligible to obtain BPSS clearance.

Experis Consulting has an exciting and unique opportunity for Developer's who are looking to train and upskill to become UI/ UX Designers whilst working onsite for one of the leading Technology and Outsourcing clients within the IT industry. This is a great opportunity to join Experis' ever growing consulting division where you will be trained and developed whilst representing Experis on one of our key accounts.
We're looking for dynamic Developers who possess the desire to enhance their current skills and are looking to accelerate their career within UI/ UX Design. An interaction designer works out the best way to let users interact with services and products in terms of both overall flow... and at the level of individual design elements. You will be a part of a multiple disciplinary team ensuring the accelerated application development across our clients. You will demonstrate knowledge and experience of working with Agile/Scrum.

As a minimum, ideally, we require candidates to demonstrate the following experience and attributes:

Coding knowledge & experience of HTML/CSS
GDS experience
Any experience of UX, wireframing, visual design or an Agile environment is desirable.
Successful candidates will then undertake a UX/UI boot-camp aligned to the outputs of the attached role.Once training has been completed, your day-to-day responsibilities may include:

Create prototype, wireframes, mock-ups, workflows, user flows, site maps, and storyboards, interactive design, graphic design, information architecture.
Proficient with tools such as Sketch, Invision Studio, Balsamiq, Axure, and (url removed) Prototype Kit - Interpret evidence-based research, identify user issues/difficulties and important needs, engagement with websites, platforms, and services and incorporate into your work.
Understand the usability issues of a diverse population and develop ways of engaging those users.
Design a consistent user experience across mobile devices and desktop platforms.
Collaborate with user researchers and content designers to test, iterate, and launch products and services that satisfy stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with Product Owners and Stakeholders to clarify requirements.
Work with Business Analysts on refining and updating designs aligned with business requirements.
Liaise with development teams to clarify feasibility of a design and ensure the UX solution is accurately transitioned into development.Benefit

Competitive salary based on a 37.5 hour working week, with bonus opportunities
A sophisticated training programme comprised of online and in role training to develop skills in an area that is ever growing in demand
An opportunity to be part of the next generation of Digital experts
Work for an organisation at the leading edge of technologyOther benefits include

Contributory pension scheme

22 days holiday + bank holidays
Sick payFor further information please contact Conor Fox on (phone number removed

title: Product Designer (UI focus)
description:
Product Designer (UI focus) - SaleCycle

Full Time

Immediate start available post pre-employment checks

Hybrid working contract

Location:

Currently we are only accepting applications from individuals who are based in the North East, UK.

For this role, the successful candidate will be placed on a hybrid working contract

but will be required to work from our Gateshead office at least one day per week.

Introduction

​​SaleCycle is looking for an experienced Product Designer with an understanding of all aspects of product design from user journey mapping, creation of early ideas and wireframes to prototyping user interfaces whilst working with the product delivery teams from inception of a feature through to the release.

Working in the Product Team alongside our current Product Designer, you will be involved in all aspects of the product design process, with a particular focus on UI.

This is all with the aim of delivering something which is truly of value to our users.

What you... will do…
• Apply your professional design experience to our product led delivery teams
• Participate in user research to better understand user needs.
• Produce polished, high fidelity UI components and designs using Figma
• Drive innovative outcomes that bring clarity to complex problems in close communication with multi-disciplined product delivery teams
• Collaborate and communicate effectively to our users and to the wider business
• Be a voice for our users and best practice UI design within the product team and the product delivery teams
• Champion usability and accessibility improvements in our managed service tooling
• Share responsibility for the user experience and accessibility of our platform MySaleCycle

Requirements for the Role…
• At least 4 years experience in UI / Interaction design
• Strong working knowledge of Figma
• A strong background and understanding of product design disciplines across both UX and UI (discovery, wireframing, prototyping, user testing, accessibility, design system evolution), with a passion to focus on UI
• Experienced working closely with other designers, product managers, and software engineers, ideally in a multidisciplinary team environment
• Experienced working with various areas of a design system (e.g., pattern libraries, style guides, documentation, storybook component libraries, etc)
• A portfolio of existing work providing case studies that showcase your experience and your design approach
• Ability to demonstrate a commitment to continuous professional development, staying up to date with emerging technologies

It would be great if you have…
• Experience working within a distributed design and product team
• Experience bringing Figma prototypes to life with animated component variants and transitions
• A keen interest in the martech industry
• An interest in data visualisation and data delivery
• Knowledge of front-end development practices will prove to be an advantage when communicating with multidisciplinary teams
• We use Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence and JSM) as a way of managing and supporting the product delivery process
• Most of our product delivery teams work in an agile environment

Product Vision Statement

SaleCycle increases the likelihood of customer conversion for growing and established organisations by providing tools and insight that give them the edge.

We responsibly utilise data, enabling customers to get what they need.

What We Offer…

We value our employees here at SaleCycle, so in addition to salary (dependent on experience), we offer great benefits and incentives to our employees which include:
• Flexible hybrid working
• Generous annual leave
• Your birthday off
• Relaxed dress code
• Pension Scheme
• Bonus schemes for innovation, new business, and employee referrals

And more… to check out all of our benefits, please visit our careers page.

Interested? Apply now! We would love to hear from you!
• *We are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability status or age.**

As part of the recruitment process at SaleCycle, successful candidates are subject to a DBS check.

These checks are processed by the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and the cost is covered by SaleCycle.

Within this role there are Information Security requirements which the successful candidate is required to adhere to. Please check with the Hiring Manager for further information.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
• Additional leave
• Casual dress
• Cycle to work scheme
• Flexitime
• Referral programme
• Work from home

Schedule:
• Day shift
• Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Gateshead

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
UX/UI Designer - £45k + Benefits Package. Hybrid Working - Flexible - ideally onsite 1 day every 3/4 weeks. Cumbria. Permanent. T6/MN/18348.

Mackenzie Jones have partnered exclusively with a hugely popular brand located in Cumbria.

The UX/UI Designer will be a key member of the Digital Operations & Development Team, helping to shape the future of their digital business.

The UX/UI Designer will be responsible for developing the organisations Mobile App from the ground up - this will be a large-scale project, as well as ongoing development for the website and building prototypes etc.

Role:
• Champion, Lead & Support all UX/UI activities.
• UX/UI - Mobile App development.
• UX/UI design - drive optimisation for the User Experience.
• Undertake Digital UX design - supporting the day-to-day operational improvements & the Digital Development Roadmap.
• Optimisation of current User Experience & new UX development.
• Develop UX activities - improve the customer experience & drive the... commercial performance of the website.
• UI/UX development - drive B2C & multichannel performance.

Technical Skills / Experience:
• UX/UI development experience.
• UX/UI development on Transactional Mobile Apps or Websites.

• Photoshop, InDesign & Video Editing Apps.
• Wireframing - producing concept sketches & user flows.
• User Behaviour & principles of good User Centred Design.
• HTML, CSS, JS & other front-end technologies - hands on coding skills.
• 3rd Party Supplier management experience - partnering with external development teams.
• Windows & Mac environment experience.
• Microsoft Excel, Word & PowerPoint etc.
• High level of attention to detail.
• Analytical mind-set & an approach based on data & logic.
• Creative, whilst being logical & practical.
• Judge which creative decisions - are likely to add value & boost Customer Engagement & Commercial response.
• Project Management skills - ability to coordinate multiple resources & projects/packages of work.
• Stakeholder Management/Engagement - build & nurture positive relationships.
• Ability to influence - disrupting to deliver a step change in performance.
• Ability to positively challenge & welcome feedback to drive self-improvement.
• Team Player - Collaborate & positive approach to teamwork.
• Self-starter - solution oriented & can-do attitude.
• Excellent communicator - verbal & written English.

Desirable:
• Digital Analytics Tools i.e., Google Analytics 360, Adobe Analytics & Session Recording software.

Benefits Package: Discretionary bonus scheme / group personal pension plan / 29 days' paid holiday (including bank holidays) / discounts on products / Training.

Keywords: UX/UI, UX/UI Design, UX/UI Development, Website Development, Mobile App Development, Wireframing, HTML, CSS, JS, Photoshop, InDesign, Video Editing, Google Analytics 360, Adobe Analytics, Session Recording, Windows, Mac, User Behaviour, User Centred Design, Customer Journey, UX/UI, UX/UI Design, UX/UI Development. Hybrid Working. Cumbria, Permanent, T6/MN/18348

title: UX/UI Designer (mid & senior)
description:
Responsibilities

Design is at the core of our business and as a part of our growing Design team, you will be working with a wide range of diverse clients, projects and product types. Ranging from exciting start-ups through to well known Blue chip enterprise organisations.

From design sprints to full Project delivery, our designers play a crucial role in the success of our clients, and their users products. Be part of a web established passionate and knowledgeable design team, that continues to grow and learn together.
must have requirements

You:
• Have a strong passion and talent for all things digital, and you are able to inspire your teammates with a fresh perspective.
• Are on top of contemporary practices and techniques, eager to try new things out and share with your peers and wider colleagues.
• Are self motivated and driven to keep the momentum and pace up on multiple project works.
• Understand the value of feedback / testing, have good interpersonal skills, and are a good... listener and observer of situations.
• Love design!

You can:
• Meet client and user requirements as well as validating (or disproving) client assumptions.
• Analyse research and feedback to gain user insight – and incorporate this feedback into your design direction.
• Create user-flows, wireframes, Hi-Lo fidelity prototypes, concept sketches, interaction designs using tools such as Sketch, Invision, Marvel, Principle.
• Iterate on your ideas and designs based on user input, iterative research and feedback from the wider team.
• Work well with other designers, developers and product managers to build successful digital products for a wide range of clients.

You have:
• Experience of working in sprints (agile) and can plan your design work accordingly
• An understanding of web and native technologies and the differences between them.
• Reasoned and analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.
• Strong collaboration and communication skills and the ability to voice your opinion for a given design decision.
• A continued passion and willingness to continue learning about design as a discipline.

You Must:
• Have a minimum of 3 years commercial experience
• Have strong reference-able experience in native app design​
• Be able to example and explain your contribution to projects you showcase when interviewed
• Be adaptable and a strong generalist, the role will be demanding and so are our clients.
• Be prepared to be a recognised, vocal team player and fit into our diverse culture and company.
• Be ready for a challenge. We offer

What We Offer

Unlimited holidays. While we count paid leave, it's not metered.
• Flexible working environment (flexi-time, hybrid working environment)
• An enhanced maternity policy.
• A transparent and open company culture where politics is shunned and everyone works as a team.
• Annual Learning & Development budget inclusive of 4 L&D days.
• Annual personal Wellbeing budget inclusive of 2 wellbeing days.
• Access to free therapy sessions and financial wellbeing services.
• Monthly payday socials and annual Summer and Christmas parties.

Diversity & Inclusion Statement

At hedgehog lab, our team is our greatest asset.

We believe that having diversity within our team is integral to doing our best work and

creating the most innovative products for our customers. We will continue to foster an inclusive culture at the lab where everyone can be their authentic selves and thrive.

We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply to our roles and we

don’t discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual

orientation, nationality, genetics, disability or age.

If you require any adjustments to submit an application for a vacancy, or if you require any reasonable adjustment should you be invited to interview then please contact Holly Orange, Talent Acquisition Advisor, at holly.orange@hedgehoglab.com

We are a family friendly employer with a culture based on trust, autonomy and flexibility.

We are always learning and our policies and processes are ever evolving to make sure

that they’re in line with this statement.

REQUIREDLANGUAGES

To be considered for this position it is crucial that you have knowledge of the following languages
• Read C2 Proficiency Write C2 Proficiency Speak C2 Proficiency minimum required Education Bachelor

title: UI Designer (UK)
description:
We see ourselves as a new civilisation of people emerging to make the world of gaming better. We’re a different breed of games company - we do things our own way in our own style, not necessarily following what’s been done before.

Our people are at the heart of our evolution and we nurture them to be their best. Without them our vision would fail.

We strive to avoid crunch, overtime is optional and always paid, and we offer flexible working hours to allow you to enjoy a normal family life whilst making great games.

We’ve helped millions to fight their way through fearsome mobs in Minecraft Dungeons, battle each other and the environment in Rust: Console Edition and most recently worked with Bethesda Game Studios to craft new adventures for Vault Dwellers around the world in Fallout 76.

We’re growing rapidly and as a result we’re looking for a UI Designer to join our studio in Middlesbrough (UK), home to the beautiful North Yorkshire coastline and countryside. As a UI Designer at... Double Eleven, you’ll demonstrate a player-focused approach to building game interfaces that are functional, intuitive and fun to use, from full menu systems to feedback HUDs. With the support of a Lead Designer, your role will include producing flows, annotated wireframes/mockups, and visual designs, which under your guidance are then developed into final quality UIs by our artists, for console and/or PC.

In this role you will set up camp at our HQ in Middlesbrough. We are continuing to assess the covid-19 situation, and our studio is set-up with the necessary covid-19 support measures to keep our teams safe. The wellbeing of our teams is at the heart of everything we do, and we are keen that all our teams feel safe and reassured.

Strictly no agencies (sorry guys!) and we’re unable to sponsor a visa for this role.

We can support UK relocation and have a dedicated People team on standby to assist you and your family with every step to us.

We kindly ask all applicants to submit a portfolio to support their application. We’re afraid applications without an accompanying portfolio will not be considered.

WOULD YOU ENJOY
• Helping to create beautiful games
• Being part of an amazing team working on multiple AAA titles
• Being trusted to work independently and proactively to the highest standards
• Working with experienced teams in the industry

What You’ll Be Doing
• Work with Design to conceptualise and produce creative and effective UI solutions that are intuitive, user-friendly and define the game experience.
• Produce high quality, considered and annotated UI designs, flows and/or interactive prototypes to showcase your work to the project’s creative leads.
• Collaborate with other departments to guide the path of your UI Designs through their development and implementation.
• Ensure and maintain consistent UI systems, controls and language across the game.
• Review and evaluate your work to ensure that the UI is integrated correctly.
• Ensure that our UI designs appeal to a broad audience, across various platforms, with a focus on accessibility.
• Understand the requirements and creative vision of the product, receive feedback and make adjustments when required.
• Evaluate the findings and feedback from QA, playtesters, and our gamers, to refine the UI to make a great user experience.
• Become the ‘go-to' person for UI designs across the game, championing a high level of quality and player experience throughout.
• Take a proactive approach to foresee problems and provide solutions that are mindful of a project’s scope and timescales.

What We’re Looking For
• Proven experience in developing front-facing user-interfaces for games on console and/or PC.
• A solid understanding of human-centred design practice and demonstration of the design thinking process in your work.
• An excellent working knowledge of Adobe products including Photoshop, Illustrator and XD and/or Figma or Sketch.
• Experience working with and creating interactive UI mockups, in Adobe XD or similar packages, to clearly articulate the vision of your UIs.
• An ability to solve UX problems through UI, from controls and player messaging, to localization and UIs geared towards PC and Console.
• An ability to create exceptional wireframes that demonstrate a strong understanding of player interaction, messaging, controls and attention to detail.
• An ability to annotate and explain your designs clearly and confidently to other disciplines and stakeholders.
• An ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
• Experience in user-testing, player analysis and iteration.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• A portfolio showcasing a variety of design work in different styles.
• A strong passion for games on all platforms and an excellent understanding of what makes them work.

Skills Considered a Bonus
• An ability to multitask and understand priorities whilst working under limited supervision.
• Experience in prototyping / rapid concept iteration.
• An ability to work with coders to suggest and develop in house UI tools to aid with the implementation or iteration of UIs
• Knowledge and experience of game engines (Unity/Unreal), scripting (Java/Lua)
• All other relevant qualifications considered.

Qualifications
• All qualifications considered

WORKING AT DOUBLE ELEVEN:

We’re pretty sure we’re the best place to work, period.

Some of our benefits include:
• Competitive salary which is regularly benchmarked against the market as well as an annual pay review as part of an appraisal
• Flexible start time (start anytime between 8:00am and 10:00am)
• Flexible lunch hours
• 29 days of annual leave (20 days annual leave + 8 bank holidays + your birthday)
• A minimum of 8 days discretionary annual leave during the December holiday break (this is dependant on where the Christmas and New Year day fall each year)
• 1 day off if your moving house
• 4 additional days annual leave for 5 years service and a further 4 days annual leave added for your epic 10 years service milestone
• Personal development plan designed in conjunction with you, your manager and our Training & Development Manager. Plus clear progression framework
• Vitality Private Healthcare for you and your family (upon the successful completion of a probationary period)
• Potential for annual performance bonuses and end of year bonuses
• Constantly improving tools and workflow so you can focus on creativity
• Fast decision-making to allow you thrive
• State of the art office facilities i.e. VR setup, games room, book library, high spec kitchen area and more
• Free juice, hot drinks, fruit and monthly free team lunches
• Cycle scheme
• Employee referral bonus (up to £2000!)
• UK relocation package which includes financial compensation and one to one support finding accommodation / schools etc
• Opportunity to attend and speak at global events as a Double Eleven Ambassador
• Many free parties celebrating game launches, winter break and summer
• In-studio wellbeing programmes and support
• Opportunity to contribute to our internal Employee Diversity and Equality Network
• Free game codes, game swag and merchandise
• Free on site parking
• Team charity events
• Sponsored studio activities such as Football, Game Jams and any new suggestions are always considered
• Activities and events organised throughout the year based on employee choices.
• Maternity, paternity, shared parental, adoption and dependent leave available
• Christmas Saving Scheme Rewards and discounts available from Vitality health scheme
• Pension match contribution
• Excellent employee rating on Glassdoor

What We Believe

We believe that diverse developers make better games.

We believe that we're stronger as a team, and encourage an inclusive, secure and collaborative workforce.

We believe that levelling the playing field creates a safe, accessible and open environment for a wide range of people from a wide range of backgrounds.

We believe that education and communication are the foundation of creating this environment.

We encourage and welcome applications from all walks of life and our studios are fully accessible.

Through integrity, ambition and humanity, we are able to use that experience to create and bring to market great games that people love.

WHAT WE DO:

Since we first opened our doors over 12 years ago, we’ve grown to over 300 people across 2 studios in the UK and Malaysia, continuing to put our people first as we move forward into a range of original and established IP. We’re lucky enough to work with some of the best developers and publishers in the world and we’re proud to be embarking on this journey with a diverse group of people, working on projects we enjoy but that also challenge us and push us out of our comfort zones to better ourselves.

We value our people and we value their time, striving for a work-life balance and offering a whole host of benefits to those who work for us. Our learning journey is never over, we invest in our people and offer regular training and development on both a company and individual level.

WAYS TO REACH US

If you have a general query or if you need support with your application and/or an alternative way to apply, please do not hesitate to contact our Recruitment team at [email protected]

WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT TEESSIDE?

We’re lucky that this area boasts great quality of life and cost of living. https://www.numbeo.com/cost-of-living/compare_cities.jsp?country1=United+Kingdom&country2=United+Kingdom&city1=Middlesbrough&city2=London

We have both coast and country on our doorstep: https://www.enjoyteesvalley.com

title: UI & UX Designer - Virtual Reality Company
description:
UI & UX Designer - Virtual Reality Company

06042022VSNFI4_1649232734

UI/UX Designer

I'm currently recruiting for a highly-innovative company based in the North East, who design best-in-class products within the Virtual Reality simulation space. They truly are at the forefront of their field, pushing the boundaries of what's possible when you combine Virtual Reality with Artificial Intelligence technologies.

After receiving significant investment in the least year, they are looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join their expanding team in the North East. Their office is based in Gateshead, but you will have the flexibility to work from home or the office as much as you like.

As a UI/UX Designer, you will ensure that all of their VR products are design-led and built with the optimum user experience in mind. You'll work closely with clients and team members to requirements, and will design and propose visual concepts to describe end-to-end product experiences. You will... create personas, user journeys and site maps, as well as creating wireframes, prototypes and user flows, working in an Agile environment.

You will really champion design best-practices and apply these to all of the work that the team do, and collaborate with teams of software developers, QA people, project managers and others as part of the project lifecycle.

This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join a company who are truly at the forefront of their field, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible within the VR world.

Please note that you will be required to submit a portfolio showcasing your UI/UX skills and demonstrating a high level of artistic creativity as part to be considered for this role.

Requirements:
• 3+ years of design experience in simulation software, games industry or similar
• Knowledge of best practices in design and Agile processes
• Experience with VR and product visualisation including Axure, InVision, OmniGraffle, Visio, Sketch and the Adobe product suite

title: UX Designer - GDS Experience - Public Sector
description:
Job Description

At Difrent, we have an ambitious growth plan that will see us delivering cutting edge digital services to our Healthcare, Government and Corporate clients.

Our culture is founded on passion, creativity and straight talking. As a business we are fun, charity focused and out there, want people to be who they really are and want people who want to be part of that. The two owners have huge amounts of drive, ambition and have created an awesome brand.

We're now looking for a proactive and talented UX Designer to join us on a contract basis, to work on an exciting digital transformation project.

This is a great chance to work on a high profile digital service that really matters; with people who value design and help you to create work you're proud to talk about.

You'll be working in a multidisciplinary agile team to deliver a world-class, user-centred service in a truly collaborative environment.

Candidates who have previous experience of working to Government Digital... Services guidelines (GDS) will have a distinct advantage.

UX Designer - Responsibilities
• Understand user needs
• Create and rapidly iterate service prototypes
• Arrange these separate interactions into rational user journeys within that service
• Understand the existing supporting system of a service and design targeted improvements
• Identify opportunities for cost reduction and improvement within the proposed service

UX Designer - Skills and experience
• Know how to interpret user research
• Be able to work in an Agile environment
• Engage the whole multidisciplinary team with the design process
• Lead a workshop
• Exposure with Heroku (Desirable)
• Be able to sketch and prototype on paper and in HTML
• Be able to explain ideas in a way that other people understand
• Welcome the constructive criticism of their work and be able to constructively review the work of others
• Understand how form and function work together
• Know how to remove complexity from services
• Collaborate on designs with a developer
• Work at pace
• Experience of the public sector (nice to have)
• Having knowledge of GDS guidelines will be an advantage (nice to have)

This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person to get involved with a leading digital agency with a large number of projects going on at any one time.

Please note that candidates will need to apply for a DBS/criminal record check.

Location: Newcastle upon Tyne

Duration: 6 months (outside IR35)

Rate: £450 per day

title: UI Designer - AAA Games - Hybrid, Middlesbrough, UK
description:
Project: Console and PC Games

OPMs client is looking for a talented UI Designer to join their rapidly growing team working on AAA Console and PC Games.

The successful candidate will be heavily involved and demonstrate a player-focused approach to building game interfaces that are functional, intuitive and fun to use, from full menu systems to feedback HUDs.

REQUIREMENTS:
• Proven experience in developing front-facing user-interfaces for games on console and/or PC.
• A solid understanding of human-centred design practice and demonstration of the design thinking process in your work.
• An excellent working knowledge of Adobe products including Photoshop, Illustrator and XD and/or Figma or Sketch.
• Experience working with and creating interactive UI mock-ups, in Adobe XD or similar packages, to clearly articulate the vision of your UIs.
• An ability to solve UX problems through UI, from controls and player messaging, to localization and UIs geared towards PC and Console.
• An ability... to create exceptional wireframes that demonstrate a strong understanding of player interaction, messaging, controls and attention to detail.
• An ability to annotate and explain your designs clearly and confidently to other disciplines and stakeholders.
• An ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
• Experience in user-testing, player analysis and iteration.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• A portfolio showcasing a variety of design work in different styles.
• A strong passion for games on all platforms and an excellent understanding of what makes them work.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Work with Design to conceptualise and produce creative and effective UI solutions that are intuitive, user-friendly and define the game experience.
• Produce high quality, considered and annotated UI designs, flows and/or interactive prototypes to showcase your work to the project’s creative leads.
• Collaborate with other departments to guide the path of your UI Designs through their development and implementation.
• Ensure and maintain consistent UI systems, controls and language across the game.
• Review and evaluate your work to ensure that the UI is integrated correctly.
• Ensure that our UI designs appeal to a broad audience, across various platforms, with a focus on accessibility.
• Understand the requirements and creative vision of the product, receive feedback and make adjustments when required.
• Evaluate the findings and feedback from QA, play testers, and our gamers, to refine the UI to make a great user experience.
• Become the ‘go-to’ person for UI designs across the game, championing a high level of quality and player experience throughout.
• Take a proactive approach to foresee problems and provide solutions that are mindful of a project’s scope and timescales.

Interested in finding out more about the studio and project? Apply now or call directly today on +44 (0) 1206 214413!

Experience working alongside developers

A design for development approach

title: Director of UI/UX
description:
At PMG, we exist to inspire all people to feel that anything is possible personally and professionally. It's what powers us to deliver value, innovation, results, and Digital Made for Humans™ for the world's most ambitious brands by bringing a more human-centric approach to digital.

As UI/UX Director, you will lead and guide a growing user experience team, which designs and defines the optimal information architecture, flow, taxonomy, navigation, and style of our marketing intelligence platform, Alli. Your leadership will build a top-quality user experience team by defining the design vision, standards, guidelines, best practices, and improvements around how the user experience team interacts with other groups. Your creative thought leadership will drive visual design by combining industry best practices with your expertise and insights about human behavior.

We're innovating fast and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant ways. You will be part of a... team that is leading innovation by combining technology, industry expertise, and entrepreneurial experience to massively disrupt the digital marketing space for our clients.

On our design team, we appreciate designers who think deeply, speak clearly, and work collaboratively. If you are interested in a career where your hard work is always noticed and appreciated among a team of true professionals, then this is the place for you.

General Description:
• Recruits, mentors, and develops strong design and research teams
• Leads design team in near and long-term planning of projects, ideation, selection of tools, design process, and concept explorations
• Empowers designers to learn and creates an environment that facilitates shared learnings
• Gives feedback to designers at various project stages (concepts, development of systems and elements, execution of screens, creation of animations and iconography, etc) in design reviews, team critiques, and 1:1s to improve the output, efficiency, and quality of their UI/UX execution and deliverables
• Partners with Product and Engineering Leadership on UI/UX roadmap. Collaborates to define the strategy and experience of consumer-facing products
• Communicates and presents ideas, designs, and solutions to senior management, cross-functional teams, and collaborates with stakeholders to advocate for "what's best for the end-users"
• Fosters strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively advocate for design strategy, product vision, and goals

Skills & Experience:
• 10+ years related work experience
• Bachelor's Degree in Design, Information Architecture, HCI, or related field / equivalent work experience
• Experienced in managing and developing a UI/UX Design team
• Experienced in working with user researchers, UX designers, copywriters, engineers, and product managers to drive strategy, vision, and execution
• Experience working in a fast-paced, highly cross-functional organization
• Experience in usability, focus & A/B testing
• Passion for understanding audiences and their behavior
• A portfolio of work demonstrating design abilities
• Strong analytical and technical skills
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously of varying size and scope
• Self-motivated, interest in new tools and technology
• Strong knowledge of typography and graphic design fundamentals a plus
• Working knowledge of HTML and CSS preferred
• Great team chemistry and fosters a fun collaborative work environment
• A passion / interest in digital advertising

About PMG:

PMG is a global independent digital company that seeks to inspire people and brands that anything is possible. Driven by shared success, PMG uses strategy, creative, media, and insights, as well as its proprietary marketing intelligence platform Alli, to deliver Digital Made for Humans™. Our team is made up of over 500 employees globally, and our work for brands like Apple, Athleta, Best Western Hotels & Resorts, Kohler, McDonald's, Nike, Old Navy, Sephora and Shake Shack runs across 85+ countries and has received top industry recognition from Cannes Lions to Adweek Media Plan of the Year.

Ranked by Deloitte, Inc., Entrepreneur, and Adweek as one of the fastest-growing companies in the nation, PMG has grown because of its commitment to continuous improvement, business integrity, cultivating dynamic relationships, and putting people first. The company has been named Adweek's Breakthrough Media Agency of the Year, MediaPost's Independent Agency of the Year, 7X Ad Age Best Places to Work, 3X Best Places for Working Parents, and one of Fast Company's Best Workplaces for Innovators.

Being part of PMG means being part of a company culture that's unmatched in digital. We're willing to work hard to serve our clients and deliver value, results, and innovation -- which often requires true grit and remaining agile. We believe in taking care of ourselves and each other so that we continuously improve in every way.

We'd love to get to know you and share more about why we love PMG and the work we do.

Join us in making digital more human → Apply Now

In alignment with our core values to be inclusive and always change for the better, PMG is committed to creating a more diverse and inclusive culture, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe we only change for the better by bringing different people to our company. PMG recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Learn more about our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion and our action plan for change here

CAMP Systems is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry. CAMP is the pre-eminent brand in its industry and is the exclusive recommended service provider for nearly all business aircraft manufacturers in the world. Our services are delivered through a SaaS plus model and we support over 20,000 aircraft on our maintenance tracking platform and over 31,000 engines on our engine health monitoring platform. Additionally, CAMP provides shop floor management ERP systems to over 1,300 aircraft maintenance facilities and parts suppliers around the world. CAMP has grown from a single location company in 2001, to over 1,000 employees in 13 locations around the world.

CAMP's relationships with business aircraft manufacturers, aircraft maintenance facilities, and parts suppliers place it in a unique position to understand how current offline information flows in the business aviation industry to introduce friction to the global market for business aviation parts and services. CAMP is building a digital business that will streamline the exchange of parts and services and create substantial value for both CAMP and the aviation industry at large.

CAMP is an exciting company to work for, not only because of its future growth prospects, but also because of its culture. Smart, motivated people, who want to take initiative, are given the opportunity and freedom to make things happen. CAMP is part of the Hearst Business Media portfolio. We are located in Merrimack, NH - an hour from Boston, and a half hour from the Massachusetts tech corridor

title: User Experience and User Interface (UX/UI) Design
description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’sPrivacy Noticeand Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description...

At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments, we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide.

Join Takeda as a User Experience and User Interface (UX/UI) Design where you will support the user-centered design of medical devices and combination products. You will also harness user needs, product requirements, and usability evaluation as inputs into the design and development of the product user interface, such as hardware, software, and instructional materials to support the safe and effective use of the product for the intended use by the intended users in the anticipated use environment. You will manage UX Research planning and execution, UX/UI design conceptualization, prototyping, testing, and evaluation. As part of the UI/UX, you will report to Associate Director, User Experience and User Interface (UI/UX) Design Lead.

How you will contribute:
• Design User Interfaces for print and digital platforms.
• Develop research strategy.
• Conduct user experience research.
• Visualize data from research.
• Mapping user experience.
• Translating user needs into user experience and interface requirements.
• Visualize design ideas through sketches and digital renderings.
• Evaluate user interface concepts iteratively.
• Build low and high-fidelity wireframes and prototypes.
• Create medical illustrations and animations.
• Contribute to a design system and guidelines.
• Provide empirical UX design insights for product development.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, packaging, labeling, quality, clinical & medical affairs, regulatory affairs, commercial, legal, and purchasing.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
• B.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 4 years of UX/UI Design experience or
• M.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 2 years of UX/UI Design experience.
• A UX/UI Design portfolio is required.
• Experience working on MS Windows with Adobe CC Suite is required.
• Experience working with Figma and Axure is preferred.
• Experience working in safety-regulated environments such as Healthcare technology is preferred.
• This position may require up to 15% yearly travel, including domestic and international.

What Takeda can offer you:
• Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
• Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
• Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
• Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
• Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions
• Family Planning Support
• Flexible Work Paths
• Tuition reimbursement

More about us:

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

Base Salary Range: $79,800 to $114,000, based on candidate professional experience level. Employees may also be eligible for Short Term and Long-Term Incentive benefits as well. Employees are eligible to participate in Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Tuition Reimbursement Program and Paid Volunteer Time Off.

In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Description

A multinational client is looking for a UI/UX Designer to conceive, plan, manage, design, and develop its digital products, and to craft and deliver unique digital experiences for its users and customers...

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Study design briefs and conceptualize visuals based on identified requirements.
