title: Ux designer
description:
Job Description

Summary Tripsdesign&ux Tripsrides...

In the Rides group, we craft the ground transportation experience for Booking.com. This design role in the Rides Booking experience will focus on helping our customers get around during their trip.

Helping them find and book transport options that best fit their needs.

We collaborate closely with our colleagues across the Trips & Accommodation Business Unit to ensure our customers receive a joined up experience no matter what Booking.com product they book.

We’re looking for an experienced designer who has :

Great eye for detail and applying this to their designs and prototypes
• Whilst we need someone autonomous, we also need a strong communicator who has great collaboration skills with other designers and disciplines
• Confident with running design research and presenting this back to a variety of stakeholders
• Experience in the use of Design Systems
• Experience with responsive web design
• Experience with App design is a bonus but not necessary
• Strong stakeholder management in and outside of your immediate teams

Responsible for understanding the needs and constraints of the user, the business, and the technical implementation, and applying their craft to create the most practical solutions to achieve the teams and businesses goals.

Work directly in a team within their subject area to define and execute the design details and make our products and services useful, usable, and desirable through holistic, transparent, and accessible means.

Produce innovative and comprehensively-detailed designs in order to drive the execution while ensuring their ideas are clearly understood by others through collaboration, testing and documentation.

They ensure that design guidelines and best practices are applied. Works with product and engineering to ensure content is accurately portrayed.

Responsibility :
• Effectively utilises a variety of research and data to better understand and design for user needs and to inform design decisions, validate hypotheses and document insights.
• Seeks out timely feedback and critique as fuel to improve design solutions and strategy; proactively seeks out collaboration and co-design opportunities in order to provide well-rounded user experiences and shows willingness to iterate to define and refine solutions.
• Creates high-quality design assets and solutions for their team and track to improve the overarching user experience, usability and accessibility of the product(s).
• Acts consistently as an advocate for end user needs and perspectives in product area discussions, reviews, and critiques.
• Demonstrates applied understanding of Booking's brand standards and design systems, principles and guidelines and applies them in their work.
• Has knowledge of prototyping tools or prototyping environments and web coding languages such as HTML, CSS, etc where relevant to implement their solutions within the scope of their team.
• Communicates effectively, candidly, collaboratively and constructively so that team objectives are met and rapport and trust are established.

Knowledge and Skills
• 3 - 5 years of relevant experience designing for digital products / native mobile apps
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Basic knowledge about CSS / HTML
• Solution oriented and result driven
• Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team
• Good communication and analytical skills
• Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude
• A portfolio which demonstrates previous design experience, breadth and depth of design skills, a case study or two which illustrate challenges, methods, roles, and outcomes.
• Bachelor’s degree a plus.
• Language : English

title: Senior CX/UI/UX Designer, Digital Solutions
description:
Werfen

Werfen, founded in 1966, is a worldwide developer, manufacturer and distributor of specialized diagnostic instruments, related reagents, automation workcells, and data management solutions for use primarily in hospitals and independent clinical laboratories. The Company’s business lines include Hemostasis, Acute Care, and Autoimmunity diagnostics, as well as Original Equipment... Manufacturing. Our success comes from a specific focus in these rapidly evolving diagnostic areas, our commitment to customers, and our dedication to innovation and quality. We’re passionate about providing healthcare professionals the most valuable and complete solutions to improve hospital efficiency and enhance patient care.

Our North American Commercial Operations, as well as our Headquarters and Technology Center for Hemostasis and Acute Care Diagnostics, are based in Bedford, MA. Our Headquarters and Technology Center for Autoimmunity Diagnostics is based in San Diego, CA. Additionally, our Technology Center for Hemostasis and Blood Gas Reagents is in Orangeburg, NY, and our Technology Center for Whole Blood Hemostasis is in San Diego, CA.

Job Summary

A Senior CX/UI/UX Designer (hereafter called “Designer”) drives user experience design from end-to-end, including ideation, concept development, detailed design, prototypes, and user testing. The Senior Designer works together with Solution Leaders and developers to create great customer journeys that deliver business impact. Key activities include conducting initial user research, driving a solution vision based on business and user insights, designing desirable and intuitive multi-channel experiences, developing wireframes and visual designs, and iteratively validating solutions with users.

Responsibilities

Key Accountabilities:
• Advocates for user-centered design solutions
• Conducts user and ethnographic research to discover insights, define user personas, and map user journeys
• Creates distinctive, branded digital experiences that are desirable and consistent across multiple platforms, devices and channels
• Develops new product concepts, storyboards, detailed interaction designs, screen flows, and prototypes to clearly articulate solutions
• Creates compelling visual designs that align to company and product brand standards
• Conducts concept and usability testing to iteratively validate and improve design solutions
• Actively collaborates as part of an agile team to ensure designs are feasible and implemented accurately
• Tracks user experience metrics and reports on the success of UX improvements, including analytics

Networking/Key Relationships

Will interface on a regular basis with groups across the organization as needed (within the Digital Solutions Team, Global Communications, R&D, Clinical Software, and others).

Qualifications

Minimum Knowledge & Experience Required for the Position:
• Bachelor’s degree or a minimum of 5-7 years of work experience, or an Associate’s Degree with a minimum of 8 years of work experience  
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in Customer Experience / User Experience Design 
• Minimum of 5 years of experience developing digital products
• Strong functional visual design capabilities, specifically for digital. Experience using Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, Axure RP, Framer, UXPin, Marvel or similar tools. Experience working with component-based and template-based design systems is considered a plus

Skills & Capabilities

Domain Expertise
• Able to plan, conduct, and synthesize user research and usability testing, prepares research questions and runs customer interviews/testing and proposes solutions
• Skilled at creating interaction design solutions, such as desktop, web and mobile applications
• Strong visual design skills, able to create compelling, branded, high-fidelity product screens
• Working knowledge of visual asset creation and prototyping tools
• Can develop independently: Personas, User Journey, Benchmarking, UX Map Architecture, User Flows
• Healthcare knowledge and enthusiasm is a plus

Agile/Digital Experience
• Hands-on experience designing customer-facing solutions
• Proven experience working in design teams in an Agile product development setting
• Experience in planning and running design-led workshops such as Ideation, Wireframing, Blueprinting or Rapid Prototyping
• Experience in helping facilitate collaboration-based agile ceremonies, such as workshops or Retros, e.g., together with Scrum Master, preferred

Individual Skills
• Influences and guides team members in setting goals and provides feedback
• Creates innovative solutions that generate significant value for customers
• Collaborates with other designers to problem solve design challenges and maintain a level of design consistency and coherence across products
• Experience in planning and conducting user research at various stages of the design process
• Strong communication skills with ability to articulate the value of a design choice to users and non-designer stakeholders
• Creative problem-solving and analytical thinking
• Able to produce high quality creative solutions in a fast-paced environment
• Combined skills in at least 2 out of the following: User Research, Interaction Design, Visual Design

Mindset And Behaviors
• Synthesizes abstract ideas into tangible solutions for design
• Is passionate about problem-solving through design, acting as an ambassador
• Sees value in taking an iterative design approach
• Has a strong sense of ownership and proactively advocates for the end user
• Open to taking on new challenges and learning new skills
• Collaborative, curious, empathetic, open-minded, innovative

Travel Requirements

None.

If you are interested in constantly learning and being challenged on a daily basis, we encourage you to submit your resume or CV.

Werfen appreciates and values diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V.

We operate directly in over 30 countries, and in more than 100 territories through distributors. Annual revenue is approximately $2 billion and more than 5,000 employees around the world comprise our Werfen team.

www.werfen.com

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
User Interfaces play a critical role in SVH Software products by allowing users to intuitively monitor, maintain, and visualize the operation and impact of our solutions. We are seeking a UI Designer to help us develop and maintain a cohesive and visually pleasing experience for users across all of our user interfaces and target personals. The candidate will work closely with users, engineers and... product managers to develop an understanding of our systems and user needs. The candidate will be a foundational member of our graphic design team, so excellent collaboration and communication skills will be necessary.

Duties and Responsibilities
• Synthesize requirements from existing functionality, customer input, brainstormed ideas, and direction from senior management
• Develop user flows, wireframes, specifications/documentation, and prototypes
• Conduct user testing and accessibility testing
• Work closely with our engineering team through implementation, testing, documentation, and release
• Help promote best practices in design, usability, and accessibility within the design and engineering teams and across the company
• Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive
• Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment
• Actively engage with internal stakeholders to build consensus on system behaviors.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s Degree in Fine Art Design or related discipline
• 3+ years experience creating UI/UX designs in a professional setting
• Portfolio containing examples of past UI projects
• Proficient in Adobe CC Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)
• Strong understanding of HTML, CSS and Vector Graphics
• Experience with design collaboration tools, such as Invision
• Experience working autonomously to develop UX specifications and style guides
• Strong portfolio and live examples of past UI projects
• Introductory knowledge of React and SASS (Syntactically Awesome Stylesheets)
• 2D/3D drawing by hand or computer and have ability to visualize concepts
• Demonstrated ability to work with minimal day to day technical direction.
• Operate effectively in a multi-disciplinary, team-oriented culture.
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.
• Experience working on cross-functional teams and collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders
• A dedicated and enthusiastic approach to solving problems
• Passionate about what you do and care deeply about the things you build

Apply by sending your resume along with cover letter to jobs@svhsoftware.com

title: Senior User Interface Engineer - Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
**R0028713**
• *Senior User Interface Engineer - UI/UX Designer**
• *Remote - U.S...

The **Senior User Interface Engineer - UI/UX Designer** is responsible for architecting, in close working relationships with product management, technology, and clinical teams, a phenomenal user experience while delivering features to meet market needs. This role will act as both designer and product owner for our Simplifi+ portfolio, creating solution designs and writing user stories for agile development teams to bring those designs to fruition.

This role will add and iterate on features for end users as well as build internal tooling to help implementation and support teams scale with expanding sales. The Simplifi+ solutions are workflow driven products that requires a designer able to dive into product technical details, user journey mapping and flow diagrams to inform product features that can help hospital teams save patients' lives.
• *ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

• Build in-depth knowledge of the Simplifi+ product suite, users, and use cases; understand full user experience to inform design decisions.

• Collaborate with Product Manager to design product functionality to meet roadmap goals.

• Create user-friendly designs that emphasize translating user processes into straightforward user interfaces and navigation flows.

• Collect user feedback on features and functionality, and work with Product Manager to incorporate feedback into roadmap.

• Create mockups and flow diagrams to effectively communicate design and feature ideas.

• Consider existing insights, technical constraints, business needs, and specific platform demands to produce data-informed solutions.

• Collaborate with technology and clinical informatics teams to break designs and features into epic and story-level approaches.

• Collaborate with product, technology, client services and clinical resources to build in-depth technical understanding of the product, to inform feature design and story writing.

• Write user stories; work with scrum master to maintain iterations for agile development team.

• Conduct in-depth data and technical analysis to inform feature development.

• Plan, organize, and conduct user research. Present results of research to project teams and management with findings and recommendations.

• Be autonomous. Make decisions, back them up, get them built.
• *JOB QUALIFICATIONS**
• *Education:** A Bachelor of Science (BS) or Bachelor of Arts degree (BA) or equivalent is desired.
• *Required Experience:**

• 5+ years of design experience.

• Knowledge of agile software development process and experience with requirements management and complex projects.

• Experience writing detailed functional specifications.
• *Preferred Experience:**

• Background and/or education in the healthcare industry with specific knowledge of hospital information technology preferred.

• Experienced with methods of UX and design related processes.
• *Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:**

• Comfortable working on a existing and new products in a fluid environment.

• Comfortable working independently and making decisions.

• Comfortable both with user interface design, and diving into technical and data details to inform features.

• Demonstrated ability to communicate the rationale and thought process behind ideas and solutions and collaborate with people from different disciplines with different needs.

• Demonstrated capability for solving problems and generating ideas around sophisticated interactions.

• Desire to work collaboratively as part of a high performing team with aggressive goals.

• Ability to be flexible and adjust quickly to changes in priority or customer needs.
• *Travel:** 5%

title: Senior ui ux designer
description:
Description

At Humana's Experience Center (XC), we are explorers, listeners, creators, and thinkers working together to influence the ways that people care for themselves and one another...

We are seeking individuals who are passionate about solving big problems in healthcare for seniors, with experience in understanding consumers' underlying needs and how to go about addressing them.

Above all else, we are human-centered, kind and respectful, and always looking to understand and support our members. Come help us redefine the future of healthcare.

Responsibilities

An XC Product Designer is...

Human-centered - They put people at the center of everything they do, always seeking to deeply understand and empathize with them in the entire context of their lives.

The designer advocates for the user's needs with peers, facilitates user research on a regular basis, and continuously delivers based on evidence-backed insights in order to ensure products and services fit the user need.

Strategic - They strive for experiences that are desirable for members, viable for the business, and operationally and technically feasible.

They look to best practices and methods in order to uncover real member needs and to synthesize insights from research and data.

They understand and practice the design processes across the product lifecycle. Additionally, the designer develops a full-stack skillset, ensuring that the visual interaction design complements the user research findings.

Collaborative - They are a humble and generous contributor to a cross-functional team. They recognize and respect the deep expertise of others, helping the team move forward.

The designer participates in the team's rituals, facilitates user research activities, and serves as part of a design pair.

They are a fast learner and are willing to adapt to the product design needs and processes.

A Storyteller - They are a communicator and presents research to colleagues and stakeholders. They are able to thoughtfully discuss and justify design decisions, give honest effective feedback to others, and leverage their communication techniques.

Key Responsibilities

The Senior Product Designer is an individual contributor, who works within a cross-functional team to create and drive the delivery of both virtual and in-person experiences that are impactful for our members and measurable for the business.

Facilitate the design process over the course of a product lifecycle, working effectively as part of a design pair and advocating for the user's perspective.

Within a design pair, develop the assets necessary for product success, which include, but are not limited to, the following : research discussion guides, screeners, research insights, remote tests, and the resulting research reports.

Develop the design assets that include, but are not limited to, the following : customer journeys, user flows, sitemaps, research plans, paper prototypes, sketches, wireframes, visual designs, clickthrough prototypes

Advocate for the user based on user research insights, product ambition, value proposition, and technical feasibility.

Uncover user needs in order to craft how users will interact with our products / services.

Co-create with both XC team members and our internal stakeholders to understand user and business needs, identify design opportunities, and create meaningful experiences.

Be a great storyteller by preparing product demos and engaging stakeholders with design decisions.

Contribute to the continuous development of the design discipline.

Working together, we will :

Have specific opportunities to make healthcare better for our members, transform the future of care today, while working to build and deliver technology.

Engage in ongoing activities that enable us to learn, practice, and evolve design to integrate it into a more agile and efficient process.

Collaborate on products and services that change the way our members enroll, seek, and establish care.

willingness to broaden own skillset into adjacent specializations while refining mastery of primary skillset.

Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

title: Ui ux designer
description:
Ballotpedia is seeking a full-time, 100% remote user interface / user experience designer and analyst to join our growing team.

This is an ideal opportunity for a highly curious and experienced professional and problem solver who is passionate about utilizing technology, design and automation to help Ballotpedia fulfill its civic mission of informing voters, and expand its election coverage to... cover every contested election in America, especially at the local level.

Taking direction from the Vice President of Election Product and Technology Strategy, you will report to our Director of Technology and be part of the Ballotpedia Tech team.

You will create product functional requirements and specifications, create wireframes and mockups, and design user interfaces.

You will also build mockups and prototypes for user feedback and testing to validate designs if necessary. The ideal candidate will help us create the best user experience possible for our readers and audiences on our website and mobile applications and across our entire suite of election information products and services.

Ballotpedia’s Election Product and Tech teams support the rest of the staff in making high-quality political data and unbiased encyclopedic content available to the American public by improving many aspects of Ballotpedia’s web presence and the behind-the-scenes tools used by staff.

Responsibilities

As a UI / UX Analyst Designer, you will :
• Analyze business goals, product goals and operational areas and processes to identify problems, issues, and improvement opportunities that can be solved with automation and system capabilities.
• Perform the necessary research and analysis to support change recommendations.
• Document system requirements through functional specifications and user stories.
• Create requirements and specifications for product and systems development producing designs using process and data flow diagrams, flowcharts, and other documentation as needed.
• Define user responsibilities, roles, and duties in context of system capabilities and system interactions using use cases and other forms of documentation.
• Create wireframes and build prototypes to communicate system capabilities to and for both users and developers.
• Confirm and refine development designs and specifications through user discussions and user / usability testing.
• Following best practices and industry standards, design User Interfaces for web based applications (desktop, tablet and mobile views) to support product and user needs
• Produce detailed system specifications using CSS and low and high-fidelity mockups
• Design system outputs (reports, databases, exports, and API endpoints)

Qualifications And Characteristics

A UI / UX Analyst Designer must :
• Have at least three years of career experience in user interface and user experience, analysis, design, and information architecture (IA).
• Be able to evaluate business goals and user needs, and translate them into product, operational and system requirements and specifications.
• Be able to communicate requirements through creation of written specifications, use cases, data / process diagrams, mockups, wireframes, and other forms of documentation.
• Be able to interact with users of all types, as well as developers both independently, as a leader or participant, and / or as part of a team effort always in a positive and constructive manner.
• Be humble, seeking to improve the work of the rest of the staff, and approaching projects as a team member.
• Be dedicated and willing to work hard to support the mission of Ballotpedia
• Have an unending appetite for learning and mastering new technology
• Experience with the following is required :
• Adept proficiency with popular UI / UX visual design platforms including but not limited to (you will be able to use your platform of choice) :
• Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, Marvel, Adobe XD, Proto.io, Craft, Axure, etc

Environment

The UI / UX Analyst Designer will work remotely from their home location. All Ballotpedia staff work remotely. To join Ballotpedia, you must have a computer with Internet access.

Ballotpedia has a flexible work environment, BP Flex, in which every employee enjoys unlimited vacation and flexibility in scheduling.

Each employee will be oriented to the principles of Ballotpedia’s flexible environment during new employee training.

Compensation

The starting pay range for the UI / UX Analyst Designer is $75,000-$90,000 / year commensurate with experience.

In addition to salary, Ballotpedia offers an annual benefits stipend equivalent to $8,000 that is paid out in equal increments in each paycheck once an employee becomes benefits eligible.

The stipend may be used to pay for a full benefits package, including health, vision, and dental insurance; retirement accounts;

and more. If benefits are not elected, the stipend is taxed as regular income and added to salary.

To Apply

To apply, visit the Ballotpedia job opportunities page and fill out the form.

Please attach the following in PDF format :
• résumé
• cover letter detailing your interest in Ballotpedia’s mission, this position and your salary expectations

Please ensure that either your résumé or your cover letter include your current address.

About Ballotpedia

Ballotpedia is a collaborative team of fast learners and creative problem solvers who are eager to work hard to make the world a better place.

federal, state, and local offices.

We work diligently to present the available information about elections, candidates, judges, ballot measures, policies, and more in a way that enables our readers to vote with confidence and to act as engaged citizens outside of the polling booth.

Ballotpedia readers, like Ballotpedia staff, are special people.

When we launched in 2007, we did not go out of our way to seek new readers. Starting with our small team of visionary idealists, nerds, and aspiring political journalists, we just wrote the best unbiased online articles we could, especially about ballot measures.

Readers found those articles in droves. It turns out there was an unclaimed audience out there people who wanted straightforward facts about political issues, and were willing to read at length instead of just scanning the headlines.

If you build it, they will come : '' our readers came to our neutral oasis in growing numbers; we’ve had many millions of lifetime pageviews, we reached nearly half of all voters in 2020, and, in the month surrounding the November 2020 election, we were the 77th most-visited website in the U.S.

We’ve come to realize that we need to meet our readers where they are. In doing so, over the past five years, we’ve grown our email newsletter program from infancy to include more than 1,000,000 opt-in subscribers with more than a dozen newsletters to choose from.

We are working in numerous ways to help put our neutral information in front of people at the times when they most need it, including on mobile phones while you’re standing in the voting booth.

We firmly believe that our readers, and the mindset we help them cultivate, are essential to the preservation of our great civilization in a world where too many others are fighting to get us all addicted to sensational posts and the irrational decisions they foster.

title: User Experience and User Interface (UX/UI) Design
description:

Job Description...

At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments, we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide.

Join Takeda as a User Experience and User Interface (UX/UI) Design where you will support the user-centered design of medical devices and combination products. You will also harness user needs, product requirements, and usability evaluation as inputs into the design and development of the product user interface, such as hardware, software, and instructional materials to support the safe and effective use of the product for the intended use by the intended users in the anticipated use environment. You will manage UX Research planning and execution, UX/UI design conceptualization, prototyping, testing, and evaluation. As part of the UI/UX, you will report to Associate Director, User Experience and User Interface (UI/UX) Design Lead.

How you will contribute:
• Design User Interfaces for print and digital platforms.
• Develop research strategy.
• Conduct user experience research.
• Visualize data from research.
• Mapping user experience.
• Translating user needs into user experience and interface requirements.
• Visualize design ideas through sketches and digital renderings.
• Evaluate user interface concepts iteratively.
• Build low and high-fidelity wireframes and prototypes.
• Create medical illustrations and animations.
• Contribute to a design system and guidelines.
• Provide empirical UX design insights for product development.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, packaging, labeling, quality, clinical & medical affairs, regulatory affairs, commercial, legal, and purchasing.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
• B.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 4 years of UX/UI Design experience or
• M.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 2 years of UX/UI Design experience.
• A UX/UI Design portfolio is required.
• Experience working on MS Windows with Adobe CC Suite is required.
• Experience working with Figma and Axure is preferred.
• Experience working in safety-regulated environments such as Healthcare technology is preferred.
• This position may require up to 15% yearly travel, including domestic and international.

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

title: Staff CX/UI/UX Designer, Digital Solutions
description:
Overview

Werfen...

Werfen, founded in 1966, is a worldwide developer, manufacturer and distributor of specialized diagnostic instruments, related reagents, automation workcells, and data management solutions for use primarily in hospitals and independent clinical laboratories. The Company’s business lines include Hemostasis, Acute Care, and Autoimmunity diagnostics, as well as Original Equipment Manufacturing. Our success comes from a specific focus in these rapidly evolving diagnostic areas, our commitment to customers, and our dedication to innovation and quality. We’re passionate about providing healthcare professionals the most valuable and complete solutions to improve hospital efficiency and enhance patient care.

Our North American Commercial Operations, as well as our Headquarters and Technology Center for Hemostasis and Acute Care Diagnostics, are based in Bedford, MA. Our Headquarters and Technology Center for Autoimmunity Diagnostics is based in San Diego, CA. Additionally, our Technology Center for Hemostasis and Blood Gas Reagents is in Orangeburg, NY, and our Technology Center for Whole Blood Hemostasis is in San Diego, CA.

Job Summary

A Staff CX/UI/UX Designer (hereafter called “Designer”) drives user experience design from end to end, including ideation, user research, concept development, detailed design, prototypes, and user testing. The Staff Designer works with Solution Leaders and developers to create great customer journeys that deliver measurable business value. A Staff UX Designer will be hands-on in all aspects of user experience, including gathering and understanding business & user requirements, creating information architecture diagrams and user flows, building detailed wireframes, high & low fidelity prototypes, and creating new concepts. Key activities include conducting initial user research, driving a solution vision based on business and user insights, designing desirable and intuitive multi-channel experiences, developing wireframes and visual designs, and iteratively validating solutions with users.

Responsibilities

Key Accountabilities
• Transform ideas, business opportunities, research, and creative vision into tangible products and services that provide users with clear, usable, practical, and desirable outcomes.
• Conducts customer research and builds strategic user experience roadmaps with marketing, strategy, and other stakeholders.
• Conducts user and ethnographic research to discover insights, define user personas, and map user journeys
• Creates distinctive, branded digital experiences that are desirable and consistent across multiple platforms, devices, and channels
• Develops new product concepts, storyboards, detailed interaction designs, screen flows, and prototypes to clearly articulate solutions
• Creates compelling visual designs that align with company and product brand standards
• Conducts concept and usability testing to validate and improve design solutions iteratively
• Actively collaborates as part of an agile team to ensure designs are feasible and implemented accurately
• Tracks user experience metrics and reports on the success of UX improvements, including analytics
• Coaches, mentors, and inspires junior designers to help develop reusable Werfen design systems and component libraries.

Networking/Key relationships

Will interface regularly with groups across the organization as needed (within the Digital Solutions Team, Global Communications, R&D, Clinical Software, and others).

Skills & Capabilities:

Domain Expertise
• Able to plan, conduct, and synthesize user research and usability testing, prepares research questions and runs customer interviews/testing, and proposes solutions
• Skilled at creating interaction design solutions, such as desktop, web, and mobile applications
• Ability to lead and establish best practices and design thinking/process - driving best digital experiences
• Strong visual design skills, able to create compelling, branded, high-fidelity product screens
• Expert knowledge of visual asset creation and prototyping tools
• Can develop independently: Personas, User Journey, Benchmarking, UX Map Architecture, User Flows
• Profound capacity to turn complex interactions into intuitive user experiences
• Healthcare knowledge and enthusiasm are a plus

Agile/Digital Experience
• Hands-on experience designing customer-facing solutions
• Proven experience working in design teams in an Agile product development setting
• Experience in planning and running design-led workshops such as Ideation, Wireframing, Blueprinting, or Rapid Prototyping
• Experience in helping facilitate collaboration-based agile ceremonies, such as workshops or Retros, e.g., together with Scrum Master, preferred

Individual Skills:
• Influences and guides team members in setting goals and provides feedback
• Self-starter –leads projects, products, and teams by example. Collaborates with other designers to problem solve design challenges and maintain a level of design consistency and coherence across products
• Experience in planning and conducting user research at various stages of the design process
• Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate the value of a design choice to users and non-designer stakeholders
• Data sleuth – great skill combing through analytics and behavioral insights to generate new experiments and opportunities to improve our products and differentiate the user experience. Able to produce high-quality creative solutions in a fast-paced environment
• Combined skills in at least 2 out of the following: User Research, Interaction Design, Visual Design

Mindset and Behaviors:
• Synthesizes abstract ideas into tangible solutions for design
• Is passionate about problem-solving through design, acting as an ambassador
• Sees value in taking an iterative design approach
• Has a strong sense of ownership and proactively advocates for the end user
• Open to taking on new challenges and learning new skills
• Collaborative, curious, empathetic, open-minded, innovative

Qualifications

Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:
• Bachelor’s degree or a minimum of 15-20 years of work experience, or an Associate’s Degree with a minimum of 12 years of work experience  
• Minimum of 10 years of experience in Customer Experience / User Experience Design 
• Minimum of 10 years of experience developing digital products
• Strong functional visual design capabilities, specifically for digital. Experience using Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, Axure RP, Framer, UXPin, Marvel, or similar tools. Experience working with component-based and template-based design systems is considered a plus

Travel requirements:

None.

Werfen appreciates and values diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V

We operate directly in over 30 countries, and in more than 100 territories through distributors. Annual revenue is approximately $2 billion and more than 5,000 employees around the world comprise our Werfen team.

www.werfen.com

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
At JockMKT (pronounced “Jock Market”), we are building the second-screen experience for live sports with a social, interactive daily fantasy sports (DFS) marketplace where users buy and sell shares of players in real-time with real money. With all shares based on guaranteed payouts, JockMKT has rapidly grown transaction volume and processes millions of dollars of user trades each month.

Since... launching in 2020, JockMKT has expanded gameplay from support for the PGA and NFL to the NBA, MLB, NHL, and NASCAR, and released innovative new products for our customers across our mobile apps, web platform, and open REST and WebSocket-based API. Headquartered in Boston, we embrace workplace flexibility with a hybrid work model and hire remotely across US time zones.

We’re looking for a Lead Product Designer with a strong background in UX/UI product design and strategy for both mobile and web. If you excel at taking complex, data-rich information and distilling it into a clean, simple, user experience, we want to talk to you!

About You:
• 4+ years experience working with consumer-facing applications, preferably in a growing startup environment
• Experience with Figma and/or other modern design/prototyping/wire-framing tools
• Strong understanding of mobile and web development frameworks and limitations
• Adept at balancing design, development, and business requirements
• Able to be the voice of design, always advocating for best design practices and understanding the best ways for Design and Development to work together
• Able to lead user testing/user research efforts
• Ability to apply design and development frameworks and methodologies
• Familiar owning the end-to-end design process, and understanding high level conversion funnel/engagement metrics
• Excellent communication skills, applying an empathetic, user-centered approach to problem-solving
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design simple, easy-to-use interfaces for new and existing products
• Background in human-centered design research, including: interviews, workshops, persona-building, and customer journey mapping
• Bachelor’s degree in design or human factors-related disciplines

Ultimately, you'll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients' needs and help us grow our customer base.

Impact:
• You'll design new experiences for both buyers and sellers in the residential real estate space.
• You'll define how Edgewise interacts with our users.
• You'll work on new interesting design problems and have an opportunity to create new end-to-end experiences.
• You'll work both utility and experiential interfaces.

Requirements

What you'll bring:
• 5+ years experience of hands-on professional experience as a UX/UI Designer or Product Designer with a proven track record of ownership
• Effective communication skills in multiple settings
• Strong execution skills and familiarity in modern tools such as Figma
• Able to incorporate user feedback to tackle real-world problems to create the best design solutions
• Self-starter attitude with a disciplined work ethic
• Able to work independently without constant supervision

Benefits
• Competitive hourly rate ($50-75 / hour based on experience)
• Fully remote

title: UI/UX Designer
company_name: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
description:
Job Description

The Pattern (pattern.broadinstitute.org) group at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard focuses on the design and development of visualization tools to help researchers discover, explore and explain insights. We’re looking for a full-time designer who is excited to use their skills to create effective visual designs that will drive biomedical science forward...

We’re a fast-paced team that works on a variety of projects including data portals with interactive data visualization, exploratory web apps, interactive visual explainers, and mobile applications. If you like to solve visual problems, we have them!

This is a perfect position for a designer who is mission-driven with passion for and curiosity about biomedical science. You will be a key member of a vibrant and creative team, and take part in collaborations with researchers, software engineers, and other designers.

You will participate in an iterative design process in efforts to identify important scientific goals and lead ideation and concept development sessions. You should possess excellent graphic, web and screen design skills, and have a solid grasp of data visualization and interaction design principles for desktop and mobile formats.

Key Responsibilities
• Bring ideas and innovative design solutions.
• Lead meetings with collaborators to learn about their science, define aims and the scope of work for the collaboration, create use cases, identify user personas, and design main functionality and features for products.
• Lead projects by setting milestones and organizing and leading design reviews with collaborators.
• Collaborate with software engineers, researchers and designers to explore and iteratively refine design solutions, producing sketches, workflow diagrams, and wireframes for data-intensive digital products
• Partner with team members and collaborators to explore and find effective data visualization solutions
• Produce high-fidelity clickable mockups, ensuring design objectives are clearly communicated to the development team.
• Communicate with developers to ensure design ideas are technically practical.
• Meet project milestones and deadlines.
• Demonstrate ability to manage multiple projects by focusing on one project while keeping track of others.
• Demonstrate competence and confidence to carry out tasks independently.
• Keep up on design trends, best practices, existing solutions, standards + protocol, spectrum of needs and the problems to be solved.

Potential Additional Activities
• Conceive and create illustrations and graphics to accurately and effectively communicate scientific concepts and results for publications
• Produce various collateral materials in support projects undertaken by Pattern such as infographics and scientific figures
• Present work at conferences, internal and external meetings, annual retreat.

Required

Qualifications
• Portfolio demonstrating relevant experience
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a design field OR equivalent experience in UI/UX design
• Excellent problem-solving skills
• Strong verbal and visual communication skills using a variety of methods to convey ideas and concepts (e.g., storytelling, storyboards, clickable mockups, mood boards, prototypes, etc.)
• Ability to demonstrate thorough rationale for your design decisions and show how value was added in your designs
• Critical thinking skills with an open mind to alternative solutions
• Ability to see the value of utility and practical solutions but with a tendency to think outside of the box for more effective solutions than the status quo
• Ability to thrive in iterative design process while maintaining strong organizational and time management skills
• Proficiency in industry standard UI/UX tools such as Figma or XD and knowledgeable in Adobe Creative suite
• Expert knowledge of graphic design and information design principles
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Preferred
• Some background or experience in biomedical sciences
• Heightened attention to detail, taking pride in ownership and responsibility for your work
• Experience designing digital products for scientific fields
• 3+ years of post-undergraduate work or equivalent experience
• Working knowledge of HTML, CSS flex and grid, and responsive layout design.

All Broad employees, regardless of work location, must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 by Tuesday, October 12, 2021. Requests for exemption for medical or sincerely held religious beliefs will be considered.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
At JockMKT (pronounced “Jock Market”), we are building the second-screen experience for live sports with a social, interactive daily fantasy sports (DFS) marketplace where users buy and sell shares of players in real-time with real money. With all shares based on guaranteed payouts, JockMKT has rapidly grown transaction volume and processes millions of dollars of user trades each month.

Since... launching in 2020, JockMKT has expanded gameplay from support for the PGA and NFL to the NBA, MLB, NHL, and NASCAR, and released innovative new products for our customers across our mobile apps, web platform, and open REST and WebSocket-based API. Headquartered in Boston, we embrace workplace flexibility with a hybrid work model and hire remotely across US time zones.

We’re looking for a Lead Product Designer with a strong background in UX/UI product design and strategy for both mobile and web. If you excel at taking complex, data-rich information and distilling it into a clean, simple, user experience, we want to talk to you!

About You:
• 4+ years experience working with consumer-facing applications, preferably in a growing startup environment
• Experience with Figma and/or other modern design/prototyping/wire-framing tools
• Strong understanding of mobile and web development frameworks and limitations
• Adept at balancing design, development, and business requirements
• Able to be the voice of design, always advocating for best design practices and understanding the best ways for Design and Development to work together
• Able to lead user testing/user research efforts
• Ability to apply design and development frameworks and methodologies
• Familiar owning the end-to-end design process, and understanding high level conversion funnel/engagement metrics
• Excellent communication skills, applying an empathetic, user-centered approach to problem-solving
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design simple, easy-to-use interfaces for new and existing products
• Background in human-centered design research, including: interviews, workshops, persona-building, and customer journey mapping
• Bachelor’s degree in design or human factors-related disciplines
• Portfolio demonstrating your process as a designer

Nice to Have:
• Some level of interest in gaming, sports, and/or trading is a plus

What We Offer:
• Interesting work at the intersection of finance and sports
• Competitive salary and stock options
• Health, dental and vision insurance
• Flexible Paid Time Off (Suggested 4 weeks)
• 401k
• Team events and internal contests with our product
• Home office stipend
• Commuter Benefits

We value diversity at Jock MKT and believe the unique contributions each of us drives our success. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Note: We are unable to sponsor work visas at this time.

Jock MKT focuses on Marketplaces, Fantasy Sports, Mobile Games, and Finance Technology. Their company has offices in Boston. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://jockmkt.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

Scopic is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, marital status, national origin, gender, veteran status, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.

Job description

We are interviewing for an experienced UI/UX Designer with exceptional problem-solving abilities and solid design instincts who can translate business needs into well-executed customer-focused experiences for Takeda’s Digital Workplace.
Our ideal candidate possesses a rich toolbox of Human-centered Design practices required for delivering successful UI for web-based applications and products, and understands design systems and how they integrate with technology and content modeling. You should have experience with design and prototyping tools such as Figma and Axure. You will be working with talented people who are forward-thinking and compassionate on projects that align with our values of Patient, People, Planet.
We operate within a system of transparency and open communication that accelerates progress and allows for a healthy work / life balance.
The successful candidate will thrive working within agile, cross-functional teams and proactively contribute subject matter expertise.

Responsibilities
• Participate in all UI design stages from discovery to development hand-off

title: UI/UX Designer / Developer [Remote]
description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other... marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works - for good.
• JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere
• HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $50 - $85/hr
• ESTIMATED DURATION: 20h/week - Long-term

THE OPPORTUNITY

Required Technical Chops
• Ability to design UI and UX using Figma (and other relevant tools)
• Trading experience as indicated above
• User Interviews / research
• Prototyping and orchestrating user tests. Specifically, you will be required to review recordings and/or observe traders using the application via livestream and generating design insights to improve their experience on the application.
• Ability to document design requirements in a clear manner

Nice-to-have Skills
• HTML / CSS
• TailwindCSS / Chakra UI
• JavaScript (React) What you'll be working on

The client is currently building a day-trading application (with an existing team of three developers), and needs a UI/UX Designer to join the team. The high-level objective is to put the power of automated trading into the hands of day-traders who typically trade manually. The ideal UI/UX designer should have experience in at least one of the following:
• Building a trading application (for previous employers or clients)
• Building trading algorithms
• Actively trading the markets in any asset class (stocks, options, crypto, forex etc) 4. Familiarity with day-trading applications such as DAS Trader Pro, Sterling Trader Pro, Thinkorswim, Trader Workstation etc

While the emphasis on this position is to design intuitive error-reducing interfaces for traders who typically made trading decisions using sub-second data, it is highly desirable if the designer has basic development skills to convert designs into HTML/CSS/JS that the team can use a starting point for feature development.

The ideal candidate will work ona part time basis (10 - 20 hours per week), and will work with the client to design a trader-centric experience that will be implemented by the development team. The candidate will also participate in twice-a-week meetings to provide updates and help guide the direction of the product from a design perspective. The client is a customer-driven Product Manager by day, and is able to bring to bear his significant experience in developing digital products whilst guaranteeing a respectful and fulfilling working experience.

The product is expected to launch in February 2023, however, more features will be developed post launch and there exists the possibility of a long-term relationship depending on performance and fit.

If this interests you, please share your portfolio emphasizing your experience designing trading apps. Years of experience don't matter, just bring your A-game.

Apply Now!

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we'd welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status

title: Senior UI/UX Product Designer (Remote, Work from Home available)
description:
Description

At Humana’s Experience Center (XC), we are explorers, listeners, creators, and thinkers working together to influence the ways that people care for themselves and one another. We are seeking individuals who are passionate about solving big problems in healthcare for seniors, with experience in understanding consumers’ underlying needs and how to go about addressing them. Above all... else, we are human-centered, kind and respectful, and always looking to understand and support our members. Come help us redefine the future of healthcare.

Responsibilities

An XC Product Designer is…

Human-centered – They put people at the center of everything they do, always seeking to deeply understand and empathize with them in the entire context of their lives. The designer advocates for the user’s needs with peers, facilitates user research on a regular basis, and continuously delivers based on evidence-backed insights in order to ensure products and services fit the user need.

Strategic - They strive for experiences that are desirable for members, viable for the business, and operationally and technically feasible. They look to best practices and methods in order to uncover real member needs and to synthesize insights from research and data. They understand and practice the design processes across the product lifecycle. Additionally, the designer develops a full-stack skillset, ensuring that the visual interaction design complements the user research findings.

Collaborative – They are a humble and generous contributor to a cross-functional team. They recognize and respect the deep expertise of others, helping the team move forward. The designer participates in the team’s rituals, facilitates user research activities, and serves as part of a design pair. They are a fast learner and are willing to adapt to the product design needs and processes.

A Storyteller – They are a communicator and presents research to colleagues and stakeholders. They are able to thoughtfully discuss and justify design decisions, give honest effective feedback to others, and leverage their communication techniques.

Key Responsibilities

The Senior Product Designer is an individual contributor, who works within a cross-functional team to create and drive the delivery of both virtual and in-person experiences that are impactful for our members and measurable for the business.
• Facilitate the design process over the course of a product lifecycle, working effectively as part of a design pair and advocating for the user’s perspective.
• Within a design pair, develop the assets necessary for product success, which include, but are not limited to, the following: research discussion guides, screeners, research insights, remote tests, and the resulting research reports.
• Develop the design assets that include, but are not limited to, the following: customer journeys, user flows, sitemaps, research plans, paper prototypes, sketches, wireframes, visual designs, clickthrough prototypes
• Advocate for the user based on user research insights, product ambition, value proposition, and technical feasibility.
• Uncover user needs in order to craft how users will interact with our products / services.
• Co-create with both XC team members and our internal stakeholders to understand user and business needs, identify design opportunities, and create meaningful experiences.
• Be a great storyteller by preparing product demos and engaging stakeholders with design decisions.
• Contribute to the continuous development of the design discipline.

Working together, we will:
• Have specific opportunities to make healthcare better for our members, transform the future of care today, while working to build and deliver technology.
• Engage in ongoing activities that enable us to learn, practice, and evolve design to integrate it into a more agile and efficient process.
• Collaborate on products and services that change the way our members enroll, seek, and establish care.

Set yourself apart:
• Ability to support and teach fellow designers through design pairing, design critiques, and general ways of working.
• A strong portfolio demonstrating a full understanding of the end-to-end design process.
• Extensive experience with Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite. Ability to learn new software quickly a plus.
• Experience with applying user-centered design processes.
• Understanding of areas of specialization within the greater design landscape, including but not limited to Design Research, Visual Design, Service Design, UI / UX Design, and Product Design; willingness to broaden own skillset into adjacent specializations while refining mastery of primary skillset.
• Ability to create design assets (e.g., customer journeys, flows, prototypes, visual designs, etc.).
• Extensive knowledge of rapid prototyping methods, ranging from paper sketching to digital prototypes.
• HTML / CSS / JS skills are a plus.
• Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

Your experience:
• 3 – 6 years of relevant industry experience
• Bachelor’s design degree or equivalent experience in a related field
• Demonstrated experience working in UX, Visual Design, or IA within multiple cross-discipline teams (both technology and design)

Additional Information

Humana and its subsidiaries require vaccinated associates who work outside of their home to submit proof of vaccination, including COVID-19 boosters. Associates who remain unvaccinated must either undergo weekly negative COVID testing OR wear a mask at all times while in a Humana facility or while working in the field.

Work-At-Home Requirements
• WAH requirements: Must have the ability to provide a high speed DSL or cable modem for a home office. Associates or contractors who live and work from home in the state of California will be provided payment for their internet expense.
• A minimum standard speed for optimal performance of 25x10 (25mpbs download x 10mpbs upload) is required.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Your purpose:

You will be responsible for designing user interfaces and visuals to enhance the user experience for our SaaS platform. This role will create end-to-end experiences that turn complex problems and workflows into intuitive and elegant interfaces. Ultimately, you will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive for our users...

This role will report to our Director of Design. The job is located in Boston, MA.

Who You Are:

You’re an individual with close attention to detail and a strong understanding of the product's user experience. You care about the product's impact on their relationship with use and their own business. You can build toward achieving that vision by using data and interviewing users to inform your work and decisions; collaborating with team members to provide the best user experience fuels you to get to our professional and team goals.

This position requires activities that are subject to US Export Control Laws and require US Citizenship or Green Card Holder.

Responsibilities
• Develop wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity interfaces around customer needs
• Work alongside designers, engineers, and product managers to ensure we’re solving problems for our users the right way.
• Utilize and contribute to our design system and component library
• Use research and data to inform design decisions
• Partner with Engineering to ensure that our implementation and user experience are high-quality
• As part of the Paperless Parts team, further, the company-wide DEI & social impact initiates

Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities
• 2+ years of experience designing for SaaS or digital products in a software product company
• Solid understanding of how to build intuitive, user-first designs
• Experience working with and building on a design/component library
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• A UX/UI Design portfolio is required
• Travel to customers as needed; vaccination required

title: Entry Level UX Design- Northeast
description:
Welcome to Avanade Experiences, where the best in creative and technology mix it up to push the boundaries of innovation. We're a fast-moving, big-idea-dreaming, mishmash of designers, UX architects, technologists, delivery experts, writers, and more, who, when brought together, create trans formative digital experiences for some of the biggest and best brands on the planet. Sound like a place... you wouldn't mind hanging your hat? Great, in North America you can find us in Atlanta, Chicago, Houston, Los Angeles, NYC, Raleigh, Seattle, and Toronto.

About the Role:

The UX Design team stands out for its lively creativity and flawless style. It translates users' needs, business objectives and technology capabilities from concept to delivery with exceptional attention to detail. It aims to craft an alluring experience that skillfully incorporates the voice of the end user.

As a UX Design Analyst, you would assist with customer engagements and create UX/creative transformation deliverables on projects. You would be working within the design team to assist in workshops to gather stakeholder and end user goals using a pool of techniques to help break down barriers, communicate better and generate new ideas. You would be assisting in the creation of compelling wireframes that illustrate a best-in-class experience for our clients, and artfully test those ideas by participating in user testing.

What you'll do:

Work with our design and UX leads to create compelling user experiences
Support UX discovery via workshops & design thinking methods

Create low to high fidelity wireframes to illustrate the recommended experience
Participate in the creation of journey maps, user flows and personas
Learn the end-to-end process from project kick-off to delivery handoff
Understand how to design within different platforms/technologies

We think boldly and inclusively. We experiment with new approaches and expect some to fail. We like solving hard problems. We remove barriers to entry so we can expand our talent pools and provide more opportunities for all to thrive at Avanade. Together, we will position Avanade as an award-winning destination for top talent, that is future ready and truly diverse.

Academic requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, Psychology, or a similar field of study

About you:

Some experience in UX design
Demonstrate a growth mindset with knowledge of UX design capabilities and strategies. You have knowledge of UX disciplines such as:

UX research methods
information architecture
usability testing

Wireframing
Prototyping

Great communicator with an eagerness to work within a team
Creative mind and collaborative spirit
Knowledge of design disciplines including principles of UI design, layouts, graphics development, typography, color, and visual theories

Functional knowledge of UX design tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Adobe XD

What we offer you:

Our Early Talent program offers distinctive experiences through limitless learning opportunities that encourage you to master Microsoft and pursue big ideas and ambitious growth for yourself as part of Avanade's people-first culture. We value you and plan to stay committed by offering competitive pay and benefits, flexible work arrangements, and a commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Avanade requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Avanade will consider requests for medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement on an individual basis.

Applicants for employment in the US/Canada must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States/Canada

Avanade(R) Is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, veteran, military or marital status, genetic information, or any other protected status

title: Sr UI/UX Designer
description:
EBSCO Information Services (EIS) provides a complete and optimized research solution comprised of e-journals, e-books, and research databases - all combined with the most powerful discovery service to support the information needs and maximize the research experience of our end-users. Headquartered in Ipswich, MA, EIS employs more than 2,700 people worldwide, most now working hybrid or remotely... We are the leader in our field due to our cutting-edge technology, forward-thinking philosophy, and outstanding team. EIS is a company that will motivate you, inspire you, and allow you to grow. Our mission is to transform lives by providing relevant and reliable information when, where, and how people need it. We are looking for bright and creative individuals whose unique differences will allow us to achieve this inclusive mission around the world.

EBSCO Information Technologies is looking for design talent. The Senior UI/UX Designer is an active leader on the User Experience team well-versed in the collaborative design process and capable of bringing innovative ideas from concept to code. You’ll be a key part of strategic initiatives and responsible for crafting best-in-class experiences and interfaces.

About the team

We are a multidisciplinary UX team made up of talented designers and researchers who focus on a wide variety of EBSCO products. We service numerous product and development teams across the organization helping the business achieve its goals.

About the role

Your mission as the Senior UI/UX Designer will be to drive design quality on each and every project, while simultaneously advancing design standards for EBSCO’s products and platforms. You will work on a variety of projects that include internal and external facing web applications, and mobile applications.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for exceptional design and a portfolio to match. We’re looking for a user-focused individual who can communicate ideas through sketches, prototypes, detailed mockups or code.

You will develop visual concepts (i.e. sketches, wireframes, high fidelity concepts, interactive prototypes and designs system components) to feed user research, long-range plans, capabilities and features to be executed by agile development teams.
• Be able to solve complex scenarios with elegant and compelling design patterns.
• Experience communicating in different levels of fidelity, anywhere from sketching to HTML/CSS.
• Utilize storytelling in your design process to frame the problem space, justify design direction and establish measurement framework.
• Show strong ability to present to different audiences across the organization.
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders and UX team members to brainstorm new, forward-thinking, features and functionalities.
• Assist business stakeholders, and product management in planning design resources with a goal of providing consistent and reliable estimates for design tasks.
• Work closely with the development teams to build and polish your design vision.
• Champion a common design process and help maintain design standards in our centralized library of design elements and visual language.
• Continue to build and advance EBSCO’s design system.
• Be effective throughout the entire product development process, from problem definition to detailed UI and visual design

Please include an online portfolio when applying.

What you should have
• A strong online portfolio, displaying a foundation in Typography, Interaction and Visual Design, and Ideation.
• Solid understanding of building usable, accessible, and modular designs that can scale to millions of users.
• 7+ years as an individual contributor role within a UX team or equivalent.
• Have shipped products and features. Not just designed a website.
• Experience with design systems and component libraries
• Must have an online portfolio.

Preferred Qualifications
• Expert-level skills in design software (Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Cloud, etc.)
• Familiarity with HTML and CSS. (Advanced coding skills is a plus.)
• Familiarity with a multitude of User Research methodologies and experience working from research findings.
• An understanding of accessibility standards
• Experience working with distributed teams and understand the sensibilities and responsibility that come with it.
• Degree in a relevant field (HCI, Graphic Design, Interaction Design, etc.)
• Ability to work on multiple projects and be self-directed in daily tasks
• Demonstrated creativity and innovation
• Solid oral, written and listening communication skills

The position reports into the Design Manager within the User Experience Design team.

Target Annual Salary Range: $99,495 - $142,135 This Pay Target range includes a bonus target of 5% of base salary. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors including your skills, qualifications, education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location. EBSCO provides a generous benefits program including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a retirement savings plan, paid parental leave, holidays and paid time off (PTO), as well as tuition reimbursement. View more about EBSCO’s benefits here: https://www.ebsco.com/about/benefits

We are an equal opportunity employer and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. We strictly prohibit and do not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, color, sex, pregnancy status, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment. We comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law

title: UI/UX Design Architect
description:
Position:
UI/UX Design Architect
Job Description...

Do you have endless curiosity about how people use technology? We are looking for an enthusiastic User Experience (UX) person to join a team of passionate professionals obsessed with quality, usability, and simplicity. We are expecting intuitive, innovative, and beautiful human experiences led by data-driven processes.

Arrow Electronics, Inc is a Fortune 104 company that helps the world’s best technology companies think Five Years Out and work together to innovate. We are a global provider of technology products, services, and solutions, with 2021 sales of $30 billion. Arrow Electronics is currently seeking a UI/UX Design Architect to work in our SiliconExpert subsidiary.

The UX team includes a wide range of disciplines including design, interaction, research, code development and analytics. We're organized across multi-disciplinary teams where designers and developers tightly collaborate in exploring, crafting, and validating the user/customer experience. You'll have regular interactions with stakeholders and be capable of being a UX lead for a project team. You are a proactive thinker and eager to learn new skills to develop your career and increase the value of our products. You are comfortable working in an Agile environment as well as other Methodologies, such as Kanban and FDD.

The ideal candidate follows design patterns and innovates using UX best practices, a team player and collaborator, as well as having an analytical mind for approaching solving UX problems logically. We are looking for someone who is excited about being part of a team of learners, constantly contributing to the team's collective growth and success. They will be strong in visual design, front-end engineering technologies, knowledgeable on the latest trends and innovations in UI/UX, a deep understanding of WCAG and 508 accessible compliance, and has experience with research and analytics tools. You should have a strong technical background in interaction design methodologies and implementations.

Work You'll Do
• Innovate and mentor, as well as an openness to new learning, nurturing ideas and growing new skills in the UX sphere
• Assist in solving all sorts of design challenges with creativity, efficiency and precision
• Full stack design skills (interaction, usability, graphic design, html, CSS, SEO, Analytics, A/B testing, UX Research, etc.)
• Easily Create wireframes and review user journeys
• Create and enhance user personas
• Ensure projects are completed according to established specifications and are properly documented throughout the project life cycle.
• Develop and report on KPIs for tracking digital creative team contribution to revenue and overall company performance
• Lead discussions and reviews of creative digital strategy deliverables with stakeholders
• Proactive thinking and eager to move out of comfort zone in order to develop your career and move the company forward

Required Qualifications
• Experience in designing supply chain applications and platform highly desirable
• Experience in B2C applications a must have
• Self-starter and team player, with strong technical and personal leadership skills
• Must be comfortable working on multiple projects across different domains simultaneously
• Deep understanding of information architecture and software interaction design principles
• 10+ years of proven track record working in a UI/UX design-focused role
• 10+ years professional experience in software interaction design and implementation

As the Lead role of our multi-disciplined UX team, we desire for an applicant to also possess many of these skills.

Desired Qualifications
• A complete mastery of interaction design and prototyping processes
• A complete mastery of identity and brand development
• Deep understanding of limitations and functions of the DOM, including HTML, CSS, and JS
• Highly proficient in communicating ideas using whatever tool necessary
• Advanced understanding of user experience research methodologies and principles
• Superior knowledge of Accessible responsive web design and development

EDUCATION

Typically requires a minimum of 14 years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 12 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent experience.

About SiliconExpert

Since 2000, SiliconExpert helps you make better data-driven decisions with a human-driven experience. Over 500 electrical, software and data engineers handcraft our component database of more than one billion parts to deliver the most comprehensive and current tools in the industry. Customers globally use our solutions to manage risk, avoid redesigns, and mitigate obsolescence in innovative industries such as consumer electronics, telecommunications, automotive, medical and aerospace. SiliconExpert's customers include: leading commercial and government OEMs, top-tier authorized distributors, contract manufacturers and component suppliers. Whether it’s a design engineer or financial expert, supply chain management or procurement manager, SiliconExpert is a complete components data intelligence solution for organizational alignment, efficiency, collaboration, and optimization.

$117,900.00 - $175,450.00

Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.
